In The Millers, at 8:30, Carol (Margo Martindale) adds her dentist to the Miller Family Blacklist for charging a late fee, so Nathan (Will Arnett) must take his personal relationship with her underground. In Two and a Half Men, at 9, Walden (Ashton Kutcher) decides that Kate (Brooke DOrsay) is the One  until he meets Vivian (Mila Kunis). And in The Crazy Ones, at 9:30, Simon (Robin Williams) thinks he may have found the One (Pam Dawber) as well, but he becomes disillusioned with love after Gordon (Brad Garrett) and his partner break up. David Copperfield appears as himself.

title: In I.P.O., a Quest to Satisfy Chinas Appetite for Pork
description: HONG KONG  There is a commodity creating ravenous demand among Chinas growing consumer class, one whose pricing is so important that it influences the Chinese central banks monetary policy. The commerce ministry even maintains strategic reserves and has been piling them higher in recent weeks in an attempt to stabilize prices.

title: Corrections: April 10, 2014
description: NATIONAL

title: In French Premiers Blend of Socialism, Conservative and Centrist Notes
description: PARIS  Frances new prime minister introduced the country this week to his particular brand of Socialist Party politics: more centrist on social issues, more conservative economically and more combative than the man who appointed him, President Franois Hollande.

title: Whats Next in the Search for Flight 370
description: Investigators have narrowed down the search area for the missing Malaysian jetliner, but it could be weeks or months before they find any trace of the plane.

title: Setting Up an Election in the Worlds Largest Democracy
description: MEERUT, India  Raj Singh endured hot winds as he feverishly operated a sewing machine outdoors to repair tents that had ripped in a storm the night before.

title: Dogged Prosecutor Seeks to Paint Pistorius as a Bully
description: Oscar Pistorius, the South African athlete accused of murdering his girlfriend, faced new questions on Thursday from a dogged prosecutor intent on depicting him as a narcissistic bully who routinely berated her and recklessly carried a loaded gun everywhere he went.

title: Test Yourself | English, April 10, 2014
description: Take the Quiz

title: Students End Occupation of Taiwans Legislature
description: Updated, 8:20 a.m.ET | Hundreds of protesters who occupied Taiwans legislature for more than three weeks decamped Thursday evening, bringing to an end a standoff over the handling of a trade pact with China.

title: Piramal to Sell Vodafone India Stake for $1.48 Billion
description: LONDON  Piramal Enterprises, the largest minority investor in Vodafone India, said Thursday that it had agreed to sell its entire stake in the business to the British telecommunications company Vodafone.

title: In Mongolia, a Gift Horse for Hagel
description: ULAN BATOR, Mongolia  Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel knew even before he landed here that there was no way he could keep the horse.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Student Stabs 20 People at High School Near Pittsburgh
description: In Student Stabs 20 People at High School Near Pittsburgh, Timothy Williams and Emma G. Fitzsimmons report on a mass knife attack on Wednesday.

title: Bomb Explodes Outside Greek Central Bank
description: ATHENS  A large car bomb exploded outside Greeces central bank Thursday morning, shaking buildings for blocks around but causing no injuries.

title: European Union Debates Initiative on Embryo Protection
description: BRUSSELS  A packed hearing on a petition calling for the protection of human embryos led to a rare outbreak of raucous exchanges in the European Parliament on Thursday  a sign that the battles over abortion and stem cell research that divide nations like Spain and the United States are making a serious incursion into European Union affairs.

title: The Paramedic Murderer of Narrowsburg, N.Y.
description: In the hills around Narrowsburg, N.Y., where second-home owners tend gardens and the Lenape once roamed, people dont forget a mysterious death. They still talk about the bar owner who shot his waitress in the chest late one night and served just six months in jail after saying it was an accident. Then there was the story about the man who arrived home one night only to notice that his wife, who had been in the back seat, was no longer in the car. Her body was found on the side of a road along the route hed taken. Charges were never filed.

title: Personalities Beyond Fists and Faces
description: Holger Keifel spent eight years as a shadow in the court of boxing royalty, making portraits of fighters, trainers and promoters in the corners of rooms where he did not belong. The best of three or four frames captured in the fleeting moments of a news conference, weigh-in or short breathers between sparring sessions  each was a jab.

title: Drinking Milk Linked to Arthritis Relief
description: A large study has found evidence that milk consumption may slow the progression of knee arthritis.

title: Do You Like to Exercise?
description: A recent genetics study of lab rats seems to suggest that the motivation to exercise  or not  may be partly inherited, at least for small rodents. Perhaps some of us are born to enjoy exercise, while others  not so much.

title: Group Says It Has Raised Over $1.7 Million for Hillary Clinton
description: Ready for Hillary, the independent group devised to build support for Hillary Rodham Clintons potential 2016 presidential campaign, said Thursday that it had brought in 22,000 new donors and raised more than $1.7 million in the three-month period that ended March 31.

title: New York Today: Take Out the Compost
description: Good Thursday morning to you.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times.

title: Free to Be Mean: Does This Student Satire Cross the Line?
description: On a recent cloudless afternoon, a group of young comedy writers  one in Ray-Bans and a floppy wizard hat, another in skateboard sneakers and funky jeans  descended upon San Diego State Universitys palm-tree-dotted campus, brandishing copies of their latest creation: a 12-page broadsheet of lewd humor.

title: Papyrus Referring to Jesus Wife Is More Likely Ancient Than Fake, Scientists Say
description: A faded fragment of papyrus known as the Gospel of Jesuss Wife, which caused an uproar when unveiled by a Harvard Divinity School historian in 2012, has been tested by scientists who conclude in a journal published on Thursday that the ink and papyrus are very likely ancient, and not a modern forgery.

title: Teslas Lightweight Solution to Preventing Model S Fires
description: A cloud of doubt lingering over Tesla Motors parted on March 26, when the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration closed an investigation of the Model S begun in response to two cars that were destroyed by fires after striking objects on the highway.

title: The Trouble With Too Much T
description: In 2009, the South African middle-distance runner Caster Semenya was barred from competition and obliged to undergo intrusive and humiliating sex testing after fellow athletes at the Berlin World Championships questioned her sex. Ms. Semenya was eventually allowed to compete again, but the incident opened the worlds eyes to the process of sex testing and the distress it could bring to an athlete who had lived her whole life as a girl. When an endocrinologist, a gynecologist and a psychologist were brought in to determine whether the teenager was really a woman, she simply asserted, I know who I am.

title: Daily Report: As the Internet Grows, It Grows Less Secure
description: It was the computer programming equivalent of misspelling Mississippi  an error at once careless, inevitable and hard for most human eyes to spot, Farhad Manjoo writes in his State of the Art column.

title: China Sets Hong Kong-Shanghai Trading Deal
description: HONG KONG  It was a seven-year wait, but China on Thursday finally announced a plan to allow two-way investment between the Shanghai and Hong Kong stock exchanges.

title: Who Are Hit Men?
description: STORNOWAY, Scotland  Everyone starts as a novice, whatever your job. You bumble around, make mistakes, learn by doing. It applies in any walk of life, and the criminal industry isnt any different. A team from Birmingham City Universitys Center for Applied Criminology has carried out the first typological study of British hit men, and it starts, of course, with the novice.

title: In Our Pages: April 11
description: 1914: Eavesdropping End Promised

title: Photos: The Making of the Masters
description: When Augusta National Golf Club opened in 1933, there were few hints at the grandeur of its future. Bobby Jones, having retired from golf as an amateur at age 28, wanted a place to play golf in private. After winning 13 major titles, he was swarmed at any golf course he strolled on to, so he sought a course of his own, where he could invite his friends to join as members. Clifford Roberts, an investment banker and friend, helped him acquire the 385 acres that would become Augusta National and together they steered their little club into history.

title: Its Official: No Deductible Caps in Small-Business Health Plans
description: Tucked inside the so-called Medicare doc fix bill  must-pass legislation to forestall steep cuts in payments to doctors  that President Obama recently signed was a separate provision that removed restrictions on deductibles in small-business health plans. As a result, small-business owners may be able to shift some of their health care costs, especially as they increase, to their workers.

title: Twitter and Facebook Wield Little Influence on TV Watching
description: Listen to executives at Twitter and Facebook talk about how we watch television and you might walk away thinking that Americans are chattering nonstop on the social networks while watching their favorite shows.

title: The Oscar Pistorius I Knew
description: Michael Sokolove, a contributing writer to The Times Magazine, wrote a cover article in 2012 on Oscar Pistorius, who is now being tried in the shooting death of his girlfriend.

title: RLM Finsbury Names New President
description: RLM Finsbury, a strategic communications and advisory firm, said on Thursday that Stephen Labaton would become its United States president.

title: Bank of England Holds Key Rate at 0.5%
description: LONDON  The Bank of England on Thursday left a key interest rate unchanged at a record low, as Britains economy continues to recover and inflation remains in decline.

title: Times Minute | Why L.B.J. Still Matters
description: In the Video

title: Tachyus, a Data Start-Up for Oil Industry, Raises $6 Million From Founders Fund
description: Since graduating from Stanford in 2011, Dakin Sloss has already co-founded two start-ups, including the government data analysis company OpenGov.

title: Authorities Cast Doubt on Signal in Jet Search
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The Australian authorities searching for the missing Malaysia Airlines plane said Friday that the latest potential signal was probably not from the flight recorders, despite hopes raised the previous day.

title: Coffee, Tea or Liberation?
description: So many momentous things happened in 1969.

title: Watch Proteins Do the Jitterbug
description: If you could shrink down to the size of a molecule and fly into a cell, what would you see?

title: Morning Agenda: Junior Banker Blues
description: JUNIOR BANKERS STILL WORK LONG HOURS | In the last six months, many of the biggest investment banks have signaled a sea change in their corporate culture, telling their most junior employees to ease up a bit on their hard-charging work schedules and take a few weekend days off. But like other practices on Wall Street, the more things change, the more they stay the same, William Alden and Sydney Ember write in DealBook.

title: R.B.S. Agreement Opens Door for Future Dividends
description: LONDON  The Royal Bank of Scotland has reached a deal with the British government that will pave the way for it to pay dividends in the future.

title: All Eyes on Delhi As It Goes To Vote
description: NEW DELHI  The nations capital went to the polls on Thursday in a three-way race for Delhis seven parliamentary seats that could be a bellwether of the national elections.

title: Ending Vitriol, Icahn and eBay Reach a Deal
description: Last month, Carl C. Icahn appeared ready to take no prisoners in his battle with eBay, calling the online commerce giant among the worst-run companies he had ever seen.

title: Taking a Risk, Investors Snap Up Once-Shunned Greek Debt
description: ATHENS  Investors shunned Greek bonds at the height of the European economic crisis, fearful that the regions sickest nation would collapse from its financial woes.

title: Seeking More From Chinese Films
description: There was a sting to the China Film Directors Guild awards in Beijing this week, when the director Feng Xiaogang, the head of the jury, announced that the guild would not award the top prizes  film of the year and director of the year. The reason? No film in contention was good enough: Chinese films need to meet a higher standard, Mr. Feng said.

title: Massacre in a Nairobi Mall
description: The Shabab, an Islamist militant group based in Somalia, took responsibility for the attack, saying it was revenge for Kenyas military operations in Somalia.

title: G.M. Places 2 Engineers on Leave in Inquiry
description: DETROIT  The ignition-switch scandal at General Motors widened on Thursday as the automaker suspended two engineers and added another repair to its recall of cars with a faulty ignition switch that has been linked to 13 deaths.

title: The Woman Within
description: Reed Birney and Patrick Page, actors in Harvey Fiersteins new Broadway play Casa Valentina, learn the art of cross-dressing.

title: Clothes Make the Man
description: Before rehearsals began for the new Broadway play Casa Valentina, the seven men in the cast were asked to come to work a few days early. They arrived to find a huge table covered with ladies wigs in 60s-era hairdos  flips, bobs, French twists. Nearby was a long rack of colorful house dresses and white slips and brassieres. Yet no one made a move. The actors shared small talk, sipped coffee, checked their smartphones and looked around as if the room were empty.

title: Ruth Rathblott, of Harlem Educational Activities Fund, on Seeking Opportunities
description: This interview with Ruth Rathblott, chief executive of the nonprofit Harlem Educational Activities Fund, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: U.S. Court Seems Split on Utah Gay Marriage Ban
description: DENVER  The push for same-sex marriage, which has celebrated victory after victory in courtrooms across the country, entered an uncertain stage on Thursday as a federal appeals court appeared divided about whether the socially conservative state of Utah could limit marriage to a man and a woman.

title: Fast-Growing Sectors Drive a Market Sell-Off
description: Investors dumped Internet, biotechnology and other fast-growing companies at a dizzying pace on Thursday, dragging down the rest of the stock market and stirring up painful memories of the dot-com bust in 2000.

title: Michael Lewis: By the Book
description: The author of Liars Poker, The Blind Side and, most recently, Flash Boys says its hard to dramatize the quotidian in a way that makes it fresh for readers: Its like describing the air we breathe.

title: From Smallest of Clues, Flying Reptiles Reborn
description: About 220 million years ago, as we learn at a thoroughly entrancing new exhibition at the American Museum of Natural History, a fish caught a pterosaur, chewed it up and spit out the pieces. The expelled mass eventually fossilized, creating what is decorously called a gastric pellet. We see its cast here: a compact, egg-size mound of spindly, bent, broken and crushed sticks.

title: Dont Hoodwink the Help, Dear
description: In the first moments of our acquaintance with Johanna Parry  before the opening titles of Hateship Loveship appear on screen, and before the first notes of music have sounded  we know some important things about her. We note her kindness as she grants an old womans dying wish, and also her practicality and physical strength. Other people will perceive Johanna as drab, passive and unworldly, a person to be quietly mocked or carelessly ignored, but the first shots of Liza Johnsons new film, adapted from a story by the Canadian Nobel laureate Alice Munro, provide important evidence to the contrary.

title: Qatar Investment Executive Said to Start Hedge Fund
description: LONDON  A top investment executive at Qatars sovereign wealth fund is leaving to start a hedge fund, people briefed on the development said.

title: Why Students Are Tested, and Why Some Parents Opt Out
description: Amid protests and debate, unprecedented numbers of students opted out of New York States English Language Arts testing this month. Some parents opted out as a way to voice their objections over the practice of administering federally mandated standardized tests, others because of concerns over how test results are used to evaluate schools and teachers. Many parents are simply confused about the origin and purpose of the standardized tests all children are required to take and what it means to opt out of them. Consequently, I thought Id use this weeks column to explain the nuts and bolts of standardized testing and opt-outs.

title: House Tour | Joseph Dirand
description: The architect takes T through his luxuriously minimal Paris apartment and discusses why he favors function over form in decoration.

title: 36 Hours in Seville, Spain
description: You dont have to spend long in Seville to see why so many operas have been set there. A sense of drama pervades the Andalusian capital, from its Moorish royal palaces and extravagant Catholic festivals to the way the strum of a guitar tends to send a whole room into syncopated clapping. Maybe its this penchant for pomp that keeps the city dynamic in lean times. At contemporary-minded shops, restaurants and arts spaces that continue to open among Sevilles tangle of narrow stone alleyways, a friendly localism seems to rule the day.

title: How the Aam Aadmi Party Lost Its Way
description: NEW DELHI  One morning last December, I traveled from my house to Ramlila Maidan, a sprawling area in central Delhi, where Arvind Kejriwal, the leader of the Aam Aadmi Party, was to be inaugurated as the citys new chief minister.

title: Briton Named President of ABC News
description: ABC put in place the missing piece of its succession plans Thursday, naming James Goldston the president of ABC News, replacing Ben Sherwood.

title: ScienceTake: Those Clever Crows
description: Scientists are trying to understand the limits to the well-established intelligence of crows.

title: The Moral: Aesop Knew Something About Crows
description: Crows and their relatives, like jays and rooks, are definitely in the gifted class when it comes to the kinds of cognitive puzzles that scientists cook up.

title: Shares in Ally Dip in Their Debut
description: Updated, 6:17 p.m. |

title: Indian Candidates Biography Has an Asterisk: A Wife, of Sorts
description: NEW DELHI  At a campaign rally this year, Narendra Modi, leader of the Bharatiya Janata Party, offered this curious qualification for the post of Indias prime minister: He could not possibly be corrupt because he is a bachelor.

title: Poetry Pairing | A Poem of Changgan
description: This weeks Poetry Pairing features A Poem of Changgan by Li Po and the Sunday Review article Romance at Arms Length by Daniel Jones.

title: Day 2 of Pistorius Cross-Examination
description: The Paralympic athlete Oscar Pistorius returned to the stand to face new questions from the state prosecutor, Gerrie Nel, on the fourth day of the defendants testimony in Pretoria, South Africa.

title: Does the Rock Hall of Fame Matter?
Will House of Cards Deal Elsewhere?
description: House of Cards, the Netflix depiction of a Machiavellian America, has been tight with the government of Maryland. So tight, in fact, that it has enjoyed not just $26.7-million in show business tax credits for filming its award-winning production there, but also use of the legislatures debating floor as an occasional set.

title: Its Time for Africas Green Revolution, Focused on Corn
description: I hope youll read Tina Rosenbergs latest Fixes post  A Green Revolution, This Time for Africa. The first Green Revolution, in Asia, was centered on rice and wheat. Rosenberg lays out the case for an African focus on corn (known as maize almost everywhere else in the world):

title: Justice Dept. Accuses Albuquerque Police of Excessive Force
description: ALBUQUERQUE  At least 37 times in the last four years, police officers here have responded to threats with bullets, killing 23 people and wounding 14 others. On Thursday, the Justice Department weighed in with a scathing assessment, accusing the Albuquerque Police Department of a pattern or practice of use of excessive force that routinely violated peoples constitutional rights.

title: Today in Small Business: Saving the Family Business
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: A Picture Becomes a Weapon in a Banks Proxy Battle
description: Below is a picture taken at last years annual shareholder meeting of our banks chairman, the two-sentence shareholder letter from the activist investor Joseph Stilwell began. None of the other board members bothered to wake him up.

title: U.N. to Send Peacekeepers to Central African Republic
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United Nations Security Council on Thursday voted unanimously to send 12,000 peacekeepers authorized to do whatever necessary to protect civilians in the Central African Republic, where a vicious sectarian conflict has effectively partitioned the country into Christian and Muslim swaths and left a trail of gruesome killings.

title: Quebec City Festival Offers Music Fans a Summer Bargain
description: The Festival dete de Quebec, now in its 47th year, will offer more than 300 performances in Quebec City, from July 3 to 13, the festival announced on Thursday. The festival bills itself as Canadas largest outdoor music event (although it presents shows at indoor venues as well). It is also one of the bargains of the festival circuit: a festival pass, which allows access to all shows, is priced at 78 Canadian dollars (about $72); the first 60,000 passes will sell for 68 Canadian dollars (about $62). A spokesman said that 300,000 people attended the festival last summer.

title: Times Minute | Jesus Wife?
description: Also on the Minute, federal courts review same-sex marriage and a voyage into a neuron.

title: Times Minute | Did Jesus Have a Wife?
description: In the Video

title: Fire Death Leads Police to Codify Protocols
description: The New York Police Department has issued mandatory protocols for officers entering buildings in response to fires, after an officer responding to a blaze in a Brooklyn high-rise died.

title: Colbert Will Host Late Show, Playing Himself for a Change
description: CBS made its choice, quickly and definitively: Stephen Colbert will succeed David Letterman as the host of its late-night franchise, which Mr. Letterman created when he came to the network in 1993.

title: In Villages Torn by Violence, Traditional Loyalties at Risk
description: FUGANA, India  Sakur Ahmed, an ironsmith, is a member of the only Muslim family left in the village of Fugana, in the northern state of Uttar Pradesh, where violence between Muslims and Hindu Jats erupted in September. When Muslims fled the village, Mr. Ahmed, protected by a Hindu neighbor, chose to stay.

title: Bomb Explodes Outside Bank of Greece
description: The deputy prime minister of Greece, Evangelos Venizelos, spoke after a large car bomb exploded outside Greeces central bank on Thursday morning.

title: Cuomo Caught Up in Rare Conflict With Prosecutor
description: IRONDEQUOIT, N.Y.  An unusually public confrontation between two of the states most powerful officials escalated on Thursday. Preet Bharara, the United States attorney for the Southern District of New York, not known for engaging in on-air rebukes of elected officeholders, took aim at Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo over his decision to dissolve an anticorruption panel.

title: Judge Approves SAC Plea, Closing a Painful Chapter
description: Updated, 9:40 p.m. | In the span of a week, Steven A. Cohens investment firm changed its name, hired a former federal prosecutor and became a felon.

title: Look Again, With Love and Liebling
description: Jerome Lieblings career was devoted to the idea that every person has value and dignity. A new exhibit shows that sentiment with lyric beauty.

title: Wheelies: The BMW X6-Fighter Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Greenish Shootlets in Southern Europe (Implicitly Wonkish)
description: There are hints of recovery in some of Europes austerity-stricken economies. Even Greece is finally showing some signs of an uptick. And you know one thing is going to happen: some people will say, See  growth despite austerity! Krugman and the Keynesians were wrong!

title: Microsoft Touts Data Protection Approval in Europe; Eager for New Customers
description: LONDON  Online privacy is heating up as a selling point, at least in Europe.

title: House-Passed Budget Shows Parties Divergence
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Rodney Davis won his House seat in 2012 by barely a thousand votes, making him a leading candidate as Target No. 1 for Democrats who are eager to make his support for the latest House Republican budget a centerpiece of the fall campaign.

title: CNN to Show Documentaries in 9 P.M. Time Slot
description: CNN is getting out of the host business in its 9 p.m. time slot, at least for now.

title: Segal Awards Go to JACK Quartet and Melissa Aldana
description: A quartet and a saxophonist won this years Martin E. Segal Awards, given to emerging artists who are associated with Lincoln Center.

title: Evidence Comes Up Short as Egypt Tries 3 Journalists
description: CAIRO  Prosecutors on Thursday were unable to produce video footage that they say is the basis of their case against three journalists accused of conspiring to broadcast false reports about civil strife in Egypt. Instead, they showed a Cairo courtroom footage of family photographs, trotting horses and Somali refugees in Kenya.

title: Oversight Committee Censures Ex-I.R.S. Official for Refusal to Take Questions
description: WASHINGTON  A House committee voted on Thursday to hold a former Internal Revenue Service official in contempt for refusing to answer its questions about her role in holding up applications for tax exemption from conservative political groups before the last election.

title: Live Nation to Open Outdoor Concert Venue at Manhattan Pier
description: Roseland is no more, but another new space for concerts is opening in Manhattan.

title: Videos Dismissed in Al Jazeera Case
description: Mike Greste, the brother of a detained Al Jazeera journalist, Peter Greste, commented after an Egyptian judge dismissed videos presented by the prosecution. The image above is from March 31.

title: Plaintiffs on Utahs Ban on Gay Marriage
description: Two of the plaintiffs in a case challenging Utahs ban on gay marriage, Moudi Sbeity and Derek Kitchen, discussed why they were pursuing the lawsuit.

title: A Night With Janis Joplin Cancels Off Broadway Run
description: Just a day before A Night With Janis Joplin was to have started its second New York run, producers announced on late Wednesday they were canceling the show.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: Joe
description: David Gordon Green narrates a sequence from his film featuring Nicolas Cage and Tye Sheridan.

title: How Many Minutes Does It Take?
description: Ben Werschkul is the senior producer for news in the video department at The Times.

title: Sacrificing Sense for Speed in Markets
description: Rube Goldberg: A comically involved, complicated invention, laboriously contrived to perform a seemingly simple operation.

title: Image of the Day: April 10
Text to Text | Of Mice and Men and Friendship in an Age of Economics
description: As John Steinbecks novel The Grapes of Wrath prepares to celebrate its 75th birthday, its oft-taught brother, Of Mice and Men, is in previews on Broadway.

title: Seen on the Street | Outside the Fall/Winter 2014 Sydney Womens Shows
description: A glimpse at what gals are wearing this season.

title: 50 Years Later, Obama Salutes Effects of Civil Rights Act
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  For three days, the veterans of a long-ago movement reunited and drew together their spiritual heirs to explore the legacy of the Civil Rights Act a half-century after it transformed America. And then the legacy walked onstage.

title: No Handouts From These Rabbits
description: TIMOTHY HASKELL, he of the slightly twisted imagination who regularly scares people as the creator and director of the Nightmare haunted houses in New York around Halloween, has something new and a bit less diabolical planned for Easter weekend: Full Bunny Contact, a carnival more focused on fun than on fright.

title: A Series of Cataclysmic Events, at Good Prices
description: As a freshman in college, the Miser navely chose to fulfill his science requirement with an introductory course in astronomy. He dug space as much as the next guy. A semester of looking at the stars? Compared with balancing equations, calculating vectors or dissecting dead animals, how hard could it be?

title: Why Liberalism Needs Pluralism
description: Just to ride a little further on my recent hobbyhorse, pluralism, I thoughtthis Andrew Sullivan analysisof the divide between same-sex marriage supporters over the treatment of Brendan Eich was useful in thinking through some wider political issues as well.

title: BMW Recalls 156,000 Vehicles With 6-Cylinder Engines
description: BMW is recalling about 156,000 vehicles equipped with 6-cylinder engines because a defect could cause stalling or engine damage, the automaker said in a news release Thursday. The action comes almost two years after the automaker began fixing the same models in China, according to a report the automaker filed with the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.

title: David Gordon Green Narrates a Scene From Joe
description: Nicolas Cage has an intimate moment with a venomous snake in this scene from Joe, narrated by the director David Gordon Green and also featuring Tye Sheridan. Mr. Green discusses how the scene was shot using a handful of non-traditional actors and a real cottonmouth snake.

title: Mike Flanagan on Oculus
description: The director discusses his horror film about a haunted mirror.

title: Tax Revenue Rockets Up, Helping Lessen the Deficit, Treasury Department Says
description: The economy may be plodding along. But business is booming for Uncle Sam.

title: Upgrades for Historic Luxury Hotels
description: After restoring some of its most historic hotels last year, including the Gritti Palace in Venice and the Hotel Maria Cristina in San Sebastian, Spain, the Luxury Collection from Starwood Hotels & Resorts announced a second round of upgrades, this time to two more historic properties, the Hotel Imperial in Vienna and the Excelsior Hotel Gallia in Milan, and two more-modern ones including Santa Marina Resort in Mykonos, Greece, and Grand Hills in Broumana, Lebanon.

title: The Treasure Rests at the Bottom
description: How is the English language so impoverished that we do not have a word for the glory of rice brought nearly to a scorch at the bottom of a pot? The Spanish call it socarrat; the Chinese, guo ba. It is graten in Haiti, nurungji in Korea, pegao in Puerto Rico, khao tang in Thailand, xoon in Senegal.

title: Next Guessing Game: Who Will Replace Colbert?
description: Stephen Colbert is dead. Long live Stephen Colbert. One day after I wrote of the downside of replacing David Letterman with Stephen Colbert, CBS went ahead and did exactly that.

title: N.H.L. Promoted Violence Regardless of Health Risk, Players Suit Says
description: Nine former professional hockey players have filed a lawsuit against the N.H.L. that says the league intentionally created, fostered and promoted a culture of extreme violence.

title: Icahn May Someday Win, and eBay Will Spin Off PayPal
description: Carl C. Icahn has lost the battle of bluster at eBay. The activist investor is quitting his proxy fight now that the company is appointing one new director and agreeing to talk to him. Considering that Mr. Icahn had never seen worse governance and was broadly right about the benefits of eBay separating its PayPal unit, thats a retreat. But he may yet win the war.

title: Common Core Gets Strong Defense From State Education Chief
description: Under sustained attack over new standardized tests and learning standards, the New York State education commissioner told an audience on Thursday that were not retreating and that the constant criticism was damaging an overdue effort to raise student achievement.

title: Officials Approve U.N. Peacekeeping Unit
description: The French and American ambassadors to the United Nations, Grard Araud and Samantha Power, and the Central African Republics foreign minister discussed the United Nations peacekeeping operation.

title: Living With Cancer: Bedtime Issues
description: Like the other women in my cancer support group, I have been trying to salvage aspects of the person I had been before the diagnosis.

title: Border Capture, Seen From Above
description: On a helicopter with its pilot and a Border Patrol chief, a reporter and photographer for The New York Times watched migrants crossing the Rio Grande and turning themselves in.

title: The Early Years of Stockholms Mega Home-Design Store
description: The only way to really understand how much the Stockholm design emporium Svenskt Tenn stands for Swedish style is to go and visit the store. What Herms and Fortnum & Mason are to Paris and London, respectively  beacons that help foreigners better grasp the culture of the town theyre in  Svenskt Tenn is to their northern and more mysterious sister. At the 90-year-old department store, you can buy almost anything for the home, from one of the deepest production sofas in the world to a doorstop shaped like an acorn anything, that is, but something boring. Its fitting that the ground floor of the store includes an art gallery with a rotating schedule of shows.

title: Obama Pays Tribute to Civil Rights Act
description: President Obama delivered remarks on the 50th anniversary of the Civil Rights Act at the Lyndon B. Johnson Presidential Library and Museum in Austin, Tex.

title: Icahns Feud With eBay Generated Noise, but Slight Bump for Shares
description: Updated, 5:47 p.m. | In his monthslong battle with eBay, Carl C. Icahn accused the online commerce site of failing to generate bigger returns for shareholders.

title: Eli Manning Has Surgery on Ankle He Injured in Season Finale
description: Giants quarterback Eli Manning had arthroscopic surgery on his left ankle Thursday to relieve pain associated with a sprain he sustained in the last game of the season.

title: Hoping for Asylum, Migrants Strain U.S. Border
description: HIDALGO, Tex.  Border Patrol agents in olive uniforms stood in broad daylight on the banks of the Rio Grande, while on the Mexican side smugglers pulled up in vans and unloaded illegal migrants.

title: A Journey North, From Farther South
description: Driven out by deepening poverty but also by gang violence, increasing numbers of Central American migrants are crossing the Rio Grande from Mexico into the United States, where many seek asylum.

title: The Gun Report: April 10, 2014
description: More than 300 people banned from owning gunsincluding felons, fugitives andpeople with histories of mental illnesswere able to buy them in Maryland last year because state police were flooded with background check requests, The Baltimore Sun reported yesterday. And because of a loophole that allows gun dealers to release firearms after waiting a week, regardless of whether a check is done, 51,812 guns were handed out prematurely.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz
description: In the news: exercise enjoyment, Medicare dollars and pregnancy risks. Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: Centuries of Judaica From Life and Rites in Muslim Lands
description: Artifacts from Sephardic Jews who fled Muslim countries, typically with few possessions in hand, are re-emerging and being reunited in virtual and tangible forms.

title: Benghazi: The Administration Has Won
description: Remember Karl Rove wandering around the Fox News set on election night 2012, trying to convince his colleagues that Mitt Romney, and not Barack Obama, had won the state of Ohio?

title: A Journey North, From Farther South
description: Driven out by deepening poverty but also by gang violence, increasing numbers of Central American migrants are crossing the Rio Grande from Mexico into the United States, where many seek asylum.

title: In Search of Wild Costa Rica
description: By the end of our fourth day on the Osa Peninsula of Costa Rica, we had seen, according to the tally kept by my 9-year-old, Sasha, dozens of species of animals. We had peered at leafcutter ants, army ants and zombie ants. We had been deafened by howler monkeys, beguiled by squirrel monkeys and strangely stirred by capuchin monkeys, whose feet bear an eerie resemblance to human hands. That afternoon, in the national park that covers a third of the peninsula, we had even spied two tapirs, endangered mammals that look like hornless rhinoceroses with long snouts.

title: An Auctioneer Comes Back to the Business
description: The rumors started Sunday, when the Qatar Museums Authority said that Edward Dolman, its executive director and acting chief executive, was stepping down after three years.

title: De Blasio, Marking 100 Days on Job, Says Grass Roots Will Drive Agenda
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio, seeking to recapture the energy that propelled him to victory last November, marked his 100th day in office on Thursday with a rhetoric-heavy speech that called on his supporters to help him create a people-powered government in New York.

title: Reverse Mortgage Realities
description: Adult children have reason to be wary when their parents start talking about reverse mortgages. The loans make sense only for those who plan to stay in their homes for the rest of their lives and can afford to pay property taxes and insurance for that long.

title: Abusing Both Medicare and Politics
description: Campaign finance reformers have long warned that the growing power of big money in politics would produce a giant scandal. But those scandals happen every day, and the trading of campaign donations for political favors has steadily eroded public trust in Washington. The latest illustration of that can be seen in the connection between Medicare fraud and super PAC abuse.

title: Minimalist Show, Minimally Revised
description: Museum art exhibitions are painfully ephemeral. Once they close, they are gone, except for their catalogs and documentary photographs. This has understandably spurred visions of time travel among curators and curators in training.

title: The Battle for Late Night Viewers on Screens of All Sizes
description: Congratulations, Stephen Colbert! Youve been crowned one of the kings of late night television, succeedingDavid Letterman as host of the Late Show, CBSs flagship late-night franchise.

title: Exploring the Amazon in Rio 2
description: Images from Rio 2 of sequences set in the Amazon rain forest.

title: A Protg of James Turrell Makes His New York Debut (With Lasers and Holograms, Naturally)
description: As a child growing up in Ohio, the artist Matthew Schreiber was fascinated by the lasers he saw in Star Wars and at the theme park Ontario Place in Toronto, which he visited with his family. Years later, he began incorporating them into his art practice, and today he will unveil those efforts, including a mesmerizing room filled with darting red beams of light, in his first New York solo show, Sideshow, on view through May 10 at Johannes Vogt.

title: Yee I-Lann: Picturing Power
description: Tyler Rollins Fine Art

title: Pictures of the Day: India and Elsewhere
description: Photos from India, Indonesia, Israel and Russia.

title: Kristen Morgin: The Super Can Man and Other Illustrated Classics
description: Zach Feuer

title: Peter Buggenhout: Caterpillar Logic II
description: Gladstone Gallery

title: Paris-Roubaixs Quaint Course Is Viciously Bumpy
description: WALLERS, France  On one side, the rock was as flinty and jagged as a chipped tooth. On the other, its edge was caved in, so the surface sheared away sharply. Squatting in the dirt, Clement Huchez examined the stone, rolling it in his hands for a few moments. Then he slid it into the rubble puzzle in front of him and exclaimed, Its perfect!

title: Greece Returns to the Bond Markets
description: The European Unions competition commissioner, Joaqun Almunia, and the Greek finance minister, Yannis Stournaras, said Greeces return to the bond markets was good news for the whole euro zone.

title: Joe Sola: American Sex Room and other Works
description: Blackston

title: Letters: Canon Fire
description: Canon Fire

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 63
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: Ivn Navarro: This Land is Your Land
description: Madison Square Park

title: The Cubs of Wall Street
description: Imagine youre a scientist in some sci-fi alternate universe, and youve been charged with creating a boot camp that will reliably turn normal but ambitious people into broken sociopaths more or less willing to do anything.

title: The Justice Gap
description: Low-class people do low-class things. Whats notable in this reflexive dismissal of those with modest means are not the words themselves. Rather, please turn your attention to the person whom Matt Taibbi, in his ambitious new book documenting Americas unequal administration of justice to rich and poor, quotes saying them: a private attorney hired by New York State to defend low-income people in criminal court. We never learn his name, but Taibbi calls him Waldorf because he resembles the grouchy old balcony heckler on The Muppet Show.

title: Demolished Club Casts a Long Shadow
description: The developer HFZ Capital is proposing a new building for the empty lot at 20 West 40th Street, and the Historic Districts Council is not happy, protesting that the flat-topped 32-story tower is out of place on a street that has long had a picturesque skyline.

title: At One With Their Dogs, Growling and Snapping
description: The most indelible scenes in David Gordon Greens Joe, filmed in the backwoods of Texas, have the fierce clarity of illuminations glimpsed in a lightning flash. In one lingering afterimage, a team of mostly African-American laborers, toiling in a desiccated pine forest, methodically poison sickly trees with juice hatchets (small axes that squirt deadly herbicide) to kill them off and make room for the planting of hardier species. These woodsmen, played by nonprofessionals, share an easy, rough-hewn camaraderie. They are the least tormented characters in Joe, a punishing exercise in Southern miserablism.

title: An Alfresco Fling Beats Selling Tractors
description: Before Alain Guiraudie made his justly lauded Stranger by the Lake, he directed The King of Escape, a fresh, antic comedy thats powered just as much by libido. In this case, sex is comedy, and Mr. Guiraudie makes the most of the anarchic freedoms of the genre. Originally shown at Cannes in 2009, The King of Escape matter-of-factly sketches out a randy patch of the French countryside, where cruising thrives among butch, gray-haired rustics and where aphrodisiac roots grow in the woods.

title: Heads or Tails
description: The life of a penny.

title: No Cause for Shame
description: My husband and I will soon be reunited with a couple we spent a lot time with in the 80s, but havent seen much of since. Our sons, now both 34, used to play together, so I know the subject of children will come up. But our son has suffered from addiction for years, and lives on the edge of poverty because of the unfortunate choices hes made. How do we deal with their questions without infringing on his privacy?

title: What the Sea Took Away, a Daughter Restores
description: Fourteen years ago, my husband vanished. A talented sculptor whose work was in major collections, he had been in a downward spiral for over a year, unable to finish a single piece of work, tumbling into alcoholism, paralyzed by depression.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times.

title: Art and Style Are Their Lifeblood
description: With their finely chiseled clavicles and cheekbones, their nocturnal habits and exquisite taste, Adam and Eve are about the coolest couple you could imagine. (They are played by Tom Hiddleston and Tilda Swinton, which definitely helps.) Adam lives in a vast apartment in the picturesque ruins of Detroit, surrounded by vinyl records and vintage guitars acquired by an eager young gofer named Ian (Anton Yelchin). Eve haunts the alleys of Tangier, speed-reading old books in every known language and lingering in an all-night cafe with Christopher Marlowe, who still regrets, five centuries after the fact, not receiving proper credit for Shakespeares plays.

title: A Weeks Vigil, Then Easter Hallelujahs
description: A sampling of musical presentations planned for the holiday season at churches and other sites in New York, compiled by Anne Mancuso. All are free unless otherwise noted. (Churches accept donations. Unless noted otherwise, church choirs are featured in church concerts.) An expanded listing is available at nytimes.com/arts.

title: Missing Ingredient on Minimum Wage: A Motivated G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON  Each of the three previous presidents  two Republicans, one Democrat  signed an increase in the federal minimum wage.

title: For New York City Doormen, Some Closed Doors
description: It has been more than two decades since the city faced a large-scale strike by the doormens union. But this could change when its contract expires on April 20.

title: 2 Regulators Issue Guidelines on Sharing Cyber Security Information
description: WASHINGTON  Sharing information between companies about threats to cybersecurity is not likely to raise antitrust concerns, the Justice Department and the Federal Trade Commission said Thursday.

title: Tenor Receives Richard Tucker Award
description: Michael Fabiano, a 29-year-old whose burnished tenor has made him one of the opera worlds most closely watched young singers, has won the $50,000 Richard Tucker Award, the foundation that gives the award announced on Thursday.

title: A Delaware Court Flexes a Never-Tested Muscle
description: The Delaware Court of Chancery, known as the nations business court, has now done something it had apparently never done before in its 222 years  issue an arrest warrant.

title: Banned Groups Leader Given Pakistani Parliament Seat After Vote Dispute
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistans electoral commission has granted a parliamentary seat to the leader of a banned sectarian group that has long been accused of inciting violence against minority Shiites.

title: Jazz Singer, Meet Big Band
description: When a jazz singer performs with a large band, transcendence arrives only at the moment that the disparate musical ingredients suddenly click into place, and you feel propelled by the acceleration of a mighty engine whose components all mesh. Such moments were infrequent on Tuesday evening at Birdland, where the singer Jane Monheit appeared with the Manhattan School of Music Swing Band. But the few times the elements jelled, the aligned forces achieved the state of bliss I like to call musical liftoff.

title: Peeling Back the Layers of Time for a 30th Anniversary
description: Stephen Petronios staying power, especially in the financially precarious world of modern dance, is breathtaking. Whether his sinuous, slippery choreography appeals or not  more on that later  he is committed.

title: Writing a Playbook That Ensures Glory
description: Kevin Costner is one of the great salesmen in American movies, a natural-born closer. Hell look you in the eye, start in with the pitch, and the next thing you know, you almost believe that Donald Sutherland and Lyndon Johnson killed Kennedy; that if you build a ballpark in the middle of a cornfield, they will come; and that Dances With Wolves is a better picture than Goodfellas. Something about him  the baby blues, the slightly weak chin, the aw-shucks manner, at once aggressive and self-effacing  makes him hard to resist, even when you know youre being conned. Thats part of the appeal.

title: Navigating the Art of Japan From a Different Direction
description: No compass is needed for Points of Departure: Treasures of Japan From the Brooklyn Museum, a radically reorienting show at Japan Society Gallery. Organized around the four cardinal directions, the show gives you a new way to navigate Japanese art  one that emphasizes regional cultures, outside influences and indigenous populations.

title: Passions, Superstar and More
description: A sampling of seasonal celebrations in New York, including drama, readings and processions. Free, unless otherwise noted. (Churches accept donations.)

title: Whiffs of Choral Ambrosia
description: A sampling of choral works for the Easter season in New York. Free, unless otherwise noted. (Churches accept donations.)

title: The Breakfast That Preceded The Dinner Party
description: Love it or hate it, Judy Chicagos The Dinner Party remains a great, enduringly provocative monument of feminist art. Permanently enshrined in a triangular room taking up most of the space allotted to the Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art at the Brooklyn Museum, it consists of a three-sided banquet table with 39 elaborate place settings. Each is dedicated to a famous woman who is represented by the works most controversial feature: a fancifully stylized image of a vagina rendered in two or three dimensions on a large dinner plate.

title: Androgynous Betrayals
description: The breadth, nerve and intricacy of Francine Proses big new novel should surprise even her most regular readers. A bona fide page turner, Lovers at the Chameleon Club, Paris 1932 unfolds over 20 years, across an increasingly ominous Europe, among thugs and artists and poseurs who share only the danger that threatens to cramp their partying style. The Chameleon Club is their unofficial Paris headquarters, a cross-dressers heaven specializing in innocently filthy humor. But as that chameleon in that title indicates, everything here, even the Chameleon Club itself, is subject to wartime change.

title: Origins Story, Through a Modern Lens
description: The photography world has been ruled in recent years by a fascination with abstraction and experimental processes and techniques. You see this everywhere in the current Association of International Photography Art Dealers show at the Park Avenue Armory. Even Hans P. Kraus Jr., who deals in photographic old masters, is showing  alongside vintage prints by Charles Marville, now featured in a show at the Metropolitan Museum, and Eugne Atget  some 19th-century pencil drawings by John Herschel, an important contributor to early photography. The drawings here, of Stonehenge and sights on the European Grand Tour, were made with a camera lucida, an optical device that functions in a manner similar to that of the camera obscura but in full daylight rather than a dark room.

title: Theater Listings for April 11-17
description: Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current productions, additional listings, showtimes and ticket information are at nytimes.com/theater. A searchable, critical guide to theater is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Warily, Jordan Assists Rebels in Syrian War
description: IRBID, Jordan  When rebels want to return to Syria to fight, Jordans intelligence services give them specific times to cross its border. When the rebels need weapons, they make their request at an operations room in Amman staffed by agents from Jordan, Saudi Arabia and the United States.

title: Federal Regulators Advise Banks to Protect Their Systems From Internet Security Flaw
description: Updated, 7:17 p.m. | Federal regulators are advising banks to take steps to protect their systems from the Heartbleed Internet security flaw that could put sensitive customer information at risk.

title: Lifetime Anguish Is the High Cost of Courage
description: What place is there nowadays for a solid, old-fashioned movie about war, remembrance and reconciliation? That question occurred to me while watching The Railway Man, an unabashedly stodgy, high-minded film in the David Lean tradition (without the grandeur), starring Colin Firth as Eric Lomax, a British Army officer who served and suffered during World War II.

title: Sebelius Resigns After Troubles Over Health Site
description: WASHINGTON  Kathleen Sebelius, the health and human services secretary, is resigning, ending a stormy five-year tenure marred by the disastrous rollout of President Obamas signature legislative achievement, the Affordable Care Act.

title: Official on Report on Albuquerque Police
description: The acting assistant attorney general for the Justice Departments civil rights division, Jocelyn Samuels, discussed an investigation that concluded the Albuquerque police used excessive force.

title: Photo Diary | Milan Design Week 2014: Salone and Paul Smith
description: Scenes from the Milan Design Week photo diary of Danilo Scarpati.

title: Comedy Listings for April 11-17
description: For news about comedy and humor, including critical commentary: nytimes.com/arts. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Movie Listings for April 11-17
description: Ratings and running times are in parentheses; foreign films have English subtitles. Full reviews of all current releases: nytimes.com/movies.

title: Worry About a Smelly Rental
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly online column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Domesticated Macaws Reclaiming Their Wild Side
description: The cinematic equivalent of attack by kaleidoscope, Rio 2 sucks you in and whirls you around before spitting you out, exhausted. A tropical tornado of cadmium and cobalt, magenta and marigold, Carlos Saldanhas frantic follow-up to his well-received 2011 animated feature, Rio, ups the ante on sound and movement but pays scant attention to story. Prioritizing a sellable soundtrack  and a veiled plug for this years World Cup soccer tournament  over an original and engaging narrative might not have been the intent, but it sure feels that way.

title: Pop & Rock Listings for April 7-11
description: Prices may not reflect ticketing service charges. For full reviews of recent concerts: nytimes.com/music. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Jazz Listings for April 11-17
description: Full reviews of recent jazz performances: nytimes.com/jazz. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Seeking Favor Among Those You Regulate
description: The strangest things become commonplace in politics, like the ties that bind the oil and gas business and some of its regulators.

title: Opera & Classical Music Listings for April 11-17
description: Full reviews of recent classical performances: nytimes.com/classical. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Budget Chief Is Obamas Choice as New Health Secretary
description: WASHINGTON  Even when Sylvia Mathews Burwell was in her early 30s, friends speculated that she might return to her native Hinton, W.Va., and run for governor someday. After all, she had been a Rhodes scholar, and her mother  who later became mayor of Hinton, population 2,600  had driven her daughters interest in politics.

title: Dance Listings for April 11-17
description: Full reviews of recent dance performances: nytimes.com/dance. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Museum and Gallery Listings for April 11-17
description: Museums and galleries are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of recent art shows: nytimes.com/art. A searchable guide to these and many other art shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Spare Times for Children for April 11-17
description: ISLAND OF LEMURS: MADAGASCAR

title: Gathering of Gods From Places Long Forgotten
description: When the Metropolitan Museum of Art gives its all to an exhibition in terms of space, money and scholarship, and the art involved is as rich as a massed chorale and as haunting as a single-voice chant, no institution on earth can produce more impressive results. Such is the case with Lost Kingdoms: Hindu-Buddhist Sculpture of Early Southeast Asia, 5th to 8th Century, which opens on Monday.

title: Spare Times for April 11-17
description: OPENING OF LUNA PARK (Sunday) Veterans of the Cyclone roller coaster  and those who appreciate it best while standing on terra firma  will cheer as Luna Park kicks off another season in Coney Island, Brooklyn, starting at noon. An egg-cream splash on the venerable roller coaster, which turns 87 in June, will set it and the other attractions at the amusement park in motion once again.

title: On the Wall, Whos the Deadliest One of All?
description: Dont try to outwit a haunted mirror: It can see you. Thats the moral of Oculus, a derivative but efficient chiller that cribs from Solaris, The Shining and The Amityville Horror yet also shows glimmers of imagination.

title: Finding the Pleasure in the Details
description: Schuberts hourlong Octet in F for Winds and Strings can have a pleasantly narcotic effect on the listener, each one of its amply proportioned six movements warping sensations of time and purpose like a carefree summer afternoon. So I didnt think too much of it at first when I found my mind wandering during Saturday evenings performance of the work by Musicians From Marlboro, an ensemble from that Vermont-based festival, as part of the Peoples Symphony Concerts.

title: A Light Touch on Ecstasy, Melancholy and Wonder
description: The English soprano Lucy Crowe, who made her New York recital debut on Wednesday evening at Weill Recital Hall, is a winsome presence, with long blond hair, a ready grin and bright eyes. They match her bright voice, which suits the early-music repertory for which she has begun to be known in this country.

title: Digging Up Old Drilling Logs to Strike Not Oil, but Water
description: Daniel Ortuo pulled a small piece of Texas history from a shelf in a building at the University of Texas at Austin. The yellowing piece of paper said that on Dec. 19, 1951, John L. Boyd began drilling a 1,350-foot-deep oil well through 17 layers of shale and limestone in Crockett County in southwest Texas.

title: On-Camera Dating
description: A rare sustained epistolary romance, Hank and Asha runs on video recordings instead of pen and paper. Though not very ambitious, this winsome, whisper-thin tale shimmers along with the charming urge to connect and reveal yourself that links its two correspondents.

title: Breaking Silence on a Monk
description: Thomas Keating: A Rising Tide of Silence is a loving portrait of the titular Trappist monk and author, directed by Peter C. Jones, his nephew. The film covers Father Keatings early days in an affluent family in New York City and on Long Island, then progresses through his passionate embracing of the monastic life.

title: Doctors Shun Insurance, Offering Care for Cash
description: LAREDO, Tex.  For 12 hours a day, the waiting room at Dr. Gustavo Villarreals family practice is packed with patients who pay a flat $50 fee for the convenience  or necessity  of a walk-in, quick-turn doctors visit.

title: U.S. Indicts Ex-Connecticut Governor Again
description: John G. Rowland, who resigned as governor of Connecticut 10 years ago in a corruption scandal, was indicted on Thursday on charges that he tried to hide his involvement in congressional campaigns in 2010 and 2012.

title: Teenagers, Fed Up, Hatch a Deadly Plan
description: Several times, Perfect Sisters shifts its tone so jarringly that youre left scratching your head. But eventually you realize that Stan Brooks, the director, might be making a point with the incongruity. If so, kudos to him for trying something different in a movie that otherwise could have seemed like an extended episode of any of the scheming-teenager shows that are all over television.

title: GTT
description: Our quirky, discerning picks for

title: Kitchen Table Anarchists Under Siege
description: A stodgy banquet of idealistic speeches and weeping violins, No God, No Master presents a fascinating period in modern American history  the infamous 1919-20 raids on anarchist suspects by Attorney General A. Mitchell Palmer  with more earnestness than artistry.

title: Events in New Jersey for April 13-19, 2014
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Latin Rhythms, Exported to the Mideast
description: Pierre Dulaine, a teacherandformer champion in ballroom dancing, is the founder of Dancing Classrooms, a nonprofit organization behind the events in Marilyn Agrelos 2005 documentary, Mad Hot Ballroom. That film concerned Dancing Classrooms work with New York students; in Hilla Medaliascharming Dancing in Jaffa,Mr. Dulaine heads to Israel to try to instill mutual respect in 10- and 11-year-old Jewish and Palestinian Israelis through a 10-week course in the movements (and courtesies) of Latin dance.

title: Rescinding an Honor for an Anti-Islam Activist
description: To the Editor:

title: Finding Meaning in Life
description: To the Editor:

title: Philip Roth, Still Writing (Letters, at Least)
Students Reading E-Books Are Losing Out, Study Suggests
description: Could e-books actually get in the way of reading?

title: Exploring the Blot on a Newspapers Record
description: At a media ethics talk excerpted toward the end of A Fragile Trust, an audience member asks the speaker, Jayson Blair, why anyone should ever believe him. That question isnt satisfactorily addressed in Samantha Grants documentary, a decade-later excavation of the scandal involving Mr. Blair at The New York Times. Its not as if this superficial accounting of his offenses offered evidence of renewed credibility.

title: A Man of God, and of Contradictions
description: The title of Ilan Duran Cohens film The Jewish Cardinal may sound like a punch line. But it accurately describes a real man, Jean-Marie Lustiger, the Paris-born son of Jewish immigrants from Poland, who at 13, bar mitzvah age, converted to Catholicism in the fraught year of 1940.

title: On Madison Avenue, the Word on Mad Men
description: FROM the filming of its pilot episode to the disclosure that its seventh  and last  season would be split in two, the AMC series Mad Men has intrigued, captivated and sometimes infuriated the real-life counterparts of the shows fictional advertising men and women of the 1960s.

title: A View From Hong Kong
Wooing the Boss With a Spicy Dance
description: Comedy, romantic and otherwise, has shuttled back and forth across the Atlantic over the years, picking up a band of horny buddies here, some mumbling self-deprecation there. Cuban Fury (which has both) stars the British comic Nick Frost as Bruce, a former child salsa-dancing champ. But despite the overblown title, the movie is milder than a Will Ferrell drag vehicle and more of an ordinary shy-guy-makes-good yarn punched up with some recurring bits.

title: The Question Is Whodunit; the Answer Is Clear
description: Unthinkable is unwatchable, which is too bad, because there are certainly enough oddities in the incident it tries to dramatize to have made for a decent conspiracy theory film.

title: Events on Long Island for April 13-19, 2014
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: California: Reward Offered to Solve Attack on Power Substation
description: With no apparent progress in determining who attacked an electric substation in Silicon Valley a year ago, Pacific Gas & Electric on Thursday offered a $250,000 reward for information. The utility said that it planned $100 million in security investments in the next three years. The attack did not shut off power but did substantial damage when someone shot out radiators on 17 transformers and clipped fiber-optic telephone lines. Also on Thursday, government and industry officials testified at a Senate committee hearing that they were making progress on improving both physical and cybersecurity on the grid, a subject of rising anxiety.

title: Like, if You Cant Beat Em, Join Em?
During Hagel Visit, China Showed Its Military Might, and Its Frustrations
description: ULAN BATOR, Mongolia  When Robert M. Gates visited China in 2011 as the United States defense secretary, the military greeted him with an unexpected and, in the view of American military officials, provocative test of a Chinese stealth fighter jet, a bold show of force that stunned the visiting Americans and may even have surprised the Chinese president at the time, Hu Jintao.

title: Dont Stand There. The Dance Cartel Wants You to Shake It!
description: HOW do you start a dance craze? The members of the Dance Cartel think the next Nae Nae or Dougie could be the Space Bounce or maybe the Flickitty Poppitty.

title: Polk Award for Snowden Coverage Draws 2 to U.S.
description: Glenn Greenwald and Laura Poitras, two of the journalists who reported on documents about government surveillance leaked by Edward J. Snowden, plan to return to the United States on Friday to accept a Polk journalism award for national security reporting.

title: The Tobacco Ties That Bind
description: I DONT smoke, but if during the day I wanted to buy cigarettes, I could walk into the CVS pharmacy across the street from my office, or the Walgreens two blocks away, and get them. Theyre kept right behind the cash register.

title: Bush Urges Effort to Close Black and White Students Achievement Gap
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Former President George W. Bush called the achievement gap between white and black children a national scandal on Thursday and urged both parties to come together to address it as the central civil rights issue of the modern era.

title: Events in Westchester for April 13-19, 2014
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Russia: Lawmakers Want to Investigate Gorbachev
description: Five members of the Russian Parliament have asked the prosecutor general to open a criminal case to investigate the breakup of the Soviet Union and the role played by the former leader Mikhail S. Gorbachev. They contend that he failed to heed a referendum in 1991 that showed that a majority of Soviet citizens wanted to retain the union, and that he illegally formed a committee to study granting sovereignty to the Baltic countries. Mr. Gorbachev, 83, responded that he would cooperate but blamed the leaders of Russia, Ukraine and Belarus for the breakup. This stirring up of history captures an official mood today in Moscow, where many are questioning the legitimacy of former Soviet borders, and President Vladimir V. Putins government has twice in five years crossed them with the Russian Army, in Georgia in 2008 and in Ukraine this year.

title: How to Heal the Heartland
description: Its tornado season, the springtime tempest, which means the Big Empty of the United States will get another cameo on the nations stage. Prepare for the annual montage of heartbreak and houses tossed to the wind, of schools scalped of their roofs and trailer parks reduced to rubble.

title: The Grand Jury Indictment
description: The United States attorneys office said John G. Rowland, a Republican who served as governor of Connecticut from 1995 to 2004 and as a congressman from 1985 to 1991, would be arraigned on Friday afternoon.

title: Health Care Nightmares
description: When it comes to health reform, Republicans suffer from delusions of disaster. They know, just know, that the Affordable Care Act is doomed to utter failure, so failure is what they see, never mind the facts on the ground.

title: Shoe Thrown at Hillary Clinton During Speech
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton was interrupted during a Las Vegas speech on Thursday, when a woman in the audience threw a shoe at her.

title: The Moral Power of Curiosity
description: Most of us have at one time or another felt ourselves in the grip of the explanatory drive. Youre confronted by some puzzle, confusion or mystery. Your inability to come up with an answer gnaws at you. Youre up at night, turning the problem over in your mind. Then, suddenly: clarity. The pieces click into place. Theres a jolt of pure satisfaction.

title: NYT Now: Sylvia Mathews Burwell
description: Michael D. Shear on President Obamas new nominee for health secretary.

title: Amazon Buys ComiXology
description: Amazon extended its domain over the world of words on Thursday by acquiring ComiXology, the giant digital comics platform. Terms were not disclosed.

title: At Amen Corner, Masters Scores Turn for the Worse
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  When Adam Scott walked to the tee of the treacherous par-3 12th hole during the first round of the Masters, he was at the pivot of the exalted Amen Corner. The crowd awaiting him  among the largest on the grounds of the Augusta National Golf Club  rose in applause.

title: For Greece, a Sign of Stability
description: After years of agonizing austerity and the biggest debt restructuring in history, Greece had some good news on Thursday when investors reacted enthusiastically to the countrys return to global capital markets with the sale of five-year bonds, raising 3 billion euros, or about $4.2 billion. The sale attracted more than 20 billion in orders, driving the interest rate down to 4.75 percent, well below expectations.

title: Israel to Halt Tax Transfers to Palestinians
description: JERUSALEM  Israel will halt the monthly transfer of tax revenues it collects on behalf of the Palestinian Authority and use the money to offset Palestinian debts to Israeli utility companies, a government official said late Thursday.

title: Mr. Cuomos Gift to the Cynics
description: Nine months ago, Gov. Andrew Cuomo looked New Yorkers in the eye and said, Trust is everything to me. Dont believe it.

title: Events in Connecticut for April 13-19, 2014
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Former Bell, Calif., Official Sentenced on Corruption Charge
description: LOS ANGELES  The former assistant city manager of Bell, Calif., was sentenced Thursday to more than 11 years in prison on corruption charges, and ordered to pay millions of dollars in restitution to the city she robbed.

title: Satellites Show Russian Forces Poised Near Ukraine
description: MOSCOW  NATO released satellite photographs on Thursday showing Russian military equipment, including fighter jets and tanks, that it described as part of a deployment of as many as 40,000 troops near the border with Ukraine. The release came the same day that President Vladimir V. Putin reiterated a threat to curtail gas sales to Ukraine.

title: Telling a U.N. Envoy to Stay Home
Anglican Leader, Under Fire for Remarks, Urges Caution on Same-Sex Marriage
description: OKLAHOMA CITY  The archbishop of Canterbury, under fire for appearing to link expanded gay rights in the United States to violence against Christians in Africa, said on Thursday that he is advocating for a slow and deliberative response to same-sex marriage, mindful of the global implications.

title: Former Massachusetts Senator Announces New Hampshire Run
description: PORTSMOUTH, N.H.  From the Mount Cube Sugar Farm in Orford to the Moose Muck Coffee House in Colebrook, Scott Brown has been testing his message across New Hampshire and, to the surprise of almost no one, has decided that it works.

title: In eBay Fight, Icahn Chooses Peace Over War
description: Its not every day that you hear the billionaire activist investor Carl C. Icahn utter the statement, its better to have peace than war.

title: Lance Armstrongs Positive, if Reluctant, Step in a Sports Purification
description: Last summer, Lance Armstrong sat a few feet from me and said he would never rat out his friends by publicly revealing who had helped him dope and who had known about his doping. Not a chance. No way. The last thing he would ever do.

title: Minnesota Lawmakers Vote to Raise Base Wage
description: Minnesota lawmakers voted to raise the minimum wage on Thursday, making it the fifth state to raise base wages this year with midterm elections approaching.

title: An App to Avoid the Unwelcome on Your List
description: Cloak is the antisocial-media app: It combs your Instagram and Foursquare feeds (and any day now, those of Twitter and Facebook) so you can avoid undesirable people. When someone youre trying to elude checks in on Foursquare, say, the location shows up on a map within Cloak, alerting you to the whereabouts of your nemesis. You can set the app up so that it alerts you when specific people  a former girlfriend or boyfriend, for instance  are posting to social media, or you can have a broad alert set for when you really just want to be alone. Despite its name, Cloak doesnt hide you; if you want to hide, dont post to Instagram.

title: A Private Equity Titan With a Narrow Focus and Broad Aims
description: One of the best-performing private equity firms of the last 15 years doesnt have a big name like K.K.R., Blackstone or TPG.

title: U.S. Agencies Generally Acted Properly Before Boston Bombing, Report Says
description: WASHINGTON  Federal law enforcement and intelligence agencies generally shared information and followed procedures appropriately in their investigation of Tamerlan Tsarnaev and his brother, Dzhokhar, in the years leading up to the Boston Marathon bombing, but they should have more closely scrutinized Tamerlan when he returned to the United States from Dagestan in 2012, according to a report by the inspector general for the intelligence community that was releasedon Thursday.

title: Keeping Track: Drug Sentences and Crowdfunding
description: Shorter Drug Sentences

title: Mexico: Convicted Trafficker Now Aiding U.S. Officials
description: The United States attorney in Chicago said Thursday that a top member of the Sinaloa gang had been cooperating with the authorities since he pleaded guilty to drug trafficking charges a year ago. The man, Jess Vicente Zambada Niebla, who was arrested in Mexico in 2009, is the son of Ismael Zambada Garca, believed to be one of the leaders of the Sinaloa gang. Under a plea deal, Mr. Zambada Niebla, 39, could receive a lighter sentence if he continues to cooperate. The agreement describes how he delivered tons of cocaine and heroin from South and Central America to distributors, who then smuggled the drugs to the United States. Also Thursday, the Treasury Department said that it was imposing sanctions on real estate companies in Guadalajara that laundered money for other top figures in the same gang.

title: Northern Ireland: Man Charged in 1998 Bombing
description: A well-known Irish Republican was charged on Thursday with the murders of 29 people who were killed in a car bombing in Omagh, Northern Ireland, in 1998. The bombing, which was carried out by the Real Irish Republican Army, a splinter group, was the worst single atrocity of the conflict known as the Troubles, and it wounded more than 220 people. But there has never been a criminal conviction in the case. The man charged Thursday, Seamus Daly, 43, was arrested on Monday. He was one of four men ordered to pay more than $2.5 million in damages to the victims families in a civil case five years ago. He has always denied involvement in the bombing.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for April 10, 2014
description: April 10, 2014

title: Radio Clip Shows Different Side of Republican Senate Challenger in Mississippi
description: WASHINGTON  State Senator Chris McDaniel cuts a smooth-as-silk image as he crisscrosses Mississippi seeking to topple Senator Thad Cochran in the Republican primary.

title: Lance Armstrong Reveals Names in Lawsuit
description: In documents released as part of a whistleblower lawsuit, Lance Armstrong reveals for the first time that several key members of his cycling team knew or aided him in doping.

title: Gaza Runner, Israeli Hurdles
description: The Palestinian Olympic athlete Nader al-Masri has been denied permission by Israel to cross from Gaza to participate in this years Palestine Marathon in Bethlehem.

title: Heartbleed Flaw Could Reach to Digital Devices, Experts Say
description: When the Heartbleed bug was disclosed on Monday, the attention focused on the fallout for major Internet companies like Yahoo and Amazon. But security experts said the potential for harm could extend much further, to the guts of the Internet and the many devices that connect to it.

title: Two Gambles on Outfielders, but One Costs Millions More
description: Grady Sizemore played every game in 2007, from opening day through the seventh game of the American League Championship Series. He was on the winning side of the final postseason game at the old Yankee Stadium, but his Cleveland Indians fell short of the World Series. The Boston Red Sox stopped them.

title: Mideast Tensions Sideline a Gazan Marathon Runner
description: BEIT HANOUN, Gaza Strip  As a boy growing up in this town close to the border with Israel, Nader al-Masri was the neighborhood champion of Catch Me if You Can. No one could catch me, he recalled. After soccer matches, young Nader would do laps around the empty field.

title: A Toast to the Ramps of Spring
description: The first wild onions of the season  or ramps, as they are called  are to die-hard food lovers what robins or baseball are to the rest of us: a harbinger of spring. One of the first restaurants in the city to be serving ramps this year is Tarallucci e Vino, an Italianesque wine bar at 15 East 18th Street. I basically called everyone I knew trying to find them, said Andrew Welch, the head chef, who eventually scored a batch of ramps from an unnamed forager in South Carolina.
