description: To the Editor:

title: Nascar Owner Haas Plans U.S. Formula One Team
description: CONCORD, N.C.  The first United States-based Formula One race team since the 1970s could be on the starting grid by 2015 if all goes according to plan for Gene Haas.

title: Internet Evidence Contradicts Russian Claims on Ukraine, Western Diplomats Say
description: Ambassadors from the United States, Britain and France all told the United Nations Security Council on Sunday night that video evidence posted online  showing well-armed insurgents seizing police stations in eastern Ukraine  contradicts Russian claims that peaceful protesters in the region are under threat from government forces.

title: Scenes From The Illustrated Courtroom
description: For Elizabeth Williams, who has spent more than three decades depicting famous criminals through her drawings, the job of courtroom illustrator is a study of character.

title: From Ordinary Life, Extraordinary Images
description: Chang Chao-Tang didnt think much of his images of everyday life in Taiwan, but a new exhibit highlights the purity of them, showing real people and places.

title: New York City F.C. to Play at Yankee Stadium for Three Years
description: New York City F.C., a team that will enter Major League Soccer next year, will play its first three seasons at Yankee Stadium, according to two people familiar with the teams plans.

title: Storefront, Airbnb for Retail Spaces, Raises $7.3 Million
description: Sometimes copying the concept of a start-up and changing the idea slightly can lead to astoundingly unoriginal companies.

title: Carriages Belong in Central Park
description: DURING his run for mayor, Bill de Blasio pledged to eradicate the Central Park horse-drawn carriage business. He called the industry inhumane, and proposed to replace the retired horses with electric-powered replicas of vintage cabs. Since taking office, he has not agreed to meet with the operators or hear their views. In a Google Hangout on Friday, the mayor affirmed his commitment to a ban: We expect action on it this year.

title: After Fire, Picturesque Hills of Chilean Port City Are Left in Ruin
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  Two days after wind-borne flames ravaged the steep hills surrounding Valparaso, many slopes of colorful houses that gave the slender port city a picture-postcard landscape have been reduced to rings of ruins.

title: The Oldest Hatred, Forever Young
description: Most of the hate crimes in the United States dont take the fatal form that the shootings in Kansas over the weekend did, and most arent perpetrated by villains as bloated with rage and blinded by conspiracy theories as the person accused in this case, Frazier Glenn Miller. Hes an extreme, not an emblem.

title: Voice of Soccer Calls the Action Well Off the Field
description: THE World Cup in Brazil was eight months away when a small group of ESPN marketers gathered last October to decide how to promote Ian Darke, the media giants lead announcer for the event.

title: Chinas Actions in Hunt for Jet Are Seen as Hurting as Much as Helping
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  When a Chinese government vessel took the world by surprise this month with its announcement that it had detected underwater signals that might have come from the missing Malaysia Airlines plane, China suddenly looked like the hero of the multinational search effort.

title: The Book That Didnt Exist
description: Seventeen years ago I wrote a book, which you can find on Amazon and Google and elsewhere online. This is unusual only because my book was never published. Its called Goths, fitting for a title that has left its traces on the Internet but does not exist. The traces themselves are ghostly. Other than the title, Amazon lists only the publisher (Random House Trade), language (English) and ISBNs (one with 10 digits, the other with 13). Google goes further by giving the publication date (March 1, 1998) and promising a cover image  but it turns out to be a placeholder. And unlike Amazon, Google neglects to mention that the book is a hardcover. Google admits, We havent found any reviews in the usual places, which in this case would be the planet Earth. Be the first to review this item, Amazon encourages, but has as yet found no takers.

title: Immigrants Stir New Life Into So Paulos Gritty Old Center
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  For obvious reasons, many Paulistanos still consider this megacitys decrepit old center a no-go zone.

title: The Deadly Cost of Fashion
description: A photojournalist who covered last years deadly collapse of the Rana Plaza building in Bangladesh draws connections to New York from clothing labels he found in the rubble.

title: Israeli Officer Killed on Way to Seder in West Bank
description: JERUSALEM  An Israeli police officer was fatally shot and his wife and young son were wounded Monday evening as they drove to a Passover Seder near the West Bank city of Hebron, according to a spokeswoman for the Israeli military.

title: The Deadly Cost of Fashion
description: Last April 24, Ismail Ferdous, my co-director on this Op-Doc video, photographed the deadliest disaster in garment industry history: the collapse of Rana Plaza in Bangladesh, which killed more than 1,100 workers and injured around 2,500.

title: Family of Shooting Victims Speaks Out
description: Mindy Corporon and Will Corporon spoke after their family members were killed on Sunday at the Jewish Community Center in Kansas.

title: Daniel Radcliffe Remains a Draw on Broadway
description: Daniel Radcliffes star power on Broadway remains intact. After helping generate million-dollar weekly grosses as the leading man in the 2011 revival How to Succeed In Business Without Really Trying, Mr. Radcliffe  best known as the eponymous boy wizard in the Harry Potter movies  returned to Broadway last week as the title character in Martin McDonaghs 1996 dark comedy, The Cripple of Inishmaan. For its first two preview performances, Inishmaan grossed $155,234  or 95 percent of the maximum possible amount, with nearly every seat sold.

title: Phyllis Frelich, Tony-Winning Actress and Deaf Activist, Dies at 70
description: Phyllis Frelich, the actress who made a groundbreaking and Tony-winning Broadway star turn in 1980 in Children of a Lesser God, Mark Medoffs play  written with her and her husbands help  about the courtship and marriage of a deaf woman and a man who can hear, died on Thursday at her home in Temple City, Calif., near Los Angeles. She was 70.

title: 2 Pakistanis Suspected of Cannibalism After Head Is Found
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  In a macabre case that has transfixed and horrified Pakistanis, the police on Monday arrested a man suspected of cannibalism after they found an infants head at his home.

title: Utah Garage Cleaning Turns Up Boxes of Suffocated Infants
description: PLEASANT GROVE, Utah  The infants were found in cardboard boxes, each one rolled up in a shirt or towel and tucked into a plastic bag. One had been stillborn, their mother, Megan Huntsman, told the police. The other six, she said, she had strangled or smothered immediately after giving birth, and interred them in the garage of her familys brick home here.

title: Canadas Lonely Standard-Bearers in the N.H.L. Playoffs
description: MONTREAL  Perhaps it is just a random quirk of probability, but the numbers are eye-opening nonetheless. For the first time since 1973, only one Canadian team  the Montreal Canadiens, fittingly  qualified for the Stanley Cup playoffs, which begin Wednesday. Six of the seven Canadian teams will not play in the postseason, while 15 of the 23 teams based in the United States will.

title: U.S. Halts Effort to Collect Old Social Security Debts
description: WASHINGTON  The Social Security Administration said Monday that it would stop trying to collect taxpayers debts that were more than 10 years old.

title: Appeal to Return 4 to Death Row Is Heard
description: The North Carolina Supreme Court on Monday heard arguments about whether it should reinstate death sentences for four inmates whose punishments were reduced under a law that allowed certain criminal defendants to challenge their sentences by raising claims of racial bias in their prosecutions.

title: 2 Executives Leave G.M. After Wide-Ranging Recall
description: DETROIT  In the first major shake-up of General Motors senior management since the company announced a wide-ranging recall in February, its chief spokesman and head Washington adviser, and its top human resources executive have left the company.

title: Iran: U.N. Is Asked to Resolve Envoys Visa Dispute
description: Iranon Mondaysaid it had complained to the United Nations over the refusal by the United States to grant a visa to its choice for ambassador, Hamid Aboutalebi, a career diplomat who once worked as an interpreter for the revolutionary group that seized the American Embassy in Tehran in 1979. The deputy foreign minister for European-American affairs, Majid Takht-e Ravanchi, was quoted by the official Islamic Republic News Agency as saying that Iran had asked the Committee on Relations with the Host Country to examine the issue and that Secretary General Ban Ki-moon should intervene if necessary. But United Nations officials said that neither Mr. Bans office nor the committee had yet received any written complaint from Tehran or its United Nations mission. An official at the mission of Cyprus, which currently leads the committee, said that after it received a written complaint it could take up the issue at its next, yet-to-be-scheduled quarterly meeting. The committee can only make recommendations.

title: Mexico: Homicides Decline Near Border, Report Says
description: Murders in Mexico declined in 2013, and they decreased significantly in several cities near the border with the United States, according to a new report from the Justice in Mexico Project at the University of San Diego to be released Tuesday. Using preliminary police data, researchers identified a homicide decrease of about 16 percent, with some of the biggest drops in murders in Ciudad Jurez and Monterrey, notoriously dangerous cities that have recently calmed down as the war between criminal gangs and the government has declined in intensity. Still, experts warn, it is not clear whether the decline is attributable to an overall weakening of organized crime: The number of gun-related murders has held steady as other kinds of killing have declined, and homicides have sharply risen in states farther south. Extortion and kidnapping have also increased nationwide. But with overall murder rates down for the second year in a row from their 2011 peak, some parts of Mexico appear to be on the mend, said David A. Shirk, an author of the report. The decrease in violence that the government in Mexico is trying to convince people of is in fact real, he said.

title: Specialists Join Call for Veto of Drug Bill
description: Womens rights and medical groups have called on Gov. Bill Haslam of Tennessee to veto legislation that would allow criminal assault charges to be filed against women who use illegal drugs during pregnancy. Critics say the measure will harm babies because pregnant women will be afraid to seek medical care.

title: With Ukraine Tensions Mounting, U.S. Weighs New Sanctions Against Russia
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama warned President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia on Monday against further disruption of eastern Ukraine even as the United States and Europe prepared to expand sanctions against leading Russian figures in the next few days.

title: Looking at Some Corporate Tax Loopholes Ordinary Citizens May Envy
description: Its Tax Day.

title: Phelps Is Back, and at His Age, Why Not?
description: Despite vows to the contrary, Michael Phelps, the most prolific medal winner in Olympic history, will return to competitive swimming after all.

title: C.E.O. Pay Goes Up, Up and Away!
description: At 79, Graef Bud Crystal is the grand old man of executive compensation critics. Once a top compensation consultant, he switched sides in the 1980s, becoming a fierce critic of many of the practices he helped institutionalize, and analyzing executive pay for other media like Fortune and, most recently, Bloomberg News. Hes been known to call his second career atoning for my sins.

title: Zander Hollander, Sports Trivia Shepherd, Dies at 91
description: Zander Hollander, a journeyman journalist who rebounded from the merger of his newspaper in the mid-1960s by becoming what Sports Illustrated called the unofficial king of sports paperbacks  particularly a once wildly popular series of encyclopedic yearbooks  died on Friday in a nursing home in Manhattan. He was 91.

title: Marathon Bombing Suspect Waits in Isolation
description: He cannot mingle, speak or pray with other prisoners. His only visitors are his legal team, a mental health consultant and his immediate family, who apparently have seen him only rarely.

title: A Long Obedience
description: Monday night was the start of Passover, the period when Jews celebrate the liberation of the Israelites from slavery into freedom.

title: In the Middle East, Time to Move On
description: The pointless arguing over who brought Israeli-Palestinian peace talks to the brink of collapse is in full swing. The United States is still working to salvage the negotiations, but there is scant sign of serious purpose. It is time for the administration to lay down the principles it believes must undergird a two-state solution, should Israelis and Palestinians ever decide to make peace. Then President Obama and Secretary of State John Kerry should move on and devote their attention to other major international challenges like Ukraine.

title: Red-Hot Brewers Win by Swinging Freely, Always
description: MILWAUKEE  No team in the major leagues swings as aggressively as the Milwaukee Brewers. No team in the major leagues has as many victories, either. The Brewers believe these facts are related.

title: Political Rifts Slow U.S. Effort on Climate Laws
description: WASHINGTON  The United States needs to enact a major climate change law, such as a tax on carbon pollution, by the end of this decade to stave off the most catastrophic impacts of global warming, according to the authors of a report released this week by the United Nations Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change.

title: In Ukraines East, Russians Are Blending Right In
description: HORLIVKA, Ukraine  In a video posted online Monday, a man wearing an unmarked green uniform calls to attention a squad of Ukrainian policemen who have just switched over to the pro-Russian side in this eastern Ukrainian town.

title: Gefilte Fish Is Scarce This Passover. Taste Buds Are Ambivalent.
description: Erik Antes spent most of Sunday, the day before the start of Passover, on the phone behind the counter at BenZs Gourmet in Crown Heights, Brooklyn, fielding frantic phone calls.

title: Batters Reward
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  Batter up! Gary Cee is back, and he, like many sports fans, is dreaming about baseball. Today, Mr. Cee is going to make sure that we get on base by any means necessary, even if it means walking us.

title: Unmet Promise on Discrimination
description: President Obama has made repeated use of executive orders to advance the administrations goals when Republicans in Congress refused to act. Last week, he signed two orders requiring modest but important steps by federal contractors to narrow the wage gap between female and male employees.

title: Apparent Hate Crime Aimed at Jews Instead Strikes Christians
description: William L. Corporon was a longtime family doctor, but to his family, he was Popeye, a nickname bestowed by a grandson, Reat Underwood.

title: A Deadline for Grandfathered Weapons
description: Weeks after a demented gunman killed 20 children and six adults in a Newtown, Conn., school, Gov. Andrew Cuomo and New York legislators passed the SAFE Act, a strong gun-control law that included a broad ban on semiautomatic assault weapons. Those who already owned such weapons could keep them if they agreed to register the guns with State Police by midnight Tuesday.

title: Preventing Painkiller Overdoses
description: The Food and Drug Administration earlier this month approved a hand-held device that can quickly reverse the effects of an overdose and prevent deaths from opioid painkillers and heroin. The easy-to-use injector delivers a dose of the drug naloxone, a treatment that is typically delivered in hospitals but can now be used by family members or emergency responders at the scene of an overdose.

title: Schimmel Brings Flair and Pride in Heritage to W.N.B.A.
description: UNCASVILLE, Conn.  On Monday afternoon, Shoni Schimmel, a member of the Confederated Tribes of the Umatilla in eastern Oregon, sat inside the lobby of the Mohegan Sun hotel, surrounded by Native American-inspired dcor and steps away from a souvenir shop selling dream catchers.

title: DNA and Insurance, Fate and Risk
Florida Lawmakers Proposing a Salve for Ailing Springs
description: CHIEFLAND, Fla.  To the untrained eye, Manatee Springs is an idyllic refuge in Central Florida: The cool water is so clear in parts that the sand glistens like polished aluminum. A vast series of underwater caves beckons thousands of divers. Deer wander by as do manatees, turtles, owls. Eagles soar overhead.

title: Yankees McCann Cleared by X-Ray
description: The Yankees reported mixed results from the medical tests performed on two players Monday.

title: Testimony From Britain May Be Used in Terror Trial
description: A key government witness in the terrorism trial of a radical Islamic cleric may testify from Britain via a closed circuit television connection, a federal judge in Manhattan said in a ruling released on Monday.

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, April 15, 2014
description: Its the Jewish madeleine. Its that food that has the ability to transport you in time and connect you to your lineage.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for April 14, 2014
description: April 14, 2014

title: Maple Leafs Turn to Shanahan to Give Team Identity
description: TORONTO  Brendan Shanahan won three Stanley Cups and an Olympic gold medal during his playing days, and the Maple Leafs hope that winning culture will transcend to a club that collapsed late in the season.

title: Dont Skimp on Legal Training
In the Bronx, Supporters Go Against Rep. Rangel
description: State Senator Adriano Espaillat picked up a number of important endorsements on Monday in his second attempt to unseat Representative Charles B. Rangel, the 22-term Harlem Democrat, gaining the support of the Bronx borough president, Ruben Diaz Jr., and several other members of the Bronx Democratic establishment.

title: Publicizing of Veterinary Files Is Urged for Triple Crown Events
description: The chairman of the Jockey Club, one of horse racings most influential groups, called Monday for the veterinary records of every horse competing in this years Triple Crown races to be made public immediately. He said the goal was to ensure that the horses were sound and not under the influence of unnecessary drugs and that the races were run safely and fairly.

title: Fourth of July Fireworks Show Will Move Back to East River
description: In the half-hour on the Fourth of July when the electrifying palette of fireworks dances and dazzles across the night sky, Lisa Ricca said that the familiar mantra of real estate  location, location, location  applied to her apartment complex in Weehawken, N.J., and not because she is a sales agent who has brokered deals for at least 50 units there.

title: Corrections: April 15, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Mets Record Is Better Than Play Has Been
description: PHOENIX  The schedule was not kind to the Mets over the first two weeks of the season. They faced the Washington Nationals, the Cincinnati Reds, the Atlanta Braves and the Los Angeles Angels, four teams that are considered contenders. Four teams with more star power than the Mets had, all with higher payrolls. These were teams built to win now, unlike the Mets.

title: Bystander, 13, Shot in Brooklyn
description: A 13-year-old boy was shot twice in the head on Monday in Brooklyn, apparently a bystander in a dispute between two men, the police said.

title: Worker Dies After Falling From Building
description: A construction worker died on Monday after he fell onto scaffolding at an office building near Pennsylvania Station in Midtown Manhattan, the police said.

title: Landlords to Repay Over $1 Million in Fees
description: Ben Warren, a retired theatrical prop designer, had lived in his Bronx tenement for more than 30 years when the building changed owners in 2007. Soon, heat and hot water became sporadic, repairs went undone and tenants started being harassed.

title: Pulling Tricks From Everyones Sleeves
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio can swell with enthusiasm for people and movements and moments progressive.

title: Officer Testifies About Encounter With Occupy Wall Street Protester
description: It was St. Patricks Day 2012, and after spending his afternoon looking for intoxicated people at Pennsylvania Station, Officer Grantley Bovell was deployed to Lower Manhattan to help clear Zuccotti Park of scores of protesters who had gathered to mark the six-month anniversary of the Occupy Wall Street movement.

title: Inmate Gets Life in Prison for Plotting to Behead a Judge and a Prosecutor
description: Joseph Romano seemed like just anotherpost-recession white-collar criminal when he went to jail for fraud two years ago  a Long Island man with a wifeand three children, a volunteer at his childrens school, a Navy veteran who liked vintage cars and had gotten too greedy.

title: Prices Soaring for Specialty Drugs, Researchers Find
description: Even as the cost of prescription drugs has plummeted for many Americans, a small slice of the population is being asked to shoulder more and more of the cost of expensive treatments for diseases like cancer and hepatitis C, according to a report to be released on Tuesday by a major drug research firm.

title: Whats on Tuesday
description: 10 P.M. (ABC) CELEBRITY WIFE SWAP  Isabella Hofmann, the former girlfriend of the actor Daniel Baldwin, trades places with Halima Rashid, the wife of the musician Jermaine Jackson (above right with Ms. Rashid) in this Season 3 opener. After struggling with drug addiction for a decade, Mr. Baldwin is sober and trying to rebuild his relationship with Ms. Hofmann, who lives in a modest home in the Hollywood Hills area of Los Angeles with their autistic son, Atticus (above left with Mr. Baldwin and Ms. Hofmann). Ms. Rashid, meanwhile, lives in a grand estate with plenty of room for her racks of clothing and shoes, as well as the couples show dog, Fiji. Despite the differences in their lifestyles, the women seem to welcome the change. The men? Not so much.

title: India Election Digest: April 15
description: What you need to know on Tuesday about Indias elections: A group dedicated to stamping out superstition challenges fortune tellers to predict the outcome of the elections, the daughter of Prime Minister Manmohan Singh expresses anger at the publication of a memoir by a former aide to the prime minister, and a former Coal Ministry official writes a memoir about his time in the government.

title: Adding Design to His Business Duties
description: Cali, Colombias third largest city, has overcome much of its reputation as a violent place overrun with crime and drug cartels. But it still surprises many to learn it is the home of a luxury accessories brand with a new mens line.

title: Mets Win Does Not Come Without Its Costs
description: PHOENIX  Juan Lagares and Curtis Granderson had started the season on opposite paths. Lagares was the young, exciting center fielder who was finally hitting enough to make a case to play every day. Granderson was the newly acquired, highly paid veteran who was in a slump.

title: Times Minute | Boston Bombing Tribute
description: The national correspondent Katharine Q. Seelye reports from Boston ahead of events to commemorate the anniversary of the marathon bombing.

title: Times Minute | Boston Bombing Tribute
description: In the Video

title: The Death That Kindled the Uprising at Tiananmen Square
description: Updated, 3:57 a.m.ET| Rarely has the timing of an ousted leaders death been so consequential. In 1989, Hu Yaobang, a former general secretary of the Chinese Communist Party, was attending a meeting of the Politburo when he became pale and shaky, asked to be excused and crumpled with a heart attack. Twenty-five years ago, on April 15, he died after a week in the hospital, an event that unleashed a cascade of demonstrations centered on Tiananmen Square, which culminated in the armed crackdown of June 3-4.

title: Expatriate Indians Return Home to Have Their Say
description: Sajid Aboobacker, 35, flew to Kozhikode, in the southern state of Kerala, from Dubai on a chartered flight on April 7 with 145 other Indians, desperate for their voices to be heard in a historic Indian parliamentary election that could see the triumph of the Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party and its prime ministerial candidate, Narendra Modi.

title: Submersibles First Scan for Jet Wreckage Is Cut Short
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  The search for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 has moved to the dark depths of the Indian Ocean with the first deployment of an unmanned submersible to scan the seabed for signs of wreckage, officials said Tuesday.

title: Reading Valentines Card, Pistorius Leaves the Stand
description: PRETORIA, South Africa  It took just nine minutes on Tuesday for Oscar Pistoriuss defense lawyer to release him from anguished days and hours on the stand, and he did so with a last, loving message from the woman he is accused of murdering.

title: Hong Kong I.P.O. Structure Is Fine as Is, Investor Survey Finds
description: HONG KONG  Hong Kong may have lost Alibabas giant initial public offering to the United States, but for some large investors in this Asian financial hub, thats just fine.

title: From Ordinary Life, Extraordinary Images
description: Chang Chao-Tang was a high school student in 1959 when he borrowed his older brothers Aires Automat 120 twin-lens reflex camera without much thought. He liked going for long walks with the camera after school; it eased the burden of his homework. Eventually, he found himself taking photos with the camera every day, photos of common people and places in Taiwan, like youngsters poking out of street corners or at beaches, farm animals, and dolls.

title: Tracy Morgan: You Got to Watch What You Say
description: The comedian Tracy Morgan talks to Dave Itzkoff about his return to stand-up, reflects on the limits of free speech and offers some advice to his former 30 Rock colleague Alec Baldwin.

title: Chinese Military Newspaper Likens Lost Jet to Pearl Harbor
description: Throughout the search for the missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, commentators have groped for analogies to convey the enigma of how a Boeing 777-200 could disappear without a trace. Chinas official military newspaper, the Liberation Army Daily, may well be the first to liken the aircrafts loss to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor.

title: Tribute and Mourning Year After Boston Bombings
description: BOSTON  It may be one of the biggest cities in the country, but Boston was a small town on Tuesday as it mourned the losses it suffered in carnage a year ago and honored the sense of community that emerged from the ashes.

title: Norway Returns a Rare Silent Film to China
description: Updated, 5:55 a.m.ET | In a gesture that could help ease relations between Norway and China, strained since the awarding of the 2010 Nobel Peace Prize to the imprisoned democracy advocate Liu Xiaobo, the National Library of Norway has returned a long-lost Chinese silent film.

title: Indias Supreme Court Recognizes 3rd Gender
description: Updated, 10:29 p.m. | NEW DELHI  In a landmark ruling on Tuesday, the Supreme Court of India allowedtransgender people to identify as a third gender and directed the central and state governments to give full legal recognition to them.

title: New York Today: Tax Day Ritual Recedes
description: Good soggy Tuesday to you.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times.

title: The Mazda Miata Turns 25
description: Tom Voelk, who produces the Timess video reviews, reveals whats in his garage: a first edition Mazda Miata. Heres his personal take on how the car was received when it hit the market 25 years ago.

title: A 25-Year Affair With a Mazda Miata, Still Going Strong
description: A lot of now-significant pop culture appeared in 1989: Nintendo gave the world the Game Boy; The Seinfeld Chronicles were first broadcast on NBC (and yes, they quickly renamed it); Mazda rolled out what has become, for many, the most popular sports car ever produced, the 1990 MX-5 Miata.

title: Animal Rights Group to Turn Bear-Bile Farm Into Sanctuary
description: A state-owned company that raises bears to extract bile for use in traditional Chinese medicine says it will hand over 130 bears to an animal rights group, and the farm where they were raised will be turned into a rehab center. The move marks a major success in the campaign to end the practice of bear-bile farming, which animal rights campaigners call cruel and abusive.

title: Hedge Fund Manager Makes Lonely Defense of G.M.
description: Updated, 5:42 p.m. |

title: In Annual Letter, BlackRock Chief Says Firm Will Keep Speaking Out
description: Over the last 26 years, BlackRock has become one of the biggest investment managers around, with more than $4 trillion under management.

title: A Non-Techie Tries to Build a Tech Company
description: As a non-techie, I was daunted by the task of starting a technology company, Posse. I had an ambitious idea to build a social network that connects customers and retailers but I didnt know what a line of code looked like, let alone what language we should use or how to tell a good engineer from a bad one. Like many entrepreneurs, I had a vision but no clue how to execute it.

title: Motorola Solutions to Sell Enterprise Business for $3.5 Billion
description: Updated, 10:14 a.m. |

title: F.B.I. Video Warns of Efforts to Recruit American Students as Spies
description: The United States government has released a 28-minute video about the case of Glenn Duffie Shriver, an American who took money from Chinese intelligence officers while living in Shanghai and was convicted of trying to acquire United States defense secrets for them.

title: European Parliament Approves Laws on Banking Overhaul
description: BRUSSELS  After countless late-night meetings and political skirmishes, the European Union on Tuesday put in place the final pieces of a landmark plan for managing a banking system whose troubles have done so much to dent the blocs economy.

title: Daily Report: Etsy Seeks Wholesalers Role in Handicraft Sales
description: Etsy, the popular e-commerce site for handmade, vintage and other artisan items, now has over a million sellers of goods, and the company says it generated $1.35 billion in sales last year. Still, although Internet retailing is a growing market, more than 90 percent of retail commerce still takes place in physical stores, and like many retailers that started online, Etsy wants a piece of that action. Instead of opening locations, Elizabeth A. Harris reports, Etsy wants its sellers to take wholesale orders, so that through them, Etsy can be in thousands of stores at once without ever cutting a rent check.

title: Ukraine Sends Force to Stem Unrest in East
description: SLOVYANSK, Ukraine  The Ukrainian military landed airborne troops at an airport about 25 miles south of here on Tuesday, raising tensions with Russia in the opening phase of what the government in Kiev called a wider military operation to confront pro-Russian militants in the eastern part of the country.

title: In Performance: Adrian Lester of Red Velvet
description: This weeks video features Adrian Lester in a scene from Lolita Chakrabartis Red Velvet, a drama about the 19th-century African-American actor Ira Aldridge. In this scene Mr. Lester, who plays Aldridge, reflects on a painful incident that happened during his days as a young actor. The show, directed by Indhu Rubasingham, continues through April 20 at St. Anns Warehouse.

title: Save the Subjunctive!
description: Heres the latest in my series of quixotic pleas on behalf of a dying verb mood.

title: Fast Home Wireless: A Content Weapon?
description: Consumers will ultimately choose the winners in the competition among cable companies, television networks, tech giants and others to supply our digital entertainment. We may do it, however, in a way we dont expect: by the speed of our home networks.

title: Adding a Religious Holidays Calendar
description: Q. Is there any add-on or overlay to add a comprehensive Jewish calendar to my Macintosh Calendar app on OS X 10.9 Mavericks? The current calendar offers a few religious holidays, but by no means all.

title: Dreaming of Corporate Tax Breaks
description: A LOOK AT CORPORATE TAX LOOPHOLES | Individuals have long sought to take advantage of dozens of tax deductions and loopholes, but corporations have excelled at this game, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in the DealBook column.

title: 3 Former ICAP Brokers Appear in British Court in Libor Manipulation Case
description: Updated, 9:13 a.m. | LONDON  Three former brokers at the British financial firm ICAP appeared in court on Tuesday on charges that they conspired to manipulate a global benchmark interest rate.

title: Desalination Plant Said to Be Planned for Thirsty Beijing
description: BEIJING  A coastal desalination plant planned for east of Beijing could provide a large portion of the drinking water for the parched Chinese capital by 2019, the state news media quoted officials as saying on Tuesday. The reports indicated that the government and state enterprises were investing heavily in desalination projects to alleviate a dire water shortage in northern China.

title: Believe It or Not, a Skeptics Journey
description: There are many writers who I wish would declare, as Barbara Ehrenreich does at the start of her new book, I will never write an autobiography. But she is not among them.

title: City University of New York Announces Dance Initiative
description: It wont come as a shock to New York-based choreographers to learn that a 2010 report from the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation cited a critical need for affordable dance rehearsal space in the city. But it might be a surprise to learn that the City University of New York has responded to that report with a new residency program, announced on Tuesday, that will provide rehearsal and performance space at the universitys campuses across the five boroughs.

title: Troubled Italian Bank May Seek Larger Share Sale
description: PARIS  Shares of Monte dei Paschi di Siena fell sharply on Tuesday after a report that the troubled Italian bank was seeking to raise substantially more cash than investors had been expecting.

title: President of Algeria Seeks Fourth Term
description: Abdelaziz Bouteflika, president of Algeria for 15 years, is running for another term despite his apparent frail health.

title: The Decision: One Child, One School
description: Jon and I binge-read the emails. We had applied to nine preschools for our daughter, and the decisions rolled in: We were in, off earlier wait lists, on new wait lists, we got into the synagogue. (Phew!) One lottery school that rejected us right away invited us to start the entire process from the top. Not happening.

title: Census Survey Revisions Mask Health Law Effects
description: WASHINGTON  The Census Bureau, the authoritative source of health insurance data for more than three decades, is changing its annual survey so thoroughly that it will be difficult to measure the effects of President Obamas health care law in the next report, due this fall, census officials said.

title: Now Screening | Tribeca Premieres Documentary About Raf Simonss Dior Debut
description: With Raf, we had what you could call a reluctant protagonist, says the director Frdric Tcheng of Christian Diors artistic director of two years, Raf Simons. He had always purposefully stayed away from the public eye. In Dior & I, which premieres this week at the Tribeca Film Festival, Tcheng documents the creation of Simonss first couture collection for the house in spring 2012. Having previously worked on fashion films like Valentino: The Last Emperor and Diana Vreeland: The Eye Has to Travel, Tcheng was able to gain access to Simonss famously cloistered world, documenting him as he studied Diors s archives, worked in his atelier and visited his childhood home.

title: In Our Pages: April 16
description: 1939: Roosevelt Presses for Peace

title: Diageo Makes New Bid for Controlling Stake in United Spirits of India
description: LONDON  Diageo said on Tuesday that it had made an offer of 1.13 billion pounds, or about $1.9 billion, to take a controlling stake in United Spirits of India.

title: Which Books From Your Past Do You Read Now With Ambivalence?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. Chang-rae Lee has said that rereading D. H. Lawrence feels artistically inspiring, but also cringe-inducing. This week, Adam Kirsch and Zo Heller discuss the books from their past that they now read with ambivalence.

title: Barclays Picks Former Bain & Co. Executive to Lead Compensation Committee
description: LONDON  Barclays said on Tuesday that it had chosen a former Bain & Company managing director to serve as the head of its compensation committee.

title: The Read Around: Robert Coover
description: Robert Coover, whose latest novel is The Brunist Day of Wrath, says he feels most like a writer when working late into the night.

title: Today in Small Business: Etsy Goes Wholesale
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: The Collections | The Top 10 Moments at Milan Design Week
description: Salone del Mobile, Milans annual design week, concluded Sunday. As is custom, the official Salone event where the biggest furniture companies introduce their latest designs all under one roof, in one of the largest convention centers in the world was punctuated with a series of special exhibitions called Fourisalone (meaning outside salone), put on by local showrooms, shops and museums. And this year, a few underlying themes unified the whole experience. For starters, everyone, it seems, played up the contrast between new and current designs against the historic backdrop of the city. At the center of it all was Rossana Orlandis much-talked-about exhibition of contemporary works at the Museo Bagatti Valsecchi, a 19th-century palazzo. I wanted to create a dialogue between the new and the old, Orlandi said about the show, Untold.

title: U.N. Cites Abuses in Crimea Before Russia Annexation Vote
description: GENEVA  Amid fears of escalating violence in eastern Ukraine, the United Nations called on Tuesday for action to counter misinformation and hate speech used as propaganda and urged the authorities in Crimea to account for killings, torture and arbitrary arrests in the buildup to the March referendum that led to its annexation by Russia.

title: Reopening of Picasso Museum in Paris Delayed Again
description: PARIS  The reopening of the Muse Picasso  closed for more than four years during a renovation and expansion  has been delayed yet again, a museum spokeswoman said Tuesday. Andra Longrais, the spokeswoman, said no date had been set for its opening and declined to give an explanation for the delay. Since the Picasso museum is under the stewardship of the French government, the official date has to be determined by the Culture Ministry. The building site is all but ready, the lights for the art works are in place and except for a few minor technical items, everything is done, Ms. Longrais added.

title: Video: Robert Coover Talks About The Brunist Day of Wrath
description: In The Read Around, authors talk about the when, where and how behind their books. Above, Robert Coover discusses The Brunist Day of Wrath, a sequel to his 1966 novel The Origin of the Brunists, which introduced the fictional religious cult of the title.

title: Rising Sun
description: Joe Romm draws our attention to the third slice of the latest IPCC report on climate change, on the costs of mitigation; the panel finds that these costs arent that big  a few percent of GDP even by the end of the century, which means only a trivial hit to the growth rate.

title: How Working Women Help the Economy
description: If someone asked you to name the most important economic trends of the last 30 years, you would probably respond with rising inequality, increasing globalization and fast-paced technological change.

title: Facebook Requires Users to Install Separate Messaging App
description: Youve heard of shotgun weddings? Well, Facebook is imposing a shotgun upgrade on everyone who uses its mobile apps. But the company swears youll live happier ever after.

title: Video and Social Media Posts on the Anniversary of the Boston Marathon Bombings
description: Updated, 3:13 p.m. On the first anniversary of the Boston Marathon bombings, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. was among the officials speaking on Tuesday at a tribute for the victims and survivors, as my colleague Katharine Q. Seelye reports.

title: Supply, Demand, and Unemployment Benefits
description: Ben Casselman points out that weve had a sort of natural experiment in the alleged effects of unemployment benefits in reducing employment. Extended benefits were cancelled at the beginning of this year; have the long-term unemployed shown any tendency to find jobs faster? And the answer is no.

title: Italy Nominates Veteran as Chief of Eni
description: LONDON  Claudio Descalzi has served as a hard-working lieutenant to Paolo Scaroni, the chief executive of the Italian oil giant Eni, for years. Now the Italian government, which has a controlling stake in the company, has chosen Mr. Descalzi to succeed Mr. Scaroni.

title: Countdown to the 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 58
description: After celebrating his 28th birthday April 10, Fernando Gagos world  make that his World Cup  crumbled.

title: The Young: Lost and Alienated
description: Flailing youth befuddled and intimidated by a forbiddingly complex world is a theme that seeps into the bloodstream of this years Tribeca Film Festival, which begins its 13th edition on Wednesday in Lower Manhattan theaters.

title: Times Minute | Kievs Military Operation
description: Today on the Minute, Ukraine announces military operations against pro-Russian militants.

title: Times Minute | Kievs Military Operation
description: In the Video

title: Facts & Figures: A Cheaper Obamacare
description: The Congressional Budget Office said yesterday that the Affordable Care Act should be cheaper than originally projected.

title: Finnish Stamps to Honor Noted Erotic Illustrator
description: In the fall, the Finnish postal service will release a new set of stamps, including evocative photos of Finnish bridges, pastel-hued garden scenes and  oh, yes  sleek sado-masochistic drawings with abundant amounts of beefy male nudity.

title: Peter Baker on U.S. Strategy With Russia
description: Peter Baker, The Timess chief White House correspondent, discusses the Obama administrations use of diplomacy with Russia in trying to resolve the crisis in Ukraine.

title: Taking No-Kill Approach With Feral Cat Population
description: It was nearly 3 a.m. and her target still had not fallen for the trap. Stephanie Seiler was sitting in a 22-year-old pickup truck on a Brooklyn street. She knew he would be back, so she opened a bottle of wine and settled in to the 12th hour of her stakeout.

title: Afghanistan Says NATO Airstrike in East Killed Civilians
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Afghan officials said that a NATO airstrike in eastern Afghanistan killed a woman and two children on Tuesday, again raising the issue of civilian casualties at a time when both the presidential election and the future of the Western troop presence are unresolved.

title: Moments From Pistoriuss Time on Stand
description: Dramatic moments from Oscar Pistoriuss seven days of testimony in his murder trial.

title: Obama Commutes a Prisoners Sentence, Lengthened More Than 3 Years by a Typo
description: WASHINGTON  Ceasar Huerta Cantu did not discover the mistake until he had already spent six years behind bars. His lawyer had missed it. The judge did not notice. But studying a report he was not supposed to have, the federal inmate noticed something was wrong.

title: Joan Jonas to Represent United States at 2015 Venice Biennale
description: Joan Jonas, a pioneering figure in performance and video art, has been chosen to represent the United States at the 2015 Venice Biennale.

title: Finishing One Race and Starting Another
description: A year ago, John Eligon, a Midwest correspondent, ran the Boston Marathon and then covered the aftermath of the bombings at the races finish line. He plans to run again this year.

title: Wheelies: The Molto Bello Bonus Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: The Case Against Higher Taxes
description: Because its tax day, because he mentions me and because Im easily provoked, below the quote youll find three rejoinders to Jonathan Cohns admirably forthright argument that American society would be much better off if most of us were writing larger considerably larger checks to Uncle Sam:

title: Gallery | Inside the Homes and Studios of the Worlds Finest Designers
description: The photographer Leslie Williamsons new book, Modern Originals: At Home With Midcentury European Designers, out from Rizzoli today, offers an intimate look at the homes and studios of some of Europes best known designers, including Le Corbusier, Alvar Aalto, Carlo Mollino, Gae Aulenti and Finn Juhl, alongside lesser known names like Roland Rainer, Joseph Nemec and Renaat Braem. It follows Williamsons first book, Handcrafted Modern: At Home With Midcentury Designers (Rizzoli, 2010). Both titles are part of a larger project Williamson began almost 10 years ago. I made a dream list of the homes of all the architects and designers I wanted to visit in my lifetime, she explains. Ive always been a fan of design, and I was curious to see how these people  whose work I love and am inspired by  lived themselves.

title: Image of the Day: April 15
Linklaters Boyhood to Open BAMcinemaFest
description: The Brooklyn Academy of Music announced Tuesday that its sixth annual BAMcinemaFest, which will run from June 18-29, will open with Richard Linklaters Boyhood, a film that has been receiving considerable praise on the festival circuit.

title: Chevrolet Corvette Z06 Convertible: A New V8 Engine Roars Inside
description: What is it? The droptop version of Chevrolets extremely powerful Corvette Z06.

title: Twitter Acquires Gnip, Bringing a Valuable Data Service In-House
description: Updated | Added the announcement of Twitters new vice president of consumer product.

title: ABCs Nightly News Scores a Rare Ratings Win Over NBCs
description: ABC News broke a winning streak for NBC News last week, though not an exorbitantly long one, as it once did in morning television.

title: Intersection: Dohas Souq Style
description: At the bustling Souq Waqif in Doha, Qatar, Fahad Al Obaidly, a fashion designer, likes to wear traditional garments then add a modern twist.

title: Editor With a String of Hits Is Joining Little, Brown
description: Little, Brown and Company announced Tuesday that Lee Boudreaux, a widely admired editor and the editorial director of Ecco, a division of HarperCollins, for the last nine years, has been named vice president and editorial director of her own imprint, which will bear her name and publish 8 to 10 titles a year.

title: Iraq Shuts Down the Abu Ghraib Prison, Citing Security Concerns
description: BAGHDAD  The Iraqi government said Tuesday that it had closed the Abu Ghraib prison, the site of a notorious prisoner abuse scandal during the American occupation of Iraq, because of fears that it could be overrun by Sunni insurgents who have gained strength over the last year.

title: Capital Murder Among Charges for Suspect in Kansas Shooting
description: OVERLAND PARK, Kan.  State prosecutors on Tuesday charged a 73-year-old white supremacist with murder in the killing of three people outside two Jewish community facilities on Sunday.

title: Whats the Point of the Pulitzers?
description: Do the Pulitzer Prizes still matter? Do they stand for anything except journalistic self-congratulation? The question comes up every year around this time.

title: Suspect Charged in Kansas Shootings
description: Steve Howe, the district attorney for Johnson County, Kan., announced that prosecutors had filed murder charges against the white supremacist accused of fatally shooting three people.

title: Not All Investigations Are Alike
description: Say a company finds out that it is under investigation for possible criminal violations. Its challenge is to figure out the chances that the investigation will result in charges and the possible impact of those charges on its business. Not all investigations are alike, and there are telltale signs about how serious a threat one may present.

title: Where Peter Chang Cooks, They Will Follow
description: SHORT PUMP, VA.  Peter Chang was in the house.

title: One Person, One Vote? Maybe One Day
description: President Obama said on Friday that he would make voting rights a priority. But given that Congress can barely get around to naming post offices anymore, D.C.-led progress seems unlikely.

title: On Tax Day: Whats Fair?
description: Jared Bernstein is a senior fellow at the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities in Washington and a former chief economist to Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: HotelTonight Goes Beyond the Last Minute
description: HotelTonight, the popular mobile application for booking last-minute hotel rooms, is now helping travelers to plan further in advance.

title: Derick Brassard Leaves Rangers Practice With Back Injury
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Center Derick Brassard left practice clutching his lower back Tuesday as the Rangers began preparations for their first-round playoff series against the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: After Rainout, Doubleheader for Yankees
description: The Yankees have high hopes that their two youngest starting pitchers, Masahiro Tanaka and Michael Pineda, will lead their rotation into the future, and both will be on display Wednesday in what could be a captivating day-night doubleheader.

title: Land Rover Discovery Vision Concept: An Intrepid Rollout
description: With New York preparing for its annual auto show, Land Rover chose a grand stage Monday night  the deck of the Intrepid museum in the Hudson River in Manhattan  to unveil its Discovery Vision Concept S.U.V.

title: Listen Up | Coachella Newcomer Courtney Barnett on Playing Slacker Rock and Life in the Fast Lane
description: Speaking before last weekends edition of Coachella, Courtney Barnett sounded wiped out. The 26-year-old Australian songwriter, who specializes in a lackadaisical style of slide-guitar music which she has described as slacker-rock, had just disembarked in Los Angeles after a 16-hour flight from Melbourne, her hometown, en route toCoachella, her first-ever major festival date. Its kind of terrifying, but I havent processed it, she said of her appearance in Indio, which shell reprise next Sunday during the festivals second weekend.

title: South Williamsburg: Catching Up to the North Side
description: New Yorkers love to debate about which is better. The Nets or the Knicks? This restaurant or that one? Subways or cabs?

title: Iran Escalates Dispute Over U.N. Envoy
description: UNITED NATIONS  Irans increasingly angry protests over the American decision to not grant a visa to its new United Nations ambassador, and the uncertainty over how far the dispute will go, have not only rubbed feelings on both sides raw. They have laid bare the limits of global law when its provisions clash with the interests of the host country, the United States.

title: Pension Deal Edges Detroit a Step Closer to Recovery
description: Detroits pension boards and a retirees group say they have reached tentative agreements with the city that could serve as a breakthrough in its quest to settle with its major creditors and propel itself out of bankruptcy before the end of the year.

title: After Prank by Dutch Girl on Twitter, Real Trouble
description: PARIS  Youthful pranks in the age of Twitter are no laughing matter, especially if you are a 14-year-old Dutch girl impersonating a terrorist.

title: The Gun Report: April 15, 2014
description: Last week, the Florida House passed a bill that would allow people to carry concealed guns without permits during natural disasters and emergency evacuations. The bill was pushed by the N.R.A., whose lobbyist, Marion Hammer, came down hard on the governors office for failing to carry water for the organization.

title: Blaming the Messengers, Euro Edition
description: Aha. I missed this, from Jrgen Stark, which is one of the most amazing things Ive ever seen written by a former central banker:

title: New Crop of I.P.O.s Getting Back to Basics
description: From Ally Financial to Zoes Kitchen, initial public offerings may be getting back to basics.

title: A Branch of Racines Is Coming to New York
description: Headliner

title: Neil Youngs Digital Music Project Raises $6.2 Million Online
description: PonoMusic, the high-definition digital audio business from Neil Young, has raised $6.2 million on Kickstarter, making it that crowdfunding platforms third-most successful project.

title: In Boston, Hope and Reflection
description: Officials and survivors of the Boston bombings gathered for a memorial service to commemorate the first anniversary of the attack at the marathon that killed three people and injured hundreds.

title: Italian Premier Appoints Women to Lead 3 Major Company Boards
description: ROME  Underscoring his stated ambition to shake up Italy and enact social and economic reforms, Prime Minister Matteo Renzi proposed this week that women lead the boards of three of Italys largest state-controlled companies: an oil giant, the largest public utility and the postal service.

title: A Sushi Guide, Designer Tableware and More
description: To Marvel Over: Never Too Early to Think Big

title: A Green Group Sees Hope in The End of Chinas Coal Boom
description: Through much of its history, Greenpeace has been big on what I call woe is me, shame on you messaging on the environment. As I explained at a TEDx event in Portland, Ore., over the weekend, fingerpointing (including Greenpeaces) is appropriate in many instances, but doesnt work well with human-driven global warming. The blame game too often ends up resembling a circular firing squad.

title: Yahoo Earnings Offer a Peek at Alibabas Big Growth Ahead of Its I.P.O.
description: For some time, Yahoo earnings have been more than a report card for the company. They have also been a window into the earnings of its partner, the Chinese online commerce giant Alibaba Group.

title: A Spicier N.H.L. Playoff Recipe
description: Under a new format this season, the N.H.L. playoffs are arranged by division, with no reseeding after each round, resembling an N.C.A.A. tournament bracket. Even though some teams face more difficult matchups than they would have under the previous format, the league got exactly what it wanted: matchups with plenty of spice and the renewal of some good rivalries.

title: Pictures of the Day: Boston and Elsewhere
description: Boston and More  Pictures of the Day

title: VW Shows a Refreshed Jetta
description: What is it? A mildly refreshed version of Volkswagens top seller, the Jetta sedan

title: Pictures of the Day: Boston and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Boston, Ukraine, Spain and Brazil.

title: In the Kitchen With Clmentine and Ruth
description: Ruth Levy is no pushover. A Bronx native of firm opinions and great vivacity, she decoded Nazi intercepts during World War II and went on to a career in publishing. Along the way she learned to channel her flamboyant sensibilities into sculpture, and somehow managed to badger the redoubtable Martha Graham into teaching her to dance. Though later blind and almost deaf, she has lived on her own, with the help of a health aide, in her Chelsea apartment of 50 years.

title: Yahoo Profit Is a Footnote to Alibabas Huge Gains
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Investors were already salivating over the initial stock offering of Alibaba Group, the giant Chinese e-commerce company. On Tuesday, they got a glimpse of Alibabas tremendous growth that is sure to whet their appetite even more.

title: Tavern on the Green Sparkles Again
description: Tavern on the Green reopens April 24 after two years of work inside and out on the historic, nearly 150-year-old structure designed by Calvert Vaux and Jacob Wrey Mould.

title: New York Drops Unit That Spied on Muslims
description: The New York Police Department has abandoned a secretive program that dispatched plainclothes detectives into Muslim neighborhoods to eavesdrop on conversations and built detailed files on where people ate, prayed and shopped, the department said.

title: M.I.T.s Alex Pentland: Measuring Idea Flows to Accelerate Innovation
description: In the 1970s, when he was a student at the University of Michigan, Alex Pentland worked on a government-financed research project that used satellite imaging to study animal life on earth. The focus was the beaver population and the animals movements in Canada.

title: Echoes of Downton Abbey on Vacation in England
description: Look down there, my 22-year-old daughter, Harriet, said to me pointing to a window beside us. We were approaching the south terrace of Cliveden House, an estate in Buckinghamshire, England, that for more than 300 years has been the home of dukes, earls, viscounts and, for a short period in the 1700s, Frederick, the Prince of Wales. I turned and caught the quick flash of a knife in the basement kitchen and watched as a young man wearing a navy apron and white uniform expertly peeled shells off langoustines.

title: Britains Working Mens Clubs Succumb to Modern Life
description: On a recent evening, over a couple of half-pints of lager (served rather icy, by British standards, at 1.50, or $2.45, each), the writer Ruth Cherrington reclined in the maroon upholstered lounge of the Langham Working Mens Club in North London. The scene was quiet. The barmaid hovered near the bars sole patron: a white-haired gentleman in a leather coat who was watching the BBCs Great British Bake Off on TV. Walls were cluttered with dartboards, billiard scores, trophies and advertisements for bingo nights. People want something more trendy, thats the thing, said Ms. Cherrington, with an apologetic look around the empty space.

title: A Fresh Take on Easter
description: Norman Van Aken, the Miami chef and restaurateur, will spend Easter weekend this year with family, he said, in Key West, where his career began. On the menu: Ham for a horde.

title: Flailing, Befuddled Youth
description: Images of some of the movies in the Tribeca Film Festival.

title: Yellen Suggests That Fed Will Push to Shore Up Market for Short-Term Debt
description: A crucial part of Wall Street still keeps federal regulators up at night. But Janet L. Yellen, the chairwoman of the Federal Reserve, said on Tuesday that the Fed was actively considering measures to strengthen that potential weak spot.

title: Intels Profit Slips, but Investors Are Still Turning Toward Techs Staid Stalwarts
description: For now, in technology stocks, it is nice to be a little old-fashioned.

title: Italian Touch, With a Taste of Cognac
description: The choreographer Simone Forti and the composer Charlemagne Palestine are old friends. They met in 1970 at the California Institute of the Arts and soon began improvising together in performances called Illuminations. But when they gathered together in a fourth-floor gallery at the Museum of Modern Art on Sunday evening, it had been nearly 40 years since they had last staged one of these Illuminations in New York. So it was a signal event, with a new title: Illlummminnnatttionnnsssss!!!!!!!

title: Photos That Cross Borders and Challenge Perceptions
description: Janet Jarman has followed Marisol from her childhood in Mexico to life as a young mother in the United States, making images that now educate teachers and doctors about immigrant life.

title: Oliver North, Now in the Service of TVs K.G.B.
description: When the producers of the FX series The Americans, an espionage thriller set in the early 1980s, began preparing a story line about the governments covert efforts to help contra rebels in Nicaragua, they wanted to consult with someone well versed in this chapter of recent history.

title: An Ache, and Pluck, That Linger in a Heart
description: Somewhere past the halfway point of Ashley Monroes second show at Joes Pub on Monday night, nestled between puckish but armored tunes called Dixie and Unhappily Married, there came a bittersweet new song with a softer story to tell. It was a ballad, From Time to Time, in the form of a dead fathers message to his daughter. Someday youll be fine, sweet as wine, Ms. Monroe sang in the chorus. Its all right to remember/From time to time.

title: Narcissism (Smile!), Set to a Thumping Beat
description: Perhaps every social trend gets the anthem it deserves, but the selfie generation deserves something a little more imaginative and nurturing than #Selfie, by the New York dance music duo the Chainsmokers.

title: Where Humbert Humbert Might Whisper in Your Ear
description: There was something strange going on at the Mid-Manhattan Library on Monday night. If regular patrons glanced up, they might wonder why a blond girl in a colorful sundress and two long fishtail braids was walking people over to a corner, making them swear an oath against animal cruelty, then running away. Or why a man took groups of two behind a bookshelf to show them a beetle and talk about Franz Kafka.

title: Notes of Orange, Apple and Brooklyn
description: THIS ROOM DIFFUSER IS LIKE EXCALIBUR, said Ginger Partington, the tall and bodacious vendeuse at Twisted Lily, an upscale perfume store that has been inexorably wending its way around (Im not going to say choking) the longtime essential-oil purveyors of Boerum Hill, Brooklyn.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times.

title: Architects Mourn Former Folk Art Museum Building
description: As scaffolding went up around the former Folk Art Museum building on Tuesday, one of its two architects broke his silence to say how devastated he and his partner are about the Museum of Modern Arts decision to tear down one of our most important buildings to date.

title: Moelis & Co. Prices Its I.P.O. at $25 a Share, Below Expectations
description: Shares in publicly traded investment banks havent fared well so far this year. Investors are betting that Moelis & Company, a seven-year-old boutique founded by a veteran deal maker, will do better.

title: Getting a College Degree in Prison
Angelika Taschen on the Ever-Changing Magic of Berlin
description: When Angelika Taschen speaks of Berlin, her passion is palpable. Words like outstanding and beautiful are affectionately spun into the conversation, and her soft German accent bounces with enthusiasm. This city has risen from the ashes to become something very magical, she says. It is constantly changing, so there is always something new to discover  I love it.

description: RECENT SALE

title: Medicare and Eye Doctors
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: His Rsum Before the Age of 4: I Saw Jesus on a Horse
description: The wooing of religious moviegoers  a delicate operation, as the Noah backlash attests  has been ramping up lately, with major players like Ridley Scott and Ben Kingsley mining the Bible for box office gold. But if theres such a thing as a safe bet in this genre, its Heaven Is for Real, a Christian sermon that even the most doctrinaire believer can applaud.

title: In Corporate Monitor, a Well-Paying Job but Unknown Results
PET Scans Offer Clues on Vegetative States
description: People with severe brain injuries sometimes emerge from a coma awake but unresponsive, leaving families with painful questions. Are they aware? Can they think and feel? Do they have any chance of recovery?

title: In Nigeria, Terrorism Moves South
description: ABUJA, Nigeria  LATE last month, a workman on his way to my house rang to explain that he was running late because of the mayhem caused by a bomb blast in the city. Instantly, I was skeptical. There couldnt possibly be another bomb in Abuja. Not with all the tedious checkpoints on major streets here, and the thorough checks at the entrance to public buildings.

title: Two Artistic Outlooks, Heightened Side by Side
description: The artists Tacita Dean and Mary Frank might not make the most obvious pair, but they share space  and explore it  in a portmanteau program at Film Forum. Ms. Deans latest film experiment, JG, traces time in stark outlines with desolate landscapes, triptychs and some dazzling cutout techniques, all of which are followed by Visions of Mary Frank, a comradely portrait of that sculptor by the musician and documentarian John Cohen.

title: Tensions Boil Over on Camera in Ukraines East and West
description: As my colleague Andrew Kramer reports, Ukraine moved to blunt the momentum of separatist rebels in the east of the country, launching a military operation to secure an air base in Kramatorsk, where the police headquarters was seized last weekend.

title: Steven B. Greenberg
description: Mr. Greenberg, 67, is a founder and the president of the Greenberg Group, a real estate advisory and brokerage company based in Hewlett, N.Y., that focuses on retailers. Clients include the luxury brands Gucci and Faonnable.

title: Nasal Spray Holds Hope in Fighting Flu Epidemic
description: Scottish and American scientists have found a new way to prevent flu infections that could, in theory, be used to fight an epidemic long before a vaccine is ready.

title: Chevrolet Trax: The Big News Is Old News
description: Chevrolet doesnt have a lot to talk about at this years New York auto show, but the company is making the most of whats at least partially new in its lineup.

title: Days of Tea and Honey: Memories of a Quiet Iraq
description: Six months ago, a suicide bomber killed 13 children at a school playground in Qabak, Iraq, a town near Tal Afar in the northern province of Nineveh. I was dismayed to read the news. My platoon visited Qabak often during our deployment in 2009. It was quiet then. Iraq, we thought, had finally achieved a tentative peace.

title: A London Guide for 1 Police Plaza
description: Since returning as commissioner of the New York Police Department, William J. Bratton has been generous in thanking those who helped him get here: the mayor, Bill de Blasio, for the job; his wife, Rikki Klieman, for her support; even a childrens book, for igniting his boyhood fascination with the police.

title: Tech Leaps, Job Losses and Rising Inequality
description: Its hard to overstate the excitement of tech people about what is on the verge of happening to the practice of medicine.

title: Veterans and White Supremacy
description: EVANSTON, Ill.  WHEN Frazier Glenn Miller shot and killed three people in Overland Park, Kan., on Sunday, he did so as a soldier of the white power movement: a groundswell that united Klansmen, neo-Nazis and other fringe elements after the Vietnam War, crested with the bombing of the Oklahoma City federal building in 1995, and remains a diminished but potent threat today.

title: The Civil War Death Toll, Reconsidered
description: What did the Civil Wars death toll mean to those who lived through it? We are now told that wartime deaths were unprecedented and overwhelming, and constituted one of the fundamental experiences for the wartime generation. But is this really true?

title: Changes in Store for American Masters on PBS
description: American Masters, the award-winning 28-year-old PBS biography series that has traditionally chronicled the lives of prominent Americans in arts and culture, is getting a broader purview as well as a new executive producer.

title: Sir Robert Peels Nine Principles of Policing
description: Police Commissioner William J. Bratton lists the following guidelines on his blog. There is some doubt among scholars that Sir Robert Peel actually enunciated any of his nine principles himself  some researchers say they were formulated in 1829 by the two first commissioners of Londons Metropolitan Police Department.

title: When Is Foreign Aid Meddling?
Marine Is Disciplined for Drinking on Presidential Trip
description: The Marine Corps has removed a Marine from embassy security detail after he broke a rule against consuming alcohol in the hours before reporting for duty in the Netherlands, where President Obama attended a summit meeting last month, a spokesman said. The Marine, Cpl. Korey Nathan Pritchett, had been drinking within eight hours of working security as part of a temporary assignment for the presidents trip, the spokesman said Tuesday. Corporal Pritchett has been reassigned from duty at the embassy in Montenegro, but details of his new posting were not announced. The spokesman also declined to discuss other disciplinary measures against Corporal Pritchett.

title: Early Data in E-Cigarette Study May Raise Safety Concerns
description: A laboratory study presented early this year reported that the nicotine-laced vapor generated by an electronic cigarette promoted the development of cancer in certain types of human cells much in the same way that tobacco smoke does.

title: In Yonkers, a Shuttered Jail Becomes Part of a Budding Art Scene
description: YONKERS  Mayor Mike Spano looked out at the waterfront here and decided it was no place for a jail. So last year he put the Yonkers City Jail up for sale.

title: For Hockeys Version of Pairs Skaters, Points Arent for Style
description: Ryan Getzlaf and Corey Perry were born in Canada six days apart. They were drafted by Anaheim in the first round of the 2003 N.H.L. draft nine picks apart. They made the Ducks together in 2006-7.

title: Not the Same Old, Same Old
description: At first, the article in The Jerusalem Post last week seemed like the same old, same old: A picture of a ransacked Israel Defense Forces post in the West Bank. Then a quote from Defense Minister Moshe Yaalon: The State of Israel will not tolerate such criminal activity, which is terrorism in all respects. Those Palestinians will never quit.

title: Milan Court Gives Berlusconi a Year of Community Service
description: ROME  For a man who attracted headlines  and legal trouble  for cavorting with bevies of young, and sometimes very young, women, being forced to spend time with people closer to his own age may be a bitter pill for Silvio Berlusconi.

title: Washington Retail Districts Future Rides on Streetcars
description: WASHINGTON  The streetcars stopped running in 1949, replaced by buses. In the wake of the assassination of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. the 1968 riots devastated the commercial corridor. Only in recent years has revitalization occurred and gentrification taken hold.

title: Sue Townsend, Creator of Adrian Mole Books, Dies at 68
description: Sue Townsend, who beat the odds of a difficult early life to become one of Britains most popular writers and social critics, chronicling life on the economic fringes of post-imperial Britain with insight and wit, died on Thursday in Leicester, England. She was 68.

title: Talk About Income Inequality: De Blasio Is No Bloomberg, Tax Returns Confirm
description: No beachfront acquisitions in the Hamptons. No lavish household expenses.

title: Unpaid Interns Gain the Right to Sue
description: Thousands of interns poised to flood New York Citys offices and institutions this summer may be unpaid. But come June, their legal standing will be improved.

title: Tech Companies Commit to Offering a Kill Switch for Preventing Phone Theft
description: To combat phone theft, several lawmakers over the last year have put pressure on manufacturers and wireless carriers to include smarter antitheft technology on smartphones. A group of tech and phone companies on Tuesday said they were on board with the idea.

title: A Tough Transition for Womens Triathlon
description: Triathlons can be grueling tests of endurance and grit, but the sport itself is facing a challenging course among N.C.A.A. programs.

title: Turketarian or Meatatarian? Its All in the Framily
description: THE saying the Greeks had a word for it is getting a Madison Avenue makeover as marketers serve up more words of their own in place of real ones.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for April 15, 2014
Bloomberg Plans a $50 Million Challenge to the N.R.A.
description: Michael R. Bloomberg, making his first major political investment since leaving office, plans to spend $50 million this year building a nationwide grass-roots network to motivate voters who feel strongly about curbing gun violence, an organization he hopes can eventually outmuscle the National Rifle Association.

title: Parking Rules
description: Because of Good Friday (Orthodox), alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City on Friday. Other regulations remain in effect.

title: Otto Petersen, the Voice of Vulgarity, Dies at 53
description: Otto Petersen, a ventriloquist who was the flesh-and-blood half of Otto and George, a comedy team renowned for vulgarity so stunning as to make Rabelais look like a church picnic, died on Sunday at his home in Keyport, N.J. He was 53.

title: Texas Twins Campaign, but They Arent Sure for What
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex.  Mayor Julin Castro of San Antonio faced off in a televised debate on Tuesday against a Republican candidate for Texas lieutenant governor, even though Mr. Castro, officially anyway, is not running for anything at all.

title: Look-Up Line Would Warn Dangers Ahead for Amateur Hockey Players
description: Despite a series of rule changes and awareness campaigns aimed at eliminating spinal cord trauma, amateur hockey players continue to sustain paralyzing injuries from crashing into the boards. Tom Smith of Swampscott, Mass., had the extraordinary misfortune to incur two separate spinal injuries, in 2008 and 2009.

title: Fresh Off Pulitzer Win, The Globe Tentatively Toasts Its Future
description: When The Boston Globe won a Pulitzeron Mondayfor its reporting on the bombing at the citys marathon last year, the newspapers editor, Brian McGrory, asked for a minute of silence before praising the journalists involved in the coverage, each one by name.

title: City Explores Ways to Curb Taxi Speeds
description: For generations, the back-seat drivers of New York City have coached their cabbies to step on it. Soon, a very different message may be coming from the front seat.

title: Mr. Putins Power Play
description: When President Vladimir Putin of Russia talks about what is happening in Ukraine these days, it is as if hes looking into a mirror. He says fascists and nationalists are running amok in Kiev, even as Crimea is annexed in the name of Great Russia; he says Russians are threatened in eastern Ukraine, even as Russia directs secessionists there to seize administrative buildings and arms; he calls on President Obama to use his influence to prevent the use of force in Ukraine, even as he puts a major military force on the Ukrainian border.

title: Better Rules for Bad Lawyers
description: In 2009, a lawyer in New York helped his client settle a claim for $30,000. The lawyer then had the check issued in his own name, deposited it into his own account and used all of the funds for himself. The client demanded his money to no avail.

title: Across Athens, Graffiti Worth a Thousand Words of Malaise
description: ATHENS  The young man climbed a 30-foot scaffold on a building in central Athens and dipped a brush into a tray of gray paint. With rapid flicks of his wrist, he outlined a haunting image: a baby with two faces, looking simultaneously into an abyss and toward the sky, its vacant eyes searching for a future that was not there.

title: Video of Suspect in Shooting Case
description: The police are seeking the publics help to identify a suspect who shot two people, including a 13-year-old bystander, on Flatbush Avenue in Brooklyn on Monday at around noon.

title: After Being Shot, Boy Comforted Family
description: A 13-year-old Brooklyn boy who was shot twice in the head stands a 90 percent chance of losing his right eye, his family said Tuesday. But they added that luck saved him from even worse harm.

title: Pineda Set to Face Unwanted Scrutiny
description: There will be no way for Michael Pineda to sidestep what lies ahead Wednesday night, when he pitches against the Chicago Cubs. For all he has accomplished this season in finally returning to the major leagues and performing effectively, he will find himself being scrutinized because of the mysterious substance that was spotted on his pitching hand during his outing last week against the Boston Red Sox.

title: Russia Is Quick to Bend Truth About Ukraine
description: MOSCOW  The Facebook post on Tuesday morning by Prime Minister Dmitri A. Medvedev of Russia was bleak and full of dread.

title: A Cleanup Plan for a Toxic River
description: The inventory of pollutants at the bottom of the Passaic River, which meanders for 90 miles through northern New Jersey, is long and truly frightening. More than a century of industrial activity has deposited PCBs, pesticides and other contaminants into sediment that, in some places, is 15 feet deep. Among the worst of the poisons is dioxin, generated in part by a plant in Newark that produced Agent Orange and other deadly pesticides during the 1960s.

title: Cruel Truths Always Survive a Shooting
description: Toxic dread floods the opening minutes of The Library, which opened on Tuesday night at the Public Theater, and good luck to the audience member who prefers not to be disturbed. It isnt just the sight of the girl on the table, laid out like a corpse at a mortuary, which greets theatergoers arriving at Scott Z. Burnss new play.

title: Game of Drones
description: WASHINGTON  It will be tough to go into the big battle against drones without the irrepressible Goose.

title: Headline of April 16, 1912
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Todays puzzle by Michael Dewey is an acknowledgment of the tragedy that befell the people aboard the TITANIC in the early morning hours of April 15, 1912. Mr. Dewey tells us more about why the puzzle is running now in his notes below, so lets move on to the puzzle.

title: G.M. Chief Cites New Safety Moves and Says Repairs Are Now Underway
