description: General Motors chief executive, Mary T. Barra, reiterated her vow on Tuesday to root out the cause of the long delay in its recall of defective cars and to make sure that safety defects are never again buried in the automakers bureaucracy.

title: More Talks Expected in Central Park Five Lawsuit
description: Lawyers for New York City said in a court filing on Tuesday that they expected to be able to resume settlement talks shortly in the protracted lawsuit by five men convicted in the 1989 rape of a jogger in Central Park, and would work to resolve the case by the end of May.

title: General and Former Defense Official Urge Nonlethal Military Aid for Ukraine
description: WASHINGTON  Ukraines military has an urgent need for nonlethal military assistance like body armor, night-vision goggles, communications gear and aviation fuel to defend against a potential Russian attack, according to a new analysis by a former NATO commander and a former Pentagon official.

title: More Shipments, New Accidents and Calls for Safety
description: A sharp increase in rail shipments of oil over the past decade has been accompanied by accidents and derailments that have renewed the debate about regulating transportation of hazardous materials. The shipments are regulated by federal authorities; state and local officials have little say. Despite warnings of safety risks, measures to restrict or ban such transportation have been defeated.

title: Despite Rise in Spills, Hazardous Cargo Rides Rails in Secret
description: Jodi Ross, town manager in Westford, Mass., did not expect she would be threatened with arrest after she and her fire chief went onto the railroad tracks to find out why a train carrying liquid petroleum gas derailed on a bridge in February.

title: Social Messages on Athenian Walls
description: The anguish of the times has increasingly crept into the elaborate stencil work and multitude of large, colorful murals found all over the city.

title: Arizona: Law Signed to Allow Surprise Inspections at Abortion Clinics
description: Gov. Jan Brewer on Tuesday signed a bill allowing health inspectors to carry out surprise inspections on abortion clinics without having to get a court-approved warrant. The law, which passed Arizonas Republican-led Senate last week on a partisan vote, subjects abortion clinics to the same inspection requirements applied to other medical facilities, to which warrantless inspections are the norm. Opponents argued that it invites harassment in a state hostile to abortions. Arizona is regarded as having one of the most restrictive set of abortion controls in the nation.

title: Brazils Star, Petrobras, Is Hobbled by Scandal and Stagnation
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  No company has embodied Brazils rise like the oil giant Petrobras.

title: In Syria, a Show of Democracy Amid Destruction
description: HOMS, Syria  The center of this city is a blockaded, insurgent-held war zone, its skyline jagged with broken concrete. Ringing it is a patchwork of scarred neighborhoods, some functioning but fearful, some crammed with the displaced, others reduced to bombed-out shells where only soldiers move. Much of Homs is scarcely fit for human habitation, never mind a safe and peaceful exercise in democracy.

title: At U.N., a Grim Viewing of Alleged Syrian Torture
description: UNITED NATIONS  Members of a deeply divided United Nations Security Council spent two hours on Tuesday morning looking at pictures of mutilated, skeletal corpses that were said to have been taken by a former Syrian Army photographer.

title: As Credit Dries Up, Smaller Companies in China Feel the Pinch
description: HONG KONG  Hunan Xinwei Bags Company, a manufacturer of knapsacks and handbags, is struggling to survive. The Chinese economy is slowing. Wages are rising amid a shortage of blue-collar workers. And competition from countries like Vietnam is growing.

title: Britain: New Surveillance Chief Named
description: Britain on Tuesday named Robert Hannigan as the next director of its electronic surveillance agency, GCHQ, which last year came under scrutiny for widespread spying alongside the United States National Security Agency. Mr. Hannigan, 49, who has been director general of defense and intelligence at the Foreign Office since 2010, will take over from Iain Lobban when he steps down in the fall, Foreign Secretary William Hague announced. Officials have denied that Mr. Lobbans departure is linked to the controversy over the close relationship between GCHQ and the N.S.A., which was revealed in documents leaked by the former American intelligence contractor Edward J. Snowden. Under pressure to be more transparent, Mr. Lobban became the first head of the agency last November to give evidence in public before lawmakers.

title: The Hague: Charges Stand for Mladic
description: Judges on Tuesday refused to throw out two charges of genocide against the former Bosnian Serb military commander Ratko Mladic, saying there is enough evidence for his war-crimes trial to continue on all counts. Under tribunal rules, charges can be dropped if evidence is seen as insufficient after the prosecution rests its case, which it did this year. Over the course of 200 hours, prosecutors brought 164 live witnesses and used thousands of documents  including Mr. Mladics own war logs  to make their case. Among other charges, Mr. Mladic, 72, is accused of waging a campaign of ethnic cleansing to drive non-Serbs from ethnically mixed regions of the former Yugoslavia, and of involvement in the mass killing of more than 7,000 unarmed men in Srebrenica.

title: Canada: 5 Students Killed in Alberta
description: A guest at an end-of-semester party in Calgary, Alberta, stabbed and killed five other university students early Tuesday morning, the police said. Rick Hanson, Calgarys police chief, said no obvious event or remark seemed to lead to the killings. The four men and one woman who died were each stabbed several times with a knife their attacker found in the house, and the police said they were all students at the University of Calgary in their 20s. Officers arrested a man near the house who was described as an invited guest and the son of a veteran of the police force. News reports said the suspect was a law student at the university.

title: Mets Lagares Takes Detour to the Disabled List
description: PHOENIX  The Mets had raved about Juan Lagares for weeks. How he was maturing as a hitter. How he knew the strike zone. How he was coming into his own.

title: Growth Rose 7.4% in First Quarter, China Reports
description: HONG KONG  Confirming the concerns of investors and economists, the Chinese government announced on Wednesday morning that the countrys inflation-adjusted economic output in the first quarter was up 7.4 percent from a year ago  and had risen much less than that, compared with the previous quarter.

title: A New York Rivalry Takes an Uneven Turn
description: It was the sight of Carmelo Anthony in street clothes Tuesday at Barclays Center that emphasized how diminished the supposed rivalry between the Knicks and the Nets had become over this regular season.

title: Abortion Endures as a Political Tripwire
description: Why is there such a difference in the durability of two foundational issues of American conservatism: gay marriage and abortion?

title: As Season Nears End, Wizards Can Rise or Fall
description: The 16 playoff teams are already known, but heading into the N.B.A.s final day of the regular season on Wednesday, there is still jockeying to be done. No team has more to gain, or lose, than the Washington Wizards.

title: SoftBank Shares Get Lift From Alibaba, Too
description: HONG KONG  Yahoo isnt the only company tagging along for Alibabas magic carpet ride.

title: Fargo Recap: Making Way for Marge and Lester
description: In Fargo, winter never leaves. The premiere of Fargo on FX resurrects all those parkas, earflaps and never-ending white fields of the stuff we grew so tired of this year.

title: The Three Breakout Stars of the Milan Furniture Fair
description: At last weeks Milan Furniture Fair, you couldnt turn around without bumping into a project by a heavy hitter like Patricia Urquiola, Scholten & Baijings, Barber Osgerby, Konstantin Grcic or the Bouroullec brothers. With many design manufacturers still struggling five years after the financial crisis, its little wonder that they are relying more than ever on star power. But even so, the rise of blogs, e-commerce and limited-edition design has made it easier than ever for young, independent talents to flourish, and they are producing and exhibiting their own work without having to wait around for big brands to show interest. There was no shortage of up-and-comers in Milan last week if you knew where to look, from the halls of Rossana Orlandis gallery to the Lambrate district to the Satellite section of the Salone itself. Here are three of this years standouts.

title: Revised SAT Wont Include Obscure Vocabulary Words
description: The College Board on Wednesday will release many details of its revised SAT, including sample questions and explanations of the research, goals and specifications behind them.

title: Younger Skin Through Exercise
description: Editors note: Were featuring thes article again because who doesnt want to look younger?

title: Times Minute | End to Spying on Muslims
description: On the Minute, the New York Police Department suspends its Muslim spying program, new research on vegetative patients and Oliver North helping shape the story line of The Americans.

title: Times Minute | End to Spying on Muslims
description: In the Video

title: Rescuers Rush to South Korean Ferry Accident
description: SEOUL, South Korea  At least one person died when a ferry that was carrying hundreds of high school students to a resort island listed to one side and began sinking off the southwestern tip of South Korea, the maritime police said on Wednesday.

title: More Ex-Players Sue N.H.L.
description: Three more retired hockey players have sued the N.H.L. alleging that the league allowed fighting and promoted violence while minimizing the risk of head injuries. The three are Dave Christian, who was on the United States Olympic team for the 1980 Miracle on Ice and who played 1,009 N.H.L. games; Reed Larson, the highest-scoring American defenseman in N.H.L. history when he left the league in 1990; and Bill Bennett.

title: Errors in Inquiry on Rape Allegations Against FSUs Jameis Winston
description: An accusation against Jameis Winston, a marquee quarterback for Florida State, did not prompt an in-depth inquiry by either the university or the police. By the time prosecutors got the case it was nearly a year old.

title: India Election Digest: April 16
description: What you need to know on Wednesday about Indias elections: Gandhi family members make some pointed jabs, but not just at the Bharatiya Janata Party, and the wealth gap between the richest and poorest candidates is $1.6 billion.

title: Corrections: April 16, 2014
description: BUSINESS DAY

title: A Conversation With: Author Sanjaya Baru
description: In writing his book The Accidental Prime Minister, Sanjaya Baru, the former media adviser to Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, was trying to defend his former boss, who he said was consistently undermined by Sonia Gandhi, the president of the Indian National Congress, over his two terms.

title: Whats on Wednesday
description: 8 P.M. (13, 49) TOUCHING THE WILD Joe Hutto  the writer, artist and naturalist  has parented a clutch of wild turkey hatchlings and embedded with a herd of Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep. This Nature special, based on Mr. Huttos book Touching the Wild: Living With the Mule Deer of Deadman Gulch, journeys to the Wind River Mountains of Wyoming, not far from Mr. Huttos ranch, where a chance encounter with a young buck led him to spend seven years living among the members of a mule deer family. He returned an upward nod of the head, and I looked away and I nodded my head, and he returned the gesture again, Mr. Hutto, above, recalls. That deer was willing to see me as an individual, and he very clearly saw that I granted him his individuality. I was not seeing something, I was seeing someone.

title: Nieuwenhuis, in Season Debut, Powers Mets Over Diamondbacks
description: By Tim Rohan

title: National Security Commission Meets for the First Time
description: President Xi Jinping has presided over the first meeting of the recently established National Security Commission, and his remarks suggested that the commission would have the power to reach into nearly every aspect of domestic and foreign policy.

title: Students Among Hundreds Missing After South Korean Ferry Sinks
description: JINDO, South Korea  The parents waited in dread through the night, huddled under blankets in this South Korean port town, staring out to sea for a sign that rescuers had found any of the 281 people, many of them high school students, still missing after a ferry sank on Wednesday.

title: A Story of Displacement in Gujarat Comes to Mumbai
description: AHMEDABAD, India  When the noted Indian classical dancer Mrinalini Sarabhai and her husband, Vikram, founded theDarpana Academy of Performing Artsin 1949, the couple took care to avoid displacing any of the residents who lived next to their property on the western banks of the Sabarmati River in this city.

title: A Top Player Accused, and a Flawed Rape Inquiry
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla.  Early on the morning of Dec. 7, 2012, a freshman at Florida State University reported that she had been raped by a stranger somewhere off campus after a night of drinking at a popular Tallahassee bar called Potbellys.

title: Credit Suisse Profit Falls 34% in First Quarter
description: LONDON  Credit Suisse said on Wednesday that profit fell 34 percent in the first quarter as the Swiss bank shed assets and streamlined its investment banking operations as part of an overhaul of its business.

title: Official Praises Eviction Workers as Most Lovable
description: Chinas demolition workers, the people who tear down houses and move residents  often against their will  to make way for new construction, have been called many things. But they have rarely received a paean like that from a district official in Xinyang, in the central province of Henan.

title: Pistorius Trial to Adjourn This Week Until May 5, Days Before Election
description: PRETORIA, South Africa  The judge in the trial of Oscar Pistorius, the double-amputee track star accused of murdering his girlfriend, said on Wednesday that proceedings would be postponed after hearings ended on Thursday until May 5, two days before South Africas national election.

title: Photos That Cross Borders and Challenge Perceptions
description: Beyond prizes, page views or any other measure of prestige, Janet Jarman has a newfound appreciation for the impact of photojournalism. A project that began 18 years ago in a Mexican dump has taken her on a journey across borders with a family whose lives illustrate the complexities of immigration. But rather than be content that it will reach some abstract audience, she is excited that the project is being used by teachers and medical professionals in North Carolina to understand the lives of Latin American immigrants who are remaking the region.

title: Comfort Food Grows Up
description: Here is a recipe that plays as well to children as to the most sophisticated of palates, on date nights and family nights alike. It is for crisp-tender lamb meatballs, seared before being cooked through in a fragrant, vaguely North African tomato sauce zipped up with orange juice and warm spices, then topped with feta and mint. You can cook it in an hours time, not all of it spent working.

title: How the President Got to I Do on Same-Sex Marriage
description: By presidential fund-raising standards, the dinner at the St. Regis hotel in Washington in April 2011 was an intimate one. President Obama made the rounds, moving among the dozens of people in attendance, including Chad Griffin, a 37-year-old political operative known for his ability to raise money in Hollywood and for his work on trying to legalize same-sex marriage. It was Griffin who persuaded the conservative lawyer Theodore B. Olson and the liberal attorney David Boies, adversaries in the 2000 Bush v. Gore case, to bring a federal lawsuit challenging the constitutionality of Californias Proposition 8, the amendment banning same-sex marriage that voters approved in 2008.

title: Metso Board Rejects Merger Approach by Scottish Rival
description: LONDON  The Finnish company Metso said Wednesday that it had rejected an offer by its Scottish engineering rival, the Weir Group, to open merger discussions.

title: German Firm Sells Heat Exchanger Operations to Funds Advised by Triton
description: LONDON  GEA Group of Germany said on Wednesday that it had sold its heat exchangers business to funds advised by the private equity firm Triton Partners, in a deal that valued the unit at 1.3 billion euros, or about $1.8 billion. GEA had announced plans last year to sell the unit, which involves components for heating, air conditioning and ventilation systems.

title: New York Today: Snows of Mid-April
description: Good Wednesday morning to you.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times.

title: Citic Group Seeks $36.5 Billion in Hong Kong Listing
description: The Citic Group, one of Chinas biggest state-owned conglomerates, said on Wednesday that it had reached a formal deal for what amounts to a backdoor listing in Hong Kong valuing the company at about $36.5 billion.

title: Ukraine Push Against Rebels Grinds to Halt
description: SLOVYANSK, Ukraine  A military operation that the Ukrainian government said would confront pro-Russian militants in the east of the country unraveled in disarray on Wednesday with the entire contingent of 21 armored vehicles that had separated into two columns surrendering or pulling back before nightfall. It was a glaring humiliation for the new government in Kiev.

title: Candidates Exploit Loopholes to Skirt Spending Limits
description: BANGALORE, India  The cost of a cardamom garland: $36, or 2,200 rupees. A days chair rental: 11 cents. A polyester flag: 16 cents. A silk shawl: $11.

title: Software That Helps Small Businesses Ship Like Amazon
description: In his spare time two years ago, Jarrett Streebin operated a gift-card reselling business that required his customers to send their gift cards to him. He wanted to give them preprinted, prepaid shipping labels to make the process easy, but it proved more complicated and took longer than he expected.

title: In Our Pages: April 17
description: 1889: Roman Riots Again

title: Quotation of the Day: News in the Words of Presidents, Queens and the Everyman
description: That dramatic utterance appeared in the Quotation of the Day in The New York Times for June 13, 1987. A statement for the history books, it was a classic choice for the quotation, a feature of The Times for well over half a century.

title: Daily Report: Growth of Alibaba Propels Interest in Yahoo
description: Investors were already salivating over the initial stock offering of Alibaba Group, the giant Chinese e-commerce company. On Tuesday, they got a glimpse of Alibabas tremendous growth that is sure to whet their appetite even more, Vindu Goel reports.

title: Bank of America, Weighed by Legal Costs, Posts Loss
description: Updated, 8:30 p.m. | Bank of America delivered an unwelcome surprise to its investors, as the bank disclosed larger-than-expected legal expenses in the first quarter stemming from the financial crisis.

title: Divers Search Sunken Ferry
description: The vessel was carrying 477 passengers and crew, including 325 high school students.

title: The Future of Facebook May Not Say Facebook
description: In the two years since its rocky initial public offering, Facebook has become a strong business that regularly releases financial results that set investors hearts aflutter. Despite every hipster prediction otherwise, the companys user base keeps growing, and nearly a fifth of the time that Americans spend on their smartphones is spent on Facebook. That surpasses the amount of time we spend on any other single service by a wide margin  and beats just about anything else we do on our phones, or perhaps in our lives, period.

title: Can Facebook Innovate? A Conversation With Mark Zuckerberg
description: For my column this week about Facebooks new approach to creating social apps, I spent some time talking to Mark E. Zuckerberg, the companys co-founder and chief executive. We met in a conference room at Facebooks headquarters in Menlo Park, Calif., on a sunny Friday earlier this month.

title: Sebelius Said to Weigh Run for Kansas Senate Seat
description: WASHINGTON  In her darkest hour last fall, Kathleen Sebelius suffered one of the deepest cuts from an old family friend who accused her of gross incompetence over the rollout of the Affordable Care Act and demanded that she resign as secretary of health and human services. Now she is weighing revenge.

title: Bank of Americas Big Loss
description: Bank of America reported a first-quarter loss of $276 million on Wednesday, as legal expenses related to the financial crisis mounted, Michael Corkery writes in DealBook. The bank said its litigation expenses increased to $6 billion in the quarter, showing how Bank of America is still paying for its mortgages missteps nearly six years after the financial crisis.

title: Playing Hooky at Grandmas Deli
description: Dear Diary:

title: Citing Russian Moves, NATO Plans New Deployments
description: BRUSSELS  The head of NATO pledged on Wednesday to immediately step up military patrols along the alliances vast eastern border in response to mounting evidence of Russian interference in Ukraine.

title: Introducing PourOver and Tamper
description: For over a year, weve been working on PourOver.js and Tamper, two of the internal libraries behind the Red Carpet Project, Faces of Breast Cancer and High-Rise reader stories, among others.

title: Raising the Curtain on This Years Tribeca Film Festival
description: Get your popcorn ready. The Tribeca Film Festival, now in its 13th year, returns to downtown Manhattan today to host 12 days of obsessive moviegoing and compelling conversation about film. Co-founded in 2002 by the actor Robert De Niro with his producing partner Jane Rosenthal and the real estate financier Craig Hatkoff, the festival was originally conceived as a cultural response to Sept. 11. And while its reach has expanded significantly over the years  a staggering 6,117 films were submitted for this years festival, increasing both the quality and diversity of the offerings (fans will remember, though they might prefer not to, that Star Wars Episode II: The Clone Wars premiered at the inaugural fest)  the spirit of the original outing has remained intact.

title: Active Cleanup of Oil Spill Is Ended on Louisiana Coast
description: The cleanup efforts on the Gulf Coast in response to the Deepwater Horizon oil spill have entered a new phase, with the oil company BP announcing that it is ending its active cleanup of Louisianas coast almost four years after the disaster.

title: Ford Transit Skyliner: Up, Up and Away
description: What is it? A concept vehicle based on the Ford Transit full-size van.

title: Another Autobahn Burner From AMG and Mercedes-Benz
description: Introduced on Tuesday, April 15: 2015 Mercedes-Benz S63 AMG S 4Matic Coupe

title: French Caterer Elior Considering an I.P.O. This Summer
description: Elior, a French catering and support services provider, said on Wednesday that it was considering an initial public offering this summer.

title: An Ex-Mayor, in His Own Words
description: In one of his first interviews since leaving office, Michael R. Bloomberg was by turns restless, wry, entirely lacking in self-doubt and, at least for now, reticent to pass judgment on his successor. He mused about his accelerated entry into heaven and his rock star reputation. The following is an extended version of Mr. Bloombergs interview with The New York Times, in which he also discusses the political potency of the National Rifle Association, the types of gun control he thinks are effective and ineffective, and his post-mayoral life.

title: Hunting for the Best Carry-On Bag
description: How do you know when its time to replace your carry-on bag?

title: Recipes for Kids: Bananas, Cold and Custardy
description: Making this recipe is like doing a magic trick: whip up plain frozen bananas and end up with the creamiest, dreamiest dessert you ever tasted. You have to try it to believe it!

title: In Disarray, Mt. Gox Signals a Move Toward Liquidation
description: Mt. Gox, the Bitcoin exchange that filed for bankruptcy protection early this year after disclosing that hackers had made off with a half-billion dollars worth of the virtual currency, said on Wednesday that it would most likely be liquidated.

title: India at a Crossroads
description: A journey across the worlds largest democracy. This years race between the Indian National Congress and the Bharatiya Janata Party reveals deep divisions in society and politics.

title: Political Novice in India Meets a Gritty Reality on the Campaign Trail
description: SITAPUR, India  She marched through her campaign office like a candidate from almost anywhere in the world, girding herself to address a scrum of reporters. But the reporters were not interested in an interview. Instead, they came to insist that she buy ads in their newspapers.

title: Pushing the 2-State Path in Gaza
description: BEIT LAHIYA, Gaza Strip  To define Ezzeldin Masris battle as uphill is an understatement. He runs the Gaza branch of OneVoice, a group that promotes a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. In the Gaza Strip, where more than half the 1.7 million residents are classified as refugees, and the ruling Hamas party of Islamic militants opposes negotiations with Israel, Mr. Masri often feels that his is the one voice of pragmatic realism.

title: Gazans on Peace Negotiation Breakdown
description: Residents reflect on the impact of the breakdown of American-brokered negotiations between Israel and the Palestinians.

title: Hanging a Shingle in Detroit
description: DETROIT  Ask business owners what it is like to operate in Detroit and you will hear comparisons to the Wild West or a third-world country. They often mean it as a compliment.

title: Worlds Fair Showed a Different Side of the Port Authority
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey designs, builds and maintains the engines of the regional economy: airports, marine terminals, rail lines, tunnels, bridges and, of course, life-size fiberglass dinosaurs.

title: Jo Becker on the Moment that Mattered to the Vice President
description: Accompanying Jo Beckers cover story this week about the evolution of President Obamas view on same-sex marriage is a never-before-seen photograph of Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. with Johnny and Josie Ward-Lombardo during a party at the home of their parents, Sonny Ward and Michael Lombardo in 2012. Biden was there to meet with a group of prominent gay Democrats.

title: New Tours of Johnsons Glass House
description: Starting in May, visitors to architect Philip Johnsons renowned Glass House in New Canaan, Conn., will have a twice-monthly option of taking a self-guided tour, allowing them to linger in the house and at several other Johnson-designed buildings on the 49-acre grounds.

title: Image of the Day: April 16
Piketty Day at the Graduate Center
description: A talk by Thomas Piketty at the CUNY Graduate Center, followed by a panel discussion with Steve Durlauf, Joe Stiglitz, and somebody else. Starting at 6 PM; live streaming here.

title: Renegade, a New Baby in the Jeep Family
description: Introduced on Wednesday, April 18: 2015 Jeep Renegade

title: App Smart: Hotel Booking
description: Kit Eaton delves into three hotel booking apps that can help transform how you book rooms.

title: Finding, Comparing and Booking Rooms From Your Mobile Device
description: HOTEL booking apps have transformed the way I book rooms. I used to hate doing this online, because it was awkward, and it took too much time to find a hotel I liked and weed through reviews to make sure I wasnt making a bad decision.

title: Today in Small Business: Dont Turn Left
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: A Risk Analyst Explains Why Climate Change Risk Misperception Doesnt Necessarily Matter
description: David Ropeik, the risk communication consultant and author of How Risky is it, Really? Why Our Fears Dont Always Match the Facts, had some concerns about the way I characterized our inconvenient minds in my TEDx talk in Portland, Ore., over the weekend.

title: Miley Cyrus Cancels Concerts After Hospitalization
description: Hospital TV is wacccckkkkkkk!!!!! Miley Cyrus posted Tuesday night on Twitter, after the Sprint Center in Kansas City announced that she had canceled her concert there that evening upon being hospitalized for a severe allergic reaction to antibiotics.

title: South Korea Ferry Survivors on Ordeal
description: Passengers rescued from the ferry that sank off South Korea described what happened on the boat and expressed worry about others on board.

title: With a Do-Nothing Congress, Its Time for Executive Action
description: With Congress determined to do nothing for the foreseeable future, the Brennan Center for Justice at the New York University School of Law has come up with 15 executive actions that President Obama could take in three areas: voting rights, criminal justice and the rule of law.

title: On View | Turning Ancient Craft Techniques Into Modern Fashion
description: Carla Fernndez is an artist and activist whose medium is fashion. She works with traditional textiles from her native Mexico to create contemporary designs, supporting and nurturing artisan communities in the process. Now her work gets the museum treatment in a new show, The Barefoot Designer: A Passion for Radical Design and Community, the first-ever fashion exhibit at theIsabella Stewart Gardner Museumin Boston.Through fashion photographs and drawings, garments, video and performance, the show explores the techniques of master artisans from each ofMexicos five states, and Fernndezs method for designing with them using the rectangular and square patterns of indigenous garments, a technique she calls the square root. By incorporating these ancient methods into a modern fashion line, we are fast-forwarding tradition, she says.

title: House Hunting in ... Puerto Rico
description: A SIX BEDROOM ESTATE ON DORADO BEACH

title: Turkey Greets Twitter Delegation With List of Demands
description: ISTANBUL  Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey has called Twitter the worst menace to society and a tool of foreign conspirators. For good measure, he has also accused it of evading taxes.

title: Taliban Say They Killed 7 Afghan Police Officers
description: MAIDAN WARDAK, Afghanistan  A group of Afghan policemen were kidnapped on Wednesday while traveling in civilian clothes, and the Taliban later claimed that they had killed seven of them.

title: Can Government Play Moneyball?
description: If you scrambled to file your tax return by yesterdays deadline, you might take comfort in knowing that most Americans  55 percent in a 2013 Gallup poll  say the amount they pay in income tax is fair (although that figure has been higher in recent years). The number conceals big differences of opinion, of course: while 66 percent of Democrats feel this way, the number drops to 49 percent for Republicans.

title: How to Take the Ultimate Drone Selfie
description: Smile! Youre on a drone camera!

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 57
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: Recommended Reading: Heartbleed Edition
description: Heartbleed Disclosure Timeline: Who Knew What and When?

title: Criticized on Taxes, Starbucks Will Move European Offices to London
description: PARIS  Starbucks, which has suffered withering criticism in Britain for avoiding taxes, said on Wednesday that it would move its regional headquarters to London from Amsterdam and pay more to the British Treasury.

title: Times Minute | Korean Ferry Tragedy
description: Hundreds missing and feared dead of the South Korean coast. Also on the Minute, Kathleen Sebelius weighs a Senate run and Facebooks big gamble on apps.

title: Times Minute | Korean Ferry Tragedy
description: In the Video

title: Candy Crush to Expand to China
description: LONDON  Candy Crush is coming to China.

title: Making the Most of Time
description: Time works so differently for children. While harried adults flutter about getting ready for this or that, children tend to get lost in their books, their Lego metropolises, their imaginary games. And when its suddenly time to go to school, or to soccer practice or, heaven forfend, to bed, theyre astonished. Where did the time go?

title: Contenders for the New Musical Tony Are Anyones Guess
description: Practice usually makes perfect, but not for this seasons new Broadway musicals. Eleven of the 12 new shows had tryout runs in an effort to get them right, only to find a tepid reception from critics and audiences when they finally opened on Broadway.

title: The Gun Report: April 16, 2014
description: On Sunday, 73-year-old Frazier Glenn Miller opened fire outside a Jewish Community Center in aKansas City, Mo., suburb, killing three people. William Lewis Corporon, 69, was taking his grandson, Reat Underwood, 14, to an audition for KC SuperStar, a talent competition for high school students, when they were gunned down in the parking lot. Terri LaManno, 53, was visiting her mother at a nearby retirement complex. LaManno worked as an occupational therapist for visually impaired children. Yesterday was her 25th wedding anniversary.

title: Hillary Clinton Struggles to Define a Legacy in Progress
description: WASHINGTON  It was a simple questionto someone accustomed to much tougher ones: What was her proudest achievement as secretary of state? But for a moment, Hillary Rodham Clinton, appearing recently before a friendly audience at a womens forum in Manhattan, seemed flustered.

title: How Pop-Up Stores Are Spurring Innovation in Detroit
description: Detroit, a city famously filled with abandoned buildings and blighted neighborhoods, has a major selling point for entrepreneurs: If you have an idea you want to test, Detroit has the space for it.

title: Yellen Says Job Weakness Forestalls Raising Rates
description: Even as a number of indicators point to better economic times ahead, the chairwoman of the Federal Reserve, Janet L. Yellen, reiterated on Wednesday that she expected interest rates to remain very low until the recovery is on a more secure footing and the American economy is more fully involving available workers and other resources.

title: 2015 Hyundai Sonata: Modern Maturity for Fluidic Sculpture Design
description: Introduced on Tuesday, April 15: 2015 Hyundai Sonata

title: The Toyota Camry Signs Up for a Refresher Course
description: Introduced on Wednesday, April 16: 2015 Toyota Camry

title: Are Blood Pressure Drugs Worth the Falls?
description: For older Americans, high blood pressure is a fact of life. By one common estimate, more than 70 percent of those over age 70 contend with it. That means medication to lower blood pressure has become a fact of life, too.

title: Classical Playlist: Beethoven, Mahler, Aaron Copland and More
description: COMPOSING AMERICA: Works by John Adams, William Bolcom, Aaron Copland and Paul MoravecThe Lark Quartet(Bridge)The Lark Quartet offers an engaging traversal of folk and pop-influenced music by American composers, beginning with John Adamss foot stomping 5 Pages From Johns Book of Alleged Dances. The disc also includes William Bolcoms Billy in the Darbies and Coplands Two Pieces for String Quartet. The Lark is joined by the pianist Jeremy Denk for Paul Moravecs texturally rich Piano Quintet. (Vivien Schweitzer)

title: E. L. Doctorow Wins Library of Congress Award
description: The 2014 Library of Congress Prize for American Fiction has been awarded to E. L. Doctorow, the author of Ragtime, The March, Worlds Fair and several other works of fiction.

title: A Mustang Finds the Best Parking Spot in Manhattan
description: To celebrate the Mustangs 50th anniversary, Ford put a 2015 Mustang convertible on the Observation Deck of the Empire State Building.

title: Moelis & Co. Rises After Smaller-Than-Expected I.P.O.
description: Updated, 4:06 p.m. | When Moelis & Company first disclosed the price range for its initial public offering less than two weeks ago, the market for newly public stocks was on a tear.

title: Ford Celebrates the Old Mustang With a New Pony
description: The people at Ford are all misty eyed about Mustangs 50th anniversary, which falls on media day at the New York auto show. Its an emotional time for them as they celebrate the birthday of the Mustang and a milestone marketing effort in the city where it all started at the 1964 Worlds Fair. To mark the anniversary on Wednesday, the company placed a 2015 Mustang on the Observation Deck of the Empire State Building.

title: For Obamacare, What Counts As Success?
description: Ezra Klein, in his new capacity as one of the impresarios behind Vox, has written a pair of attention-grabbing posts here,and thenheredefending the proposition that Obamacare has, in some sense, won, and that conservatives who cant come to terms with that victory cant come to terms with reality itself. Reading them, it struck me that this argument would benefit from laying down some specific markers for the near future, because Klein seems to move back and forth between two definitions of success. At times, as when he writes that Obamacare has won its survival and allows that that there are still many good critiques to make of the law, he seems to be using a narrow definition, with which I mostly agree the law wont collapse under its own weight, the enrollment levels are high enough to make a return to the coverage status quo ante unlikely, etc. But when he uses language like the individual mandate  is working and the law is back on its expected track, and concludes that[Kathleen Sebelius]can leave with the law she helped build looking, shockingly, like a success, it implies a stronger definition of victory, in which Obamacare isnt just continuing, isnt just unlikely to be swiftly repealed, but is clearly succeeding as a policy in basically the way its advocates predicted that it would.

title: Dee Dee Myers to Join Warner Bros. as Head of Communications
description: LOS ANGELES  Dee Dee Myers, once the White House press secretary to Bill Clinton, will be joining Warner Bros. as executive vice president for worldwide corporate communications and public affairs, the studio said on Wednesday.

title: Climate Change, the Musical
description: Steve Cosson and Michael Friedman had a highbrow hit in the fall collaborating on Anne Washburns Mr. Burns: A Post-Electric Play. They are reunited for the latest production from the inventive, inquisitive theater troupe the Civilians, in residence at the Public Theater as part of the low-price, low-frills Public Lab series. The Great Immensity, written and directed by Mr. Cosson with songs by Mr. Friedman, asks the big-time question of whether man can change his destructive ways before the planet goes kablooey.

title: Florida Derby Winner to Miss Kentucky Derby
description: Constitution, the undefeated winner of last months $1 million Florida Derby, will miss the May 3 Kentucky Derby and the rest of the Triple Crown races because of a slight hairline fracture in his front right cannon bone, his co-owner WinStar Farm said.

title: Stealth Taxes Are Still Income Taxes
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago. He is the author of The Redistribution Recession: How Labor Market Distortions Contracted the Economy.

title: A Bohemian Getaway in the Heart of Mumbai
description: Until this year, Mumbai didnt have a single boutique hotel. There was the Taj Palace, with its iconic confectionary grandeur; some characterless, midrange hotels scattered around Colaba, the core of historic South Mumbai; the Oberoi and the Trident in their 1970s concrete boxes. But there was no hotel that captured both the rich visual heritage of historic Bombay and the intense aesthetic energy of contemporary Mumbai. Now, theres Abode.

title: City Ballet Gala to Take a Look Back
description: New York City Ballets spring gala will celebrate the 50th anniversary of its Lincoln Center home  featuring works that were performed at the theaters inaugural performance in 1964 and an onstage tribute to some of the ballet stars who performed that season.

title: The East Village: In the Thick of Things
description: Shortly before their marriage around two years ago, Michelle and Andrew Gasparovic moved to New York from Boston. With just a few days to find a place, they rented a one-bedroom with a balcony at Tribeca Pointe, on the waterfront at the north end of Battery Park City.

title: Competing Views of Teacher Tenure Are on Display in California Case
description: LOS ANGELES  These are two vastly different portraits of Californias education system. In one, poor and minority students are frequently placed in front of incompetent teachers whose blackboards are filled with basic misspellings and who play irrelevant movies instead of devising lesson plans for class time. In the other, the vast majority of teachers are providing students with all they need to learn, and well-run school districts are able to ferret out and dismiss the ones who are not.

title: Incorporating a Touch of Cabaret Into Your Wardrobe
description: On April 24, when the Roundabout Theater Company revival of Cabaret opens, a negligee-clad Michelle Williams will make her Broadway debut as Sally Bowles, and Alan Cumming, in those fetishistic suspenders, will reprise his Tony-winning performance as the master of ceremonies. After an evening at the Kit Kat Klub at Studio 54, you may be tempted to draw on the tea-rose-colored chemises, sexy black underpinnings and flapper-style accessories worn at the decadent Weimar-era Berlin nightclub for your own wardrobe. Here are some ways to do it  and not for a costume party.

title: Piketty Day Notes
description: Im going to be commenting on Thomas Piketty later today, and I thought I would write up my thoughts in advance; this may or may not be what I actually end up saying.

title: Samsung Saw Death of Apples Jobs as a Time to Attack
description: .big-quote { color: #444; padding: 20px 40px 10px 40px; box-shadow: inset 0 0 5px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 20px 0 20px 0; position: relative; font-size: 17px; line-height: 35px; background-color: #fffff5; } .big-quote .story-body-text { font-size: 16px !important; line-height: 21px !important; font-family: nyt-franklin, arial, helvetica, sans-serif !important; font-weight: 200 !important; } .big-quote .page-promo { display: none; position: absolute; bottom: 20px; right: 20px; color: #eeeeee; background-color: rgba(0,0,0,.65); padding: 8px 15px 8px 15px; font-family: nyt-franklin, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 15px; font-weight: bold; border-radius: 4px; } .big-quote:hover .page-promo { display: block; }

title: Post Holdings Reaches $2.5 Billion Deal for Michael Foods
description: Updated, 7:35 a.m. | The cereal maker Post Holdings has reached a deal to buy Michael Foods, a food processing and distribution company, the companies announced on Thursday.

title: Obamacare Truthers at MSNBC
description: Just a quick note in support of government statisticians. They do an incredibly important job, and by and large do it very well. Theyve also maintained a well-deserved reputation for staying out of the political fray, of acting as civil servants, not party apparatchiks.

title: Bank of America Not Alone in Reporting Anemic Results
description: Anemic results underscore how little fun it is to run a big bank these days. The $276 million loss that Bank of America announced on Wednesday, however, at least provides some valuable perspective.

title: What You Get for... $1,400,000
description: SANTA BARBARA, CALIF.

title: Bloombergs $50 Million Investment in Fear
description: Fourteen years ago, hundreds of thousands of women and their families rallied along the National Mall in the Million Mom March, demanding greater gun safety for their children and touching off a grass-roots political challenge to the National Rifle Associations grip on Congress. Yet their campaign has only grown more difficult since then despite the steady, grisly flow of carnage.

title: Korean Coast Guard Video of Ferry Rescue
description: As my colleague Choe Sang-Hun reports, more than 280 passengers, most of them students, were still unaccounted for Wednesday night as coast guard and navy divers searched a ferry that sank hours earlier off the southwestern tip of South Korea.

title: Terry Riley Music Among Highlights of River to River Festival
description: Music created and inspired by Terry Riley, the minimalist master, will be played at Federal Hall. The Trisha Brown Dance Company will perform on the East River waterfront. The Haitian songwriter Blo, who calls his music Ragganga, will play at the South Street Seaport.

title: Happy and Frozen in Place at No. 1
description: Disneys Frozen soundtrack is once again the No. 1 album in the country, with sales of 133,000 copies, according to Nielsen SoundScan.

title: Organize Photos on Your Phone
description: Molly Wood tests three apps, including the new Carousel by Dropbox, that help you sort and share the overwhelming number of photos on your mobile device.

title: For Young Traders, a Market Where Air Jordans Are Blue Chips
description: With sneakers slung around their shoulders and pockets full of cash, young boys huddle in hotel ballrooms and high school gyms, shouting and bartering as if they belong on a trading room floor.

title: The Best Photo Organizing App? Im Still Looking
description: I HAVE about 2,500 photos stored on my smartphone, and who knows how many more on previous phones and other devices I use. I need an organizing principle, stat.

title: Tribeca Film Festival: New York Via Park City or Berlin
description: The 13th edition of the Tribeca Film Festival gets under way on Wednesday with some 100 offerings to choose from. How is a film fan to decide?

title: British Government Seeks Lift From Economic Data
description: LONDON  Britain crossed an important economic and psychological threshold on Wednesday when growth in paychecks caught up with inflation after years of financial crisis, austerity and an accompanying dip in living standards.

title: Scene City: A Public Display of Affection
description: Michael Douglas, Catherine Zeta-Jones and Chlo Grace Moretz attend opening of The Library at the Public Theater.

title: BMW X4
description: A look at BMWs new Sports Activity Coupe, the X4

title: Cohen Gets to Trade for 90 Days Before Paying SAC Penalty
description: Even when he loses, the billionaire investor Steven A. Cohen manages to find a way to win.

title: The X4 Is Another Utility Player From BMW
description: Introduced on Wednesday: 2015 BMW X4

title: A Scottish Trail Will Celebrate John Muir
description: To celebrate the spirit, work and legacy of the conservationist John Muir, Scotland will officially unveil the John Muir Way on April 21.

title: Taliban End a Cease-Fire With Pakistan
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  The Pakistani Taliban said Wednesday that they were ending a six-week-old cease-fire but would continue peace talks with the Pakistani government.

title: In Germany, Strong Words Over Google's Power
description: BERLIN  A trans-Atlantic war of words  and profits  over the future of the Internet heated up on Wednesday when the head of Germanys largest publisher admitted that we are afraid of Google and suggested that European authorities were colluding with the American Internet giant to develop a business model that in less honorable circles would be called extortion.

title: Court Deportations Drop 43 Percent in Past Five Years
description: New deportation cases brought by the Obama administration in the nations immigration courts have been declining steadily since 2009, and judges have increasingly ruled against deportations, leading to a 43 percent drop in the number of deportations through the courts in the last five years, according to Justice Department statistics released on Wednesday.

title: Tanaka Lets Neither Cubs Nor the Cold Get to Him
description: Joe Girardi has been careful about how he handles Masahiro Tanaka. Nothing is trifling in this, Tanakas debut month in the major leagues, and Girardi, an obsessive planner, seemed to have Tanakas initial starts lined up at the ideal times.

title: Seeking Young Viewers, Pivot Bolsters Its Original Programming
description: A small, somewhat new cable channel is wooing additional viewers and advertisers by beefing up its original programming, including what would be its first original scripted series.

title: Jasmin Shokrian Dives Into the Burgeoning Dallas Art Scene
description: The Los Angeles-based designer Jasmin Shokrian makes quietly striking, sculptural clothes beloved by women in the art world. During last weeks Dallas Art Fair, the owners of Tenoversix  the L.A. boutique that last year opened an outpost in (and served as a design consultancy for) Dallass art-filled Joule Hotel  invited Shokrian to hold a trunk show in their space. The event offered an ideal excuse for Shokrian to explore the metropolis and its booming cultural scene over the weekend. It felt like kind of a magical city, she says. Yes, shes talking about Dallas. Here, she shares some highlights, including a joint exhibition by Julian Schnabel and Richard Phillips at Dallas Contemporary and an accompanying dinner, a spin through the fair, a gallery opening co-hosted by the model and Dallas native Erin Wasson and a party called the Eye Ball.

title: Yellen Discusses Feds Coming Decision
description: Speaking at the Economic Club of New York, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, Janet L. Yellen, said the Feds coming decision on interest rates would depend on employment and inflation thresholds.

title: The Birth of a Conspiracy Theory
description: If you spend enough time on the Internet youll eventually encounter a conspiracy theory. If you watch closely enough, sometimes you can actually see one being born.

title: Fargo on FX Debuts to an Audience of More Than 4 Million
description: The new FX drama Fargo got off to a promising start on Tuesday, with ratings across several broadcasts that added up to more than four million viewers.

title: Clip: Proxy
description: A scene from the film Proxy, directed by Zack Parker.

title: Cut the Clutter in Your Social Media Accounts
description: BEING active on social media platforms like Twitter and Facebook is kind of like having a basement in the suburbs. These accounts can quickly become so cluttered that you might as well shut the door and say goodbye  youre never finding anything you need again.

title: In the Garden of Souls and Gardens of Childhood
description: One worthy mission of Ballet NY, a chamber troupe founded in 1997 and still hanging on, is to offer chances, and trained dancers, to budding choreographers. So it might have been disappointing that the companys program at Ailey Citigroup Theater on Tuesday featured no new works. Three out of the four pieces had been made for other groups. Yet this, too, was part of a worthy mission: allowing the creations of lesser-known choreographers to be seen again, embodied and interpreted by different dancers, giving those works a chance at an extended life.

title: Earnings and Sales From Google Disappoint
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Alexander the Great is said to have wept because he ran out of kingdoms to conquer. Google is eager to avoid such a miserable fate.

title: Acura TLX: All-Wheel Steering Tries for Another Comeback
description: Introduced on Wednesday, April 16: 2015 Acura TLX

title: One-Man Hollywood in the Midwest
description: The concepts are high. The budgets are low. The themes are unnerving. Thats the best way to describe the films made by Zack Parker, a native of the Midwest who takes a more-than-meets-the-eye approach to his moviemaking. Mr. Parker is based in Richmond, Ind., a small town on the eastern side of the state that wouldnt exactly be the first location choice for many directors. But he has shot four disturbing features in that area.

title: Conquering Displacement With Words
description: BARCELONA, Spain  When he was just 22, the Spanish-Argentine writer Andrs Neuman was anointed by no less a luminary than the Chilean writer Roberto Bolao, who had a discriminating eye for talent and wasnt lukewarm when he found it. The literature of the 21st century, Bolao proclaimed, will belong to Neuman and a few of his blood brothers. Bolao said he felt like weeping when he discovered such a young, gifted writer; Mr. Neumans first novel, Bariloche (1999), Bolao wrote, had enthralled and hypnotized him for the uncanny ease of its writing.

title: Profit and Revenue Slip at IBM as Hardware Sales Fall and Layoff Costs Rise
description: IBM is investing heavily in the future. It has placed multibillion-dollar bets on businesses to deliver computing remotely over the Internet cloud, on sophisticated data-analysis software and on its Watson artificial-intelligence technology.

title: Incubator Arts Project to Close
description: The Incubator Arts Project, a well-regarded experimental performance company, announced on Wednesday that it would close in July after deciding not to renew its lease at St. Marks Church in the East Village. In a statement, Incubators leaders were vague about the reasons for the decision but others involved with the company said the closing was due to the difficulty of raising money and generating revenue  a challenge faced by many theaters of all budget sizes.

title: Credit Sought by ABC News for Pulitzer, but Rejected
description: It was a moment of triumph for accountability journalism. An investigation on sick Appalachian miners being denied medical care and benefits by the coal industry was honored on Monday with one of the highest awards in journalism: the Pulitzer Prize for investigative reporting.

title: Leaping Off the Screen: Nelson George Talks About Soul Train
description: Nelson Georges new book, The Hippest Trip in America, documents the history of Soul Train, the landmark television dance show that had its premiere in 1971. Soul Train, which was created in Chicago then moved to Los Angeles, showcased and deeply influenced African-American music, dance and fashion, hosting artists like Stevie Wonder and James Brown and starting the careers of dancers like Rosie Perez and Jody Watley. In a recent email interview, Mr. George discussed his earliest memories of Soul Train, why certain stars wouldnt appear on the program, the shows possible return and more. Below are edited excerpts from the conversation:

title: For Diabetics, Health Risks Fall Sharply
description: Federal researchers on Wednesday reported the first broad national picture of progress against some of the most devastating complications of diabetes, which affects millions of Americans, finding that rates of heart attacks, strokes, kidney failure and amputations fell sharply over the past two decades.

title: A Filmmaker Relishes His Next Act(s)
description: Michael Douglas and Catherine Zeta-Jones were sitting in the mezzanine of the Public Theater on Tuesday night, discussing whether Steven Soderbergh would make good on his promise of retirement. The director has said that he is finished directing movies.

title: A Cultural Bazaar in Doha, Qatar
description: The Souk Waqif (standing market) in Doha, Qatar, has been rebuilt within the last decade into a shopping hub that includes architectural elements of the original century-old souk. At the Qatari market, you can shop for spices, traditional garments and kitchenware, or just enjoy a sip of Arabic coffee or a smoke from a hookah. The areas blend of traditional and modern elements also manifests itself in the ways people dress to go shopping, ranging from women wearing a niqab to a colorful head scarf, to saris to jeans. Fahad al-Obaidly, a fashion designer, was in the area on a recent afternoon wearing a traditional floor-length coat with a black pair of jeans. Speaking through an interpreter, he credited the cultural mix of the area as a source of fashion inspiration. This interview has been edited and condensed.

title: Combative Director, Even in Letters
description: Elia Kazans 1988 A Life  arguably remains the most raw, soul-searching memoir ever written about a career in show business. And his story remains polarizing, whether for his naming names to the House Un-American Activities Committee or for his candor about the pain he inflicted on those who loved him.

title: Beauty Bars That Offer Quick Touch-Ups
description: The actress Stephanie March, who plays the assistant district attorney Alexandra Cabot on Law & Order: SVU, was talking on a recent afternoon about a perk of her job: getting her makeup done professionally. My lawyer makeup was like me only better, which was a revelation to people who saw me after work, said Ms. March, 39.

title: In a Choreographers Imagination, a Kiss Is Never Just a Kiss
description: When Eduardo Vilaro took the job of the artistic director of Ballet Hispanico in 2009, he left the company he had founded in Chicago, the Luna Negra Dance Theater, in the hands of the Spanish choreographer Gustavo Ramrez Sansano. Five years later, with Luna Negra having folded, Mr. Vilaro and Mr. Sansano have crossed paths again. On Tuesday at the Joyce Theater, Ballet Hispanico unveiled its first commission for Mr. Sansano, El Beso, which was also his New York debut as a choreographer.

title: Songs of the Dead (and Others), Alive and Kicking
description: Combinations and recombinations, the familiar and the strange, the chance to find something new within old songs, the camaraderie among musicians onstage and between longtime performers and loyal fans  all the jam-band elements were in place when Phil Lesh and Friends played the last of 10 area shows, the second of two concerts at the Brooklyn Academy of Music on Tuesday night.

title: A Little Zaniness and a Little Cabaret
description: As Lucie Arnaz, her eyes aflame, swiveled onto the stage of Caf Carlyle on Tuesday evening and spat out the lyrics to the sizzling Lena Horne hit Love, she emulated the attitude of combative challenge that was a Horne signature. No matter that Ms. Arnaz, 62, is not as glamorous as Horne was even in her 80s, or that her voice isnt as full-bodied or her manner as insinuating. The Horne tribute was still a smart, effective opening salvo in her show Spring Is Here.

title: True King of Late Night? He Might Raise Eyebrows
description: After the latest upheavals in late-night television, with Stephen Colbert being picked to replace David Letterman, Jimmy Fallon establishing an early lead on Jimmy Kimmel, and the futures of Chelsea Handler and Craig Ferguson suddenly up in the air, the new king of comedy might be the star making the fewest headlines.

title: After Years of Writing, an Authors Own Epic Fantasy Comes True
description: The fantasy writer Brandon Sandersons reputation is finally as big as his novels  and thats saying a lot.

title: Despite Hurdles, House Democrats Hold Edge in Small Donations
description: WASHINGTON  House Democrats are winning the early battle for small donors, raising nearly $20 million more than Republicans so far this election cycle among so-called small-dollar donations.

title: Jordanian Jets Strike Vehicles Trying to Enter From Syria
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Jordanian warplanes on Wednesday destroyed three vehicles trying to enter the country from neighboring Syria in an unusual strike that underscored Jordans intensive efforts to maintain control over a border crisscrossed by smugglers, Syrian insurgents and refugees.

title: Sky Ferreira: A Rebel, When Time Permits
description: Around 3 in the morning after the last Met Ball, the singer Sky Ferreira met one of her idols, Madonna. By met, I mean attacked, said Ms. Ferreira, 21, over iced tea at a Cuban restaurant in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, where she lives. I think I sat in her lap at one point. She showed a photo of the two of them on her phone.

title: Rating Men in New York
description: Dear Diary:

title: Silodor Open Pairs at the Spring Nationals
description: DALLAS  At the Spring Nationals here last month, the Silodor Open Pairs was won by John Diamond of Boca Raton, Fla., and Geoff Hampson of Las Vegas. They finished more than four boards ahead of Richard Budd of Portland, Me., and Zach Grossack of Newton, Mass. Third were Jill Levin of Henderson, Nev., and Jill Meyers of Santa Monica, Calif.

title: Bookshelf | Homes Inspired by the Creative Lives of their Owners
description: In the new book The Inspired Home: Nests of Creatives (Rizzoli, $55), Kim Ficaro and Todd Nickey prove that the most inspiring homes are not always the ones dreamed up by architects, designers or the incredibly wealthy. And they should know: Ficaro has styled props and interiors for Bon Apptit, Town & Country, Elle, Harpers Bazaar and Domino, while Nickey co-owns a successful design company in L.A. Rather than choosing homes simply because they struck their fancy, the co-authors first rounded up a trove of creative types  artists, writers, musicians, stylists, art directors  who had interesting personal style, and then hoped their homes would follow suit. Their instincts proved correct, and the 17 nests featured in this beautiful coffee-table book, shot by the Danish photographer Ditte Isager, reveal the inspiring combination of natural light and accidental, lived-in beauty. And despite the authors professions, Ficaro and Nickey opted not to style or decorate any of the interiors before they were photographed. We wanted to let the places breathe on their own, explains Ficaro.

title: BMW 4 Series Gran Coupe: Playing by the Numbers
description: Introduced on Wednesday, April 16: 2015 BMW 4 Series Gran Coupe

title: Deals by the Incoming La Scala Chief Cause a Stir
description: ROME  Alexander Pereira hasnt even begun his first season as general manager of La Scala and his stewardship is already generating controversy. Mr. Pereira, who is scheduled to take over the Milan opera house on Oct. 1, signed an agreement to buy four productions for La Scala from the Salzburg Festival, where he is the director, without the approval of the Italian authorities, according to La Scala and the mayor of Milan.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, South Korea, India and Bosnia.

title: In All the Spring Fashion Looks, a Balance
description: It takes a steady compass to navigate the sea of contradictory impulses defining fashion now. Go big, the merchants, designers and trend forecasters will tell you as they tout the charms of outsize pants, crop tops and calf-grazing dresses, while in the same breath trumpeting the sexiness of tiny shapes.

title: Spring Fashion: Hand Yourself Bouquets
description: There was nothing temperate about Stephanie Solomons spring fashion forecast. Your tights, throw them out, she urged. Get rid of your hats, your scarves, but most of all those hose. You never want to see them again.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times.

title: A Rose Is a Rose Is a Song Is a Song
description: What do Gertrude Stein and Prince have in common? Theyre both androgynous, said the songwriter-musician Heather Christian playfully, after rehearsals for the new theater piece, The World is Round, based on Steins childrens book of the same name. They also have a tendency to repeat themselves. Particularly Stein, whose famed circular line rose is a rose is a rose is a rose comes from that 1938 book.

title: 2 Hedge Fund Titans Agree to Buy the Milwaukee Bucks
description: Two Wall Street bigwigs, Marc Lasry and Wesley Edens, have a taste for distressed assets.

title: A Homecoming of Sorts for Mark Fields of Ford
description: The opening keynote address at the New York International Auto Show by Mark Fields, chief operating officer of Ford Motor, unsurprisingly promoted innovation and technology, but it sidestepped any discussion of rumors that the company would soon take a new direction with one of its most visible technologies.

title: From Madonna to Hedwig, Dressing the Divas of Rock
description: ARIANNE PHILLIPS KNOWS from fashion-savvy divas. A veteran fashion stylist and costume designer with a score of films and two Oscar nominations to her name(for Walk the Line and W.E.), she is still best known for styling Madonna, working on her music videos, films and last five world tours.

title: An Easier Way to Delay Cutting the Cord
description: Doctors in the delivery room are increasingly urged to hold off cutting the umbilical cord of a newborn. Delayed clamping, as its called, allows blood to continue flowing from the placenta, improving iron stores in the baby.

title: Aston Martin Vantage GT: A Blue Light Special, Comparatively
description: Introduced on Wednesday, April 16: 2015 Aston Martin Vantage GT

title: Sights and Sounds From the Furniture Fair
description: The 53rd International Milan Furniture Fair had more than 350,000 visitors from some 160 countries.

title: Square Feet: 84. Possessions: 305.
description: From time to time, Dee Williams does a possession count. The last tally was 305.

title: Discounts at Broadway Panhandler and Lightology
description: Holiday cooking essentials are up to 65 percent off at Broadway Panhandler, through Sunday or while supplies last (a Wusthof five-inch Santoku knife, originally $135, is about $50; a Le Creuset round skillet grill, regularly $220, is about $120); 65 East Eighth Street (Broadway), 212-966-3434 or broadwaypanhandler.com.

title: Should We Remove Wall-to-Wall Carpeting?
description: Q. We have worn carpet in our bedrooms and hardwood floors in the rest of the house. Should we replace the carpet, change it to hardwood or leave it as is?

title: Your Trainer Saw That
description: Angela Harrigan, a personal trainer at Life Time Fitness, sees each client maybe two hours per week, but she knows exactly how much of the other 166 hours theyve spent furthering  or undoing  their efforts.

title: Gather Round the Fire, Wherever You Want It
description: Behold the Dude: the first truly portable fire pit and grill from the Salt Lake City-based Cowboy Cauldron Company. This 45-pound vessel, the smallest of the companys four hemispherical braziers, was designed with migratory outdoor entertaining in mind.

title: A Cold One Wrapped in Plastic
description: Govino, a company known for making plastic wineglasses you wouldnt be embarrassed to use in public, recently introduced something similar for beer. Craft brew is huge right now, said Joseph Perrulli, the creative director. We saw an opening, went back and forth on designs and settled on a classic pilsner shape.

title: Study Finds No Evidence of Heartbleed Attacks Before the Bug Was Exposed
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Ever since the Heartbleed bug was exposed last week, the question everyone has been asking is: Did anyone exploit it before a Google researcher first discovered it?

title: Symbolism Meets Modern Life
description: Amy Reichert, an architect and exhibitions designer in Chicago, devotes part of her time to creating custom-made limited-edition Judaica, a challenge that requires adapting ancient synagogue fittings to modern clients needs, and then explaining them to craft artists who may never have attended a Seder. She has turned floating brass flowers into menorahs, has decorated silver Sabbath goblets with pearls and has had elm Seder plates carved to resemble desert dunes.

title: Their Game, Now Ours
description: What, you didnt catch Liverpool storm back against Manchester City last week? You missed Wayne Rooneys 58-yard wonder goal against West Ham United?

title: When Our Maids Lived In
description: If youre a real estate hound, Manhattan Classic: New Yorks Finest Prewar Apartments (Princeton Architectural Press, $50) is either a twist of the knife or a handy resource, depending on your point of view and your bank account. A total of 85 apartment houses built from the 1880s to the 1930s, the citys first building boom, are collected here, along with floor plans and some interior photos. An index organizes buildings by architect or developer.

title: Bentley Flying Spur V8: A Smaller Engine Arrives for North America
description: Introduced on Wednesday, April 16 The Bentley Flying Spur V8

title: Its All 1810 to Them
description: John and Judy Hobday live in what could almost be considered a museum: an 1810 stone house that they have painstakingly restored to its (nearly) original state.

title: A Need to Go Public With Test Data
description: To the Editor:

title: Occasional Tables: Holding Their Liquor
description: Lauren Rottet has designed her share of hotels and bars, the Loews Regency and the Surrey hotels on the Upper East Side and bars at the Hudson hotel near Columbus Circle among others. And she has produced a collection of furniture for Decca. So she knows how essential an occasional table is when youre entertaining.

title: Political Roadblocks to Action on Climate Change
description: To the Editor:

title: Cancer Society and Tobacco
description: To the Editor:

title: Gilded Lily | Chelsea
description: Hedge-funders and scions may keep the extravagant bar tabs afloat, but the bottle-service universe always expands toward downtown for cool points. The latest alignment occurs on Wednesdays at Gilded Lily, a club on West 15th Street that opened in February.

title: College Acceptance Rates
description: To the Editor:

title: Better Pay for the Disabled
description: To the Editor:

title: In Milan, Putting a Pretty Face on It
description: MILAN  At the 53rd International Furniture Fair here, which ended on Sunday, the German designer Konstantin Grcic introduced a chair for the Finnish company Artek. Running into him midweek, I congratulated him on the piece. Youve gotten in touch with your inner girl, I said.

title: Luxury Oral-Care
description: When celebrities are asked about their personal grooming habits, they often cite Marvis as their preferred toothpaste. But this beloved Italian brand is facing competition in the luxury mouth-freshening department.

title: Dutch Design, Up for Bid
description: The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas, a glass slab of casino halls and 3,000 hotel rooms, once had an avant-garde attraction as well: a street-level showroom devoted to the Dutch design company Droog, whose signature witticisms (dresser drawers roped together, rags stacked to form chairs, milk bottles clustered into chandeliers) were shown on a translucent white floor.

title: Witness to History, Searching for Dignity
description: Twenty years after the genocide in Rwanda, David Turnley dug through his archives to confront not just ghastly images of atrocity, but also glimmers of human dignity and hope.

title: An Indecent Burial
description: Twenty-five years ago this month, with the Supreme Courts support for the right to abortion shrinking rapidly, the justices heard a case from Missouri that invited them to disavow Roe v. Wade, the precedent that 16 years earlier had given women the constitutional right to terminate a pregnancy. A month after the argument, Chief Justice William H. Rehnquist circulated to his colleagues a proposed majority opinion that would have overturned Roe in all but name, upholding the challenged regulations under such a relaxed standard of judicial review that states in the future would have been able to impose nearly any obstacle to abortion that they might think of.

title: Gee, Perfect Through Four Innings, Sparkles as Mets Sweep Diamondbacks
description: PHOENIX  For four innings, Dillon Gee was perfect, and through six innings, he was still cruising. In the seventh, however, he began to look human, and soon his day was done.

title: The Deepwater Horizon Threat
description: FOUR years ago this Sunday, BPs Macondo well in the Gulf of Mexico blew out, destroying the Deepwater Horizon drilling rig, killing 11 workers and setting off an uncontrolled oil gusher lasting 87 days. By the time the flow was stopped, an estimated 200 million gallons of oil had entered the ocean.

title: Openings, Events and Sales for the Week of April 17
description: Openings and Events

title: Americas Urban Future
description: FOR all of the attention showered on hipster enclaves like Williamsburg, Brooklyn and Portland, Ore., America is only in the beginning stages of a historic urban reordering. After over a half-century of depopulation, cities have been filling up  and not just with young millennials, but with families and even older workers and retirees.

title: Minimum Wage, Maximum Outrage
description: No one should ever endure the kind of economic humiliation that comes with working a full-time job and making a less-than-living wage.

title: James Murdoch Joins Board of Advertising Start-Up
description: James Murdoch, the co-chief operating officer of 21st Century Fox, has joined the board of True[X] Media, an advertising company based in New York.

title: My Fathers Strength
description: On the afternoon before my college graduation in 1999, there was a ceremony for graduates who were getting department prizes. My father was a New York City tunnel worker (a sandhog) and at that time he was working on Roosevelt Island, a 20-minute drive from Barnards campus. He always showered before leaving the job site, and on that day hed brought khakis, a freshly pressed shirt and tie and the new jacket my mother had gotten him for his 55th birthday. I remember what he was wearing because it was the first time I noticed him holding a handkerchief, which he used throughout the ceremony to dab the corners of his mouth. After, when we were discussing where to have dinner, I spotted a narrow river of saliva traveling down the side of his chin.

title: Obama Speaks on Jobs in Pennsylvania
description: President Obama spoke about job training at the Community College of Allegheny County in Oakdale, Pa.

title: Obama Looks for Midterm Advantage on Job Training and Immigration
description: OAKDALE, Pa.  President Obama, seeking to shore up support for midterm elections that threaten to cost his party control of the Senate, vowed Wednesday to improve federal job training programs and chastised Republicans for blocking an overhaul of immigration law.

title: Former Senator Is Selling the Bucks After Three Decades
description: Herb Kohl, who retired last year as a United States senator from Wisconsin after four terms, announced Wednesday that he was set to end his long run as the owner of the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: Living in the Grip of Vigilance
Precision to Meet Brute Force
description: When the first-round playoff series between the Rangers and the Flyers begins Thursday at Madison Square Garden, the assumption is that Philadelphia will try to thump, crash and physically intimidate the Rangers. The evidence? First, the Flyers accumulated the most penalty minutes in the N.H.L. this season, while the Rangers finished 22nd. And then there is the whole Broad Street Bullies tradition.

title: Alfa Romeo 4C
description: Alfa Romeo attempts a comeback in the United States.

title: Boston Police to Bolster Presence Before Marathon
description: BOSTON  Police officials pledged Wednesday to step up their presence near the finish line before next weeks Boston Marathon, after Tuesdays day of tribute to the victims of last years attack was marred by a bomb scare that shut down the area for hours.

title: Suburbs Try to Prevent an Exodus as Young Adults Move to Cities and Stay
description: It is a well-trod trail: Suburban youngsters enter their early 20s, leave their parents comfortable Tudors or colonials for the pizazz of the city, dawdle a few years until they find mates and begin having children and then, seeking more space and good public schools, move back to the suburbs and into their own Tudors or colonials.

title: A Quick, Satisfying Drive in the 2015 Honda Fit
description: True to its name, the 2015 Honda Fit just fits. Its a small car, and accordingly, weaves through tight urban spaces with ease. But for something so tiny, it has a lot of space inside  not just the kind that looks good in brochures, but the sort that makes drivers feel at ease, like they have finally escaped the womblike experience so many automakers offer, even on much larger cars.

title: A Settlement on Soured Mortgages May Raise Questions on What Is Enough
description: One of the unsettled questions from the financial crisis is whether the big banks have paid enough to cover the mortgage abuses they committed before the market collapsed.

title: What the Huracn and the Honeycomb Have in Common
description: One of the most stunning cars in New York for this years auto show was not to be found on the show floor of the Javits Center. Lamborghinis Huracn LP 610-4 was shown Tuesday at Bathhouse Studios, a former site of public baths on the Lower East Side that has been turned into a photo studio and event space.

title: Its Official: Yahoos Former No. 2 Made a Lot More Than His Boss
description: Henrique de Castro, who was fired in January as Yahoos chief operating officer, was paid handsomely for his largely unsuccessful efforts to turn around the companys flailing advertising business.

title: 2015 Chevrolet Trax
description: A look at the miniutility vehicle from the 2014 New York auto show.

title: With Eyes on 2016, Perry Is Mired in the Past
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  The last nine months of Rick Perrys tenure as the longest-serving governor of Texas were supposed to be a political victory lap.

title: 2015 Kia Sedona
description: Kia tries to make the case for the minivan as a modern-day family mover.

title: 2015 Jeep Renegade
description: Jeep hopes a small crossover makes a huge splash.

title: New York Lawmakers Push to Raise Wages at Biggest Chains
description: A group of Democratic lawmakers from New York City on Wednesday announced a new push to raise the minimum wage for many low-paid workers, calling for a $15-an-hour fair wage for employees of McDonalds and Walmart and other businesses with yearly sales of $50 million or more.

title: 2015 Nissan Murano
description: The crossover gets a new look for 2015.

title: When Liking a Brand Online Voids the Right to Sue
description: Might downloading a 50-cent coupon for Cheerios cost you legal rights?

title: Theres a Moon Out Tonight
description: Lets talk about something cheerful. I nominate the apocalypse.

title: Fault Lines Appear at Northwestern Over Union Vote
