title: There Goes the Sun
description: Like just about everyone who has looked at the numbers on renewable energy, solar power in particular, I was wowed by the progress. Something really good is in reach.

title: For Square, Making Money Remains a Challenge
description: The payments start-up Square has been considered one of the hottest young companies in Silicon Valley, with a multibillion-dollar valuation. But it now appears to be facing some growing pains.

title: ECO 348, The Great Recession: Long-Run Fiscal Prospects
description: Slides here (pdf). I thought it would be unfair to the students not to give them a bit of color at the end.

title: If Its Possible, It Happened
description: Zooming through a Stockholm intersection on his bicycle one morning, 18-year-old Max Tegmark never saw the truck that hit him. The blast of a horn, the screech of tires and a sickening thud followed in quick succession, extinguishing a young life filled with promise.

title: An Apple a Day, and Other Myths
description: SAN DIEGO  A trip to almost any bookstore or a cruise around the Internet might leave the impression that avoiding cancer is mostly a matter of watching what you eat. One source after another promotes the protective powers of superfoods, rich in antioxidants and other phytochemicals, or advises readers to emulate the diets of Chinese peasants or Paleolithic cave dwellers.

title: Brain-Mapping Milestones
description: As the Brain Initiative announced by President Obama a year ago continues to set priorities and gear up for what researchers hope will be a decade-long program to understand how the brain works, two projects independent of that effort reached milestones in their brain mapping work.

title: For Audiences as Varied as an Ark Full of Animals
description: LOS ANGELES  As you push on metal bars, a towering 16-foot giraffe with a mosaic body stretches its head. Flamingos with fly-swatter feet and pink-purse bodies promenade past, guided by puppeteers. A child turning a crank sets off sparks of lightning, signaling an approaching storm. And a moving rubber ramp lifts small animals, two by two, into an enormous ark made of unpainted fir.

title: Not Just Playing Around Anymore
description: This year, a United Nations program devoted to urban planning in countries affected by poverty or natural disasters began developing a sports field in the slums of Kibera, Kenya, designing it in the popular sandbox video game Minecraft. The game, which allows players to build entire worlds out of cubes in a 3-D environment, helped the project leaders create a visual representation of the field that could be easily understood by the neighborhoods residents.

title: Cancer Vaccine Proves Effective in H.I.V. Patients
description: Vaccines against cervical cancer work well even in sexually active women with H.I.V., a new study has found. It also found that women who already have one or two strains of the cancer-causing virus can be protected against others.

title: Literary Lives Laid Bare by the Nanny
description: I do judge books by their covers, sometimes, and the one on Love, Nina made me place it in the probably not pile. Its bright watercolor artwork (kids, bicycle, vaguely European street scene) suggests a book thats trying too hard, in the Peter Mayle vein, to be adorable. The subtitle, A Nanny Writes Home, doesnt dispel this impression.

title: Finding Lyricism in the Contemporary Canon
description: The scores for Refrain, Stockhausens 1959 work for three musicians, provoked some titters when they were carried onstage at Alice Tully Hall on Thursday evening. Each of the players was allotted sprawling sheets, a few feet long by a few feet wide, secured on cardboard by binder clips, and half of each sheet was given over to oddly curved musical staves.

title: Portuguese Drone Program Off to Nonflying Start
description: As the Lisbon daily Pblico reported, the Portuguese Navys fledgling drone program attracted international attention last week because of footage of the failed maiden voyage of a new reconnaissance craft that was quickly viewed hundreds of thousands of times online.

title: Their Surprise Route to Popularity
description: In sitcoms, its been the season of the embarrassing dad. Michael J. Fox, Robin Williams, Christopher Meloni, J. K. Simmons, Beau Bridges, Martin Mull and Peter Riegert have all played lovably messed-up fathers in new shows. (That could be the cast of a pretty good production of Glengarry Glen Ross.)

title: Science Tools Anyone Can Afford
description: STANFORD, CALIF.  Manu Prakash keeps a map on his bedroom wall that imagines what the world would look like if it were configured according to the scientific research that each region produces.

title: Felix Salmon to Leave Reuters
description: Felix Salmon, a prominent writer at Reuters on finance and the news media, said on Monday that he was leaving the news agency.

title: Old World, New Tech
description: BARCELONA, Spain  The streets here offer a glimpse of what the future may have to offer.

title: Maybe an A for Effort?
description: Student: Amethyst Amelia Kelly, a.k.a. Iggy Azalea.

title: Excerpt: Your Mothers Copy...
description: Chris Stack and Zo Sophia Garcia in a scene from Kirk Lynns play Your Mothers Copy of the Kama Sutra, at Playwrights Horizons.

title: Alone in a Prison Cell With a Tiny Window
description: Solitary Nation is about as hopeless an hour of television as you can imagine, which is exactly the reason to watch it. Whatever picture you might have in your mind of the nature of solitary confinement will be changed by this Frontline documentary (Tuesday night on PBS stations), and any notions you might have that it could be eliminated will be dimmed.

title: Mets Ron Darling Pitches That Should Be a Word Submission
description: Several months ago, a lot of people around here were absolutely giddy when The New York Times Magazine became a plot device on House of Cards, with actual cameos by Matt Bai, our chief political correspondent back then. But for my money, our little publication didnt really hit the pop-culture big time until last Friday night, when Ron Darling dropped a One-Page Magazine reference during the Mets broadcast.

title: Architect Helps Shape Future of a Building He Had to Leave
description: One of the happiest moments of the architect Steven Harriss career arrived as he was being evicted in 2011 from his TriBeCa loft, his home of 34 years.

title: Saudi America: Mirage?
description: At a time when Russia is saber-rattling and the Middle East is in turmoil, a welcome geopolitical trifecta could be in the making. The United States is poised to surpass Saudi Arabia and Russia as the worlds top oil producer. Canadas oil sands have vaulted the country to energy superpower status. Mexico is embarking on a historic constitutional energy overhaul that its president promises will propel the countrys economy.

title: Valeants History of Deal-Making
description: Valeant Pharmaceuticals, which said on Monday that it was teaming up with the hedge fund manager William A. Ackman to bid for the maker of Botox, is no stranger to deal-making.

title: Spotlight Illuminated Some Knicks Coaches but Singed Others
description: Red Holzman and his two N.B.A. titles cast a long shadow over the roster of coaches who tried, and failed, to lift the Knicks to the top.

title: Insider Expected to Succeed Mulally at Ford
description: DETROIT  Ford Motor has picked Mark Fields, its chief operating officer, to succeed Alan R. Mulally as the next chief executive of the company, according to a person with knowledge of the move.

title: Winning With Compassion and Respect
description: The winner of this years award in honor of Chris Hondros shares his sense of compassion and respect for his subjects

title: How Green Was Thy Norman Conquest?
description: LONDON  WHEN William the Conqueror invaded England in 1066, he could not have imagined what would happen to the land he seized from the Anglo Saxons.

title: Nothing Racist in Blackface Dancers, English Candidate Insists
description: Updated, Tuesday, 12:56 p.m. | To the ever-growing catalog of behaviors that are not racist according to European politicians  like comparing a black minister to an orangutan in Italy and sharing a fabricated image of President Obama staring at a banana in Russia  we can now add performing in blackface, thanks to a candidate for Parliament in rural England.

title: In Defense of Chocolate Milk
description: On the topic of chocolate milk, in schools in particular, Im with Mark Oppenheimer. Writing about a recent article in PLOS One describing what happened when 11 schools, serving kindergarten through fifth grade, eliminated chocolate milk from their cafeterias (the students drank less milk, threw more milk away and bought fewer school lunches over all), he says:

title: Moving Dangerous Cargo
description: To the Editor:

title: Imperiled Water Resources
description: To the Editor:

title: The College Honor Code: Trust but Verify?
description: To the Editor:

title: Mozilla, Brandeis and Free Expression
description: To the Editor:

title: Tomorrows America, in Queens
description: WHEN the New York Worlds Fair opened 50 years ago today in Flushing Meadow Park, in Queens, its president, Robert Moses, hailed it as an immediate success. And while it failed to turn a profit, more than 51 million people visited it over its two six-month seasons, drawn to its shiny corporate pavilions and space age optimism as a welcome distraction for a nation still mourning the death of President John F. Kennedy.

title: GitHub Founder Resigns After Investigation
description: [ Updated to include Twitter commentary from Marc Andreessen, the venture capitalist whose firm financed GitHub. ]

title: With Defiant Spirit, Boston Marathoners Run Again
description: More than 30,000 racers took park in the Boston Marathon, a year after an attack shattered a joyous tradition more than a century old

title: Focus Turns to Samsungs Patents at Trial
description: Before Monday, the focus of the latest Apple and Samsung patent trial was whether Samsung copied Apple. But on Monday, Samsung said Apple has done some copying of its own  including a method for transmitting video over wireless devices.

title: Camerons Description of Britain as Christian Country Draws an Angry Response
description: LONDON  Prime Minister David Camerons effort to describe his own Christian faith at Easter has backfired, with some critics accusing him of fostering alienation and division by characterizing Britain as a Christian country.

title: World Carbon Emissions
description: In billions of metric tons, 2011. The worldwide total was about 32.6 billion metric tons.

title: Keystone Pipeline May Be Big, but This Is Bigger
description: WASHINGTON  THE Keystone XL pipeline is a great political symbol. The proposed 1,700-mile pipeline, which would carry 830,000 barrels daily of carbon-heavy crude from Canadas Alberta oil sands to Gulf Coast refineries, has galvanized environmental activists, who call it a litmus test for President Obamas commitment to fighting climate change. It is a political weapon against Mr. Obama for Republicans, who call it a symbol of job creation and energy security. It has motivated liberal donors, led by the California billionaire Tom Steyer, who has personally urged Mr. Obama to reject the pipeline.

title: Autism and the Agitator
description: What do you call someone who sows misinformation, stokes fear, abets behavior that endangers peoples health, extracts enormous visibility from doing so and then says the equivalent of Who? Me?

title: Defendant Killed by Court Officer at Utah Trial
description: SALT LAKE CITY  With stunned jurors looking on, a defendant in a long-running gang prosecution was shot and killed by a deputy United States marshal in the federal courthouse here on Monday morning after he lunged to attack a witness testifying in his trial, federal authorities said.

title: Drones Are Becoming Energys New Roustabouts
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  THE egg white drone lifted off from its ground station at a hospital construction site here, hovered for an instant, then zoomed off, sounding like a five-pound bee as it buzzed around the cranes towering over the six-acre project.

title: Ice or Molten Salt, Not Batteries, to Store Energy
description: WASHINGTON  ENERGY storage is crucial to transforming the electric grid into a clean, sustainable, low-emissions system, the experts say. And its happening already, just not the way most consumers would expect.

title: Skeptical Justice Scolds Coca-Cola on Juice Label
description: WASHINGTON  Not long after a lawyer for Coca-Cola started to defend its label for a blended fruit juice at a Supreme Court argument on Monday, Justice Anthony M. Kennedy subjected her to a series of unusually harsh questions.

title: We Could See You in the Gas Tank Later, Alligator
description: PRODUCTION of biodiesel as an alternative to fossil fuels is on the rise in the United States, and one reason, proponents say, is that it can be made from a long list of raw materials.

title: When Lending a Player Can Be Self-Defeating
description: MADRID  Imagine that you own an unusually large number of sand buckets. You have so many, in fact, that when you go to the beach one morning, someone immediately asks if they can borrow one, and you happily agree. It is one fewer to carry, after all, and you probably would not have used it anyway.

title: The End, or Something
description: My new editor and I were sharing a celebratory drink at a swanky Lower Manhattan bar, like a pair of characters in my first novel, which she would publish in less than a year. She said that everyone loved it, there was only one concern: It did not have an ending. I explained that it did have an ending, it was just an ambiguous one.

title: Shunning Gas Hogs, Athletes Green Their Rides
description: JEREMY GUTHRIE considers himself easygoing and comfortable with his beliefs, including how he feels about the environment.

title: Boy Scout Troop Loses Charter Over Gay Leader
description: SEATTLE  The Boy Scouts of America, which voted last year to allow gay scouts but not openly gay scout leaders, has revoked the charter of a church-sponsored troop here for refusing to fire its adult gay scoutmaster.

title: Supreme Court Weighs Aid to Holders of Argentine Debt
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday seemed inclined to offer at least modest help to Argentinas creditors.

title: Iran Disputes Reports of Violent Crackdown in Prisons Political Detainee Block
description: Irans penal authorities sought on Monday to discredit reports of a violent clash last week inside the political detainee block in Tehrans Evin Prison, calling them fabrications fomented by enemies of the government.

title: Vietnam Returns Migrants to China After Deadly Border Clash
description: BEIJING  The Vietnamese authorities have returned to the Chinese government 11 Chinese migrants and the bodies of five others after members of the group were involved in a deadly clash with Vietnamese border guards last Friday, according to a Vietnamese news report.

title: Linking the Los Angeles Airport
description: LOS ANGELES  The two concrete nubs, dotted with rusted sticks of rebar, that protrude from the elevated rail tracks near Aviation Boulevard are reminders of the unfulfilled promise that came nearly 25 years ago with the restart of a rail system here.

title: Answering an Emergency Call: Yes, There Is a Doctor on Board
description: WHEN I travel, I try to remember a quotation often attributed to William Butler Yeats that there are no strangers, only friends you have not yet met.

title: Pakistan: Unicef Workers Freed
description: Two Unicef staff members who were abducted last week in Pakistans southern port city of Karachi have been released, a spokesman for the United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, said Monday. The spokesman, Stphane Dujarric, said the two were safe and well, but he had no other details. It was not clear who had abducted them or why they had been freed. Foreign aid workers in Pakistan have been increasingly singled out by jihadist insurgents for kidnappings and attacks. At least 12 United Nations staff members have been killed in Pakistan since January 2009. Some of the assaults have been tied to Taliban retributions for efforts by Unicef and other international aid groups to vaccinate children against polio, which has been spreading in Pakistan, particularly in the northwest tribal areas. Some Taliban leaders have said vaccine workers are Western spies using the guise of humanitarian aid to gather intelligence information.

title: The Value of Unused Tickets? Airlines Wont Say
description: HERE is the explanation for why I booked two one-way trips for the same day, from two different cities 2,500 miles apart. It involves parrots and construction workers.

title: The Tyranny of the Glass Boxes
description: One57, the luxury condominium skyscraper under development just south of Central Park, lists several neighborhood attractions on its website. Among them is the Rizzoli Bookstore, which for decades operated out of a roughly 100-year-old neo-French Classical townhouse at 31 West 57th Street.

title: Yes, Tanaka Can Still Remember How It Feels to Lose
description: BOSTON  The feeling Masahiro Tanaka had Aug. 19, 2012, must have been so bad that he resolved not to feel it again for a long, long time. That was the date of Tanakas last loss in a regular-season game.

title: Netflix Says It Opposes Comcasts Merger Bid
description: Netflix on Monday voiced strong opposition to Comcasts planned $45 billion takeover of Time Warner Cable, even while confirming that it was raising subscription prices.

title: The Leadership Emotions
description: Throughout American history, most presidents had small personal staffs. They steered through political waters as amateurs, relying on experience, instinct and conversations with friends.

title: No Corrections: April 21, 2014
description: No corrections appeared in print.

title: Wage Theft Across the Board
description: When labor advocates and law enforcement officials talk about wage theft, they are usually referring to situations in which low-wage service-sector employees are forced to work off the clock, paid subminimum wages, cheated out of overtime pay or denied their tips. It is a huge and underpoliced problem. It is also, it turns out, not confined to low-wage workers.

title: For a New Burts Bees Line, Check Your Calendar
description: WHILE it may seem that advertising is everywhere, one place marketers have not infiltrated is the popular calendar software on computers, smartphones and tablets. But now, in what Burts Bees says is a marketing first, the natural personal care brand is introducing promotional messages that will appear as appointments in electronic calendars like those by Microsoft, Apple, Google and Yahoo.

title: Investigated by Chinas Leaders, Powerful Family Has a Defender: Its Hometown
description: XIQIANTOU, China  Older villagers knew the eel fishermans boy who would become one of Chinas most fearsome men. Until recently, his two younger brothers were their neighbors. All three brothers were good people, said a 69-year-old woman who lived next door. They would not do bad things.

title: Transparency on Targeted Killings
description: For years now, the Obama administration has been playing a self-serving and duplicitous game over its power to kill people away from any battlefield and without judicial oversight or accountability. It has trotted out successive officials and doled out tidbits of information attesting to the legality of President Obamas claim to unilateral authority to carry out such killings, while withholding information essential to evaluating that aggressive claim of executive power.

title: The Real Port Authority Scandal
description: This is a column about the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, but you wont read a word in here about the lane-closing scandal in Fort Lee, N.J. This is about another scandal, one that has been going for on so long that people dont even think of it as scandalous. Indeed, it involves no illegality whatsoever. But that doesnt mean it isnt a scandal.

title: Oklahoma Supreme Court Ruling to Stay Executions
description: The Oklahoma Supreme Court stayed the imminent executions of two murderers who had successfully challenged the legality of the states secrecy in obtaining lethal drugs.

title: Hamish Maxwell, Philip Morris Empire Builder, Dies at 87
description: Hamish Maxwell, whose acquisitions of food companies in the 1980s turned Philip Morris into a consumer products colossus, died on Saturday at his home in Palm Beach, Fla. He was 87.

title: The Lives of Emma Edmonds
description: In 1864, with huge casualties from battles in Virginias Shenandoah Valley, the Union enlisted thousands of volunteer nurses from the North, among them a reclusive 23-year-old woman named Sarah Emma Edmonds. But this wasnt the first time Edmonds had volunteered for service. Nor was there any indication that this shy woman nursing soldiers in West Virginia had spent years behind enemy lines as a spy

title: Battling for a Safer Bangladesh
description: After the Spectrum sweater factory collapsed in 2005, killing 64 workers, hardly anything changed to improve factory safety in Bangladesh.

title: Looking at Costs and Risks, Many Skip Health Insurance
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Steve Huber, an affable salesman who is still paying off an unexpected medical bill, was not among the millions of Americans who signed up for health insurance under the Affordable Care Act during the enrollment period that ended March 31.

title: Panel Tells Port Authority to Lessen Governors Sway
description: For an agency that has conducted most of its business behind closed doors for decades, the meeting the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey held on Monday morning was indisputably extraordinary.

title: A Restorative Triumph After the Bomb Blasts
description: BOSTON  The white T-shirts said 4.15 Strong on the front and Survivor on the back.

title: Companies Built on Sharing Balk When It Comes to Regulators
description: In the newfangled sharing economy, questions about safety, taxes and regulation have tended to be an afterthought. That has helped propel companies like Uber, Airbnb and Lyft into the stratosphere.

title: Under Russia, Life in Crimea Grows Chaotic
description: SIMFEROPOL, Crimea  After Russia annexed Crimea practically overnight, the Russian bureaucrats handling passports and residence permits inhabited the building of their Ukrainian predecessors, where Roman Nikolayev now waits daily with a seemingly mundane question.

title: Indictment Details How to Forge a Masterpiece
description: The painting caught Pei-Shen Qians eye, but it was the price that affected him deeply.

title: Dancing Gertrude Stein, Surrounded by Wonders
description: In her 1934 lecture Plays, Gertrude Stein wondered, What is the use of telling a story since there are so many and everybody knows so many. You might ask the same question, gently, of Ripe Times The World Is Round, a tender and sassy adaptation of Steins opaque childrens book at the Brooklyn Academy of Music Fisher Theater.

title: A Journey to Intimacy Thats Nobodys Business but Their Own
description: If the title Your Mothers Copy of the Kama Sutra doesnt give you the heebie-jeebies (isnt your mothers copy of Fifty Shades of Grey mortifying enough?), rest assured that something in this new play by Kirk Lynn certainly will.

title: Watch Out: The Ex-Wife Has Arrived, and Shes Got Lots of Baggage
description: Plays with just two characters usually move in one of two directions: from animosity to comity, or vice versa. Annapurna, a new play by Sharr White starring Megan Mullally and Nick Offerman, is definitely the kind that begins in full battle.

title: Talking Mom Out of Bombing the Brownstone
description: Estelle Parsons, the great actor who stars as an embattled but indomitable Brooklyn painter in The Velocity of Autumn, a new play by Eric Coble, seems to be living an eternal springtime. Now 86, Ms. Parsons has lost little, if any, of her energy, and absolutely none of her ability to bring sustained, animated life to a well-drawn character. She never leaves the stage during this 90-minute, two-character play, which opened on Monday night at the Booth Theater, and yet she seems daisy-fresh at the curtain call, as if ready to run a half-marathon as an encore.

title: It May Be Read to a Miscreant
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  You are getting sleepy  keep your eyes on the circled/shaded squares in Ed Sessas puzzle and when you are feeling really, really relaxed, make the check out to me and send it to  never mind. Just kidding.

title: U.S. Drones and Yemeni Forces Kill Qaeda-Linked Fighters, Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON  American drones and Yemeni counterterrorism forces killed more than three dozen militants linked to Al Qaedas affiliate in Yemen over the weekend in one of the largest such attacks there in months, officials from both countries said Monday.

title: Do the Rich Call the Shots?
Waiting Lists for Kindergarten Drop by Half, New York City Says
description: The number of students placed on waiting lists for kindergarten dropped by half this year as New York Citys Education Department used a new strategy for matching students with schools, officials said on Monday.

title: As Jets Start Workouts, They Hope to Build on a Positive Ending
description: The Jets had last assembled the day after their season ended at Miami, where they toasted the present and the future  the victory that evened their record at 8-8 and the news that their beloved coach, Rex Ryan, had been retained. They filed into their New Jersey practice complex on Monday, nearly four months later, with a comparable level of excitement, to hear what could be construed as a continuation of Ryans post-mortem speech from December.

title: Mexico Honors a Colombian Writer Whom Many Considered One of Their Own
description: MEXICO CITY  Every March, often with a yellow flower pinned to his lapel, Gabriel Garca Mrquez stood on the stoop of his home here to greet well-wishers on his birthday.

title: Analysis of Airbnb Listings
description: In an affidavit filed in New York State Supreme Court, the director of research for the state attorney general noted that of the more than 19,500 listings on Airbnb in New York at the end of January, the majority were for an entire apartment.

title: Mayoral First Couple Talk About Love and Hard Times
description: In his first few months as mayor of New York, Bill de Blasio has rarely passed up a chance to dote on his wife, Chirlane McCray, from behind a lectern. On Monday he took his wife and his mushy, gushy expressiveness to the couch  and the nationwide audience  of ABCs daytime talk show The View.

title: Ukrainian Roma Face Threats and Violence
description: Roma in Ukraine said that the homes of seven of the 150 Roma families in Slovyansk were robbed by masked, armed men over the weekend.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for April 21, 2014
description: April 21, 2014

title: When It Comes to Fatherhood, It Seems Christie Knows Best
description: This has not, suffice it to say, been a season of accolades for Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey.

title: A Drivers Bloody Run-In With an Angry Detroit
description: DETROIT  Steve Utash had driven the same streets through this city for years on the way to his tree trimming jobs or his home in the suburbs. But one afternoon this month, along this familiar route, he found a side of Detroit he had never encountered, a Detroit where racial tension, churning just below the surface, can break into lawlessness in broad daylight. He found a side where people sometimes talk about meting out justice on their own, mostly because they say they cannot be sure when, or if, the police will show up.

title: Boy Who Hid in Planes Wheel Well Beat Long Odds in Surviving 5 -Hour Flight
description: Jumping a deteriorating airport fence, running across the airport unobserved in the darkness and climbing into the wheel well of a parked Boeing 767, as a California teenager did on Sunday, is not all that difficult, according to experts, but surviving the trip  in this case, a five-and-a-half-hour flight from San Jose, Calif., to Maui, Hawaii  is extraordinary.

title: Nets Anderson Has World of Experience in Pressure Situations
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Alan Anderson is one of five players on the Nets roster making his N.B.A. postseason debut during the first-round series against the Toronto Raptors. But to lump him with the other playoff initiates would be a mistake.

title: Nepalese Government to Set Up Relief Fund for Sherpas
description: NEW DELHI  The government of Nepal has agreed to create a relief fund for Sherpa mountain climbers who are injured or killed in accidents and to make other concessions to the Sherpas, according to an official at the Ministry of Culture, Tourism and Civil Aviation. The official, Sushil Ghimire, said some of the revenue the government gets from expeditions to Mount Everest would be set aside for the fund.

title: Seeking a Museum With a Funny Bone, Starting From Scratch
description: Gabrovo, Bulgaria, is the home of the celebrated House of Humor and Satire. Odessa in Ukraine plays host to the famed Humorina festival. A Museum of Comedy is being planned for a church crypt in London.

title: Intelligence Chief Issues Limits on Press Contacts
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration has barred officials at 17 agencies from speaking to journalists about unclassified intelligence-related topics without permission, according to a newly disclosed directive.

title: Mejia Shows Why Mets Can Rely on the Rotation
description: The home fans stood and applauded Jenrry Mejia as he walked off the field during the seventh inning Monday night. He had held the Cardinals scoreless, at times baffling them, and seemed to have grown up a little. This was perhaps his best start this season. He crossed his heart, kissed his hand and pointed to the sky.

title: Voices From Donetsk
description: In Donetsk, Ukraine, pro-Russian residents spoke out about Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.s visit and Americas role in the conflict between Russia and Ukraine.

title: Beleaguered Albuquerque Department Reports Another Fatal Shooting by Police
description: ALBUQUERQUE  An Albuquerque police officer fatally shot a suspected car thief on Monday during a foot chase in which, officials said, the suspect pointed a gun at the officer as he closed in on her. The shooting occurred 11 days after the Justice Department rebuked the Police Department for engaging in a pattern or practice of unconstitutional use of deadly force.

title: Russia Displays a New Military Prowess in Ukraines East
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State John Kerry has accused Russia of behaving in a 19th-century fashion because of its annexation of Crimea.

title: Decades in Prison Sought for CityTime Scheme
description: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan have asked a judge to impose sentences of 105 years, 80 years and up to 40 years on three men who the government has said became unbelievably rich in connection with New York Citys scandal-marred payroll modernization project known as CityTime.

title: Rangers Calmly Disagree With Two Diving Penalties
description: Any small advantage, gained or lost, can deeply affect a series as close as the first-round playoff matchup between the Rangers and the Flyers, which continues Tuesday with Game 3 in Philadelphia.

title: Obamas Strategic Shift to Asia Is Hobbled by Pressure at Home and Crises Abroad
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama is expected to announce an agreement with the Philippines next Monday that would give American ships and planes the most extensive access to bases there since the United States relinquished its vast naval installation at Subic Bay in 1992.

title: Even With Dying Boxers Appeal, a Tough Road Ahead for Convicted Man
description: It was the dying wish of the former prizefighter Rubin (Hurricane) Carter, a man whose life had come to symbolize how the justice system can go terribly awry: to see David McCallum, a Brooklyn man who had written to him from prison and asked for his help in overturning his murder conviction, go free.

title: Official Denies F.B.I. Was Investigating Manifesto Leak
description: A Justice Department official denied Monday that the F.B.I. had investigated how a manifesto by Khalid Shaikh Mohammed ended up at The Huffington Post. It came to light last week that agents had approached a member of the defense team for a detainee facing trial before a military commission over the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks. He was asked to sign a confidentiality agreement, something the defense lawyers said improperly made him an informant. The disclosure derailed a week of pretrial hearings, and the special trial counsel, Fernando Campoamor-Sanchez, an assistant United States attorney, is leading an investigation into the matter. It was widely speculated that the subject of the F.B.I. inquiry was how the 36-page manuscript by Mr. Mohammed  the self-described architect of the attacks  had been leaked. But in a public court filing on Monday, Mr. Campoamor-Sanchez said that was not true. He did not identify the investigations actual subject, although he apparently offered greater details to the judge in an accompanying classified filing.

title: Two Wounded in National Zoo Shooting
description: Two people were wounded in a shooting Monday evening that shut down the National Zoo on an unusually busy day. At least one suspect  initial reports said there were two  was being sought in the shooting, which occurred at the zoos entrance just before 6 p.m., the Washington police said. The police said the victims injuries were not life-threatening, but both were taken to a hospital for treatment. Police officials said they did not know what led to the shooting.

title: Student Loans Can Suddenly Come Due When Co-Signers Die, a Report Finds
description: For students who borrow on the private market to pay for school, the death of a parent can come with an unexpected, added blow, a federal watchdog warns. Even borrowers who have good payment records can face sudden demands for full, early repayment of those loans, and can be forced into default.

title: Word of the Day | suffragist
description: suffragist \sf-ri-jist\ noun

title: Utility Poles Generate Heat From Long Island Residents
description: PORT WASHINGTON, N.Y.  Rich Bentley first noticed them in Manhasset Valley Park, and thought they were for coming field lights. Other homeowners on the North Shore of Long Island began spotting them, too: towering wooden poles with big round pulleys that resemble dream catchers, outside their windows in the thick of newly amputated trees.

title: Whats On Tuesday
description: 9 P.M. (13, 49) A FIERCE GREEN FIRE (2013) At one time, it was about the dams. The naturalist John Muir and the forester Gifford Pinchot waged war in the early 1900s over the flooding of the magnificent Hetch Hetchy Valley in Yosemite National Park. Decades later, the proposed damming of the Colorado River prompted public outrage, and the environmental movement was born. Today some two million organizations worldwide work on behalf of social justice and the environment. In this Earth Day tribute, American Masters chronicles issues (pollution, whaling, conservation of the Amazon rain forest, climate change) within the fight and the players who made a difference (Lois Gibbs, who rallied on behalf of Love Canal; David Brower, above, the first executive director of the Sierra Club; and Paul Watson and Rex Weyler, the founders of Greenpeace). The environmental movement is about nature versus humanity, says Robert Redford, who with Meryl Streep, Ashley Judd, Van Jones and Isabel Allende narrates this documentary, directed by Mark Kitchell. It arose at a time when our industrial civilization has grown so powerful it threatens the natural world on which we depend for survival. It has become the battle for a living planet.

title: India Election Digest: April 22
description: What you need to know on Tuesday about Indias elections: The Election Commission takes action against alleged hate speech in Gujarat, the next Parliament is likely to be richer but less educated, and IT stocks are falling on investor anticipation of a Bharatiya Janata Party-led government.

title: Students Are Graded as They Give a Voice to the South Bronx
description: Eight reporters for The Hunts Point Express went to work on Rafael Salamanca Jr., the district manager of Community Board 2 in the South Bronx.

title: Bragging of Safety While Many Live in Fear
description: The twin holes resemble diamond studs, and a crack in the glass curls, as graceful as an eyelash along the lobby window.

title: Corrections: April 22, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: U Win Tin, Writer Jailed and Tortured in Myanmar for 19 Years, Dies
description: U Win Tin, a journalist, author and poet who became a leading opponent of the military rulers of Myanmar, where he was imprisoned and tortured for 19 years, died on Monday in Yangon, formerly Rangoon. Sources differ on whether he was 84 or 85.

title: Times Minute | Obamas Asian Trip
description: On the Minute, the Times White House correspondent Mark Landler on the coming trip of President Obama to Japan, South Korea, Malaysia and the Philippines.

title: Times Minute | Obamas Asian Trip
description: In the Video

title: Increased Activity at North Korean Nuclear Site Raises Suspicions
description: JINDO, South Korea  Just days before President Obama is to arrive in South Korea, North Korea has increased activities at its main nuclear test site, raising suspicions in Seoul and Washington that the country may be preparing to conduct a new underground nuclear test, the South Korean Defense Ministry said Tuesday.

title: Novartis and Glaxo Agree to Trade $20 Billion in Assets
description: Updated, 8:18 p.m. | The Swiss pharmaceutical giant Novartis and its British rival GlaxoSmithKline announced on Tuesday that they would swap more than $20 billion in assets as they seek to sharpen the focus of their businesses.

title: Nepal Mourns Everest Avalanche Victims
description: Three days after an avalanche killed 13 Sherpas on Mount Everest, a funeral procession was held for six of them in Kathmandu.

title: For British Biographer, Modi Was Only a Phone Call Away
description: How does one get Narendra Modi, the front-runner in the race for Indias prime minister, to sit down for an interview? According to Andy Marino, the British author of a recent biography of Mr. Modi, the answer is simple: Just call him, he said by telephone from London.

title: Test Yourself | History, April 22
description: Take the Quiz

title: Manchester United Fires David Moyes as Manager
description: The very first sign that David Moyes was not going to continue Alex Fergusons standard at Manchester United may have come before Moyes ever coached a single meaningful game.

title: From China, a Video Tribute to Its Aircraft Carrier
description: Chinas sole aircraft carrier has seized the national spotlight again, with a stirring Top Gun-style music video by the state-owned arms manufacturer Aviation Industry Corporation of China.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Boston Runs Again
description: In With Defiant Spirit, Boston Marathoners Run Again, Katharine Q. Seelye writes about the running of the Boston Marathon on Monday.

title: Free Education Comes at a Cost for Marginalized Students
description: SONBHADRA, India  On Sunday, Umesh, a soft-spoken second grader, and a dozen of his classmates clamored to tell a visitor why no children in the village of Raup had returned to their local government school in this remote southeast corner of Uttar Pradesh since March 26.

title: Biden Offers Strong Support to Ukraine and Issues a Sharp Rebuke to Russia
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Vowing that the United States would never recognize Russias illegal occupation of Crimea, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Tuesday reiterated Americas support of Ukraine, declared that no nation has the right to simply grab land from another and called on Russia to stop supporting masked gunmen who have seized government buildings across the east of the country.

title: If a Bubble Bursts in Palo Alto, Does It Make a Sound?
description: This year, Facebook purchased the mobile-messaging application WhatsApp for $19 billion, or about $350 million per employee and $40 per user, only some of whom even pay the $1 annual fee for the advertisement-free platform. But what was perhaps most remarkable about Facebooks acquisition of WhatsApp was that the start-up was making any money in the first place. In recent years, Facebook has shelled out 10-figure sums for Instagram and the virtual-reality headset maker Oculus V.R., both of which had scant or no revenue. Ditto for the safe-sexting-enabler Snapchat, which reportedly turned down a $3 billion offer from Mark Zuckerberg.

title: Winning With Compassion and Respect
description: Daniel Berehulak, a freelance photographer who often works for The New York Times, has won the 2014 Getty Images and Chris Hondros Fund Award. Preston Gannaway, a Pulitzer Prize-winning photographer based in Oakland, Calif., was selected as the award finalist.

title: What Are Your Longtime Interests or Passions?
description: Do you root for a certain team? Is there a movie you constantly watch, a book you read over and over, a band you love more than all others?

title: Search of Suspected Malaysian Jet Crash Site Is Nearly Done
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The unmanned submersible scouring the ocean floor for wreckage from Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 is nearing the end of its underwater search, having covered 80 percent of an area authorities believe to be the most likely resting place of the plane and its 239 passengers.

title: Cinderella and Her Prince, With Palpable Longing
description: La Cenerentola, Rossinis version of the Cinderella fairy tale, is Cinderellas show. The Metropolitan Opera has a dazzling, plucky and endearingly poignant Cinderella in the superb American mezzo-soprano Joyce DiDonato, who triumphed Monday night when the companys 1997 production, which gives this 1817 classic a 1930s look, returned to the repertory.

title: Voters Disapprove of Cuomos Shutdown of Anticorruption Panel, Poll Shows
description: Voters across New York overwhelmingly disagree with Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos decision to disband a commission that he had appointed to investigate corruption in state government, according to a poll released on Tuesday by Siena College.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: New York Today: A Proud Trees Second Life
description: Good morning on this mild Tuesday.

title: In Our Pages: April 23
description: 1914: The Situation in Mexico

title: So Tell Me a Story: How the Sports Narrative Works
description: Last year, John Branch won a Pulitzer Prize for his harrowing account of a deadly avalanche in the Pacific Northwest. John was the first New York Times sportswriter to win the prize for feature writing.

title: No Matter What I Do, There Is Always a 27-Year-Old Doing It Better
description: When I hear stories of other people who are doing well, my first question is, How old are they?

title: Americans Predict a Future Like Science Fiction
description: Given the fast-paced changes that happen in technology, predicting the future has become more fun than guessing who will win the Super Bowl or Dancing With the Stars.

title: Economix Meets the Gales of Change
description: Creative destruction, an economic theory credited to Joseph Schumpeter, posits that institutions are destroyed so that new institutions can grow and flourish.

title: Daily Report: Companies Built on Sharing Balk at Regulators
description: In the newfangled sharing economy, questions about safety, taxes and regulation have tended to be an afterthought. That has helped propel companies like Uber, Airbnb and Lyft into the stratosphere, David Streitfeld reports.

title: Intersection: Oaklands Style
description: People are antinormal, Sarah Barnekow said of the style in Oakland, Calif.

title: Bain Goes Off Script for Its Latest Deal
description: Bain Capital recently raised a fresh $7.3 billion fund for buyouts, but the second deal in that fund departs from the buyout playbook.

title: Top Italian Banks Tap Private Equity for Help With Troubled Loans
description: American investment firms have found numerous opportunities to capitalize on the turmoil in Europes banking sector by buying distressed assets. But one major private equity firm, Kohlberg Kravis Roberts, is taking a novel approach.

title: Navigate News With The Upshot
description: You have no shortage of excellent news sources  sources that expertly report and analyze news as it happens. Like you, those of us at The Upshot rely on those sources every day. So why are we starting a new site to help people understand the news?

title: What Good Marathons and Bad Investments Have in Common
description: My sister-in-law, Jane Richards, ran last years Berlin Marathon. Throughout the course, she retched repeatedly. She collapsed only a few steps after finishing. Her body was a wreck, and she said the race was more painful than childbirth. Yet she scores it as one of the best experiences of her life.

title: The Myth of Swing Voters in Midterm Elections
description: If you want to understand the 2014 midterm elections, remember this simple fact about American politics: There just arent that many swing voters.

title: Incumbent Southern Democrats Are Less Vulnerable Than You Might Think
description: Democrats hopes of keeping their Senate majority this November may well hinge on the ability of three of their incumbents to hold onto their seats deep in enemy territory: the South. To take the Senate and consolidate their control of Congress, Republicans need only extend their stranglehold on Dixie to Arkansas, Louisiana and North Carolina, all of which voted for Mitt Romney in the 2012 presidential election.

title: Meet Leo, Our Senate Model.
description: LEO was the first computer for ordinary businesses. Weve named our Senate forecasting model after it. Our model combines polls with other information to predict how many Senate races Democrats and Republicans will win this year. To read about the machinery behind our model  how it combines polls, analyzes other information and deals with uncertainty  we have put together an FAQ.

title: Who Likes Web Censorship? (Ask Putin.)
description: If you want to explore how Russians attitudes toward an authoritarian government may be different from attitudes elsewhere, one place to look is how they think about censorship and freedom on the web.

title: How Underpaid German Workers Helped Cause Europes Debt Crisis
description: To understand a crucial reason for the European financial crisis that nearly caused a global financial collapse and threatened to undo a six-decade push toward a united Europe, you could look at a bunch of charts of bond markets and current account deficits and fiscal imbalances.

title: The American Middle Class Is No Longer the Worlds Richest
description: The American middle class, long the most affluent in the world, has lost that distinction.

title: Back Story: How We Found the Income Data
description: Late last year, while reading a new book by the economist Angus Deaton, I came across a sentence that hinted at a solution to one of my biggest frustrations as an economics journalist.

title: Charles Rangel, the veteran New York Democrat, wants you to know that hes the tops.
description: His official site, using the less-than-subtle URL of rangel.house.gov/NumberOne, proclaims that Mr. Rangel ranks first in productivity among members of Congress, according to a list generated by TrackBill, a legislative research service. But theres a significant catch: The rankings are based on a single metric  the percentage of bills sponsored that have passed. So the list is dominated by lawmakers holding committee and subcommittee chairs, which are the gatekeepers for most bills. Of Mr. Rangels 41 pieces of legislation that have passed since 2003, when TrackBill started counting, only one was passed in the past three years. Most occurred while he was chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, which has jurisdiction over tax issues.

title: Ways to Think About the Model
description: We realize that many people will interpret our Senate model as predicting that the Democrats will retain control of the Senate this year, because the model shows their odds of doing so to be 51 percent. We think the better way to describe the race is as a toss-up, and we suggest keeping two things in mind:

title: Seeking the Right Chemistry, Drug Makers Hunt for Mergers
description: Updated, 9:12 p.m. | The pharmaceutical industry is regaining its swagger, as companies turn to big and sometimes daring deals to expand and reshape their operations.

title: Inequality 1992
description: I happened to notice Greg Mankiw citing some bogus claims that the one percent is an ever-changing group, not a persistent elite, and I thought Wait  didnt we deal with that one long ago? And that brought to mind the piece I wrote for the American Prospect 22 years ago, The rich, the right, and the facts. (It doesnt say this on the Prospect site, but it was indeed published in 1992). See the section on income mobility.

title: In Performance: Julia Bullock
description: Julia Bullock, a rising soprano from Juilliard, sings Xavier Montsalvatges Cancin de Cuna Para Dormir a un Negrito. She is accompanied by the pianist Renate Rohlfing.

title: Close but Not Quite
description: [Please note: After Deadline will not appear on Tuesday, April 29, and will return on May 6.]

title: Class-Ridden America
description: Via Mark Thoma, Larry Bartels produces the ultimate anti-Santorum argument. Santorum, you may recall, declared that we have no classes in America  even the term middle class, he says, is Marxism talk. The usual response is to point to the data and say that objectively we are indeed a class society.

title: Ackmans Botox Ambitions
description: William A. Ackman, one of the brashest men on Wall Street, has come up with perhaps the boldest move yet for an activist: He has teamed up with the health care company Valeant to bid roughly $50 billion for Allergan, the maker of Botox, David Gelles, Michael J. de la Merced and Alexandra Stevenson write in DealBook. The offer by Valeant is expected to be announced Tuesday morning.

title: This simple table summarizes our story on American living standards.
description: In 1980, the American rich and middle class and most of the poor had higher incomes than their counterparts almost anywhere in the world. But incomes for the middle class and poor in the United States have since been growing more slowly than elsewhere. Why? Among the reasons: This country has lost its once-wide lead in educational attainment. Other countries have increased their workers skill levels more quickly, helping create well-paying jobs. The United States also tolerates more inequality: The minimum wage is lower here. Executives make more money. The government redistributes less of it. By 2010, the poor in several other countries had pulled ahead. And Canadas median income had reached a virtual tie with that of the United States. Since 2010, other data suggest Canada has moved ahead.

title: About the Data
description: The data in todays article on income comes from LIS, a group that maintains the Luxembourg Income Study Database. Staff members at LIS  based in Luxembourg and at the Graduate Center of the City University of New York  gather data on household income from around the world and harmonize the statistics, so that numbers from different countries can be compared. Government agencies typically conduct the underlying income surveys.

title: Ackman and Valeant Drum Up Stealth Activism
description: Remember the dawn raid, when a would-be acquirer built up a stake before the target realized it was under attack? The activist investor William A. Ackman has come up with a kind of drone strike version. His Pershing Square Capital Management hedge fund and Valeant Pharmaceuticals have teamed up to grab a potential 9.7 percent stake in Allergan, with a hostile takeover by Valeant ready for deployment.

title: Permira to Acquire German Chemical Maker CABB International
description: LONDON  The European private equity firm Permira said on Tuesday that it had agreed to acquire the specialty chemical company CABB International of Germany.

title: Comcast Reports Strong Earnings as Cable TV Subscribers Hold Steady
description: Comcast, already the largest cable operator in the country, is trying to become even larger with a proposed takeover of Time Warner Cable. But even without that enormous planned acquisition, Comcast is growing.

title: An Online Meeting Place for Creative Types
description: After graduating from New York University in 2013 with a degree in film and television, Dan Kim found himself in an entirely unexpected situation: a friend asked him to help shoot a music video, an incredible opportunity at the time, and Kim had to turn him down. I was in film school, but I didnt know anybody who could help, he explains, referencing his then-nonexistent set of industry contacts. I thought it was insane that there was no space for people like me to share their ideas. People still use Craigslist! The realization drove Kim to create Unique Board, a website where artists working in seven different categories  cinematography, fashion, design, music, art, dance/performance and technology/programming  can find each other for different projects. Were digitizing the collaboration process, making it simple but effective by cutting off all the extra steps of networking, Kim explains about the site, which has amassed over 200 members  many based in New York, many others international  since going live in February.

title: I Am Not a Thief
description: Dear Diary:

title: Court Backs Michigan on Affirmative Action
description: WASHINGTON  In a fractured decision that revealed deep divisions over what role the judiciary should play in protecting racial and ethnic minorities, the Supreme Court on Tuesday upheld a Michigan constitutional amendment that bans affirmative action in admissions to the states public universities.

title: At Funeral, Expressions of Grief and Anger Toward Kiev Officials
description: SLOVYANSK, Ukraine  Hundreds of residents of this eastern Ukrainian city under the control of pro-Russian militants came to the Orthodox Church of the Holy Spirit on Tuesday for the funerals of three men killed in a shootout at a roadblock on Sunday.

title: Worlds Fair Relic Deemed a Treasure
description: Fifty years after the 1964 Worlds Fair opened, the New York State Pavilion, one of the last architectural vestiges of the fair, was named a National Treasure on Tuesday by the National Trust for Historic Preservation.

title: Introducing the Reader Spotlight: A Teachers View of Common Core
description: As Ive noted, I get mail. Fairly often, a readers view, sent to me, stands quite well on its own and deserves a wider audience. Toward that end, Ill occasionally feature here a letter  possibly lightly trimmed or edited for style  that fits that description.

title: Scuba Diving in Brooklyn
description: As part of an unusual internship, nine high school students work in a tropical reef, located at the end of the F subway line in Coney Island.

title: Mariss Jansons to Resign From Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra
description: Mariss Jansons, who has been the chief conductor of the Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra for nearly a decade, plans to resign his post there after the 2014-15 season, the orchestra announced on Tuesday.

title: Equipped to Dive, Students Make Aquarium Their Classroom
description: Andrew Sutchen, 18, was keeping his head down, trying to ignore the fish. It was hard to concentrate on the task at hand: underwater housekeeping for the New York Aquarium in Coney Island. They kept biting my hair, he said. I felt a tug and saw that one had pulled some out.

title: Marine Vacth, the Frequently Unclothed Star of Franois Ozons Young and Beautiful
description: In his new film, Young and Beautiful (opening April 25 in New York), Franois Ozon introduces his star, the newcomer Marine Vacth, with a tableau thats typical of the French auteur: she appears lying naked on a beach in the South of France, seen through the lenses of a pair of binoculars. The voyeuristic shot establishes her character, the affluent high school student Isabelle, as an unknowable object of desire whose motives remain inscrutable even when she starts working nights as a high-class prostitute in Paris hotels (a plot device reminiscent of Belle de Jour). The roles abundant nudity and questionable morality is certain to rocket Vacth into the consciousness of American art-house audiences.

title: Allergan Bid Adds to Spate of Pharmaceutical Deals
description: The early pairing of the hedge fund manager William A. Ackman with Valeant Pharmaceuticals International to bid for the Botox maker Allergan allows Mr. Ackman to leapfrog over a traditional step for activist investors.

title: Reports of Fraud and Violence Temper Joy Over Election in Chaotic Afghan District
description: ANDAR, Afghanistan  The turbulent district of Andar has been caught in one kind of crossfire or another for years: between American forces and insurgent leaders, between warring militant factions, between those hostile to the national government and those courting it.

title: Lorde Postpones Australian Tour
description: Lorde, the teenage pop star, has had to postpone her scheduled concert tour of Australia because of a chest infection, Billboard magazine reported.

title: Oscar Producers Will Be Back in 2015
description: Craig Zadan and Neil Meron, whose production of this years largely successful Academy Awards eclipsed their Seth MacFarlane-led show of 2013, will return to produce the Oscar show for the third consecutive year. Where the 2013 show might be best remembered for Mr. MacFarlanes flat-footed musical ode to actresses bare breasts, the 2014 shows most-enduring image was of the star-filled selfie, above, snapped by a sunny Ellen DeGeneres. This years show also drew 45.4 million viewers, according to the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, the most in 10 years. Dawn Hudson, the Academys chief executive, said in a statement that Mr. Zadan and Mr. Meron were masters at tapping into the zeitgeist and capturing the hearts of movie fans around the world. Mr. Zadan and Mr. Meron have a long history of bringing Broadway musicals to the big and little screens: They produced the film versions of Chicago and Hairspray, are in the process of producing Pippin, and for television have made Annie, Rogers & Hammersteins Cinderella and Gypsy. The 87th Academy Awards will be next Feb. 22, at the Dolby Theater in Hollywood. No host has been named.

title: Is It O.K. to Mine Real Relationships for Literary Material?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. When Robert Lowell used his ex-wifes letters for his poetry, Elizabeth Bishop told him, Art just isnt worth that much. This week, Francine Prose and Leslie Jamison discuss what they make of mining actual relationships for literary material.

title: The Diminishing American Edge
description: Last week, in a tax day post defending the virtues of light taxation, I discussed the various economic advantages that the United States of America has reaped from its lower-than-average tax burden, and the evidence that not only the U.S. but also our developed-world peers have benefited from the American style of free market capitalism. But I concluded by allowing that this argument would look that much weaker the longer the U.S. economy goes without delivering on the second half of the basic American more risk and more inequality for more growth and jobs and self-sufficiency bargain  a combinationwhich has held historically, but not so much of late.

title: No Time to Waste: Students Pursue Environmental Progress Instead of Exam Grades
description: This is an Earth Day shout-out to the dozen undergraduate students in the inaugural semester of our new Pace University Environmental Policy Clinic, a year-round course in which student teams, instead of studying for tests, work with nonprofit groups, communities or other partners to pursue achievable environmental goals.

title: With Eyes on a Possible Clinton Run, Debate on a 2-Woman Ticket
description: WASHINGTON  Few doubt that Hillary Rodham Clintons nomination for president would be good for women. But her candidacy would also probably block the paths for other women running for the White House, and, notably, for those who would like to be vice president.

title: Chernin Teams With AT&T in Online Video Investment Venture
description: Peter Chernin was stymied in his effort last year to buy Hulu, the online video streaming service. But now, Mr. Chernin, the former News Corporation president, is teaming up with his partner in that bid to form a new investment venture.

title: Image of the Day: April 22
Sherpa Guides Abandon Everest Climbing Season
description: Updated, 1:51 p.m. | Following an avalanche on Friday that produced the worst single-day death toll in the history of Mount Everest, a group of Sherpas announced on Tuesday that they decided to abandon this years climbing season, disruptingplans of hundreds of climbers, many of them waiting at the mountains base camp.

title: Tribeca Film Festival: Gia Coppola Looks Back With Compassion
description: In Palo Alto, a feature based on James Franco short stories and  screening at the Tribeca Film Festival this week, first-time filmmaker Gia Coppola follows the lives of a group of cosseted, disaffected teens as they gambol from one soccer game, one hookup and one party to the next.

title: Moscow Court Rules Navalny Libeled Politician
description: MOSCOW  A Moscow court ruled on Tuesday that Aleksei A. Navalny, the prominent Russian opposition figure, had libeled a governing-party politician, and it fined him about $8,400. The ruling may lead to the reinstatement of a suspended sentence from a previous conviction, landing Mr. Navalny in prison as he awaits trial in a third case.

title: Obama Tours Site of Deadly Landslide
description: OSO, Wash.  One month after a landslide devastated this community, President Obama promised residents that the nation was still with them in grieving and rebuilding, and would be for the long haul.

title: Fighting Words Are Rarer Among British Doctors
description: Is a journey better than a battle?

title: Striving for School-Mom Perfection
description: My eyes nearly popped from my head as I walked into the brunch: of the 12 admitted preschool students parents, 3 of us had gone to the same high school, even pre-Kin Canada! I was delighted (this was home) and shocked (was this too home?). Mostly, though, I was thrown. At this inaugural parents reception Id hoped to be school mom extraordinaire. But seeing myself through the eyes of people Id known from my childhood, I questioned whether I could really ace parent involvement  something that didnt come naturally.

title: Biden Offers Strong Support to Ukraine
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. told members of Ukraines parliament that the United States was ready to support them in securing a unified Ukraine but warned against the cancer of corruption.

title: The Vice President Who Pulled a Gun on Truman
description: Whatever your views on gun rights and gun safety, this 1938 photograph of a joking vice president, John Nance Garner, thrusting two pistols into Missouri Senator Harry Trumans chest probably has some element of shock.

title: Why Economics Failed Us, in 297 Words
description: Thomas Sargents 2007 speech to Berkeley graduates is making the rounds on the Internet. Business Insider called it the greatest graduation speech ever. Ezra Klein over at Vox says it teaches everything you need to know about economics in 297 words.

title: Forty-Four Years of Earth Day
description: When environmentalists proclaimed the first Earth Day, on this date in 1970, the air was filled with doomsday predictions. At the initial rallies to mark the day, people warned of overpopulation, a denuded planet, hundreds of millions of people starving to death, a new Ice Age or the greenhouse effect. Many  though not all, obviously  of those forecasts were off.

title: No Comment Necessary: Vote for Me or Ill Shoot
description: Alabama State Representative Steve Hurst is fighting off a Republican primary challengewith a smoker shaped like a gun.

title: Wheelies: The Far East Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Today in Small Business: How A Bar Owner Uses Dynamic Pricing
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: April 22, 1970: The First Earth Day Draws Millions
description: On April 23, 1970, The Times published a front-page article, under a six-column headline, about the first Earth Day. The event drew millions of participants across the United States.

title: Allergan Bid Charts New Territory in Takeovers
description: The $45.6 billion unsolicited offer for Allergan by Valeant Pharmaceuticals and William A. Ackmans hedge fund is many things, including bold, novel and mega in all ways. It is a new twist in the struggle between companies and shareholder activists, and could ignite a furious battle not just for Allergan but over the laws governing takeovers and activism.

title: Orbitz Adds to Third-Party Booking Credit Card Options
description: And then there were Orbucks.

title: Times Minute | Biden Wraps Up Kiev Visit
description: As Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. wrapped up his visit to Ukraine, there were concerns over Russias intentions and whats next for the embattled country.

title: Times Minute | Biden Wraps Up Kiev Visit
description: In the Video

title: The Milk Punch Revival
description: Who says bartenders arent looking out for our health? Lately, a fair number seem dead earnest in making sure that patrons get their daily allowance of calcium.

title: Claims of Chlorine-Filled Bombs Overshadow Progress by Syria on Chemical Weapons
description: Nearly 90 percent of the chemicals in Syrias arsenal have now been exported and only a few shipments remain, international monitors reported Tuesday, but the progress was overshadowed by growing concerns that the Syrian military may be dropping bombs filled with chlorine, a common industrial compound not on the list of prohibited poisons.

title: Justices Skeptical of Aereos Business
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court signaled on Tuesday that it was struggling with two conflicting impulses in considering a request from television broadcasters to shut down Aereo, an Internet start-up they say threatens the economic viability of their businesses.

title: MCC Season Will Feature LaBute World Premiere
description: World premieres of new hot-button comedies by Neil LaBute and Robert Askins will bracket MCC Theaters 2014-15 season, the theater announced on Tuesday.

title: For start-ups looking to disrupt regulated industries, the new strategy is: Ask forgiveness, not permission.
description: Airbnb, the service to let people rent out their basement apartments and spare bedrooms to short-term visitors, is in court on Tuesday fighting an effort by New York State regulators to get a list of clients. The state thinks Airbnb may be violating New York Citys law on short-term rentals. Its part of a bunch of tangles that digital companies like Uber and Lyft are having with various state and local authorities as they try to disrupt highly regulated industries.

title: American Reporter Held by Ukraine Separatists
description: Last Updated, Wednesday, 3:11 p.m. | Foreign correspondents in the eastern Ukrainian town of Slovyansk, including my colleague Andrew Roth and Roland Oliphant of The Telegraph, report that one of their number, the Vice News reporter Simon Ostrovsky has been detained by pro-Russia separatists who seized power in recent days.

title: Delaware Is Building a Strategy to Lift Some Cities Economies
description: WILMINGTON, Del.  Hoping to generate interest in rejuvenating urban areas, Delawares governor wants to offer modest development grants for proposed projects in 15 districts around the state.

title: Paul Kingsnorth and the Art of Scything
description: http://youtu.be/-byfzBwHGAk

title: Fried Chicken, in Butter Form
description: The Restaurant Takeaway column is devoted to restaurant dishes you can make in your own kitchen, tested and tweaked for home cooks.

title: Arkansas Senator Has Unplanned Heart Surgery
description: WASHINGTON  John Boozman, the junior senator from Arkansas, had unplanned heart surgery on Tuesday morning and was recovering in an Arkansas hospital, his spokeswoman said.

title: Labor Case Filed by Injured Player in 70s Has Echoes Today
description: BELLEVILLE, Ill.  In a drill at a college football practice, Fred W. Rensing charged downfield, lowered his white helmet and drilled the punt returner in the chest for a thunderous hit. Rensing did not get up, and he never walked again.

title: The Pregnancy I Endured, and the One I Missed
description: It might have been the photo of the onesie with the due date circled. It might have been the confidential email I got. It might have been all the ultrasound photos, seemingly within days of one another, popping up on my Facebook feed. It might have been when one friend told me her obstetrician said she was a champ, or the day another friend talked about getting 78 pounds of maternity clothes from her best friend, some still unopened, or the latest email from the yoga place that I never go to anymore advertising the prenatal yoga class I never took. It might have been any of those things, or it might just have been the all-too-common effects of depression combined with sleep deprivation, but suddenly I broke down in tears.

title: Digital Public Library of America Marks a Year of Rapid Growth
description: The Digital Public Library of America, a project aimed at providing free online access to the nations cultural repositories, has tripled in size to more than seven million items from more than 1,300 institutions since it opened a year ago, the group has announced.

title: E.J. Burke
description: Mr. Burke, 58, is chairman of the Mortgage Bankers Association, a national organization based in Washington that represents the real estate finance industry. He is also a newly named co-president of KeyBanks community bank, specializing in commercial and private banking. KeyBank is based in Cleveland.

title: Senator Chuck Schumer leaped to the defense of Niagara Falls on Monday.
description: The possibility that some New York cities will get less federal dollars because of declining populations has prompted the New York senator to preserve a carve-out. Cities with at least 50,000 people are eligible for direct community development grants from the federal government, while smaller cities must rely on a pool of money administered by each state. Thats a big concern for Niagara Falls and Troy. (As well as Joplin, Mo.) Each city has slipped under the 50,000 mark, according to Census Bureau estimates, meaning greater competition for the money is likely.

title: A Craft-Beer Pub Crawl in the Kitchen of Japan
description: For a long time, drinking beer in Japan meant implicitly supporting one of the countrys four major producers: Asahi, Kirin, Suntory and Sapporo. But in the mid-1990s, when a law prohibiting the operation of small-scale breweries was abandoned, the door was opened for Japanese craft beer, known as ji-biru. Even today, there are only about 200 craft breweries in Japan, so finding domestic microbrews takes some effort. (For comparison, the United States had nearly 2,500 craft breweries in operation as of June 2013, according to the Brewers Association.) But increasingly, the place to taste these relatively rare  but deliciously well-crafted  beers is Osaka, Japans third-largest city.

title: Tribeca Film Festival Directors Most Memorable New York Minutes
description: It is often said that being in New York City feels like starring in your own movie. Maybe its because the Big Apple has set the scene for so many unforgettable films that we cant help but register its urban landscape as a backdrop for the story of our lives. Or maybe its that in this metropolis of eight million  with its screaming energy and melting pot of cultures  only in the movies events seem to happen on a daily basis. Here, 14 directors each of whom is showing a film at the Tribeca Film Festival, which continues through Sunday  recall New York moments when life imitated (their) art.

title: Mondays Boston Marathon provides yet more data illustrating that arbitrary numbers can serve as motivating goals.
description: George Wu, who is not only a keen student of the sport, but also a professor of behavioral science at the University of Chicago, spent Monday night downloading the official times of all 31,805 finishers. The distribution of finishing times follows the same pattern I highlighted in this mornings column, with a statistically improbable clumping of runners finishing just before their goals of 3, 3.5 or 4 hours, and an accompanying gap with far fewer runners finishing just minutes after their goals. Befitting Bostons reputation as a race for truly competitive runners, theres less evidence of such goals mattering for those aiming to beat 5 or 6 hours.

title: Hotel Review: Vander Urbani Resort in Ljubljana, Slovenia
description: Rates

title: Restaurant Report: The Coalhouse in Gower, Wales
description: Lets face it: Wales isnt exactly known as a culinary destination. In fact, the countrys diet  high in starches and meats  gets its fair share of criticism. But the Coalhouse on Oxwich Beach, which opened last summer on the gorgeous, windswept Gower Peninsula in South Wales, defies that reputation in a stylish setting.

title: One Plate, Two Plates, Small Plates All
description: Something happened to me recently at the Cleveland, a small restaurant downtown, that struck me as both unprecedented and inevitable. After a friend and I had finished a small opening snack, the server brought our appetizers and main courses.

title: Carcillo Offers the Rangers a Tougher Look
description: PHILADELPHIA  There were hints at the Rangers morning skate before Game 3 on Tuesday night against the Flyers that Daniel Carcillo might enter the lineup for the first time in this series.

title: Making the Argument: Student Winners From Our Editorial Contest
description: Update | Dec. 9, 2014: In late January or early February of 2015 we will be announcing our second annual Student Editorial contest.

title: Appeal Judges Hint at Doubts in Insider Case
description: Updated, 9:02 p.m. | Preet Bhararas perfect record, 80 insider trading convictions without a single defeat, is in jeopardy.

title: At the Auto Show, Vehicles With a New York Connection
description: Most of the spotlight at the New York auto show is, of course, on the new models on the floor of the Jacob K. Javits center. But a handful of classics are sitting in the centers front hall. Taken from the collection at the New York State Museum, which is in Albany, all four cars are associated with New York governors.

title: Bread-Making Classes, Small Bagels, Bread Knives and More
description: To Learn: Some Short Sessions for Long-Term Success

title: Rock in Rio Festival Coming to Las Vegas Next Year
description: Rock in Rio, the huge Brazilian music festival, is coming to the United States. It will make its American debut over two weekends in May 2015 in Las Vegas, according to Billboard.

title: Tribeca First-Timers: Brnice Marlohe
description: This is one in a series of posts on debuts at the Tribeca Film Festival.

title: Up for Discussion: How to Create an Advisory Board
description: At the most recent meeting of the She Owns It business group, the owners wrapped up their conversation on motivating employees and went on to discuss the mechanics of advisory boards.

title: Lytro Goes After Prosumer Photographers With New Camera
description: When the Lytro camera debuted in 2012, it was the talk of techies and photographers. What else would you expect from a camera that was developed in Silicon Valley and used both photography expertise and a lot of fancy programming code?

title: Slovyansk Buries 3 Killed in Unrest
description: Residents in the eastern Ukrainian city of Slovyansk buried three men killed in a gunfight at a roadblock on Easter Sunday.

title: Study Linking Illness and Salt Leaves Researchers Doubtful
description: The former commissioner of health for New York City, Dr. Thomas A. Farley, has raised anew questions about the health risks posed by salt in the American diet, citing a new  study from Britain showing significant declines in heart attack and stroke risk after health officials there limited the amount of salt in processed foods.

title: The Gun Report: April 22, 2014
description: Seven people in Houston have been convicted of running guns into Mexico, where they were used to fuel that nations drug wars. State police discovered the pipeline last October, when a trooper in Kingsville stopped a car containing 35 military-style rifles stashed in a hidden compartment. Seven of them were missing serial numbers. Drivers confessed to making 100 trips across the border in six months.

title: Accusations in Hollywood Sexual Abuse Case Broaden
description: LOS ANGELES  Michael Egan, who in a lawsuit last week accused the director Bryan Singer of drugging him and sexually abusing him, has filed separate suits making similar accusations of forced sex and drug use against three entertainment executives: Garth Ancier, Gary W. Goddard and David A. Neuman.

title: Beneath the Surface of Chinas Great Urban Rush
description: At The New York Times Cities for Tomorrow event today, I led a discussion of some big social and environmental issues that lie beneath the surface of Chinas urban rush.

title: Lax Oversight Cited as Factor in Deadly Blast at Texas Plant
description: DALLAS  Federal investigators have determined that a lack of oversight and regulations at the local, state and federal levels contributed to the deadly fertilizer plant explosion that devastated a rural Texas town last year.

title: Barchetta, a New Showcase for Italian Seafood, Opens
description: Headliner

title: Do You Want a Girl Toy or a Boy Toy? McDonalds Says Workers Wont Ask
description: I thought it was just me.

title: Testing the Limits of Inside Information Cases
description: Much like the game of telephone, the final recipient of inside information may know little about who started the process or how many steps it took before arriving. When prosecutors want to pursue charges against the recipients of confidential information  the tippees  the issue is often how far down the chain they can go before they can no longer prove a violation.
