description: LOS ALAMITOS, Calif.  On a recent morning, as the sun rose over the edge of the grandstand, the trainer of the expected Kentucky Derby favorite leaned against a railing as he waited for his prized colt to emerge for his daily gallop.

title: Pfizer Move for AstraZeneca Seen
description: Pfizer is close to publicly unveiling its interest in acquiring AstraZeneca of Britain, a person briefed on the matter said on Sunday, in what would be one of the biggest deals among drug makers.

title: Yanks Have Only Praise for Cano Before His First Return
description: In the course of his 20-year career, Yankees shortstop Derek Jeter has seen many players come and go. He is no longer surprised at the business of baseball.

title: Chef Seeks to Buy Contessa Food Business
description: Ina Garten, the celebrity chef known as the Barefoot Contessa, is hoping to buy the frozen food business that carries her name and brand from Contessa Premium Foods, an unaffiliated food company.

title: Nets Fizzle Late, Allowing Raptors to Tie Series
description: Kevin Garnett made a pair of free throws with 4 minutes 58 seconds left in Sunday nights game. He pumped his fist, and the fans in the sellout crowd erupted as the Nets inched to a precious 1-point lead over the Toronto Raptors.

title: For 2 Teenagers Murders, Much Sorrow, Few Answers and No Protests
description: After the daylight shooting of a 16-year-old on a residential block in East Flatbush, Brooklyn, there were no major rallies. No public outcry from local politicians.

title: Photo Replay: April 21-27
description: Working in sync, both intentionally and by chance.

title: Game of Thrones Recap: Whispers, Threats and Baby Blues
description: Here be spoilers, but the dragons have gone missing.

title: Faithful in New York City Recall Impact of 2 Popes on Their Personal Journeys
description: As churchgoers came and went at St. Stanislaus Kostka Roman Catholic Church in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, early on Sunday morning, a woman stood outside and extended her arms as if inviting an embrace.

title: Michael Heisley, Who Rebuilt N.B.A.s Grizzlies, Dies at 77
description: Michael Heisley, the billionaire financier who bought the N.B.A.s floundering Vancouver Grizzlies in April 2000 and soon moved them to Memphis, where he revitalized the franchise, died on Saturday in Illinois. He was 77.

title: Charter and Comcast to End Fight Over Time Warner Cable
description: When Charter Communications began pursuing Time Warner Cable last year, its goal was to become the countrys second-largest cable operator.

title: Paul Robeson Jr., Activist and Author, Dies at 86
description: Paul Robeson Jr., who worked to preserve the legacy of his father, the actor, singer and civil rights advocate, since his death almost four decades ago, died on Saturday in Jersey City. He was 86.

title: String of Deadly Storms Hits Across Midwest and South
description: ATLANTA  A violent weather system lashed the Midwest and South with tornadoes on Sunday, killing at least nine people, according to some reports, and leaving vast areas of destruction. Forecasters warned that additional severe storms were likely on Monday.

title: $1.2 Billion Bid for Australian Food Company Is Rejected
description: HONG KONG  Goodman Fielder, one of Australias biggest consumer food products companies, said on Monday that it had rebuffed a takeover bid by Singapores Wilmar International and Hong Kongs First Pacific Company.

title: After 7-Year Makeover, Bronx Links of Legend Try to Reclaim the Past
description: When William Larkin, a hip-hop producer-turned-golf pro, accepted the position of general manager of the Van Cortlandt Park Golf Course in the North Bronx in 2007, it was because he thought the course could live up to its history.

title: North Korean Peace Group Insults South Korean Leader
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Koreas committee for peaceful reunification with South Korea, an official mouthpiece, has not been espousing peace lately, and its mouth has turned foul.

title: Comme des Garons Creates a Fragrance with Two Art-World Heavy-Hitters
description: Comme des Garons is back with another fragrance collaboration  and this time, it involves two of the heaviest hitters in the art world. In honor of Serpentine Galleries new Serpentine Sackler space designed by Zaha Hadid, the fashion label has partnered with the London institution on a new fragrance with a bottle and packaging designed by the artist Tracey Emin. The release, simply called Serpentine, is the first in an ongoing artist commission project for the Comme des Garons scent line. A blend of iris leaf, juniper wood and nutmeg, the scent reflects Serpentines location amongst the green grass and fresh flowers at Kensington Gardens.

title: Pop Lighting
description: Trash was the inspiration for Alvaro Cataln de Ocns vibrant line of pendant lamps, now on display at the Design Museum in London as part of its Designs of the Year exhibition. In 2011, while working on a project to combat pollution in Colombia, the Spanish industrial designer came up with the PET collection, its title a playful abbreviation of the polyethylene terephthalate bottles that contain soft drinks and water. He then hired Bogot artisans to weave colored fibers into the repurposed bottles.

title: A Stroke You Must Have
description: My father-in-law had been fishing from rowboats without incident since early childhood. But in August 1970, at age 66, alone on a Minnesota lake, he apparently fell out of the boat and drowned. He couldnt swim a stroke, yet never wore a life jacket.

title: Word of the Day | obtuse
description: obtuse\b-ts, b-, -tys\ adjective

title: N.F.L. Developmental League Envisioned
description: The N.F.L.s new director of football operations, Troy Vincent, said he could foresee a developmental league in the future, an eighth official on the field for games and the use of tablets by coaches on the sidelines to call plays.

title: Times Minute | Clippers Against Racism
description: In the Video

title: Times Minute | Clippers Against Racism
description: A fashion and political statement from the Los Angeles Clippers. Also on the Minute, two months of violence in Venezuela, and justices weigh if police can search your cellphone without a warrant.

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 46
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: Whats On Monday
description: 1 P.M. (Showtime 2) MARGOT AT THE WEDDING (2007) In this cutting comedy from Noah Baumbach two sisters  Margot (Nicole Kidman, above left, with Jennifer Jason Leigh), an accomplished novelist, and the neurotic, needy Pauline (Ms. Leigh)  come together at their family home on Long Island for Paulines wedding to the unimpressive Malcolm (Jack Black). The result, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times, is a pileup of exposed secrets, buried lies and moral failures expressed in a cacophony of screams, tears and furious whispers and a film that is frequently brilliant, finally baffling.

title: Anthony Marriott, Author of No Sex Please, Were British, Dies at 83
description: Anthony Marriott, a onetime actor who hit the jackpot as a playwright when he plugged into the British penchant for loopiness and naughty bits, co-writing a farce that became the longest-running comedy in the history of theater in England, died in London on April 17. He was 83.

title: Pitch Bounces Yankees Way, Allowing the Run That Beats the Angels
description: The pitch that sent the Yankees to a 3-2 win on Sunday against the Los Angeles Angels struck the ground several inches short of home plate and caromed toward the backstop. Angels reliever Nick Maronde had attempted a breaking ball in a duel against Brian McCann in the eighth inning of a tie game. It was a pitch that clearly did not break enough, or did not even have enough time to break at all.

title: India Election Digest: April 28
description: What you need to know on Monday about Indias elections: In a Muslim neighborhood in Gujarat, Bharatiya Janata Party members leave out any mention of Narendra Modi in their speeches; the top aide to Mr. Modi denies trying to appeal to the Hindu vote; and Priyanka Gandhis more visible role may mean shes being groomed for something larger in the Indian National Congress party.

title: Jet Hunt Focus Shifts From Air to Under Sea
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Prime Minister Tony Abbott of Australia announced on Monday an end to the search by air for debris from Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, but he said the underwater search would be intensified and expanded.

title: Video Notebook: Raptors Tie Series, 2-2
description: Kevin Garnett talks about how the Toronto Raptors were able to win Game 4 of the playoff series against the Nets.

title: Corrections: April 28, 2014
description: NEW YORK

title: Raptors Kyle Lowry Unfazed by Injury or Height Disadvantage
description: Jonas Valanciunas was standing in the Toronto Raptors locker room after Sundays game, talking to reporters, when a voice was heard from behind a wall of microphones and cameras.

title: Aerial Video Showing Widespread Destruction Left By Deadly Tornadoes
description: Updated, 1:44 p.m. | At least 15 people were killed after tornadoes ripped through parts of central Arkansas, Oklahoma, Kansas, Missouri and Iowa on Sunday, with weather officials warning more severe weather is expected on Monday.

title: Amid Protests, Taiwan to Halt Work on Nuclear Plant
description: Taiwan will halt the construction of a nuclear power plant that had met with public opposition and raised concerns about safety, the governing party has announced.

title: Storms Carve Deadly Path Through South and Midwest
description: VILONIA, Ark.  Ryan Henry stood outside his brick home and saw the tornado nearing his neighborhood, razing much of this small city in central Arkansas as it went. He dashed inside, grabbed a bedspread and headed for the bathroom, where his three daughters were already in the tub. He placed his body over the girls  twin 9-year-olds and an 8-year-old  and waited.

title: Test Yourself | E.L.L. Practice, April 28, 2014
description: April 29 is International Dance Day. Celebrate by viewing the slide show above, reading the related article, trying our quiz below and checking out our related teaching suggestions.

title: Results Are Promising in Clinical Trial of Dengue Fever Vaccine
description: The French pharmaceutical company Sanofi said on Monday that its experimental vaccine for dengue fever had succeeded in its first late-stage clinical trial. The results could help pave the way for the introduction of the first vaccine to prevent a disease that afflicts an estimated 50 million to 100 million people a year.

title: American Held in North Korea Traveled Solo, Tour Firm Says
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A 24-year-old American who was detained in North Korea this month traveled there alone and left no contact information for his family, according to the New Jersey-based travel company that arranged his trip.

title: Meda Again Rejects Takeover Bid by Mylan
description: LONDON  The Swedish drug maker Meda said on Monday that it had rejected an increased takeover offer from the generic pharmaceutical company Mylan.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Los Angeles Clippers Turn Shirts Inside Out in Protest
description: In With Uproar Around Sterling, Clippers Take the Court, John Branch reports on the controversy surrounding the teams owner.

title: U.S. Expands Sanctions, Adding Holdings of Russians in Putins Financial Circle
description: WASHINGTON  The United States added new sanctions against Russia on Monday, expanding the list of targets but concentrating on the myriad holdings of four billionaires viewed as part of President Vladimir V. Putins financial circle.

title: New Space and New Conversations for I.C.P.
description: The International Center of Photography recently announced that it would be leaving its museum space on Sixth Avenue in Midtown Manhattan at the end of this year. It has not yet disclosed plans for temporary or permanent exhibition space. Mark Lubell, the former director of Magnum Photos, became executive director of ICP in November 2013. He spoke with James Estrin about the future of I.C.P. on Friday. The conversation has been edited.

title: Do You Take More Risks When You Are Around Your Friends?
description: Weve all been warned about the dangers of peer pressure.

title: Cinven to Take Stake in Norwegian Software Firm Visma
description: LONDON  The private equity firm Cinven said on Monday that it had agreed to take a 31.3 percent stake in the Norwegian software company Visma, in a deal that values Visma at about $3.5 billion.

title: A Mayors View, #Nofilter
description: Eric M. Garcetti, the mayor of Los Angeles, turned his election campaigns grip-and-grin Instagram feed into a personal account, sharing his own view of the city he grew up in and now governs.

title: Behind the Cover Story: Charles Siebert on the Fight for Animal Personhood
description: Charles Siebert wrote this weeks cover story about the possibility of animals gaining some of the same legal rights that people enjoy. Siebert, a contributing writer for the magazine, is the author of The Wauchula Woods Accord.

title: BG Says Its Chief Executive Quits, Citing Personal Reasons
description: LONDON  The British oil and gas company BG said on Monday that its chief executive, Chris Finlayson, was resigning with immediate effect, for personal reasons, and confirmed that its production was likely to decline this year.

title: Saving Chinas Elephants
description: When it comes to cute and cuddly marketing mascots, its hard to compete with the giant panda  especially when you have rough, saggy skin, weigh four tons and occasionally stomp to death your admirers. That hasnt stopped officials and entrepreneurs in the southwestern Chinese province of Yunnan from embracing the Asian elephant as a tourist attraction and merchandising bonanza. Jinghong, the capital of Xishuangbanna Prefecture, is flecked with dancing, prancing elephant statues. Each day, thousands of visitors crowd into a local nature preserve, where they hope to spot a real, live creature although they are invariably disappointed and end up going home with a stuffed, plush facsimile.

title: New York Today: Crime and Punishment
description: Good morning on this bright Monday.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: Trying to Shield Endangered Animals From Chinas Appetites
description: Conservationists have praised a recent decision by Chinas legislature to jail people who eat protected wild animals as an important step, but they note loopholes in other legal provisions that could undercut its effectiveness.

title: Editorial Contest Winner | Cutting It Short
description: We are honoring each of the Top 10 winners of our Student Editorial Contest by publishing an essay a day, in the order of submission. You can find them all here.

title: Why the Democrats Turnout Problem Is Worst in North Carolina
description: Senator Kay Hagan of North Carolina seems as if she should be part of the firewall in the Democrats bid to retain the Senate, considering that incumbents tend to win re-election in states that are competitive in presidential elections.

title: British Library Opens Renovated Newspaper Collection
description: LONDON  An English-language newspaper published in 1620 in Amsterdam and the scandal-hit News of the World are just some of the journals to be made available to the public as part of an overhaul of the British Librarys newspaper collection.

title: Thinking of Wine as Food With Eric Asimov
description: Eric Asimov, the chief wine critic at The Times, writes three columns: The Pour, Wines of The Times and the recently started Wine School, in which he chooses one type of wine a month and discusses it with readers online. He came to The Times in 1984, joining the national desk as a copy editor, and has edited and written for the Living, Styles, Weekend and Dining sections. He wrote the $25 and Under reviews of inexpensive restaurants from 1992 to 2004, when he became the chief wine critic.

title: When Amazon Collects Sales Tax, Some Shoppers Head Elsewhere
description: For years, Amazon watchers  especially Amazons competitors and opponents  have wondered just how much the company has benefited from not having to collect sales tax on most of its transactions. Now, three economists appear to have answered the question with a new study: In states that recently forced the online behemoth to begin collecting those taxes, Amazons sales have fallen sharply.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | April 28, 2014
description: Update: April 29

title: Arle Capital to Buy Supplier of Plastic Bank Notes
description: LONDON  The private equity firm Arle Capital Partners said on Monday that it had agreed to acquire the Innovia Group, a company set to supply materials for Britains new plastic bank notes.

title: Uproar in Egypt After Judge Sentences More Than 680 to Death
description: EDWA, Egypt  Egyptian courts on Monday delivered devastating new blows to both the Islamist and liberal opponents of the new military-backed government.

title: Macroeconomics and Class Warfare
description: Back when Obama was proposing a spending plan to boost the economy, and some of us were pleading for a bigger plan, it was common to hear people from both the right and the crazy center declaring that it was all a ruse, an attempt to smuggle in liberal priorities under the guise of fiscal stimulus. This was, as it happens, completely false  and in the case of the right-wingers, a case of projection. After all, Obama didnt try to sell permanent spending increases as short-run stimulus  but Bush did exactly that when pushing his tax cuts.

title: Alibaba Buys Stake in Chinese Web TV Company for $1.2 Billion
description: HONG KONG  Alibaba and Yunfeng Capital, a private equity company controlled by Alibabas founder, Jack Ma, agreed to acquire a combined 18.5 percent stake in Youku Tudou, which broadcasts a series of popular television programs and other videos over the Internet.

title: Mad Men Recap: The Dark Knight Returns
description: Season 7, Episode 3O.K.

title: A Midsummer Is Headed for China
description: Tim Robbins and the Actors Gang, a Los Angeles ensemble theater troupe, will bring their production of A Midsummer Nights Dream to audiences in China this summer. Mr. Robbins, the actor who has served as the companys artistic director for more than three decades, will direct the performances scheduled to take place June 10 to 15 at the National Center for the Performing Arts in Beijing as part of its Shakespeare festival and June 19-21 at the Zendai Himalayas Art Center in Shanghai.

title: Annual Profit Falls 52 Percent for Angry Birds Maker Rovio
description: LONDON  All is not well in the land of Angry Birds.

title: France Stalls G.E.s Alstom Bid
description: The French government on Sunday sought to discourage General Electrics bid for Alstom, one of the largest industrial companies in France, warning that economic sovereignty was at stake, David Jolly writes in DealBook. G.E. is looking to buy Alstoms energy business, and Frances economic minister had been scheduled to meet on Sunday with Jeffrey R. Immelt, the chief executive of G.E.

title: A Monetary Puzzle
description: OK, color me puzzled. Ive seen a number of people touting this Bank of England paper (pdf) on how banks create money as offering some kind of radical new way of looking at the economy. And it is a good piece. But it doesnt seem, in any important way, to be at odds with what Tobin wrote 50 years ago (pdf)  indeed, the BoE paper cites Tobin extensively. And I have always thought of money in Tobinesque terms, even if I sometimes use shorthand descriptions that can be misread if you take them out of context; the same is true of many economists.

title: Sina Apologizes, Twice, for Posting Porn
description: Sina Corporation, owner of one of Chinas most visited websites, is sorry. Very sorry. So sorry, in fact, that it has apologized not once but twice to its readers and the national antipornography office, which last week found that lewd material had made its way onto the Sina site.

title: Doing the Math of a Bank of America Settlement
description: The governments litigators have already reached several multibillion-dollar mortgage settlements with big banks. But these deals have many moving parts and can be hard to evaluate.

title: Revenues at the Top 100 Law Firms Rose 5.4% Last Year
description: Updated, 3:29 p.m. |

title: How Verified Commenters Earn Their Status at The Times, and Why
description: Times readers, especially those who comment frequently on articles, often ask me to explain how members of that special class known as verified commenters get their stripes (or their check marks, to be more precise). The comments of these 478 readers are posted without going through the Timess moderators  about a dozen people who read comments and decide whether they should be posted. The idea is to expedite the process of getting at least some comments posted, which also lowers the overall number of comments that need moderation in advance.Some dont like it. Michael Simmons, for one, calls it unfair and wrong. In a comment on my recent Sunday column, he wrote: This has created a hierarchy of commenters wherein the same handful of readers have their comments posted before everyone else  sometimes many hours before everyone else can be vetted. This has led to abuse of the comments section, including verified commenters wishing readers happy holidays on occasion. Im tired of reading the same commenters at the top of the Readers Picks by virtue of the fact that they were able to post before everyone else. This system is undemocratic.

title: Wounded Mayor Is Both Colorful and Powerful, Loved and Loathed
description: KHARKIV, Ukraine  Fed up with the lifeless and unflattering photographs taken of him by press photographers, Gennady A. Kernes, the mayor of Kharkiv, decided to take matters into his own hands.

title: Charges in Libor Case for 3 From Barclays
description: Regulators in Britain said on Monday that they had begun criminal proceedings against three additional former Barclays employees suspected in the manipulation of a global benchmark interest rate.

title: Managing Partner of Leonard Green to Step Down
description: One of the three managing partners of Leonard Green & Partners, a private equity firm based in Los Angeles, plans to step down from that role.

title: Fans Paint U.S. Shows as Friendly to the Party
description: Chinese fans of American TV shows that government censors recently ordered removed from video websites have put their frustrations to creative use, writing parody descriptions of shows they hope to save from the ax by incorporating Communist Party-friendly phrases.

title: Bank of America Finds a Mistake: $4 Billion Less Capital
description: Updated, 9:03 p.m. | Bank of America disclosed on Monday that it had made a significant error in the way it calculates a crucial measure of its financial health, suffering another blow to its effort to shake its troubled history.

title: All the Rage | Fly Like Rich People
description: Air travel is going the way of Uber. EvoLux Transportation, a new helicopter service, will offer ride-share options and on-call private flights from an array of operators. The program is starting in New York and Miami this month, with other American cities to be added in the fall. Also in the works is FlyJets, through which customers with a little tech savvy and a lot of cash will be able to bid on private jet routes, Priceline-style, or book a standard rate immediately without all the auction fuss. In other flight news, JetBlue, the most democratic of airlines, is getting in on the cabin caste system. Starting in June, flights between J.F.K. and LAX will feature first-class seats and amenities, from lie-flat beds to Saxon & Parole-curated tapas.

title: Grimm, Staten Island Lawmaker, Is Charged With Fraud
description: For more than two years, federal investigators delved into the background of Representative Michael G. Grimm, a Republican from Staten Island now in his second term. They looked into his campaign finances, and examined the potential mob ties of one business associate and the illegal doings of another.

title: Ads Remind Desert Residents Water Doesnt Grow on Trees
description: An effort to promote water conservation among people who live and work in Southern Nevada offers a practical perspective rather than, say, the jocular suggestion during the 1960s to save water, shower with a friend.

title: Forest Labs to Buy Furiex Pharmaceuticals
description: The wave of deal-making in the drug industry continued on Monday when Forest Laboratories agreed to acquire Furiex Pharmaceuticals for up to $1.46 billion.

title: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott
description: Stuart Elliott, the advertising columnist, answers questions from readers each week. Questions can be sent to stuarte@nytimes.com.

title: Accounts and People of Note in the Advertising Industry
description: Bonfire Labs, San Francisco, hired three employees. They are John Hunt, producer; Judy Leung, designer; and Tim Pries, executive producer.

title: Cannes Film Festival Announces Feature Film Jury
description: The director Sofia Coppola and the actor Willem Dafoe will be among the nine feature-film jurors at the 67th annual Cannes Film Festival, the festival announced on Monday. The New Zealand director Jane Campion will preside over the jury, which will also include the actresses Carole Bouquet of France, Leila Hatami of Iran, and Jeon Do-yeon of South Korea; the Mexican actor and director Gael Garca Bernal; the Chinese director Jia Zhangke and the Danish director Nicolas Winding Refn. The festival runs May 14 to May 25. Last years jury awarded the Palme dOr to Blue Is the Warmest Color, directed by Abdellatif Kechiche, and Inside Llewyn Davis, directed by Joel and Ethan Coen, won the second honor, the Grand Prix.

title: Obama Gives Condolences to Storm Victims
description: President Obama offered his condolences to the families of victims after a series of tornadoes caused deaths and widespread destruction in the Midwest and the South on Sunday.

title: The Indictment Against Congressman Michael G. Grimm of Staten Island
description: The indictment against Mr. Grimm comes after a more than two-year investigation.

title: Daily Report: New York Tech Has a Lot of Money, but No Big Winner
description: Predicting that your city will be the next Silicon Valley is simple. But actually making it the next Silicon Valley is something else entirely  as New York is slowly finding out, reports Jenna Wortham on Monday.

title: U.S. Levies New Sanctions on Russia
description: In Manila, President Obama said new sanctions against Russian individuals and companies were the next stage in a calibrated effort to change President Vladimir V. Putins behavior in Ukraine.

title: Swiss Chard and Rhubarb Dress Up Sausage for Spring
description: Whats for Dinner? answers that universal question, offering recipes for simple, relatively quick dishes that use ingredients you can pick up on the way home.

title: Lawmakers Return to Congress With Modest Agenda
description: WASHINGTON  When members of Congress are campaigning for re-election in their districts, they are calling for legislation to address big problems with immigration, taxes, health care, worker pay, climate change and the countrys aging infrastructure. But as they return to Washington on Monday after a two-week break, there is almost no prospect for new legislation in those areas until after Election Day.

title: India and Pakistan Under Prime Minister Singh
description: NEW DELHI As Indian politicians ramp up their campaign efforts, one prominent party leader has been conspicuously missing this election season: Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, the leader of India for the past 10 years.

title: Another Season of Dynasty for Voters
description: Maybe its time for Americans to admit that we like the familiar faces and names of politicians from famous families.

title: George Washingtons Weakness: His Teeth
description: When George Washington opened his mouth 225 years ago this Wednesday at New Yorks Federal Hall to take the oath as the first president of the United States, he wore awkward-fitting, painful, face-disfiguring dentures. For years, he had suffered from dental problems; that morning he had swollen, burning gums and only a single original tooth in his mouth. He wore this particular set of dentures during the last nine years of his life. They clacked and creaked open and shut on tight wire springs.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird Finally Becoming an E-Book
description: The author Harper Lee has agreed to release her Pulitzer Prize-winning novel, To Kill a Mockingbird  one of only a few remaining classics currently available only in print  as an e-book on July 8, HarperCollins Publishers has announced.

title: Museum Makes Wide Collection of Images Available Online
description: The American Museum of Natural History in New York will make thousands of images accessible to the public that were previously only viewable at its research library.

title: N U M + B E R = P L A Y
description: This weeks challenges were suggested by the mathematician Bill Gosper, the brilliant and largely self-taught computer programmer and researcher considered by many to be a modern-day Ramanujan. I asked Mr. Gosper about this comparison and he responded by email with his usual humility:

title: Search for Flight 370 Enters New Phase
description: Prime Minister Tony Abbott of Australia said that the chance of finding floating debris from Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 was highly unlikely and that the search would shift to the ocean floor.

title: The Illogic of Active Trading
description: Individual investors have been busy the last few months. TD Ameritrade saw a 30 percent jump in daily trading volume compared with the same period last year. Other discount brokers reported a similar increase in daily trading volume.

title: Paul Simon and Edie Brickell in Court Over Domestic Dispute
description: The singer-songwriters Paul Simon and Edie Brickell held hands in a Connecticut courtroom on Monday and told a judge they were not a threat to each other, after they were both arrested over the weekend in a domestic dispute.

title: Food Curated: One Tough Cookie
description: More than nine years ago, Gail Dosik started One Tough Cookie, a specialty decorated-cookie company, in her West Village kitchen.

title: Video: One Tough Cookie
description: Liza de Guia is a video journalist whose blog, Food. Curated., profiles people who produce interesting food in New York and beyond.

title: In Store | With a New Collection and Installation, Dior Homme Tweaks Its Image
description: There is a certain kind of man  often barely out of boyhood  who studies Dior Homme like a holy text, pointedly adhering to the strict minimalism, dark palettes and monastic attention to detail of the collections by the designer Kris Van Assche. These gents  who thronged the brands Autumn presentation in SoHo last Thursday in sunglasses and complicated ties, with a dedication to black that would be the envy of the Nights Watch from Game of Thrones  should take note: Van Assche was wearing blue jeans. Not black. Blue.

title: In Our Pages: April 29
description: 1939: Hitler Says No to Peace Appeal

title: I.P.O. Linked to Football Player Opens for Trading
description: Updated, 2:38 p.m. | The football star Vernon Davis has arrived on Wall Street.

title: Sit-Down Comic Takes His Place as Anchorman
description: John Oliver, a graduate of The Daily Show With Jon Stewart, didnt exactly break the mold when he rolled out his new show, Last Week Tonight, late on Sunday on HBO; he just tugged at it a bit. If Mr. Stewarts current-events-based comedy is the equivalent of the evening news, Mr. Oliver gave us a satirical All Things Considered.

title: I Wish People Had More Respect
Russia and Iran Reported in Talks on Energy Deal Worth Billions
description: The Obama administrations strategy of punishing Russia with economic sanctions over the Ukraine crisis encountered a new complication on Monday with word that the Russians are negotiating an $8 billion to $10 billion energy deal with Iran, another country ostracized by American-led sanctions, which partly depend on Moscows cooperation to be effective.

title: Why Pfizer Needs to Do More to Win AstraZeneca
description: Pfizer will need to pile on more pressure if it wants to buy AstraZeneca. Pfizer has confirmed that it made a $99 billion cash-and-stock approach in January for AstraZeneca, its British rival, and is now renewing its suit. AstraZenecas chief executive, Pascal Soriot, may ultimately struggle to resist a takeover, but he ought to be able to extract a better proposal.

title: Jack Ramsay, Who Led Blazers to 1977 N.B.A. Title, Dies at 89
description: Jack Ramsay, the Hall of Fame coach who took the Portland Trail Blazers to their only N.B.A. championship and who was regarded as one of pro basketballs keenest coaching minds, died on Monday in Naples, Fla. He was 89.

title: Pear Smoothie With Spinach, Celery and Ginger
description: I have to admit, this began as a clean out the refrigerator and (aging) fruit bowl smoothie. I salvaged some spinach that had seen better days and finally used up the last of the pears Id bought a few weeks ago for another set of recipe tests. I went out to my garden and grabbed some bolting arugula and some mint. Ive been drinking kefir, a fermented milk product much like yogurt but thinner and tangier, so that went in, giving the smoothie a pleasantly acidic edge. The two ingredients that the drink needs in order for it to taste like something other than a bland green drink are the half banana and the ginger. If you let your bananas ripen completely, then freeze them, theyll contribute not only flavor, sweetness and texture but also ice to your smoothies.

title: Blueberry Kefir Smoothie With Greens
description: This green smoothie is really more blue than green, as the color of the blueberries predominates. . But the greens are there, so in my mind its still a green drink. Half a banana wasnt quite enough to punch up the flavor of the drink, but I found that a whole banana did the trick. I used a baby greens mix that included baby kale, chard (red and green), and spinach.

title: Green Smoothie With Pineapple, Arugula, Greens and Cashews
description: Pineapple can stand alone as a fruit to combine with greens in a smoothie. No bananas are required. I did add a piece of ginger to this smoothie and loved the way it pumped up the flavor. I didnt use any dairy in this one, just orange juice. And I found that it required no additional sweetener, though you could add a teaspoon of agave nectar or honey if you wish. Its best to use the pungent, feathery wild arugula for this. I used a baby greens mix that included kale, chard and spinach.

title: Pineapple-Basil Smoothie
description: Im not sure that I would order this just based on the name. But believe me, youll be pleased by this herbal concoction. Pineapple has so much sweetness and flavor on its own, and it marries well with the peppery, anisy basil. Very little else is required (no banana in this smoothie). I like to use kefir, but yogurt will work too. Pistachios and chia seeds bulk up the drink nicely, and the pistachios contribute to the pale green color.

title: Green Smoothie With Cucumber and Cumin
description: This smoothie, the only savory drink in this weeks Recipes for Health, is a bit like an Indian lassi, with a little heat from the pinch of cayenne, and some lovely spice. I used a mix of baby greens  chard, baby kale and spinach, as well as parsley and mint. It makes for a filling lunch.

title: Hey, Whiny Modern Parents, Tell Us What You Love About the Gig
description: Heres one for us to run with from  a commenter on last weeks open thread,  Lee Leander:

title: Why Ron Paul Supporters Were Removed from G.O.P. Leadership in Iowa
description: The ouster of Ron Pauls backers from Iowas Republican Party leadership this weekend might help the state party raise money.

title: Optimism as Detroit Makes Pacts on Finances
description: DETROIT  As the list of deals being struck by this city grows, the chances of a relatively smooth, swift exit from bankruptcy do, too, city officials say. On Monday, Detroit added tentative agreements with some of its unions to pacts already reached with retiree groups, pension funds and several financial creditors, moving the city closer to a plan that would allow it to emerge from bankruptcy by mid-October.

title: N.B.A. Announcement on Clippers Owner to Come Tuesday
description: The N.B.A. will make an announcement Tuesday about its investigation of the Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling, the league said in a statement Monday. League officials will hold a news conference in New York at 2 p.m. Eastern time.

title: A Websites Chief Plays Down Chinas Curb on American Shows
description: BEIJING  After recent Chinese government orders to remove four popular American television shows from websites, the chief executive of one company played down the moves impact on the industry, even as news emerged that the state broadcaster planned to show one sitcom.

title: Jay Z and Beyonc to Tour North America This Summer
description: Most married couples and families hope to get away in the coming months for a calm and quiet summer vacation, but Beyonc and Jay Z are, safe to say, not a typical married couple. On Monday, they officially announced their summer plans: a joint North American stadium tour called On the Run.

title: As His Tenure Winds Down, Obama Turns Focus to Executive Branch
description: WASHINGTON  John Podesta got a brief burst of attention from his hiring in a White House shake-up, Sylvia Mathews Burwell will be in sharp focus in coming confirmation hearings to be health and human services secretary and the cameras loved Jacob J. Lew, the Treasury secretary, during the debt-ceiling wars.

title: Israel Appears to Raise New Peace Talks Issue With U.S.
description: JERUSALEM  Days after suspending American-brokered Middle East peace talks because of a reconciliation pact reached between the Palestine Liberation Organization and its rival Hamas, the Islamic militant group, Israel on Monday raised a new source of potential tension with the United States over Washingtons approach to the unity government planned by the Palestinians.

title: Times Minute | What Sanctions Mean
description: Peter Baker, The Timess White House correspondent, on what this latest round of sanctions targeting Russia means.

title: Times Minute | What Sanctions Mean
description: In the Video

title: In Fashion | How Stella Got Her Sheep Back
description: The designer continues her eco-quest by sourcing wool from animals that lightly graze the Patagonian farmlands.

title: Didnt Read Those Terms of Service? Heres What You Agreed to Give Up
description: On Twitter, Facebook and other sites that promote sharing of content, users can typically choose whether they want to post their updates publicly to everyone or carefully select their audience.

title: Is It Time to Broaden the Definition of Insider Trading?
description: William A. Ackman and Valeant Pharmaceuticals hostile bid for Allergen is giving the public a close look at how nonpublic information can be used without breaking insider trading rules.

title: Rhoden: Swift and Severe Punishment for Sterling
description: The N.B.A. commissioner and the fans are best in position to punish Donald Sterling, should the racist comments on a tape recorder prove to be from the Clippers owner, says William C. Rhoden.

title: Living Symphonies
description: Living Symphonies is a sound installation which grows in the same way as a forest ecosystem. Portraying the thriving activity of the forests wildlife, plants and atmospheric conditions, it creates a never-ending symphony heard amongst the forest itself.

title: Science Events: Unusual Vision and D.I.Y. Neuroscience
description: May events at the intersection of art and science.

title: Video: Swift and Severe Punishment for Sterling
description: The new N.B.A. commissioner, Adam Silver, and the fans are best in position to punish Donald Sterling, should the racist comments on a tape recorder prove to be from the Clippers owner.

title: Congressman Shown on Video Kissing Aide Wont Seek Re-election
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Vance McAllister, Republican of Louisiana, who was caught on camera kissing a female staff member who was not his wife, will not seek re-election to the seat he has held for only five months, his office said on Monday.

title: Even a Few Pills Can Put a Dent in the Malaria Rate
description: A new way to prevent malaria in areas where it waxes and wanes with the weather appears to be working in West Africa, the medical aid organization Doctors Without Borders said last week.

title: Iraqs Ailing President Talabani Is Shown Casting a Vote
description: Video of a rare appearance of the ailing president of Iraq, Jalal Talabani, has surfaced on social media pages, just as some voting gets underway for the first parliamentary elections since the United States withdrawal from Iraq in 2011.

title: Justices to Weigh Finance Law as It Was Applied to Little Fish
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to decide whether a Florida fisherman ran afoul of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, a federal law aimed primarily at white-collar crime, by throwing three undersized red grouper back into the Gulf of Mexico.

title: A Place for Yoga in the Great Smoky Mountains of Tennessee
description: A beloved mountainside retreat branches out with a woodsy new spa.

title: Middle Seat Nightmare, Stuck Between Mother and Misbehavior
description: IVE been a business traveler for the past 25 years. Now, with my own company, Kurtz-Ahlers and Associates, Im traveling more than I ever have. Im in the luxury travel business and meet with people all over the world. I love what I do, but whether I like business travel is debatable.

title: Something to Sing About, Finally, at Airport Security
description: OOPS, Ive lost still another Victorinox Swiss Army Classic pocketknife  the keychain-size one with handy tools, including tiny scissors and an inch-and-a-half blade. Theyre $11.97 on Amazon, and Ive already ordered a new one to replace the one that was confiscated last week at La Guardia Airport in New York.

title: Weekly News Quiz | April 22-28, 2014
description: A Supreme Court decision, a historic ceremony and a 40th birthday celebration for a popular toy: How many of the questions in this weeks News Quiz can you answer correctly?

title: Signature to Receive Tony for Regional Theater
description: Signature Theater will become the first New York City theater company to receive the noncompetitive Tony Award recognizing a regional American theater, the Tony Awards Administration Committee announced on Monday.

title: Who Speaks for Pro-Israel Americans?
description: On Wednesday the influential Conference of Presidents of Major Jewish Organizations will vote on whether or not to admit J Street as a member. A vote to exclude J Street would, in a word, be crazy  sending an unfortunate signal about its willingness (or unwillingness) to reflect the broadest range of views, especially on a peace agreement between Israel and the Palestinians.

title: Edgar Laprade, Center and Gentleman on the Ice, Dies at 94
description: Edgar Laprade, the Hall of Fame Rangers center of the 1940s and 50s who was known for his playmaking skills and his gentlemanly behavior on the ice, died on Monday at his home in Thunder Bay, Ontario. He was 94.

title: Overriding Their Animal Impulses
description: When it comes to animal intelligence, says Evan MacLean, co-director of Duke Universitys Canine Cognition Center, dont ask which species is smarter. Smarter at what? is the right question.

title: ScienceTake | Shell Game for Animals
description: Intelligence is hard to test, but one aspect of being smart is self-control, and a version of the old shell game that works for many species suggests that brain size is very important.

title: Weekend Gun Report: April 25-27, 2014
description: Gun control supporters have the blood of little children on their hands.

title: Grimm and Prosecutors Discuss Indictment
description: Representative Michael G. Grimm of Staten Island; Loretta E. Lynch, the United States attorney in Brooklyn; and George Venizelos, an F.B.I. assistant director, discussed the congressmans indictment.

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 45
description: Its all about timing for Luiz Felipe Scolari, the coach of Brazils national soccer team, as the days tick off the calendar toward the start of the World Cup.

title: Prosecutors Charge Utah Woman in Newborn Deaths
description: PROVO, Utah  Prosecutors on Monday charged a Utah mother with six counts of murder in the choking and suffocation deaths of her babies within minutes of their births. Their tiny bodies were found stuffed into cardboard boxes hidden in the garage of her home in Pleasant Grove, Utah, just south of Salt Lake City.

title: Fox Plans Live Performance of Grease
description: No success in television is not worth imitating, as was proved again on Monday with the announcement that Fox will become the second network to commit to a live musical on television  a three-hour production of Grease.

title: Key Justice Dept. Official Is Latest to Join Law Firm
description: Two blocks separate Covington & Burlings offices in Washington from the Justice Departments headquarters. Covingtons roster of lawyers shows a closer link.

title: In the Heat of the Night
description: Q. When Im having a hot flash, does my core body temperature actually rise, or does it only feel that way?

title: Political Executions in Egypt
description: An out-of-control government in Egypt has now sentenced more than 680 people to death in a mass trial that lasted a few minutes and is part of an organized effort not just to crush its political opponents but to eliminate them. Last month, a court delivered a similar sentence on 529 others. The sentences further demonstrate that the military-led governments ruthless disregard for the law and its contrary political views go far beyond anything that former President Mohamed Morsi was accused of doing when he was deposed by the army in July.

title: These Celebrities Want You to Vote for Marianne Williamson
description: Much has been made of Marianne Williamson  a spiritual adviser and New York Times best-selling author  and her glittering, celebrity-laden campaign in Californias 33rd District. She is an exotic political animal and perfect media catnip, writes Mark Leibovich in The Real House Candidates of Beverly Hills, his dispatch from the fight for Americas second-wealthiest congressional district.

title: North Carolinas Gay-Marriage Ban Is Challenged by Church
description: In a novel legal attack on a states same-sex marriage ban, a liberal Protestant denomination on Monday filed a lawsuit arguing that North Carolina is unconstitutionally restricting religious freedom by barring clergy members from blessing gay and lesbian couples.

title: Bitter Winter Limits the Offerings of Spring
description: For cooks, particularly those in the Midwest and the Northeast, these are brutal days.

title: And Baby Makes an Unusual Three
description: Think of any of the great television series for which friendship was the defining idea  whether six-sided, four-cornered or a simple pairing  and the word effortless might come to mind. The actors and the writers made it all look effortless, and thus the friendships were believable.

title: Yo-Yo Ma and Audra McDonald Among Offerings at Sonoma Concert Hall
description: The effort to put Californias Sonoma County on the map for high culture as well as viniculture will continue next season when the Joan and Sanford I. Weill Hall at the Green Music Center plans to expand its offerings of classical, jazz, pop and world-music concerts.

title: Art and Film Luminaries Salute Dennis Hopper at Paris Photo Los Angeles
description: WhoThree of Dennis Hoppers four children  Marin, Ruthanna and Henry  gathered at Paramount Studios with Hollywood friends like Andrew and Luke Wilson and Todd Phillips (director of the Hangover franchise and friend of Ruthanna, Hoppers daughter with the Zabriskie Point star Daria Halprin) and art-world luminaries including Bill Viola and Sophie Calle for a screening of their fathers 1971 lost classic The Last Movie, in conjunction with the Paris Photo art fair. Jodi Wille, director of the documentary The Source Family, arrived with Hoppers co-star Stella Garcia. The artist Larry Bell, a friend of Hoppers since the late 50s, introduced the film.

title: An About-Face on a Risky Transplant
description: When the worlds first face transplant was performed in France in 2005, it pushed medical boundaries and made headlines. Yet the procedures future was very much in doubt.

title: British Publicist Convicted of Indecent Assaults
description: LONDON  Max Clifford, Britains best-known celebrity publicist, was found guilty on Monday of eight charges of indecent assault, including offenses dating back decades against women as young as 15.

title: A Rubber Band With a Surprising Twist
description: While working with a complex rubber band, Harvard researchers accidentally generated a shape rarely seen in nature, a hemihelix, according to a new study in PLOS One. The unusual shape is a variation on the helix, which is often represented by a DNA strand. The hemihelix is a helix that changes direction midway, as indicated by the arrow, above.

title: Muslim Leaders Denounce Police Over Raids in Czech Capital
description: PARIS  Muslim leaders in the Czech Republic on Monday accused the police of abusing their power after armed officers raided Islamic institutions in Prague over the weekend, detaining 20 people during Friday Prayer at a mosque and a community center, and arresting the publisher of a book that law enforcement officials say incites xenophobia and violence.

title: We Kill Germs at Our Peril
description: You never get something for nothing, especially not in health care. Every test, every incision, every little pill brings benefits and risks.

title: Visiting the Alps, With Liszt and Goats
description: The titles of David Langs compositions are written in lowercase. Theres a self-effacing quality to his work as composer in residence at Carnegie Hall this season, too; among the six concerts he is presenting at Zankel Hall under the title collected stories, only one work is by him. But when it comes to the music of composers he has studied, admired, mentored or championed, its a different story: Here Mr. Langs interests run wide and include the grandiose and the quirky, the sidesplittingly funny and the extremes of virtuosic self-indulgence.

title: Some Corals Can Adapt to Warmer Waters
description: Warming ocean waters have already devastated many coral reefs. But new research involving a species of coral that is resistant to higher temperatures suggests that others may be able to adapt, too.

title: Militants Pose Threat on Eve of National Elections in Iraq
description: BAGHDAD  Snipers line the rooftops across Falluja, waiting for a chance to shoot at government soldiers, should they try to invade. Homes have been wired to explode, too, just in case the government rushes the city. And roads have been studded with countless steel-plated bombs, of the type that killed so many American soldiers here.

title: Health Care Politics In One Sentence
description: The politics of Obamacare are clearly starting to shift. Its not that the public is coming to love it  not yet, anyway. But its less and less of a bogeyman, with polls suggesting a majority of the public against flat-out repeal. So theres increasing pressure on Republicans to lay out an alternative  and continuing surprise about their inability to articulate one.

title: Pakistani Says He Killed 3, Using Gay Site to Lure Them
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  The arrest of a confessed serial killer who used the Internet to lure his victims has caused alarm among gay men and lesbians in Pakistan, where social media has been quietly used to widen freedoms in a country where homosexuality is illegal.

title: Arkansas Governor on Storm
description: Gov. Mike Beebe of Arkansas and David Hogue, a spokesman for Faulkner County, discussed the search-and-rescue operation after a series of deadly tornadoes in the state.

title: Merger Talks of 2 Mining Giants Devolve Into Dueling Statements
description: Merger talks between two gold mining firms have devolved into a war of words.

title: Science Quiz: Real or Fake
description: This man dips his hand in the ice water. Can you tell if hes really in pain?

description: This man dips his hand in the ice water. Can you tell if hes really in pain?

title: Reaction to Death Sentences in Egypt
description: Egyptians reacted to a courts decision to sentence more than 680 people and a Muslim Brotherhood leader to death.

description: This woman dips her hand in the ice water. Can you tell if shes really in pain?

title: Science Quiz: Real vs. Fake
description: This woman dips her hand in the ice water. Is she really in pain, or is she lying?

title: Paradigming Is Hard
description: Mark Thoma sends us to Justin Fox, who tries hard to be sympathetic to the latest hard science/engineering guy bustling in to show those dumb economists how to do it. But as Fox clearly realizes, the reason we dont have a new economic paradigm isnt that economists are dumb, or even that all of them are rigid in their beliefs (obviously some are, or I wouldnt have as many arguments as I do.) The reason, instead, is that its hard.

title: DJ Rashad, Chicago Dance Music Producer, Dies at 34
description: DJ Rashad, a producer who helped bring the Chicago dance music known as footwork to a global audience, was found dead on Saturday in Chicago. He was 34.

title: Complicated Legacy of a Gospel Singer
description: NEW ORLEANS  When the RAMS gospel choir members took the stage on Friday afternoon at the New Orleans Jazz & Heritage Festival, they began by swaying to a recorded voice that came out of the loudspeakers like a ghost, imploring listeners about learning to love yourself.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: How Congress Is Actually Holding Down Medicare Spending
description: Its a rare health policy wonk who has a good word to say about Medicares Sustainable Growth Rate formula. Thats the formula created by Congress to govern the amount that Medicare pays to physicians for various treatments. It is supposed to adjust payments to meet an overall spending target tied to economic growth.

title: John Olivers Premiere on HBO Draws 1.1 Million Viewers
description: HBOs newest star, John Oliver, got off to a relatively strong start in his debut as a late-night host on Sundays, with 1.1 million viewers for his premiere.

title: Noma Back on Top of 50 Best List
description: Two restaurants traded places Monday at the top of a list of the Worlds 50 Best Restaurants, an increasingly influential but somewhat arbitrary ranking published by Restaurant Magazine since 2003.

title: Photo Diary | Cosplay at the Cherry Blossom Festival
description: Scenes from the Sakura Matsuri photo diary of Dina Litovsky.

title: What Does Today Owe Tomorrow?
description: If you had driven north on Highway 101 toward San Francisco a few summers ago, you might have noticed a banner hanging from a freeway bridge. What have future generations done for us? it asked.

title: Ahead of Tony Nominations, a Look at the Broadway Box Office
description: Will the 2014 Tony Award nominations, which will be announced Tuesday morning, reflect the hottest-selling plays and musicals on Broadway? Or did the Tony nominators, who cast their votes in secret on Monday, favor shows with more artistic merit than box office juice? There is no clear front-runner in any of the four top categories, so anything goes.

title: Podcast: The Origin of Genes, an Antibiotic Overload, Roommate Math
description:
Genes make you ... you. But where do they come from? Antibiotics save lives, but their overuse is evolving supergerms and could be changing our bodies. Who pays what rent for which room? Just use this handy calculator and never fight at the end of the month again.
Subscribe to the Podcast

title: Data Murky on Fertility Rates
description: Heres the question on the minds of people who spend tens of thousands of dollars on fertility treatments: What are my chances of having a healthy baby?

title: Albums From Wye Oak and Sd Laika
description: WYE OAK

title: The Continuing Evolution of Genes
description: Each of us carries just over 20,000 genes that encode everything from the keratin in our hair down to the muscle fibers in our toes. Its no great mystery where our own genes came from: our parents bequeathed them to us. And our parents, in turn, got their genes from their parents.

title: Handel to Mozart to Morris in a Pastoral Tale of Love and Jealous Rage
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  Mark Morris has often proved the most life-enhancingly musical choreographer alive. In his latest work, the two-act Acis and Galatea, you cant miss multiple layers of his musicality, but sometimes they tug in opposite directions. Its premiere here wason Friday; it will be seen in Boston in May and at New Yorks Mostly Mozart Festival in August.

title: Are These People in Real Pain or Just Faking It?
description: We all know what its like to experience pain that makes our faces twist into a grimace. But how do you know if someone elses face of pain is real or feigned? And can only humans tell the difference?

title: Reading Pain in a Human Face
description: How well can computers interact with humans? Certainly computers play a mean game of chess, which requires strategy and logic, and Jeopardy!, in which they must process language to understand the clues read by Alex Trebek (and buzz in with the correct question).

title: Art Dealer Seeks to Avoid Prison
description: Two disparate punishment options will be among those on the table on Wednesday when the art gallery owner Hillel Nahmad arrives in federal court in Manhattan to be sentenced for his involvement in an international gambling ring.

title: France Plays an Aggressive Hand in Alstom Deal Talks
description: PARIS  Shortly after news leaked last week that General Electric was working on a multibillion-dollar deal to buy part of the French industrial giant Alstom, Patrick Kron, Alstoms chief executive, got an urgent summons.

title: Light Found in Darkness of Wartime
description: Boy meets girl in Anthony Doerrs hauntingly beautiful new book, but the circumstances are as elegantly circuitous as they can be. The heroine of All the Light We Cannot See is blind, but anyone familiar with Mr. Doerrs work, which includes the short-story collections The Shell Collector and Memory Wall, will know that its title has many more meanings than that.

title: Turks and Armenians
description: To the Editor:

title: Sweden: Were Not Japan
description: To the Editor:

title: Showing the Airfare Taxes
The Rights of the Accused
description: To the Editor:

title: For Lab Rats, a Male Scientist Effect
description: Male researchers may want to bring a female chaperone when working with rodents, a new study suggests: Rats and mice experience more stress in the presence of men than of women.

title: From the Bleak Streets to the Ballet Stage
description: Dont you think it needs something after he runs after her? asked J R recently in a studio at New York City Ballet.

title: My World Grew at the Fair
description: To the Editor:

title: A Silver Anniversary, and the Bride Still Wears White
description: Its tempting to review the new Tony n Tinas Wedding in the style of a Vows column in The New York Times: The bride, a dimwit with a promising future in reality TV, wore a tasteful white gown that contrasted sharply with her bridesmaids dresses, which appeared to be on loan from a mid-20th-century jiggle joint. Or perhaps as a restaurant review parody: Guy Fieris main dish, an indifferent pasta, was garnished with a sprinkling of near-fisticuffs and tangy mother-of-the-bride histrionics.

title: Yahoo to Offer TV-Style Comedy Series on the Web
description: Yahoos chief executive, Marissa Mayer, is about to dive into the shark tank of television-style original video.

title: Moogfest in Asheville
description: Images from the festival.

title: Artificial, With a Human Touch
description: ASHEVILLE, N.C.  Geekiness reigned, proudly and openly, at Moogfest 2014, the largest iteration yet of a festival created by Moog Music, which makes all of its synthesizers and other equipment by hand at a small factory here in downtown Asheville.

title: Divide Your Rent Fairly
description: When you're sharing an apartment with roommates, it can be a challenge to decide who takes which bedroom, and at what price. Sit down with your roommates and use the calculator below to find the fair division.

title: To Divide the Rent, Start With a Triangle
description: Last year, two friends and I moved into a small three-bedroom apartment in Manhattan. We chose it for its relatively reasonable price  around $3,000 a month  and its convenient location. Just finding it was a challenge, but then we faced another one: deciding who would get each bedroom.

title: Security Flaw Hits Microsoft Browser
description: Updated with more reporting on security flaw. |

title: After Hours | Bright Light Bright Light Strips Dance-Pop to Its Bare Essence
description: Anyone whos heard the vocals-only track of Whitney Houston singing How Will I Know? can attest to the mesmerizing power of dance-pop reduced to its simplest elements. That was the feeling Friday night at Joes Pub when the young Welsh singer Rod Thomas, who goes by the Gremlins-inspired name Bright Light Bright Light, performed his entire new dance album, Life Is Easy, with only a piano and three backup singers. Thomas, who recently moved to Brooklyn from London, has gained a small, obsessive following for his passionate, moody lyrics paired with shimmering dance-pop arrangements that recall the Pet Shop Boys and Erasure, and house tracks as mixed by Shep Pettibone for the Vogue-era Madonna.

title: Three Contractors Sentenced to 20 Years in CityTime Corruption Case
description: A federal judge in Manhattan on Monday sentenced three men to 20 years in prison for their roles in the scandal-ridden payroll modernization project known as CityTime, and he also sharply criticized New York Citys contracting procedures for what he called a lack of adequate and effective oversight.

title: From Volunteers, a DNA Database
description: Abigail Wark wants to see your areolas.

title: Giving Children of Alumni a Leg Up
Reactions
description: Nutrition

title: AT&T Plans to Provide Wireless Internet for Airplanes
description: AT&T is looking to expand the reach of its wireless network to devices in the sky. On Monday, the company announced plans to provide in-flight Internet connections for some airlines.

title: Owners to Invest $800 Million More in Shanghai Disneyland
description: LOS ANGELES  Shrugging off economists concerns about a cooling Chinese economy, the Walt Disney Company on Monday announced a deal to increase spending on its coming Shanghai megaresort by $800 million.

title: Twenty Years After Apartheid
description: Joao Silva came of age as a photographer as South Africa was navigating its path to democracy. Twenty years later, he reflects on what has  and has not  changed.

title: A Low-Wage Recovery? The Evidence Isnt There
description: A new report from the National Employment Law Project, the research and advocacy group, argues that were in the midst of a low-wage recovery. But the evidence for this is thin.

title: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Egypt, Ukraine, the Philippines and Taiwan.

title: Lawyers Say U.N. Aid Does Not Need Syrias Consent
description: UNITED NATIONS  United Nations agencies and other charitable organizations do not need the permission of the Syrian government to deliver humanitarian relief to civilians trapped in the fighting and destruction from the three-year-old civil war there, a group of international lawyers and academics argued in an open letter released on Monday.

title: How to Back Up iTunes Podcasts
description: How to Back Up

title: Despite Ethics Pledge, Response by G.O.P. Varies
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Vance McAllister, Republican of Louisiana, under heavy pressure from House Republican leaders since he was caught kissing a congressional aide, announced Monday that he would not seek re-election to the seat he has occupied for only five months.

title: Singer Steps Into Spotlight as Nation Changes Political Tune
description: TEHRAN  The onetime underground pop singer smiled shyly as the high-pitched screams of his teenage fans drifted into his dressing room, just before his show on Friday. This superstar thing, he seemed to be saying, takes some getting used to.

title: Finding a Flash Drive in the Sea
description: YESTERDAY, the aerial search for floating debris from Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 was called off, and an underwater search based on possible locator beacon signals was completed without success. Although efforts to find the missing aircraft have not been abandoned, Angus Houston, the man in charge of finding the plane, said, We havent found anything anywhere.

title: Bank of Americas Bad Accounting
description: The strange accounting that tripped up Bank of America is on its way to being changed.

title: Sterlings Racial Honors
description: Exactly 50 years ago, the Beatles declared that money cant buy you love.

title: Toyota Will Shift 4,000 to New Offices in Texas
description: DETROIT  Toyota Motor said on Monday that it would move thousands of employees from California and other locations to new North American headquarters in Texas as part of a broad effort to cut costs and streamline operations.

title: Justices Appear Willing to Give a Fired Public Worker Only Half a Victory
description: WASHINGTON  After a tangled Supreme Court argument on Monday over the First Amendment rights of public employees, it seemed likely that the justices would render a split decision.

title: Senate Drops Bid to Report on Drone Use
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate has quietly stripped a provision from an intelligence bill that would have required President Obama to make public each year the number of people killed or injured in targeted killing operations in Pakistan and other countries where the United States uses lethal force.

title: Echoes of Past May Not Carry as Court Weighs 2nd Abortion Law
description: NEW ORLEANS  For the second time this year, a federal appeals panel here heard arguments about the constitutionality of a new state law governing abortion. But despite much in common between the two laws  one in Texas, and the other, the subject of Mondays hearing, in Mississippi  their effects would differ substantially, raising the possibility that the same court weighing similar laws might arrive at different conclusions.

title: Brazilian Telecom Firm Oi Raises $3.7 Billion Via Offering
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  The Brazilian telecommunications carrier Oi raised about 8.25 billion reais ($3.7 billion) on Monday through a global share offering that is part of its merger with Portugal Telecom.

title: Nash Still Contributes to Rangers Despite His Scoring Drought in the Playoffs
description: There are many ways to measure a hockey players contribution to his team, and by almost every one of them, Rick Nash is doing a lot for the Rangers in their playoff series against the Flyers. But there is one area where he is not, and it happens to be the main reason the Rangers traded away so many players to acquire him two years ago: goal scoring.

title: White House to Press Colleges to Do More to Combat Rape
description: WASHINGTON  Reacting to a series of highly publicized rapes on college campuses, the White House on Monday released guidelines that increase the pressure on universities to more aggressively combat sexual assaults on campus.

title: Welcome to the Haiyatt. In China, Its Not the Hotel It Sounds Like.
description: Is the Peninsula Hotel in Yangcheng part of the five-star Peninsula Hotels group known for its Rolls-Royces? Can you accrue Marriott rewards points at the Marvelot Hotel, which includes the Chinese characters for Marriott in its name? Is the Haiyatt hotel in China a Hyatt brand hotel? No, no and no.

title: Ratings Slip at MSNBC as Jet Coverage Lifts CNN
description: April proved a cruel month for MSNBC, with the news channel hitting some of its lowest ratings in seven years, and its prominent morning show, Morning Joe, falling to third place in the cable news competition.

title: Europe's Mob Economy
Courting Video Advertisers With Infinite (and Growing) Air Time
description: WHICH came first, a rising interest among marketers in digital video as an advertising medium or a decision by a leading trade association to significantly expand an annual series of presentations by companies that offer digital video? If it is a chicken-and-egg question, it would assuredly involve a subservient chicken, in honor of the pioneering online video that Burger King introduced a decade ago and revived last week.

title: Craig Ferguson to Leave CBS at End of Year
description: Late-night television has one more opening: Craig Ferguson announced on his CBS show Monday night that he will leave The Late Late Show at the end of the year.

title: Trainers Hunch on Modest Colt Pays Off
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Jose Garoffalo, who grew up around thoroughbreds on his fathers breeding farm, studied law in his native Venezuela before he listened to his heart. He went to the racetrack the day after he completed his studies in 1988 and pursued a career as a trainer.

title: 12 Deportation Protesters Arrested at White House
description: In a protest against President Obamas immigration enforcement, 12 people were arrested Monday morning in front of the White House after they sat down and unfurled banners calling on him to stop most deportations. About 1,500 protesters, including many Latinos, joined the rally, the first of several anti-deportation protests scheduled this week in Washington. Homeland Security Secretary Jeh C. Johnson is conducting a review of the policy with an eye to reducing deportations.

title: At Meeting, Fed Likely to Again Cut Bond Buying
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve is tiptoeing away from its economic stimulus campaign, and so far the broader economy has barely noticed.

title: Saving the System
description: All around, the fabric of peace and order is fraying. The leaders of Russia and Ukraine escalate their apocalyptic rhetoric. The Sunni-Shiite split worsens as Syria and Iraq slide into chaos. China pushes its weight around in the Pacific.

title: Buffett Bites Back
description: The first Saturday in May is always a great day for Warren Buffett. Thats the day his conglomerate, Berkshire Hathaway, holds its annual meeting in Omaha.

title: White House Steps Up Effort to Confirm Federal Judges
description: WASHINGTON  With the possibility that Republicans could take the Senate in November, the White House and Senate Democrats are working swiftly to confirm judges to the federal courts in an effort to allow President Obama to leave a lasting liberal imprint on the judiciary.

title: Syria Announces Assads Bid for Re-election as War Rages
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The Syrian government announced on Monday that President Bashar al-Assad would compete in a presidential election scheduled for June 3 that is widely seen as an attempt to enhance his perceived legitimacy despite a raging civil war that has pushed his government out of much of the country and displaced millions of citizens.

title: Lull Prompts Question: What Are Taliban Up To?
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Even as Afghanistans unfolding presidential election has captured the capitals attention, two related questions have become increasingly urgent among security officials here: Where have the Taliban gone, and what are they waiting for?

title: G.A.O. Report Sees Deeper Bank Flaws in Foreclosures
description: A new government report suggests that errors made by banks and their agents during foreclosures might have been significantly higher than was previously believed when regulators halted a national review of the banks mortgage servicing operations.

title: LGs Plan to Deface the Palisades
description: The Palisades, the cliffs that stretch more than 20 glorious miles along the Hudson River north of New York City, have been protected for almost a century by agreement of New York and New Jersey from tall buildings that damage the areas natural beauty.

title: Troubling Student Loans
description: College students who borrow from private lenders often assume that private and federal student loans work the same way. The two could not be more different.

title: White House Details Thinking on Cybersecurity Flaws
description: WASHINGTON  In a rare insight into the governments thinking on the use of cyberweapons, the White House on Monday published a series of questions it asks in deciding when to make public the discovery of major flaws in computer security or whether to keep them secret so that American intelligence agencies can use them to enable surveillance or an attack.

title: After 33 Years of Sterling, a Boiling Point
description: Why did it take a tape recording aired on a gossip website to ignite nationwide ire against Donald Sterling?

title: Schumer Weighs In, Seeking Federal Changes for Structure of Port Authority
description: The controversy over the shutting of traffic lanes to the George Washington Bridge last September has spurred widespread calls for reforming the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, the agency that operates the bridge.

title: Snowden Retained Expert in Espionage Act Defense
description: WASHINGTON  Edward J. Snowden, the former National Security Agency contractor who provided journalists a trove of classified documents, retained a well-known Washington defense lawyer last summer in hopes of reaching a plea deal with federal prosecutors that would allow him to return to the United States and spare him significant prison time.

title: Pfizer Proposes a Marriage With AstraZeneca, Easing Taxes in a Move to Britain
description: Pfizer, the maker of best-selling drugs like Lipitor and Viagra and a symbol of business prowess in the United States for more than a century, no longer wants to be an American company.

title: Why Did the N.B.A. Long Tolerate Sterling?
description: Perhaps the most disturbing aspect of the Donald Sterling scandal is that virtually no one in the sports world was surprised to hear that Mr. Sterling, the owner of the Los Angeles Clippers, may have been caught on tape spewing racist sentiments.

title: Sanctions Over Ukraine Cause Headaches in the Energy Sector
description: MOSCOW  Once a year, the chief executives of the worlds largest oil companies fly to St. Petersburg, Russias second city, for an economic forum and a rare chance to meet with President Vladimir V. Putin and his lieutenant in the energy business, Igor I. Sechin.

title: Today in Small Business: When Employees Can Unionize
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Mayor of Kharkiv, Ukraine, Is Shot
description: Ukrainian officials discussed the shooting of Gennady A. Kernes, the mayor of Kharkiv, who was shot in the back while running on Monday.

title: I Miss Him Every Second of Every Day
description: The parents of Zachary Tyler said they hoped their sons death would inspire hospitals and health care facilities to be more vigilant about controlling the spread of deadly infections.

title: New Guard of Owners Could Be Key in Sterlings Fate
description: When the N.B.A.s Philadelphia 76ers were sold in 2011, a group of private equity investors bought the team for $280 million. When the Memphis Grizzlies were sold in 2012, a 34-year-old wireless technology entrepreneur paid $377 million. This month, two hedge fund billionaires shelled out $550 million for the lowly Milwaukee Bucks.

title: A Deadly Fungus and Questions at a Hospital
description: NEW ORLEANS  The first victim was a premature boy in the intensive care unit whose mother noticed a mysterious irritation in his groin; it grew into an open wound burrowing into the babys abdomen. The last patient to die was a 10-year-old girl, whose face was ravaged.

title: Reconsidering the Saviors of a Hospital
description: In late February, Mayor Bill de Blasio opened a news conference by letting loose an aria of self-congratulation.

title: One City Falls to Pro-Russian Militants; in Another, the Mayor Is Shot
description: KONSTANTINOVKA, Ukraine  The crisis in eastern Ukraine took dark turns on Monday as the mayor of the countrys second-largest city was gravely wounded in an assassination attempt and masked antigovernment militants seized control of this city almost effortlessly, laying bare the limits of the interim governments control.

title: In Israel, Traffic Halts for a Moment of Silence
description: TEL AVIV  Every year, Jews around the world observe Yom Hashoah, a solemn day set aside to remember the millions of people who lost their lives in the Holocaust. In Israel, which became the first modern Jewish state a few years after World War II, the observance of Holocaust Remembrance Day even stops traffic, if only for a moment.

title: Place to Express an Opinion
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  When people ask what I do for a living, I always make sure to tell them specifically that I write a blog for the web version of The New York Times. Its fun to watch the range of reactions cross their faces, because most people still think of The Times in term of the print newspaper, and not everyone is aware of our online presence. And while I thank the universe every day that print is still alive and somewhat well, The Times has come a very long way in terms of presenting the news online in ways that I think are both innovative and well-designed. [The preceding paragraph is not an advertorial, opinions expressed here are Ms. Amlens alone, your mileage may vary when driving on the highway, if your puzzle solve lasts for three or more days please consult a physician. Ed.]

title: Monday Motorsports: Logano Evades the Punchy Competition for Sprint Cup Win
description: As Matt Kenseth, Jeff Gordon and Brad Keselowski were battling one another for the lead, Joey Logano slipped by and took the checkered flag Saturday night in the Sprint Cup event at Richmond International Raceway. Gordon ended up second, with Kyle Busch third. Kenseth was fourth, followed by Keselowski.
