title: Baseball Set Precedent for Disciplining an Owner
description: Any punishment handed down to Donald Sterling, the Los Angeles Clippers owner, will inevitably be compared with Major League Baseballs actions in the 1990s against Marge Schott.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for April 28, 2014
description: April 28, 2014

title: Nuclear Powers Promise and Peril
description: More than three decades after the accident at Three Mile Island cast a shadow on the atomic dream, is America again ready to give nuclear energy a chance?

title: William H. Honan, Journalist and Author, Dies at 83
description: William H. Honan, an author and journalist who directed coverage of the arts at The New York Times as its culture editor in the 1980s, died on Monday in Norwalk, Conn. He was 83.

title: Three Mile Island, and Nuclear Hopes and Fears
description: There is a certain irony in the shorthand that experts commonly use when discussing this countrys closest brush with nuclear cataclysm: TMI. Today, those letters are widely understood to mean too much information. But well before the advent of social media, TMI referred principally to the Three Mile Island Nuclear Generating Station, a power plant on the Susquehanna River in central Pennsylvania. Disaster struck there in 1979, and when it did, too much information  solid, unassailable information  was not part of the mix. Months later, a presidential commission cited a lack of communication at all levels as cause for grave concern. Americans were frightened, and not just those in Pennsylvania. Fear was intensified because, as the commission said, their right to know what was going on had been sorely compromised.

title: Move Over, Tennis Elbow; Wrist Injuries Increasingly Plague Stars
description: What should have been an exciting clash between two tennis titans was instead clouded by a white mass.

title: U.S. Couple Denied Permission to Leave Qatar While Appeal Is Pending
description: An American couple in Qatar convicted of child endangerment in the death of their adopted daughter from Africa, and not the original charge of murder, were denied permission on Monday to return home while their appeal is pending, and they faced the new possibility that Qatari prosecutors would seek to charge them with human trafficking.

title: Ending Asia Trip, Obama Defends His Foreign Policy
description: MANILA  President Obama, stung by criticism of his response to turmoil from Eastern Europe to the Middle East, defended his approach to foreign policy as a slow but steady pursuit of American interests while avoiding military conflict, and he lashed out at those he said reflexively call for the use of force.

title: Kerry Expresses Regret After Apartheid Remark
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State John Kerry issued an unusual statement Monday evening expressing his support for Israel after a controversy erupted over a politically charged phrase he used in a private appearance.

title: Creating a 3-D Model of the Arkansas Tornadoes
description: During severe weather, NOAAs doppler radar stations send out multiple radar beams that slice through the atmosphere at varying angles, creating three-dimensional picture of storms.

title: A Runway Standoff: Safety vs. Foliage at Westchester Airport
description: GREENWICH, Conn.  Sal Materia and his brother Enzo have made a patch of heaven for themselves here on Greenwichs western fringe.

title: No Sign Yet That Cano Cant Continue Playing Daily
description: On more than one occasion during their years together as Yankees, Derek Jeter discussed with Robinson Cano how he should conduct himself on the major league level. Several years ago, when Cano arrived at the ballpark a little late one day, Jeter told him that was not how the Yankees did things, according to a major league employee who witnessed that clubhouse encounter and other ones that were similar in nature.

title: Arc of a Failed Deal: How Nine Months of Mideast Talks Ended in Disarray
description: JERUSALEM  There were late-night video conferences with Secretary of State John Kerry, including one from beneath mosquito netting in an Indonesian hotel. Mr. Kerry met a total of 34 times with President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority, and about twice that with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel.

title: Penguins Hang On to Eliminate Blue Jackets Behind Malkins Hat Trick
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  The 10 frenzied final minutes of Mondays Game 6 seemed like either an eternity or a flash, depending on whether you were rooting for Columbus or Pittsburgh.

title: Brooklyn Tenants Unionize
description: Residents who have long called Crown Heights home are hoping their complaints against lackluster landlords will go further if they join forces with tenants who have just moved in.

title: Disparate Forces Align Over Affordable Rents
description: The letter came in the dead of winter, dated Jan. 29. In a written notice of termination, Toussaint Worthams landlord accused him of violating his lease by making some renovations in his kitchen, and telling him that he had two weeks to leave the rent-stabilized apartment he had lived in for more than 30 years.

title: India Election Digest: April 29
description: What you need to know on Tuesday about Indias elections: You cant bet on Rahul Gandhi anymore, the contest in Uttar Pradesh is boiling down to two heavyweights, and overseas Indians are doing their part to promote Narendra Modi of the Bharatiya Janata Party.

title: Times Minute | Congressman Indicted
description: How Federal Authorities brought an indictment against Congressman Michael Grimm. Also on the minute, the quiet passing of a peace deadline in the Middle East and spotting someone in pain.

title: The New New Basque Cuisine
description: One of only two women chefs named to the 2014 Worlds 50 Best Restaurants list announced yesterday, Elena Arzak is a pioneering force in Spanish cooking, mixing modern innovation with a deep commitment to her regions traditions.

title: Times Minute | Congressman Indicted
description: In the Video

title: Met Museum to Offer Malian Music, Theater Works and More in Coming Season
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Arts shake-up of its live performance program will continue next season when it presents a theater production in the Temple of Dendur, a series of concerts and lectures focused on Mali, and a site-specific video opera of La Celestina, a work of Spanish literature that is more than 500 years old, in its Spanish Renaissance patio.

title: Word of the Day | grievance
description: grievance\gre-vn(t)s\ noun

title: Administration Begins Search for New Contractors to Run Health Care Site
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration has begun a wide-ranging search for companies to run the online federal health insurance exchange, seeking new talent to prevent a repeat of problems that immobilized the website last fall.

title: No Jail Time for Brooklyn Man Who Threw Bleach on a Rabbi
description: A Brooklyn man who threw bleach at an outspoken advocate for victims of sexual abuse in the boroughs ultra-Orthodox Jewish community avoided jail time in a plea deal that gave him five years of probation, a spokesman for the Brooklyn district attorneys office said on Monday.

title: Mexico: Mayor Detained in Organized Crime Investigation
description: The mayor of Lzaro Crdenas, the city with Mexicos second-largest port, has been detained as part of an investigation into allegations that he is involved in organized crime, as Mexico struggles to regain control of a region under the thumb of a powerful criminal gang. The gang, the Knights Templar, had so infiltrated the port, in the Pacific Coast state of Michoacn, that the military took it over last year. The arrest of the mayor, Arqumedes Oseguera, on Monday came a day after five people were killed on the outskirts of Lzaro Crdenas when vigilante groups clashed with gunmen who they suspected were criminals. Mexico this week plans to begin to disarm the vigilantes and restore state authority.

title: Central African Republic: Hospital Raid
description: Doctors Without Borders, the international medical charity that operates in some of the worlds most dangerous conflict zones, expressed alarm and outrage on Monday over the weekend killings of 16 civilians, including three staff members, on the property of a hospital it runs in Boguila, in the Central African Republic. In a statement on its website, the group said former members of the Seleka Muslim militia raided and robbed the hospital on Saturday, opening fire on community members invited to discuss medical access. Stefano Argenziano, who directs the groups work in the country, said the group had suspended activities in Boguila and was evaluating whether to continue operations in other parts of the country, which has been split by Christian-vs.-Muslim mayhem. The group was forced to curtail work at an encampment of displaced people in Bangui, the capital, because of the violence and the collapse of government authority.

title: Ethiopia: 9 Media Workers Arrested
description: Nine bloggers and journalists were arrested in Addis Ababa last week, according to local media and Human Rights Watch, just days before Secretary of State John Kerrys scheduled visit to Ethiopia on Tuesday. Six bloggers for Zone 9, an Amharic-language website whose writers have criticized the government, and three freelance journalists were arrested. No formal charges have yet been filed. The timing of the arrests  just days before the U.S. secretary of states visit  speaks volumes about Ethiopias disregard for free speech, Leslie Lefkow, deputy director of Human Rights Watchs Africa division, said in a statement on Monday. Getachew Reda, an adviser to Prime Minister Hailemariam Desalegn, said the arrests had nothing to do with the journalists work. The police have put under custody people who have been suspected of being involved in criminal activities, he said.

title: Disney Considered Buying BuzzFeed, but Balked at $1 Billion Price
description: LOS ANGELES  At least for the Walt Disney Company, BuzzFeed quickly became a buzzkill.

title: A Deal That Collapsed Leaves a Manhattan Synagogue in Shambles
description: Sitting in the plush velvet and mahogany pews inside the Fort Tryon Jewish Center in Washington Heights, ethereal light streaming in through 80-foot stained glass windows, it is possible to be transported back in time half a century, when the sanctuary was built as an addition to the synagogue, established in 1938.

title: Nokia Announces New Strategy, and a New Chief to Carry It Out
description: LONDON  The Finnish technology company Nokia announced a new strategy on Tuesday that focuses on its core mobile telecommunications infrastructure business, and it named the head of that division, Rajeev Suri, as its new chief executive.

title: Whats On Tuesday
description: 10 P.M. (13); 11 P.M. (49) PRISON STATE Frontline reports on mass incarceration in the United States, where a disproportionate number of the 2.3 million people behind bars come from just a few city neighborhoods. This documentary, directed by Dan Edge, visits a housing project in Louisville, Ky., where a significant percentage of residents have been incarcerated, and follows four  including Keith Huff, who has been in and out of prison for 40 years, and Christel Tribble, 15, above, facing juvenile incarceration for truancy  who have vacillated between custody and freedom. Weve gone through an explosion of prison construction in this country, costing us billions of dollars to build and billions to operate, and weve come to a fork in the road where we just cant do that anymore, says Mark Bolton, the citys director of corrections, who is working to return inmates to the community. We cant afford it  and were locking up people who dont need to be locked up.

title: A Link Between Fidgety Boys and a Sputtering Economy
description: The behavior gap between rich and poor children, starting at very early ages, is now a well-known piece of social science. Entering kindergarten, high-income children not only know more words and can read better than poorer children but they also have longer attention spans, better-controlled tempers and more sensitivity to other children.

title: 2nd Publisher Pressured Over Hindu Book by U.S. Scholar
description: NEW DELHI  When Penguin India decided to withdraw a book on Hinduism by the American scholar Wendy Doniger in February, it cast a pall over the Indian publishing industry, which was already vulnerable to lawsuits because of the ambiguous language of Indian defamation laws.

title: Corrections: April 29, 2014
description: BUSINESS DAY

title: Journalist Missing Ahead of Tiananmen Anniversary
description: HONG KONG  Gao Yu, a prominent Chinese journalist who was imprisoned following the 1989 suppression of the student protests in Tiananmen Square in Beijing, is missing, with friends saying she may have been detained ahead of the 25th anniversary of the crackdown.

title: Amadeus Capital Partners Leads Funding Round for Brazils Bidu
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  The British venture capital firm Amadeus Capital Partners has made its first investment in Latin America, it said on Tuesday, leading an $8.9 million funding round in the Brazilian online insurance price comparison and brokerage company Bidu.

title: In Xinjiang, Xi Pushes Vision of Uighur Integration
description: Two sides of Chinas policy in Xinjiang  and two sides of Chinas president, Xi Jinping  have been on display during Mr. Xis visit to the tense western region, where he enthusiastically endorsed policies to integrate the Uighur ethnic minority while warning that his government would be unforgiving toward separatist violence.

title: Deutsche Bank Returns to Profit as Legal Costs Ease
description: FRANKFURT  Deutsche Bank, Germanys largest bank, said on Tuesday that it returned to profit in the first quarter as it avoided the huge litigation expenses that characterized the end of 2013.

title: No Compensation for Parents Who Have Lost Their Only Child
description: Last week more than 240 parents, drawn from about one million Chinese families whose only child has died, gathered in Beijing from around the country to ask the National Health and Family Planning Commission to compensate them for their loss.

title: Santander Profit Rises 8% on Improving Economy
description: LONDON  The Spanish lender Santander reported on Tuesday that its first-quarter profit rose 8 percent, to 1.3 billion euros, as the bank benefited from an improving economic environment and declining charges for bad loans.

title: John Oliver on the American Medias India Blind Spot
description: The premiere of John Olivers new HBO news satire show, Last Week Tonight, included a segment on the Indian parliamentary election that seemed to speak for the legions of Indian journalists who actually are covering the story, as well as the political junkies here who are avidly tracking every development.

title: Test Yourself | History, April 29
description: Take the Quiz

title: 6 Qs About the News | A Hunt for Survivors After a Night of Tornadoes
description: In A Hunt for Survivors After a Night of Tornadoes, Alan Blinder and Motoko Rich report on a string of storms that lashed the Midwest and South.

title: BPs Earnings Fall as It Continues to Sell Assets
description: LONDON  The British oil giant BP reported on Tuesday that its first-quarter earnings, excluding extraordinary items, fell 23.5 percent compared with the period a year earlier, as production slipped and it continued to sell assets.

title: Twenty Years After Apartheid
description: In a sprawling South African township stands a tall slab of polished stone etched with names of people killed in the political violence preceding the countrys first democratic elections. It is dedicated to those from Tokoza, where almost 1,000 people died violently some 20 years ago, and sits on Khumalo Street, the very road where many died.

title: Should Certain Animals Have Some of the Same Legal Rights As People?
description: Our legal system divides the world into people and everything else. People (and associations of people) have legal rights. Everything else does not. But should animals  or at least certain highly intelligent animals  be given some of the same legal rights as people?In the Op-Doc Animals Are Persons Too, Chris Hegedus and D. A. Pennebaker tell the story of the lawyer Steven Wise and his campaign to expand the legal rights of certain animals with a high level of intelligence:

title: Demolition Begins on Church That Triggered Protest
description: Demolition has begun on a church in the southeastern Chinese province of Zhejiang that thousands of worshipers had tried to protect after the authorities said it violated local building codes.

title: Vowing Changes, South Korean Leader Apologizes for Ferry Disaster
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Under mounting public pressure, President Park Geun-hye apologized on Tuesday for failing to prevent a ferry disaster that left 302 people, the vast majority of them high school students, dead or missing, and promised broad reforms to make her country a safer place.

title: New York Today: Here Comes the Rain
description: Good cloudy Tuesday morning to you.

title: Pro-Russian Militants Seize More Offices in Eastern Ukraine
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Pro-Russia militants seized more state offices in Ukraines troubled east on Tuesday, in apparent defiance of the latest Western sanctions announced against them and their presumed backers in the Kremlin, which also showed no sign of wilting in its worst confrontation with the West in decades.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: Daily Report: Yahoo Plans 2 TV-Style Comedy Series for Web
description: Yahoos chief executive, Marissa Mayer, is about to dive into the shark tank of television-style original video, Vindu Goel and Bill Carter report.

title: No One Cares About Economic Data Anymore. Thats Good News.
description: If people in your office seem to be tingling with excitement this week, it is probably because of all the big economic news on the way. The two biggest regular United States economic reports are scheduled to come out, with first-quarter gross domestic product on tap for Wednesday and April jobs numbers out on Friday. Federal Reserve policy makers are meeting Tuesday and Wednesday for one of their regular sessions to set the nations monetary policy. And a variety of other important data releases are coming, including personal income and spending, manufacturing and home prices.

title: Anonymous Chatting, Through a Simple Service
description: Secret, the popular mobile application, lets people share their deepest, darkest  and occasionally funniest  confessions anonymously, with their friends.

title: Sentenced to Death in Egypt
description: The Egyptian government has sentenced 680 people to execution.

title: Hong Kong Poll Shows Increasing Dissatisfaction With Beijing
description: For the first time in a decade, a majority of Hong Kongs residents most notably young people are dissatisfied with the way the central government in Beijing is overseeing its relations with the former British colony, a newly released poll showed.

title: South Carolina Resists as U.S. Seeks to Shut Down Disposal Site
description: WASHINGTON  As the Cold War ended, the United States and Russia agreed to each dispose of 34 tons of plutonium that was produced for use in nuclear weapons, with most of it being turned into fuel for civilian power reactors.

title: Settling the Bets of the Private-Equity Megadeals Golden Age
description: Updated, 8:49 p.m. | It has long been the $45 billion corporate buyout that should never have happened.

title: Intersection | Flatiron Functionality
description: In the Flatiron neighborhood of New York City, Aristotle Torres draws style inspiration from his childhood.

title: Tony Awards 2014: A Gentlemans Guide to Love & Murder, Hedwig and the Angry Inch Lead the Nominations Field
description: The nominations for the 68th Tony Awards were announced Tuesday morning in Manhattan. A Gentlemans Guide to Love & Murder led the Tony field with 10 nominations. Hedwig and the Angry Inch received eight, including one for its star, Neil Patrick Harris.

title: Europes Antitrust Chief Censures Googles Motorola Mobility Over Key Patents
description: BRUSSELS  Motorola Mobility broke European Union law by trying to wield unfair control over its basic patents for communications technologies used in smartphones and tablet computers, Europes antitrust chief said on Tuesday. But the commissioner did not fine the company, which is owned by Google.

title: British Economic Growth Accelerates in First Quarter
description: LONDON  Britains recovery continues to gather pace with official figures on Tuesday showing growth of 0.8 percent in the first quarter of the year, confirming the countrys place among the worlds fastest-growing developed economies.

title: Doximity, an Online Network for Doctors, Raises $54 Million
description: Facebook and LinkedIn have found success by gathering broad swaths of users. But several prominent investors are betting that a narrower focus can help a social network prosper.

title: Finding the Right Early Customers for a Start-Up
description: Before starting my technology company, Posse, I built a music management company in Australia. With each new artist, we would start from scratch with no profile, no fan base and no money to spend on marketing. Id work out how to develop a brand and how to reach the right community of early adopters.

title: In Our Pages: April 30
description: 1914: Neutralization of Oil Fields

title: SOLS, a 3-D Printing Start-Up, Raises $6.4 Million
description: Though SOLS Systems has begun to make a name for itself in the business of 3-D-printed custom orthotics, the start-up has bigger ambitions.

title: Airbnb Takes to the Barricades
description: A few weeks ago, the renegade Nevada cattle rancher Cliven Bundy became famous for challenging the authority of the federal Bureau of Land Management. He promptly drew many supporters, both on the ground and in the conservative media, before he derailed his cause with racist comments.

title: A New York Passover Story
description: Dear Diary:

title: A Failure in Texas
description: The troubled Texas utility Energy Future Holdings  which, as TXU, was private equitys biggest-ever buyout  filed for bankruptcy on Tuesday, Julie Creswell and Michael J. de la Merced write in DealBook. After months of on-again, off-again talks between the company, its owners and creditors, Energy Future Holdings went into Chapter 11 protection with a plan meant to avoid months in bankruptcy court in what will be one of the biggest Chapter 11 filings in history.

title: North Korea Lobs Shells Near Disputed Sea Border
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The North Korean military on Tuesday fired dozens of artillery shells near a disputed western sea border with South Korea, prompting thousands of South Korean islanders to flee to shelters.

title: The Hunt for False Equivalence
description: America, it goes without saying, has a powerful, crazy right wing. Theres nothing equivalent on the left  yes, there are individual crazy leftists, but nothing like the organized, lavishly financed madness on the right.

title: Dome it! Schools Can Affordably Survive Tornadoes
description: It had been very quiet in Americas tornado zone of late. But the deadly tornado outbreak Sunday night illustrated, once again, why its time for communitiesat riskto consider some new approaches to building  and learning  safely in harms way.

title: MOCA Hosts a Retrospective of Francesco Vezzolis Star-Studded Art
description: The old-Hollywood hangout Musso and Frank Grillwas an appropriate venue for a dinner last Friday celebrating Francesco Vezzolis new retrospective at the Los Angeles Museum of Contemporary Art. Decades ago, iconic stars of a screenera that has long inspired the artist from Charlie Chaplin to Greta Garbo  dined at the wood-paneled restaurants signature red booths. The Italian artist is perhaps most famous for his videos featuring stars like Michelle Williams and Natalie Portman; on Friday, a host of L.A. luminaries  including Bret Easton Ellis and Kate and Laura Mulleavy of Rodarte  turned out to show their support.

title: Top Officer of Barclays in America Is Leaving
description: For years, Barclays of Britain fought to become one of Wall Streets elite investment banks, including by buying the remains of Lehman Brothers American operations.

title: 6 Wounded in Shooting at FedEx Warehouse in Georgia
description: A 19-year-old package handler at a FedEx warehouse in a suburb of Atlanta opened fire there on Tuesday morning, injuring six people before killing himself, the police said.

title: 2014 Tony Award Nominations
description: Scenes from nominated musicals and plays.

title: Tealium, an Ad Technology Start-Up, Raises $20 Million From Silver Lake
description: A start-up that focuses on the not-so-visible business of tagging Internet ads has secured support from a big Silicon Valley investment firm.

title: In Performance: Tyne Daly
description: A scene from Terrence McNallys play Mothers and Sons, featuring Tyne Daly in her Tony Award-nominated performance. The show, which also received a Tony nomination, is at the Golden Theater.

title: Big Chinese Pork Producer Cancels Its $1.9 Billion I.P.O.
description: HONG KONG  The WH Group of China, the worlds biggest pork producer, decided on Tuesday to cancel its $1.9 billion initial public offering of stock in Hong Kong because of lackluster demand.

title: In Performance: Tyne Daly of Mothers and Sons
description: This weeks video is a scene from the Broadway play Mothers and Sons, which today received two Tony Award nominations: for the actress Tyne Daly and the playwright Terrence McNally. Ms. Daly portrays Katharine Gerard, a widow who travels to New York to visit Cal, the former partner of her son Andre, who died of AIDS several years prior, and Cals new husband, Will. In this scene Katharine, who lives in Dallas, explains why shes angry about almost everything. The show, directed by Sheryl Kaller, is at the Golden Theater.

title: 2014 Tony Award Nominations
description: Scenes from nominated musicals and plays.

title: Pro-Assad Areas Are Attacked in Syria, Pointing to Election Trouble
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  More than 50 people were killed in bomb, mortar and rocket attacks in government-controlled areas of Syria on Tuesday, as the international chemical weapons monitoring group declared that it was sending inspectors to the country to investigate suspected use of chlorine gas.

title: Where Tornadoes Are a Known Danger, the One That Hits Home Still Stuns
description: LOUISVILLE, Miss.  Ilene Estes sorted through the rubble atop a concrete slab here that used to be her home of 46 years. Like thousands of others in the South whose homes and lives have been devastated by a series of deadly tornadoes this week, she was stunned and weary. Even in parts of the country where tornadoes are commonplace, when they directly hit your street, they are uncommon terrors, their savagery discovered as if for the first time.

title: New Group Aims to Increase Number of Women in Management
description: A group of about two dozen chief executives and corporate leaders of major companies, along with the billionaire investor Warren E. Buffett, are joining together to push American companies to voluntarily bolster the number of women in company management, especially senior leadership.

title: Tony Awards Ballot
description: Make your picks below for the 68th annual Tony Awards, honoring Broadways best. The awards ceremony, which will take place in New York on June 8, will be broadcast on CBS.

title: Rent Too High? Move to Singapore
description: Anyone in the market for a luxury apartment in Hong Kong, London or Washington toward the end of last year was in luck. The rents on prime flats were sagging a bit. Billionaires could lock in leases on pieds--terre at a slight discount. You might suppose that those savings would trickle down to regular working Joes, but no  middle-market rents in those cities continued their apparently inexorable upward march.

title: Mike Leigh to Direct Pirates of Penzance for English National Opera
description: More than a few music fans who saw Mike Leighs 1999 film Topsy-Turvy, about Gilbert and Sullivans creation of The Mikado, have wondered what Mr. Leigh might do if he ever got the chance to stage one of their operettas. Now they will find out: the English National Opera announced Tuesday that Mr. Leigh would direct The Pirates of Penzance next season.

title: Alliance Battles to Save Fannie and Freddie
description: Updated, 8:31 p.m. | The investor Bruce R. Berkowitz is providing seed money for a new group that is running advertisements in newspapers and on television to support Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, the government-sponsored mortgage finance companies that lawmakers are trying to wind down.

title: Market Report | Busy Bodies
description: With splashy prints that are artfully tropical, the classic one-piece is no longer just for conservative moms.

title: Why Pikettys Book Is a Bigger Deal in America Than in France
description: The American response to Thomas Pikettys new book on inequality has been rapturous, with reviews comparing the author, a French economist, to Adam Smith, John Maynard Keynes and Karl Marx.

title: Editorial Contest Winner | Intelligence Over Diversity
description: Below, an essay by Ashley K., one of the Top 10 winners of our Student Editorial Contest

title: 90 and Facing Eviction
description: Last month, 90-year-old Bella Hornung received an eviction notice from her assisted-living home in Brooklyn. She is determined to stay as long as possible, though aware that her options are dwindling.

title: Senate Panel Approves Nominees to Help Fill Fed
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate Banking Committee on Tuesday approved the nominations of Stanley Fischer and Lael Brainard to join the Federal Reserves depleted board, and it approved the nomination of Jerome H. Powell to a new term.

title: Up in Years and All but Priced Out of New York
description: Nubia Chavez and Manuel Acua have been bouncing from rental to rental around New York City like millennials. They recently decamped to a $700-a-month room in a Queens apartment, with a shared bathroom and no access to the kitchen except to make coffee.

title: More Severe Weather After Deadly Tornado Outbreak
description: At least 11 people died Monday in Alabama, Mississippi and Tennessee after a powerful storm system spawned multiple tornadoes and ripped across several states in the South, bringing the total death toll from the severe weather to more than two dozen people since Sunday, as our colleagues report.

title: The Gun Report: April 29, 2014
description: Guns are being traded for drugs in Vermont and Massachusetts, and it has law enforcement worried, the Boston Globe reports. Vermont is grappling with a heroin epidemic that started for many as a prescription drug habit, and Massachusetts has tough gun laws, creating a toxic opportunity.

title: Stop Worrying and Enjoy Rising Wages
description: The Federal Reserves Open Market Committee is meeting this week, and if I may slightly tweak the hit song from the Disney movie Frozen so that its more relevant to monetary policy:

title: Justices Back Rule Limiting Coal Pollution
description: WASHINGTON  In a major victory for the Obama administration, the Supreme Court on Tuesday upheld the authority of the Environmental Protection Agency to regulate the smog from coal plants that drifts across state lines from 28 Midwestern and Appalachian states to the East Coast.

title: If You Think Preschools Bad, Just Wait Until Kindergarten
description: I pushed the stroller into our packed elevator. Did you decide on school? a neighbor asked, smiling at Zee. But before I could nod, she went on, cackling, If you think preschools bad, just wait until kindergarten.

title: Why Is It So Hard to Capture the Writers Life on Film?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. Thomas Mallon and Dana Stevens discuss the difficulties of conveying what writers do on film.

title: More Catholic Than the Pope?
description: My Sunday column used the double canonization of two of his predecessors to discuss some of the perils awaiting Pope Francis as his pontificate advances, and it concluded with a fairly stark claim: Some of the proposals on divorce, remarriage and communion that have been put forward by prominent figures in the church, I wrote,might lead to schism if the pope were to adopt and implement them.

title: South Korea President Apologizes
description: President Park Geun-hye of South Korea apologized for failing to prevent a ferry disaster that left 302 people dead or missing and announced broad reforms to make the country safer.

title: What Are Tonys Saying by Ignoring Realistic Joneses?
description: Its a scandal! Its an outrage! And its utterly predictable.

title: Today in Small Business: More Frightening Than Skydiving
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Obama on Foreign Policy Approach in Asia
description: President Obama defended his strategy, saying disputes must be resolved peacefully and not by intimidation or force.

title: Following K.K.R. on Twitter
description: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts, the oldest of the giant private equity firms, is dipping a toe into social media.

title: How the Struggles of Boys Play Into the Still Sputtering Economy
description: At The Upshot, David Leonhardt links fidgety boys with the poorly functioning economy:

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 44
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: Taking On a Pothole Law: In Winter, New York State Rejects Drivers Claims
description: Thomas J. Abinanti, a Democratic assemblyman from Westchester County, was driving to Albany on the Taconic State Parkway in January when his car struck a pothole. He made it to the capital, but the tire had to be replaced. A few weeks later, he hit another pothole, this one on Interstate 95. Limping off the exit ramp in Mamaroneck on the dented rim, he pulled into a nearby gas station.

title: 92nd Street Y Names Two Leaders
description: The 92nd Street Y on Tuesday announced two new major leadership appointments. Henry Timms will become its new executive director and Rabbi Peter J. Rubinstein will become director of Jewish community and the Bronfman Center for Jewish Life.

title: The Folly of Prudence
description: Many American roads are in pretty bad shape  I can attest to that, after driving up to Massachusetts and back for family business last week. When you combine that fact with the underlying macroeconomic situation, of which more in a minute, the case for spending substantial sums on repair seems obvious.

title: British Parliament Berates Officials on Royal Mail I.P.O.
description: LONDON  Usually it is falling stock prices after initial public offerings that cause headaches for bankers and business executives. In the case of Britains Royal Mail, it is the companys soaring value that has ignited outrage.

title: Money Talks. Especially Boehners.
description: Some House Republicans may feel they have good reason to oust John Boehner as Speaker next year, but there is at least one good reason not to: fund-raising. Mr. Boehner has been an increasingly important source of money for the National Republican Congressional Committee, the party wing that helps the G.O.P. maintain (and increase) its House majority.

title: After Deriding G.O.P. on Immigration Bill, Boehner Shifts His Aim to Obama
description: WASHINGTON  A week after mocking his Republican troops over their resistance to an immigration bill, Speaker John A. Boehner returned to Capitol Hill on Tuesday with a different message: Any movement on an overhaul will depend on a new White House attitude toward Republicans in Congress.

title: Image of the Day: April 29
Pfizer Most Likely Just the Tip of the Tax Sword
description: Pfizers $99 billion tax arbitrage bid will encourage copycats. The biggest charm of the United States drug giants offer for AstraZeneca of Britain lies in switching to a lower-tax domicile. The latest and largest such deal to hit the headlines raises the odds Congress will tighten rules  but not yet.

title: For Obama, a Familiar Region With Familiar Troubles
description: MANILA  For President Obama, a visit to Southeast Asia is a homecoming of sorts. Nowhere was that more evident than in the town-hall-style meeting he conducted on Sunday in the Malaysian capital Kuala Lumpur with young people from across the region.

title: Santander Offers $6.5 Billion to Buy the Rest of Its Brazil Unit
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Banco Santander announced on Tuesday a deal to acquire the 25 percent of its Brazilian unit, Santander Brasil, that it does not already own for 4.69 billion euros, or $6.52 billion.

title: European Union Demand Lifts Gazprom Earnings
description: MOSCOW  Gazprom, Russias largest company, reported Tuesday a solid showing for its yearly earnings, which were up 10 percent in 2013, with most of the increase attributable to growing demand in the European Union.

title: Instead of Saving for College, We Invested in Our Kids
description: This spring break, I sent my 17-year-old-son and his dad off on a three-state college tour with a dozen hard-boiled eggs, a rolled-up tent and tears.

title: Even When Expecting Tornadoes, People Dont Plan Well
description: The recent rash of tornadoes and deadly storms was not unexpected. It is, after all, peak season in the South and Midwest for tornadoes. Polling shows that large numbers of people living in these regions recognize that their communities are liable to be hit by a natural disaster, but most dont have an emergency plan or an emergency supply kit for their families.

title: N.B.A. Bars Clippers Owner Donald Sterling for Life
description: LOS ANGELES  The National Basketball Association on Tuesday handed a lifetime ban to the longtime Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling, an extraordinary step in professional sports and one intended to rid the league of Mr. Sterling after he was recorded making racist comments.

title: Art Matters | An Exhibition and Video Puts Art in the Hands of the Beholder
description: In 1919, Marcel Duchamp changed the course of art history when his sister Suzanne got married. Instead of mailing her a porcelain tea set or personalized table linens, the impish Duchamp sent several pages of text: a set of instructions that told Suzanne how to create the wedding present he imagined. (She was directed to hang a geometry textbook by strings from the balcony so that the wind could choose its own problems.) Since then, artists like Yoko Ono and Lawrence Weiner have taken Duchamps lead and run with it  making art by telling their audience what to do.

title: Virginia Attorney General Opens In-State Tuition to Students Brought to U.S. Illegally
description: Attorney General Mark R. Herring of Virginia told the states public colleges and universities on Tuesday that children brought to the United States illegally and raised here, the so-called Dreamers, qualified for in-state tuition.

title: Crunching the Numbers to Find the Best Airfare
description: You may have heard that the best day to buy an airline ticket is a Tuesday.

title: Hotel Review: Belmond El Encanto in Santa Barbara, Calif.
description: Rates

title: Restaurant Report: Ristorante Oreade in Castiglioncello del Trinoro, Italy
description: Tuscanys food scene has never left visitors wanting improvement, but that hasnt stopped local restaurateurs from striving for it. One recent addition, Ristorante Oreade, which opened last summer, is evidence that Tuscan cuisine  from food quality and presentation to restaurant design  can be lifted higher.

title: Britain Outlines Stress Test for Its Banks
description: Imagine that things started to look very gloomy in Britain. The value of the pound falls, inflation rises, interest rates spike to 4 percent. The economy shrinks by 3.5 percent, unemployment reaches 12 percent, and housing prices fall 35 percent, with commercial real estate declining 30 percent. Stocks and bonds weaken and bank funding dries up.

title: Military Aid for Egyptians Loses Support in the Senate
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Patrick J. Leahy, chairman of the Senate subcommittee that oversees foreign aid, said Tuesday that he would not support additional military aid to Egypt in the wake of mass death sentences handed out by Egyptian courts this week, adding significant pressure on the Obama administration to shift course.

title: Times Minute | Tony Award Nominations
description: On the Minute, the theater reporter Patrick Healy breaks down the nominees for the 68th Tony Awards. Find out who was nominated and who got snubbed.

title: Times Minute | Tony Award Nominations
description: In the Video

title: Ai Weiwei Erased From Show in Shanghai
description: The name and works of Ai Weiwei have been removed from a show in Shanghai about the history of Chinese contemporary art because of pressure from local government cultural officials, according to Mr. Ai and Uli Sigg, a Swiss art collector who helped organize the exhibition. Mr. Ai said he thought the move was in response to his vocal criticism of the Chinese government.

title: Revisiting the Racial Gap in N.B.A. Coaching Tenure
description: With race and professional basketball in the news again, we thought it was a good time to revisit an article that Ford Fessenden and I wrote for The Times in 2005. Id welcome thoughts and predictions on patterns in the last decade and in the future. Here are excerpts from the article:

title: A Gust of Sesame and Saffron
description: When Ghaya Oliveira was appointed head pastry chef for the restaurant empire of Daniel Boulud, she began a stealth campaign. As she constructed new desserts for Daniel, the very French flagship in a very upscale ZIP code, she started to sneak in the flavors of her childhood in Tunisia: jasmine and sesame, rosewater and saffron.

title: Listen Up | More Fearless Storytelling from Sharon Van Etten
description: The first song on the singer-songwriter Sharon Van Ettens thrilling new album, Are We There, out May 27, features this refrain: I need you/to be afraid of nothing. She might, perhaps, be referring to herself. Van Ettens songwriting shows little traces of fear, setting matter-of-fact descriptions of awfully complicated emotions against deceptively simple verse structures. The songs are brave, and bravely unflashy. And that voice of hers  gritty, lilting, with phrasing that suggests that efforts to reveal herself cause just as much of herself to hide  sounds not merely fearless but unafraid of fear itself.

title: No Comment Necessary: Scott Browns Take on Obamacare
description: Like confused poll respondents, Scott Brown, the former Massachusetts Senator whos running for Senate in New Hampshire, says he thinks the Affordable Care Act is disastrous, but seems to like everything it does.

title: A Corporate Paean to Frank Lloyd Wright
description: RACINE, Wis.  If anything is eternal in real estate, it is the dance of desire that exists between chief executives and their architects.

title: Company Polishes Its Frank Lloyd Wright Collection
description: This week a portion of the Research Tower designed by Frank Lloyd Wright at the headquarters of S.C. Johnson in Racine, Wis., will reopen as a museum. The project is part of an eight-year effort by the company to restore its Wright campus.

title: After Data Breach, Target Plans to Issue More Secure Chip-and-PIN Cards
description: Still pushing to right itself after an enormous data breach by cybercriminals, Target announced on Tuesday that it would switch its debit and credit cards over to a more secure technology by early next year, most likely making it the first major retailer in the country to do so.

title: Justices Appear Divided on Cellphone Warrants
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday seemed torn as it considered a pair of cases about whether the police need warrants to search the cellphones of people they arrest.

title: Jaclyn Moriarty Talks About Cracks in the Kingdom
description: Jaclyn Moriarty, an Australian writer of young-adult fiction, has just published The Cracks in the Kingdom, the second volume in her lively and engaging Colors of Madeleine trilogy. Book 1, A Corner of White, was a Boston Globe-Horn Book honor title. The novels tell the story of a girl named Madeleine, who lives in our world, and a boy named Elliot, who lives in the Kingdom of Cello. They begin writing letters to each other through a crack that opens between their worlds  a crack in a parking meter.

title: Up for Discussion: Why Have an Advisory Board?
description: At the most recent meeting of the She Owns It business group, the owners continued their discussion of advisory boards.

title: Middle Eastern Ingredients | Tahini
description: Rawia Bishara, the chef and owner of Tanoreen, discusses tahini made from sesame, one of the most universal flavors of the Middle East and the base for many of its staples.

title: Middle Eastern Ingredients | Zaatar
description: Lior Lev Sercarz, a New York spice purveyor, demonstrates how to prepare zaatar, a fundamental Middle Eastern seasoning.

title: Middle Eastern Ingredients | Yogurt
description: Ghaya Oliveira, the executive pastry chef at Daniel, discusses using yogurt as a sweet ingredient in Middle Eastern-influenced desserts.

title: Before Watchdog Mission, a Trail of Videos Warned of Chlorine Gas Attacks in Syria
description: Syrian activists have been posting multiple videos in the past few weeks showing civilians at medical facilities in the village of Kafr Zita coughing and struggling to breathe, with the narrators during the footage identifying the cause of their condition as coming from the use of chlorine gas bombs.

title: One Execution Botched, Oklahoma Delays the Next
description: McALESTER, Okla.  What was supposed to be the first of two executions here on Tuesday night was halted when the prisoner, Clayton D. Lockett, began to writhe and gasp after he had already been declared unconscious and called out oh, man, according to witnesses.

title: Cast Is Announced for Next Star Wars Film
description: LOS ANGELES  After months of fan speculation, J.J. Abrams on Tuesday finally switched off the cloaking devices protecting the identities of his Star Wars cast members. Seven newcomers and six stalwarts will star in the seventh installment of the space epic, which is scheduled for release in theaters in December 2015.

title: Standing on the Sidelines With Virtual Reality
description: LOS ANGELES  D.J. Roller, a filmmaker and explorer, has captured videos of sharks, taken cameras under the Antarctic ice, and documented the discovery of the remains of a Tyrannosaurus Rex.

title: N.B.A. Bars Clippers Owner for Life
description: The league commissioner, Adam Silver, called remarks by the Los Angeles Clippers owner, Donald Sterling, deeply offensive and harmful.

title: Turks to Seek Extradition of Preacher Living in U.S.
description: ISTANBUL  Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan said Tuesday that Turkey would officially request that the United States extradite Fethullah Gulen, a Turkish preacher in Pennsylvania whose network of followers has been accused of trying to undercut Mr. Erdogans government through a corruption scandal.

title: Mercedes Recalls 253,000 C-Class Cars for Fire Hazard
description: Following an investigation by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, Mercedes-Benz is recalling about 253,000 C-Class cars from the 2008-11 model years because the taillights could fail, according to a report the automaker posted Tuesday on the safety agencys website.

title: Godzillas Back, With Moral Authority
description: There are at least three versions of Godzilla stalking the landscape this Spring. Theres the campy, frat-boy Godzilla who parties and water skis in the Snickers candy bar commercial. Theres the apocalyptic, computer-generated terror who roars at us with a gale-force voice in the trailers for the Hollywood blockbuster due out next month. And making its way quietly through select theaters across the country is the 60th anniversary restoration of the original Godzilla classic  featuring a mere actor in a latex monster suit.

title: Dudamel & Adams: Resurrection
description: Part 11: John Adams recalls writing the final scene of The Gospel According to the Other Mary.

title: Dudamel & Adams: Unrest in Venezuela
description: Part 10: Gustavo Dudamel reflects on the political situation and street protests in Venezuela.

title: Dudamel & Adams: Crucifixion
description: Part 9: John Adams talks about composing for chorus and explains how The Gospel According to the Other Mary was influenced by current events.

title: Dudamel & Adams: El Sistema
description: Part 8: Gustavo Dudamel explains the impact that Venezuelas El Sistema program had on him, and talks about the programs continuing impact on the world of classical music.

title: Dudamel & Adams: Passover
description: Part 7: The composer and conductor discuss the passage from Gospel that incorporates the Primo Levi poem Passover.

title: Dudamel & Adams: The Performers
description: Part 6: John Adams talks about the vocalists and dancers who perform in the staged version of The Gospel According to the Other Mary.

title: Dudamel & Adams: Hard to Play
description: Part 5: The composer and conductor discuss Adams tendency to compose music that deliberately offsets the slickness and skill of the musicians performing it.

title: Dudamel & Adams: A Living Composer
description: Part 4: The composer and conductor talk about how The Gospel According to the Other Mary evolved over several performances.

title: Dudamel & Adams: The Timeless Past
description: Part 3: John Adams explains how classical music can elevate a conventional story to relevance and even timelessness.

title: Dudamel & Adams: Collaborators
description: Part 2: The composer and conductor recall the origins of their collaborative relationship.

title: Dudamel & Adams: Intro
description: Part 1: Carol Olsen Day, director of TimesTalks, introduces the conductor Gustavo Dudamel and the composer John Adams.

title: TimesTalks | Dudamel & Adams: Preview
description: The conductor Gustavo Dudamel and composer John Adams discuss their collaboration on the oratorio The Gospel According to the Other Mary.

title: Daniel Radcliffe: My Favorite Scene
description: Part 16: The actor reveals his favorite scene in the entire Harry Potter series, and explains why acting in CGI-heavy films is easier for younger actors than it is for older actors.

title: Daniel Radcliffe: Preparation
description: Part 15: The actor recalls how he prepared as a singer for his role in the stage musical How To Succeed in Business Without Really Trying.

title: Daniel Radcliffe: Directors
description: Part 14: The actor reflects on the experience of working with several different directors over the course of the Harry Potter series.

title: Daniel Radcliffe: Tough Characters
description: Part 13: The actor describes how he connects with challenging roles.

title: Top Cable Lobbyist Argues Against Broadband as Utility
description: Americas infrastructure is crumbling, says Michael Powell, the chief executive of the cable industrys trade association. Roads are in poor condition, bridges are structurally deficient, drinking water systems are near the end of their useful life and portions of the electric grid suffer regular blackouts.

title: Daniel Radcliffe: What If
description: Part 12: The actor discusses his upcoming film What If.

title: Daniel Radcliffe: The Best Potter Film
description: Part 11: The actor reveals his favorite and least favorite Harry Potter films.

title: Daniel Radcliffe: Azkaban
description: Part 10: The actor reflects on the role that Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban played in his own development and career.

title: Daniel Radcliffe: Mentors
description: Part 9: The actor recalls what he learned working alongside the veteran performers in the Harry Potter series.

title: Daniel Radcliffe: Kill Your Darlings
description: Part 8: The actor talks about his film Kill Your Darlings.

title: Daniel Radcliffe: Inspirations
description: Part 7: The actor shares who he thinks has influenced his career the most.

title: Daniel Radcliffe: The Woman in Black
description: Part 6: The actor discusses his film The Woman in Black.

title: Keeping Track: Air Pollution and Drones
description: A Limit on Out-of-State Soot

title: Daniel Radcliffe: Different Every Night
description: Part 5: The actor explains how his experiences in theater have changed him as a performer.

title: Daniel Radcliffe: After Potter
description: Part 4: The actor talks about transitioning away from the Harry Potter role and finding himself as an adult actor.

title: Daniel Radcliffe: Cripple of Inishmaan
description: Part 3: The actor reflects on living in New York City, and talks about why he chose The Cripple of Inishmaan for his next project.

title: Daniel Radcliffe: The Broadway Community
description: Part 2: The actor recalls what drew him to theater acting, and explains the difference between American and British theater.

title: Daniel Radcliffe: Intro
description: Part 1: Carol Olsen Day, director of TimesTalks, introduces the actor Daniel Radcliffe.

title: TimesTalks | Daniel Radcliffe: Preview
description: The actor talks about his post-Harry Potter career and his new play, The Cripple of Inishmaan.

title: Alliant Techsystems Break-Up and the Return of the Morris Trust
description: Its rare enough to see companies use the reverse Morris trust, a somewhat esoteric corporate finance maneuver used to cut down on taxes in a merger. But it warmed DealBooks heart on Tuesday to see a company use the even less common Morris trust.

title: The Quirk That Bolsters Allergans Defense
description: In the $45.6 billion takeover battle for Allergan, there has been much speculation about what will be the next steps.

title: Pfizers Move Poses Challenge. Heres a Solution.
description: This is what strange behavior our corporate tax policy produces: The pharmaceutical company Pfizer has offered $100 billion to buy AstraZeneca, a British competitor, and avoiding taxes has a lot to do with it.

title: Shirley
description: Shirley Austin speaks about how her therapy dog has helped her.

title: The Voices of Schizophrenia
description: Amber (who did not disclose her last name,) talks about how the voices of schizophrenia impact her life.

title: Alice
description: Alice finds that painting helps her deal with the stress of schizophrenia.

title: A Texas Bankruptcy Seeks a Home in Delaware
description: Energy Future Holdings, the big Texas utility company formerly known as TXU, and its myriad related companies filed their Chapter 11 bankruptcy petitions in Wilmington, Del., on Tuesday morning.

title: A Grande Dame Branches Out
description: The day of reckoning came on a recent Tuesday for the tacos, enchiladas verdes, cactus salad and pork posole served at Tortilleria Nixtamal in Corona, Queens.

title: Battery Park City: Quasi-Suburban
description: Battery Park City, the 92-acre planned community developed since 1980 on landfill along the west side of Lower Manhattan, is for many New Yorkers akin to a new guest bedroom added to the side of a beloved old house. Its sleeker and more functional than the main residence, but it lacks the character and inspired disorder of the creaky old place, and you never set foot in there without a very specific reason.

title: Bending Tradition, and Bowing to It
description: The chef calls this one the gun, because it hits you, our server at Cagen said promisingly as she set the nights last bite, a stubby little handroll, on the table. Glossy and dark, it looked, if you had a suggestible turn of mind, something like the barrel of a snub-nose revolver, with a metallic sheen it got from its seaweed wrapper, a rare blend of green and black kelp. The gunpowder was inside: an extra-hot, nostril-punishing slug of wasabi implanted alongside strands of sweet squash, waiting to go off when I bit into it.

title: How Tax Laws Distort the Pfizer Deal
description: The United States tax code is fueling Pfizer Inc.s $98.7 billion bid to take over the London-based pharmaceutical company AstraZeneca. If the deal goes through as proposed, a new parent company in Britain would own the combined entity, making it easier for the new firm to strip income out of its American tax base. The deal is one of several recent transactions known as inversions, where a multinational company like Pfizer, based in New York, becomes an expatriate by acquiring a smaller foreign target.

title: Vancouver Art Gallery Names New Buildings Designer
description: The Vancouver Art Gallery has selected Herzog & de Meuron to design its new and expanded home in downtown Vancouver, the gallery announced on Tuesday. The new building, which doubles the museums current space, will be the Swiss architects first project in Canada.

title: Heroin and Alcohol Led to the Deaths of Ex-SEALs
description: The authorities in the Seychelles said Tuesday that they had determined that a combination of heroin and alcohol was responsible for the deaths of two former members of the Navy SEALs working as guards on board a container ship in February.

title: Reaction to Donald Sterlings Punishment
description: N.B.A. players have a publicly united message for Adam Silver, the leagues new commissioner: Thanks, boss.

title: The Velocity of Autumn to Close
description: The new Broadway play The Velocity of Autumn will close on Sunday after just four and a half weeks of performances, the producers announced on Tuesday.

title: Decoy Opens Beneath RedFarm in the West Village
description: Headliner

title: Baseball, Happiness and Immigration: Exploring American Society and History With New York Times Maps
description: Like other images  whether photographs, charts or graphs  maps can tell a complicated story.

title: Raw Feelings, With an Aesthetic of Navet
description: Frankie Cosmoss songs are alive with the raw pink of new feeling, tender to the touch. Im the kind of girl buses splash with rain were the first words she sang on Monday night at Glasslands Gallery, and she didnt even look that sad about it, because just being aware had its own power.

title: Hot Flashes? Great News.
description: Most male directors would think twice before wading into a comedy about menopause, but not Henry Jaglom. For his 19th film, The M Word, this warmly humane and unfailingly indulgent observer of women and their distractions  as celebrated in Babyfever (1994) and Going Shopping (2005)  proves as comfortable with hot flashes as with cooling desire.

title: A Circle of Composers, Intimate and Epic
description: There is an operatic quality coursing through the work of the Second Empire sculptor Jean-Baptiste Carpeaux (1827-75), the subject of a powerful exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, through May 26, that inspired a concert of French vocal music at the museum on Saturday evening.

title: An Indie Spirits Shop, a History Book on Ramen, Real Baby Carrots and More
description: To Shop: Independent Spirits With a Story to Tell

title: Celebrating Higher Powers With Performers Here on Earth
description: Dancing the Gods, an annual festival of Indian dance presented by the World Music Institute, has a record of attracting some truly godlike dancers. In the first year, there were Rama Vaidyanathan and Shantala Shivalingappa. Then came Surupa Sen and Bijayini Satpathy (who, it happens, will perform in an unrelated concert at Baryshnikov Arts Center on Thursday and Friday). These are all stars, dazzling and recognized.

title: Wheelies: The Solo Alfa Romeo Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Withdrawn Chinese I.P.O. Is the Least Bad Outcome
description: This little piggy isnt going to the market after all.

title: N.B.A. Players, Coaches and Executives React on Social Media to Sterlings Ban
description: On Facebook  and Twitter, N.B.A. players, coaches and executives heaped praise on Adam Silver, the leagues new commissioner, for his decision to ban the Los Angeles Clippers owner, Donald Sterling, for making racist remarks that became public in an audio recording.

title: U.S. Announces Actions to Enforce Iran Sanctions
description: The United States government escalated enforcement of its Iran sanctions on Tuesday, adding eight Chinese companies, a Dubai company and two Dubai-based executives to blacklists for evading American restrictions on Iranian weapons, oil and banking transactions.

title: Alstoms Board Is Said to Back $13 Billion G.E. Bid for Energy Unit
description: The board of Alstom, the French industrial giant, voted on Tuesday to accept General Electrics bid for its power and energy unit, people briefed on the matter said.

title: Boehner Recasts Immigration Blame
description: Speaker John A. Boehner addressed the comments he made about the G.O.P. and immigration and said any movement forward on immigration hinged on President Obamas attitude toward Republicans.

title: Chinas Ruling Party Expels and Investigates Official
description: HONG KONG  Chinas Communist Party has authorized a criminal investigation of Li Chuncheng, a disgraced senior official who was close to Zhou Yongkang, the former domestic security chief at the heart of an extensive graft inquiry.

title: Definitely Not a Groupie, but Always With the Band
description: There are a pair of sentences on the first page of Lisa Robinsons memoir, There Goes Gravity: A Life in Rock and Roll, that make you think her book is going to be a gift, in a Nora Ephron meets Chrissie Hynde sort of way.

title: Blast in Gaza Damages Boat Meant for Protest
description: GAZA  An explosion before dawn on Tuesday partially sank a small boat that Palestinian and foreign activists were planning to use to challenge the Israeli-imposed naval blockade of the Gaza Strip. Organizers of the protest said they suspected sabotage. The boat, Gazas Ark, an old fishing trawler refurbished as a cargo vessel, was docked in the Gaza harbor used by fishermen. In a statement, the organizers said a security guard received an anonymous phone call warning him to leave the boat shortly before the explosion. Palestinian fishing boats are permitted to sail up to six nautical miles from the coast under Israeli restrictions. The boat was scheduled to sail in June from Gaza to European ports carrying Palestinian goods for export. Attempts to breach the blockade have usually involved boats trying to sail to Gaza. In 2010, Israeli naval commandos killed nine activists during a raid at sea on a Turkish vessel after clashes broke out on board.

title: A Bag in the Overhead Bin? Theres a Charge for That
description: Looking to save money on a flight? Pack light.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: Whats In It | Veggie Blend-Ins
description: Green Giant Veggie Blend-Ins offer vegetables in pured form to those who routinely avoid them. Are there any potential pitfalls?

title: Stealth Vegetables
description: For years, the government has been urging Americans to eat more vegetables for better health, with little to show for the effort. Consumption has been stuck at barely half the recommended amount. Now, from private enterprise, come two very different strategies. One aims to make vegetables more attractive and easier to use. The other would actually make them less visible, slipping them into other foods.

title: A Marathon Performance (Aches, Too)
description: The music of Morton Feldman, for me, is like an acquaintance you dont really click with but whose virtues you can appreciate in small doses. I can admire Feldmans spare, slow-moving aesthetic in moderation, but I find his larger works unbearably tedious. And large, by Feldman standards, is gigantic: His String Quartet No. 2 lasts around six hours. When I learned Id been assigned to review a performance of the piece, I had a brief vision of being trapped in a never-ending Feldman loop, a sort of Sartrean aural damnation.

title: Revenue Up at Twitter, but Growth Is a Worry
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Twitter is struggling to convince Wall Street that it is still a company with plenty of potential to grow.

title: Prana Living, Yoga Gear Maker, Is Sold to Columbia Sportswear
description: As more Americans practice yoga, a booming market has sprung up for stretchy pants designed to accommodate poses like downward dog.

title: Behind Focus on College Assaults, a Steady Drumbeat by Students
description: WASHINGTON  In March, two women who were sexually assaulted when they were students at the University of North Carolina arrived unannounced at the office of Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand with a request: Help us stop sexual assault on college campuses.

title: The N.B.A. Shifts to Maximum Outrage
description: The N.B.A.s decision to ban Donald Sterling for life  to be followed shortly by the deletion of the Los Angeles Clippers from the Sterling family of mismanaged properties  was all the more impressive because of the huge reversal it represented. After decades of neglect regarding Mr. Sterlings well-documented racial attitudes, the league suddenly threw everything it could find at him, the maximum penalty, the maximum fine, the maximum language of official fury.

title: Pictures of the Day: South Korea and Elsewhere
description: South Korea and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Real Madrid Routs Bayern Munich in Champions League
description: MUNICH  Cristiano Ronaldo sprinted toward the end line, his arms shaking and his eyes wide. Suddenly he stopped in front of a wall of Bayern Munich fans at the Allianz Arena, and held up 10 fingers. Then he dropped one hand and raised five fingers again.

title: Artists Hold Up a Glass to a Citys Changing Face
description: The idea of a Dan Graham pavilion in the Metropolitan Museum of Arts roof garden is so obvious, so perfect, that it really should have happened years ago. But late is better than never, and Mr. Grahams execution of the project more than makes up for lost time.

title: Pictures of the Day: South Korea and Elsewhere
description: Photos from South Korea, Philippines, Washington and Mississippi.

title: For the Whitneys Move, Boxes and Burly Men Just Wont Do
description: Anyone who has ever unwrapped a chipped piece of Wedgwood understands the headaches and peril associated with moving.

title: For a New Mother, an Illness and a Legacy
description: Tucked into the program for Oni Faida Lampleys Tough Titty, at the Paradise Factory Theater, is a pamphlet for a major breast cancer research charity, which brings to mind an early scene in this mordantly funny, quietly wrenching, semi-autobiographical play.

title: Unfinished Revolution: The Artists Soldier On
description: KIEV, Ukraine  The National Art Museum of Ukraine has just opened an exhibition of objects from the compound of former President Viktor F. Yanukovych, including a folk-art portrait of him made of poppy seeds and beans. A folk-rock group, all women, performs a raucous cabaret at night, while other artists busily produce videos about the aftermath of the mass uprising.

title: A Shot. A Man Falls, Clutching His Chest ... Etc.
description: Eugene ONeill  what a bully! His stage directions go on for pages at a time, dictating every aspect of a plays set, costumes and performance.

title: Fieldwork of Total Immersion
description: When newly minted Ph.D.s go on the job market, they usually have questions about the teaching load, research money and tenure prospects.

title: The Push to Regulate the Sharing Economy
description: To the Editor:

title: The Road to a Fast Track on the Web
Billing for Physical Therapy
description: To the Editor:

title: Standards for Power Plants
description: To the Editor:

title: Middle-Class Prosperity
description: To the Editor:

title: Tony Nominations Spread Across a Wide Stage
description: The major races for Broadways Tony Awards will be unusually wide-open this spring, with the nominations, announced on Tuesday, showing more love for Shakespeare than for Hollywood and for popular songs by Carole King and Duke Ellington than for original musicals. Ambitiously conceived productions like Rocky and If/Then fared poorly, and some of the seasons most praised performers  including the boldface names Daniel Radcliffe and Denzel Washington  were edged out.

title: A $15 Minimum Wage
description: To the Editor:

title: Ball Is in the N.B.A. Owners Court
description: Its the owners ball now. They are on the clock. Shame on them if they do not run the play that sends Donald Sterling out the N.B.A.s back door within the procedural equivalent of a 24-second possession.

title: Yahoo Chiefs Pay Tied to Another Companys Performance
description: Marissa Mayer has hit it big in the executive compensation lottery.

title: A new bill will make it easier to spot wasteful federal spending.
description: In a year or three. The House and Senate this week unanimously approved a bill  the Digital Accountability and Transparency Act (DATA Act)  that will provide detailed information to the public on federal programs and checkbook-level payments for both internal agency spending and outside grants and contracts. Thats a big deal for researchers and watchdogs  when the changes show up on USASpending.gov.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: Peter B. Hennessy
description: Mr. Hennessy, 53, is the president for the tristate region at Cassidy Turley, a commercial real estate services company that was formed about four years ago after the merger of eight firms, including four former Colliers affiliates. The tristate division is made up of offices in New York and New Jersey and has about 470 employees.

title: PEN World Voices Festival Opens On the Edge
description: The 10th annual PEN World Voices Festival got underway Monday night with a series of brief politically focused speeches by prominent international writers at the Great Hall at Cooper Union. The festivals program promised that the evening, called On the Edge, would feature bouts of unrestrained intellectual fury, and the line to get in stretched around a corner of the building.

title: The Basis for Sterlings Punishment
description: The Times sports reporter Harvey Araton asked the N.B.A. commissioner, Adam Silver, whether the Clippers owner, Donald Sterling, was punished for a single incident or multiple acts.

title: White House Wants to Lift Ban on Interstate Tolls
description: WASHINGTON  Drivers on the nations Interstates could soon be paying more to travel.

title: Clip: Neighbors
description: A scene from the film featuring Seth Rogen, Rose Byrne and Zac Efron.

title: Everyday People in Everyday Asia
description: Inspired by a project that challenges stereotypes about Africa, a Delhi-based freelancer aims to portray daily moments in Asia.

title: Trailer: Tammy
description: A preview of the film.

title: Trailer: Sex Tape
description: This is not what you were looking for, but nice try.

title: Trailer: Think Like a Man Too
description: A preview of the film.

title: Growth in Global Trade Is in Ideas, Not Stuff
description: Most of us have a mental image of what globalization looks like. Its garment workers in an overcrowded Bangladeshi factory, making clothing that will end up on sale at a discount store in a strip mall. Its container ships stuffed with consumer electronics from China headed for American ports, or tankers full of Middle Eastern oil fulfilling the worlds demand for energy.

title: Obamas Pop Culture Legacy
description: Michael D. Shear examines how popular culture has incorporated the issues that President Obama has faced.

title: Trailer: A Million Ways...
description: A preview of the film.

title: In Game 7, Sharks Are Going to Need a Bigger Effort
description: LOS ANGELES  For the San Jose Sharks and the Los Angeles Kings, Game 7 Wednesday night will feel familiar, for different reasons.

title: The Rise of the Drone Master: Pop Culture Recasts Obama
description: WASHINGTON  In Marvels latest popcorn thriller, Captain America battles Hydra, a malevolent organization that has infiltrated the highest levels of the United States government. There are missile attacks, screeching car chases, enormous explosions, evil assassins, data-mining supercomputers and giant killer drones ready to obliterate millions of people.

title: Geno Smiths Progression Is Key to Jets Quarterback Competition
description: Marty Mornhinweg, the Jets offensive coordinator, will manage the quarterback competition between Geno Smith and Michael Vick with one objective in mind.

title: Jaromir Jagr Is Set to Return, Devils Say
description: Jaromir Jagr is set to return to the Devils next season, General Manager Lou Lamoriello said Tuesday. Jagr, 42, led the Devils in scoring last season with 67 points on 24 goals and 43 assists. He played all 82 games, as well as each one of the Czech Republics six games at the Sochi Olympics. He is tied for sixth place with Steve Yzerman in N.H.L. career scoring, with 1,755 points, and is the leagues leading scorer among active players.

title: A String of Violent Storms Across the South and Midwest
description: Severe weather across the country affected states from Michigan to Florida.

title: The Right Way to Develop Shale Gas
description: LISTENING to the polarized energy debate in the United States, you might think natural gas was an economic and geopolitical cure-all  or an environmental curse. Too many oil and gas executives behave as if this newly abundant resource, released from underground shale deposits by the combination of horizontal drilling and hydraulic fracturing, has no environmental challenges. Opponents often act as if it has no economic and environmental benefits.

title: Nurses Are Not Doctors
description: EARLIER this month, the New York State Legislature passed a bill granting nurse practitioners the right to provide primary care without physician oversight. New York joins 16 other states and the District of Columbia in awarding such autonomy. (Most states still require nurse practitioners to work with physicians under a written practice agreement.) The bills authors contend that mandatory collaboration with a physician no longer serves a clinical purpose and reduces much-needed access to primary care.

title: Report Finds Deportations Focus on Criminal Records
description: WASHINGTON  A program of cooperation between federal immigration authorities and state and local police departments has been effective at focusing deportations on immigrants with a criminal record, according to a report published Tuesday by the Migration Policy Institute, a nonpartisan research organization here.

title: Do You Live Near I-35? Contribute to Our Reporting
description: A New York Times reporter, Damien Cave, and photographer, Todd Heisler, are traveling the length of I-35, chronicling how immigration is changing the U.S. Where should they visit?

title: Bagels, Lox and Me
description: On Sunday, I put on my running clothes, went out to the elevator, and pushed the button. In the time it took for my finger to travel from the wall back to my side, Id decided that it was not a day for a run but for a trip to the market. I slipped a coat over everything and went to the store, where I bought bagels, lox and cream cheese, along with some badly needed staples. I then came home and ate. (While, of course, reading The Sunday Times. Sigh. Sometimes its tough to be a clich.)

title: Amid a Revived East-West Chill, Cold War Relics Draw New Interest
description: MOSCOW  Stand in a dark tunnel as a red light flashes overhead and an air raid siren howls.

title: New York State Makes New Efforts to Combat Payday Lenders
description: Curbing abusive payday lending practices can sometimes resemble a game of Whac-A-Mole: every time regulators manage to push down one method the industry uses, another new method seems to crop up.

title: Jewish Groups Consider Including J Street
description: The American Jewish community, increasingly vexed by debate over Israel within its ranks, faces a closely watched test this week: The major umbrella organization of Jewish groups plans to vote on whether to admit a dovish lobbying organization that has been critical of some Israeli policies.

title: Official Slams Brazils Olympic Planning
description: The International Olympic Committees vice president, John D. Coates, said Brazils preparations for the 2016 Olympic Games were the worst he has ever experienced.

title: Massachusetts: Under Fire, Leader of Childrens Agency Steps Down
description: After the deaths of three children and an outcry by officials, Olga I. Roche, commissioner of the state Department of Children and Families, resigned Tuesday. Gov. Deval Patrick had defended Ms. Roche in recent months, but on Tuesday he said, She can no longer command the trust of the public or the confidence of her line staff. In one case, the police in Grafton had sent a fax to the agency warning that a baby, Aliana Lavigne, might be in danger. But the police failed to make a follow-up phone call, and no one at the agency saw the fax for six days. By then, the baby was dead. The governor named Erin Deveney, a former motor vehicles official, as interim commissioner.

title: Preparations for Rio Olympics the Worst, Committee Official Says
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  A top International Olympic Committee official on Tuesday called Rio de Janeiros preparations to host the 2016 Summer Olympics the worst I have experienced, adding to a growing chorus of doubts about the citys ability to get ready for the Games without international help.

title: Wooing Advertisers by Using Laughs
description: THE growing interest on Madison Avenue in digital video as an advertising medium is putting a new twist on 1980s-era television, as Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous gets remixed online as programming that is rich in lifestyle content or programming that tries to become famous by being funny.

title: Hagel Seeks Review of Military Policies on Hairstyles
description: WASHINGTON  Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel on Tuesday ordered the American military to review its policies concerning hairstyles popular with black women, telling critics of new Army regulations banning large cornrows, twists and dreadlocks that he takes very seriously concerns that military rules on hair have unfairly targeted black women.

title: Two Giant Banks, Seen as Immune, Become Targets
