description: Federal prosecutors are nearing criminal charges against some of the worlds biggest banks, according to lawyers briefed on the matter, a development that could produce the first guilty plea from a major bank in more than two decades.

title: Christie Nominates Ex-Attorney General to Lead Port Authority
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey nominated a former state attorney general on Tuesday as chairman of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey as he seeks to disentangle the agency and himself from the scandal surrounding the George Washington Bridge lane closings.

title: With Peace Talks Off, Netanyahu Looks at Unilateral Moves
description: JERUSALEM  After halting peace talks with the Palestinians last week, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel has asked his cabinet to bring forward alternative approaches to the intractable conflict, which are likely to include annexing parts of the West Bank or withdrawing from some settlements and shoring up others.

title: Federal Judge Strikes Down Wisconsin Law Requiring Photo ID at Polls
description: A federal judge on Tuesday struck down Wisconsins law requiring voters to produce state-approved photo identification cards at polling places, advancing a new legal basis  the Voting Rights Act  for similar challenges playing out around the nation.

title: In the U.S., Punishment Comes Before the Crimes
description: Few things are better at conveying what a nation really cares than how it spends its money. On that measure, Americans like to punish.

title: Spotify Teams With Sprint on a Mobile Music Plan
description: Spotify, the streaming music company, has struck a deal with Sprint to help market and promote its service, which offers millions of songs free and by subscription.

title: Challenging Putins Values
description: While you can talk about Ukraine until the cows come home, this story is 95 percent about Vladimir Putin and how he has chosen to define Russias interests. The truth is, Russia and its neighbors need a different definition of Russias interests. That, however, raises a series of questions: Can Moscow ever define its interests differently under Putin? If not, how do we deter him without also weakening Russia to the point of instability? And if we do induce such instability over time with sanctions, do we know what comes next and will we be better off?

title: Developer Scales Back Plans for Muslim Center Near Ground Zero
description: The developer whose proposal to build a Muslim community center and mosque near the World Trade Center failed amid a national controversy three years ago said Tuesday that he now plans to construct a museum devoted to Islam in the same location.

title: Commissioner Sees Basis for Ousting Clippers Owner
description: N.B.A. Commissioner Adam Silver deployed the nuclear option on Tuesday to force the Los Angeles Clippers owner, Donald Sterling, out of the league for racist remarks he made in a recorded conversation. Now, will Silvers actions  banishing Sterling for life from team and league business, and urging the other owners to vote to force him to sell the club  withstand any legal challenges?

title: Voter ID Is the Real Fraud
description: For the first time since the Supreme Court junked a core provision of the Voting Rights Act in June, a federal court has used the strongest surviving part of the act to strike down a states voter-identification law, and, in the process, has set out a detailed road map for upcoming challenges to similar laws around the country.

title: Milder View of Suspect in U.S. Case on Terror
description: It was around a year ago that the government unsealed charges against a Tunisian citizen named Ahmed Abassi, saying he had come to the United States to develop a network of terrorists and commit acts of terror. Prosecutors said he had radicalized one supposed terrorist and spoken of killing 100,000 people through bioterrorism.

title: Amid Iraqs Unrest, Maliki Campaigns as Strongman
description: BAGHDAD  When a well-known journalist was shot dead at a checkpoint here last month, Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki rushed to the scene. Speaking to a television camera, he promised blood for blood.

title: Not Getting Through to Mr. Putin
description: The United States and the European Union announced another round of sanctions against Russia on Monday and Tuesday: the Americans against Russians close to President Vladimir Putin, including the president of the state-owned oil company Rosneft; and the Europeans against senior Russian officials and secessionist leaders in Ukraine. The stated reason is that Russia has fulfilled none of the commitments it made at a meeting with Ukraine, the United States and the European Union in Geneva on April 17, and that Russias involvement in the recent violence in eastern Ukraine is indisputable.

title: Is Barry Whiffing?
description: WASHINGTON  Stop whining, Mr. President.

title: New York City Council Backs New Rules on Discretionary Money and Bills
description: Members of the New York City Council united on Tuesday behind proposed rules that would democratize the bill-drafting process and the way in which discretionary funds are apportioned to individual lawmakers  steps that fell short of Mayor Bill de Blasios call to do away with such spending entirely.

title: Author of the Book Gravity Sues Warner Bros. Over Credit
description: LOS ANGELES  The best-selling author Tess Gerritsen filed a lawsuit against Warner Bros. on Tuesday that claims the studio at least partly based Gravity on one of her books and as a result, owes her 2.5 percent of the blockbuster films net profit.

title: Cano and the Yankees Are Secure in Their Decisions
description: At the end of the 1990s, when the Seattle Mariners lost more often than they won, their marquee player often grew exasperated when asked about the teams struggles. Ken Griffey Jr. would sigh and say, I bat third, three words that spoke an essential truth about baseball.

title: An Alarm Over the Incursion of Foreign Words
description: Few major languages have felt the effects of globalization and modernization more acutely than Mandarin. The increasing use of keyboard devices, for example, has caused many Chinese to forget how to write characters by hand, to the extent that there is even a popular television show in which contestants compete to write complicated characters from memory.

title: Can Voluntourism Make a Difference?
An Early Skyscraper Becomes a Hotel With a View
description: For years, development plans came and went at 5 Beekman Street like City Hall workers filing in and out of their nearby offices in Lower Manhattan.

title: Grabbing the Derby Roses a Second Time Is a Tricky Task
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  The trainer Chip Woolley made an arduous drive when he took Mine That Bird from Sunland Park in New Mexico to Churchill Downs here five years ago. He had to use his left leg instead of his right, which had been fractured in a motorcycle accident, but he was comforted by the thought that he would be competing in his first Kentucky Derby with a horse that he believed belonged.

title: Emails Show Sothebys Board Shared Some of Loebs Concerns
description: WILMINGTON, Del.  Directors of Sothebys have expressed concern about compensation and the boards performance, according to emails disclosed on Tuesday during a hearing in a dispute with the activist investor Daniel S. Loeb.

title: Social Media in Afghanistan Takes On Life of Its Own
description: WASHINGTON  Afghans have long been resistant to central authority  as the United States has found to its frustration  with Afghanistan divided along tribal, cultural, religious and linguistic lines. Its mountains and valleys have stood in the way of communications breakthroughs that have unified other societies.

title: Reinventing Rye Playland Ignites an Unexpected Battle
description: RYE, N.Y.  It seemed, on its face, an unassailable approach to reinventing Rye Playland, the Art Deco amusement park in this wealthy shore town, for the 21st century  innocuous even. Spiff up the amusement rides, expand the green space, and draw year-round visitors to the county-run park with new playing fields and restaurants.

title: Epic Battle in Technology
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Full disclosure: I am an unabashed MAC fangirl. Yes, I have used both PCs and MACs. This isnt a case of Oh, shes just never tried using a PC . I have, and I have very strong opinions about this subject. Even so, Im a professional, and Im fairly certain that I will be able to cover this topic in a way that will not affect todays blog post at all. [Uh oh. Ed.]

title: Old and Familiar Rivals Are Squaring Off in Texas
description: DALLAS  As Manu Ginobili ambled off the court at American Airlines Center on Monday night, it was fairly evident that playoff game No. 161 for him had taken its toll. At this stage, they all do.

title: Williams Once Again Shows That He Is His Toughest Critic
description: Late Sunday night, shortly after the Nets fumbled away a close game to the Toronto Raptors, point guard Deron Williams, unprompted, said he put the burden of the loss on himself.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for April 29, 2014
description: April 29, 2014

title: At Sentencing Hearing, Killer Hears From Police, and His Victims Mother
description: The mothers voice began to break as she described her daughters 19 stab wounds, the blood, the abrupt end of dreams. She leaned over the court railing, her body rigid, her voice rising and splintering. The tears came.

title: Slow Going on Overhaul of Mortgage Finance
description: WASHINGTON  In the long, boggy work of overhauling the nations mortgage finance system, Tuesday morning was supposed to be an important milestone: the Senate Banking Committee was scheduled to meet and put the finishing touches on a bipartisan bill that would affect the ability of millions of Americans to buy a home.

title: For Clippers, Transition in Decision Making Begins
description: LOS ANGELES  Soon after N.B.A. Commissioner Adam Silver handed down a lifetime ban to Donald Sterling on Tuesday, the Clippers website, the one still owned but no longer operated under the direction of Sterling, went black.

title: Allstate Case Shows Risk of Signing Away the Right to Sue
description: When his children were young, Nathan Littlejohn was a regional salesman in search of a position that would allow him to spend more time with his family. So when he heard about Allstates neighborhood agent program in 1990, he was intrigued.

title: 20 Killed in Southern Yemen as Ground Assault Begins
description: The first day of a government ground offensive aimed at dislodging militants from Al Qaeda in southern Yemen led to the deaths of 20 people on Tuesday, mostly Yemeni soldiers, officials said. The assault by the army and allied militias on militant hide-outs in Shabwa and Abyan Provinces came days after heavy airstrikes in the area by Yemeni warplanes and American drones. The deadliest clash on Tuesday occurred in Shabwa Province when militants ambushed a convoy carrying security officials. A medical official in the provincial capital said the hospital there had received the bodies of 15 soldiers and treated 10 wounded soldiers. The Defense Ministry denied losing any soldiers in Shabwa, and the state-run news agency said that five militants were killed in fighting there. In neighboring Abyan, army convoys moved in without any reported resistance.

title: Apple and Samsung Cite, and Rebut, Internal Memos in Patent Case
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.  When Steven P. Jobs introduced the iPhone in January 2007, he said the devices new touch-screen technology worked like magic. He also said, And boy, have we patented it!

title: Two Rulings May Curb Lawsuits Over Patents
description: WASHINGTON  In a pair of unanimous decisions, the Supreme Court on Tuesday made it easier for the winning side in patent cases to recover its legal fees from the loser. The decisions were welcomed by some technology companies, which said the rulings would help address what they say are abusive and coercive lawsuits brought by patent trolls, or companies that buy patents not to use them but to collect royalties and damages.

title: Yet Again, Rangers Seem Averse to Prosperity
description: PHILADELPHIA  Some streaks defy logic, but the Rangers current run of futility may be the strangest of all: an N.H.L.-record 12 straight defeats while holding a lead in a playoff series.

title: Will Liberal Cities Leave the Rest of America Behind?
description: How can governments adopt substantial, effective policies in order to benefit the poor and the working class when corporations, the affluent and owners of capital can pull up stakes and relocate with ease?

title: Yanks Fall, Then Lose Pineda to Injury
description: On a cold, raw evening in the Bronx, with only a few thousand people in the stands, the focus of a dreary game was squarely on the return of Robinson Cano, who was roundly booed during each of his at-bats.

title: Fargo Recap: Dead Dogs, Spiders and Pestilence
description: O.K., after watching the third episode of Fargo, I am packing my go bag with Bactine, and perhaps a machete, a few guns and a helmet to wear in the shower, all in case of the apocalypse.

title: Simmonds Sweeps In Puck 3 Times While Taking Care of Dirty Work
description: PHILADELPHIA  When the Flyers are on the power play, it is not difficult to find Wayne Simmonds. He is the player stationed by the net, screening the goalie, buzzing across the crease, absorbing slashes and elbows and crosschecks, positioning himself in case the puck finds its way to him.

title: India Election Digest: April 30
description: What you need to know about Indias election on Wednesday: This is the seventh of the nine phases of the parliamentary elections, with 89 seats up for grabs over seven states and two union territories. The areas going to vote are: Andhra Pradesh (17 constituencies), Bihar (7), Gujarat (26), Jammu and Kashmir (1), Punjab (13), Uttar Pradesh (14), West Bengal (9), Dadra and Nagar Haveli (1), Daman and Diu (1).

title: Corrections: April 30, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Drop Everything
description: When worn with a slicked-back bun and a fresh face, a pair of dazzling pendant earrings is the perfect mate for a sunset stroll.

title: Nearly Half of New Yorkers Are Struggling to Get By, Study Finds
description: New York Citys share of poor people appears to have plateaued since the recession, at 21.4 percent, with more people working in 2012 than the year before, but at lower wages, according to a new city study. Contributing to the citys economic problems were increases in the number of Asian-Americans, immigrants and residents of Queens slipping into poverty.

title: Want to Be More Creative? Take a Walk
description: From our archives.

title: Word of the Day | grate
description: grate\grat\ noun and verb

title: Frederic Schwartz, 63, Dies; Designed Sept. 11 Memorials
description: Frederic Schwartz, an architect whose plan to rebuild the World Trade Center site finished second among hundreds of entries, and who went on to create memorials in New Jersey and Westchester County to victims of the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks, died on Monday in Manhattan. He was 63.

title: Niese Again Rises Above the Gloom
description: By ZACH SCHONBRUN

title: Whats On Wednesday
description: 10 P.M. (FX) THE AMERICANS A new mission with global stakes forces Philip (Matthew Rhys, who stars with Keri Russell, above) to seek help from Annelise (Gillian Alexy), just as an old enemy returns to Washington with a vendetta. Stan (Noah Emmerich), meanwhile, makes a discovery that could help the F.B.I. close in on the K.G.B. illegals. The episode also features It Must Be Done, an original song written by Pete Townshend of the Who  his first for a television series  and the shows composer, Nathan Barr.

title: Insurance Site and Walmart in Deal to Sell Auto Policies
description: Walmart plans to add a new consumer service to its arsenal of offerings on Wednesday, teaming up with a website that helps customers comparison shop for auto insurance.

title: Wizards Oust Cold-Shooting Bulls
description: CHICAGO  The Bulls scored on their second possession in Game 5 Tuesday night against the Washington Wizards when Carlos Boozer knocked down a high arcing jump shot. The ensuing cheer for the 2-0 lead at United Center was as much relief as excitement. In Game 4, the Bulls did not score until they spotted the Wizards 14 points in a blowout loss.

title: Times Minute | Clippers Owner Banned
description: Sam Dolnick, the deputy sports editor, on what Donald Sterlings ban means for the Los Angeles Clippers and the new N.B.A commissioner.

title: Times Minute | The Clippers Next Steps
description: In the Video

title: Alstom Backs G.E.s Offer Despite French Governments Concerns
description: Updated, 3:43 p.m. | PARIS  General Electric and Alstom, the struggling French conglomerate at the center of a politically charged takeover battle, finally said publicly on Wednesday what the business world has known for a week: G.E. is ready to acquire Alstoms energy business in a $13.5 billion deal.

title: Shell Profit Falls 45 Percent as Oil Production Drops
description: LONDON  The European oil giant Royal Dutch Shell reported Wednesday a 45 percent decline in first-quarter earnings compared with a year earlier, as production fell sharply and the company took a large write-off in its refining business.

title: BNP Paribas Says U.S. Penalties May Top the $1.1 Billion It Set Aside
description: The French bank BNP Paribas warned on Wednesday that it might have to pay penalties higher than the $1.1 billion it had set aside for an investigation by the American authorities into whether it processed payments for countries facing United States sanctions, including Iran.

title: Test Yourself | Math, April 30, 2014
description: Our weekly math problems are written by teachers at Math for America.

title: European Court Rejects British Challenge to Tax on Trading
description: BRUSSELS  The top court in the European Union on Wednesday cleared a legal obstacle to a proposed tax on financial transactions, a plan bitterly opposed by bankers in London.

title: 6 Qs About the News | A Formal Breakup With Prom Wear
description: In A Formal Breakup With Prom Wear, Marisa Meltzer reports on teenagers breaking with prom-fashion tradition.

title: In Xinjiang, a Call to Report Extremism  and Long Beards
description: Intelligence information is the essential factor in safeguarding citizens lives and property, the Shayar County government in the far-western region of Xinjiang has said, announcing rewards ranging from 50 to 50,000 renminbi ($8 to $8,000) to anyone who reports people planning violent attacks or hoarding guns and bullets, men growing long beards, women wearing veils or youths under 18 visiting a mosque. Such activities are considered signs of Muslim extremism by officials who are grappling with rising violence in the region that is home to ethnic Uighurs, a mostly Sunni Muslim, Turkic-speaking people.

title: Why Only One Top Banker Went to Jail for the Financial Crisis
description: This article is a collaboration between The Times and ProPublica, the independent nonprofit investigative organization.

title: Everyday People in Everyday Asia
description: It was June 2013 when Ian Thomas Jansen-Lonnquist, inspired by the work of theEveryday Africa project, registered the Instagram account@everydayasia. As a Delhi-based freelance photographer, he saw a chance to carve out a space similar to the@everydayafricafeed, which showcases mobile photography that captures familiar moments, even mundane ones, to counter a media narrative too often shaped by images of extreme famine and poverty.

title: Do We Need New Ways to Identify Gender and Sexuality?
description: Non-binary, intersex, neutrois, androgyne, agender, gender questioning, gender fluid, gender variant, genderqueer: these are among the 50 possibilities and permutations of gender identification Facebook will now include in a drop-down menu for people who feel the binary choices male and female arent enough.

title: With Election, Many Reminded of Horrors of 2002 Gujarat Riots
description: AHMEDABAD, India  Gulbarg Society, a complex of 18 bungalows and two apartment blocks once occupied by upper-middle-class Muslims in the largely Hindu neighborhood of Chamanpura, is now a cluster of doorless burned shells.

title: Volkswagen Extends Offer to Acquire Full Control of Scania
description: LONDON  Volkswagen said on Wednesday that it had extended its offer to take full control of the Swedish truck maker Scania, in hopes of coaxing more of the companys shareholders to sell.

title: Euro Zone Inflation Edges Up in April
description: FRANKFURT  Inflation in the euro zone rose slightly in April, according to a preliminary official estimate, but probably not enough to ease fear of a damaging downward price spiral, nor enough to take pressure off the European Central Bank to undertake new measures to stimulate the economy.

title: By One Measure, China Set to Become Largest Economy
description: For years, Americans have told Gallup pollsters that China was the worlds pre-eminent economy. They were mistaken. The United States has held that spot for more than a century. A new report suggests they may soon be mistaken no more.

title: New York Today: Umbrellas on Parade
description: Good wet Wednesday morning to you. It will rain all day.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: Xbox One to Go on Sale in China in September
description: SEATTLE  Microsoft says its latest game console, Xbox One, will go on sale in China in September, after a long ban on such products in the country.

title: By Its Own Yardstick, the Fed Is Falling Short
description: The Federal Reserve is failing to meet its basic responsibilities.

title: The Politics of Gift Giving in India
description: LUCKNOW, India  Every time second-year undergraduate law students at Lucknow University open up their 14-inch Hewlett-Packard laptops, they are reminded of the generous benefactors who gave them their computers.

title: Verbatim: From Transcript to Performance
description: In our latest Op-Doc, for the Editorial Departments section for short, opinion-piece videos, an incensed lawyer deposes a beleaguered witness. When you say photocopying machine, what do you mean? the witness responds again and again. In its absurdity, the question becomes almost profound.

title: BNP Paribas Says U.S. Penalties May Top the $1.1 Billion It Set Aside
description: The French bank BNP Paribas warned on Wednesday that it might have to pay penalties higher than the $1.1 billion it had set aside for an investigation by the American authorities into whether it processed payments for countries facing United States sanctions, including Iran.

title: The Urbane Face of the B.J.P. Nervous in Electoral Debut in Amritsar
description: AMRITSAR, India  On Sunday afternoon, Arun Jaitley, a senior leader of the Bharatiya Janata Party and leader of the opposition in Parliaments upper house, was driven to Lawrence Road, a busy thoroughfare in Amritsar, the second-largest city in the western state of Punjab.

title: House Budget Committee to Hold Hearing on Poverty
description: WASHINGTON  Is the federal government responsible for lifting millions of Americans out of poverty or trapping them in it?

title: Daily Report: Twitters Revenue Rises, but Wall St. Worries About Growth
description: Twitter is struggling to convince Wall Street that it is still a company with plenty of potential to grow, Nicole Perlroth reports.

title: App Smart: Running Partners
description: Several smartphone apps can add a helpful boost of motivation, or just provide some fun information, to a run or walk.

title: While on a Run, Apps to Match the Playlist to Your Pace
description: IF you are headed out for a walk or jog, consider adding an app for your trip. Several smartphone apps can add a helpful boost of motivation, or just some fun information, to a workout or leisurely walk.

title: 1964: Beirut is Travel Hub of the Middle East
description: BEIRUT  Lebanon is as old as time and as new as tomorrow, and its face is constantly changing. This narrow strip of the eastern Mediterranean seaboard, which lies between Syria and Israel, has been an important trading center ever since the days when it was a stop on the spice route.

title: Ukraine Says That Militants Won the East
description: KIEV, Ukraine  It is by now a well-established pattern. Armed, masked men in their 20s to 40s storm a public building of high symbolic value in a city somewhere in eastern Ukraine, evict anyone still there, seize weapons and ammunition, throw up barricades and proclaim themselves the rulers of a peoples republic. It is not clear who is in charge or how the militias are organized.

title: Profit at Carlyle Falls 18% as Real Estate Investments Underperform
description: Updated, 8:48 p.m. | Private equity may be a booming business, but that was not enough to lift the Carlyle Groups earnings in the first quarter.

title: Cloud Complexity, Simplified
description: Its hard in technology to make things simpler, but there is usually good money in it.

title: Celebrate Brooklyn! Festival Sets Lineup
description: The lineup for the 36th annual Celebrate Brooklyn! outdoor festival in Prospect Park has been announced and will feature free performances by acts like St. Vincent; the jazz and hip-hop fusion artist Robert Glasper, who will appear with Talib Kweli; the rock group Dum Dum Girls; and the Brazilian singer Bebel Gilberto.

title: Why Dangerous Supplements Linger on Store Shelves
description: The first cases of liver problems linked to a popular weight loss supplement called OxyElite Pro began in Hawaii last May. But it wasnt until four months later that the Food and Drug Administration, the agency responsible for getting dangerous products off the market, learned of the outbreak, and the product was finally recalled in November.

title: ECO 348, The Great Recession: The New Normal
description: Slides here (pdf).

title: Countering Too Big to Jail
description: Federal prosecutors are nearing criminal charges against some of the worlds biggest banks, according to lawyers briefed on the matter, a development that could produce the first guilty plea from a major bank in more than two decades, Ben Protess and Jessica Silver-Greenberg write in DealBook. In doing so, prosecutors are looking to address public outrage and alter the belief that Wall Street institutions are too big to jail.

title: On Progressive Econoblogging
description: Chris House replies graciously to my critique of his critique. However, I have some further thoughts here. The crucial question, it seems to me, is what econobloggers  and in particular, those who happen to be political progressives  are doing, and what they should be trying to do.

title: Tested Out Upstate: Classicals Future
description: Two hours into the drive from Buffalo to Albany on the New York State Thruway, you pass Syracuse, a city with dark associations for classical music lovers.

title: Hoping for Stability, Utility Operator Exelon Agrees to Buy Pepco for $6.8 Billion
description: The utility operator Exelon has again turned to deal making to expand, agreeing on Wednesday to buy Pepco Holdings for $6.8 billion to strengthen its operations on the East Coast.

title: Once More, Economy Exhibits Weakness
description: As has happened so many times since the recovery began nearly five years ago, the economy turned in another disappointing quarterly performance, surprising even the most pessimistic observers as growth in the first three months of 2014 slowed to a near-standstill.

title: Congress Party Faces Uncertain Prospects in State It Helped Create
description: HYDERABAD, India  Ever since the bill recognizing Telangana as the nations 29th state passed unanimously through Parliament on Feb. 18, politics in this heart-shaped region of south India have been as muddled and dramatic as a soap opera, with failed alliances and accusations of broken promises and backstabbing between lawmakers.

title: When a Restaurant Calls to Confirm a Reservation
description: Dear Diary:

title: Voters in City of Srinagar Heed Calls For Boycott
description: As Srinagar, the summer capital of Jammu and Kashmir, voted on Wednesday, the election was taking on a familiar pattern: In the first four hours of polling in the city, turnout was 5 percent, compared with 31 percent in Vadodara in Gujarat, where Narendra Modi of the Bharatiya Janata Party was running for Parliament.

title: Glisten in the Sun
description: Heavy moisturizers are so last summer, thanks to new body oils that are as weightlessly refreshing as a summer breeze.

title: Intrade Co-Founder Opens Fantasy Sports Site
description: The online betting and prediction market Intrade shut down last year after discovering financial problems and running afoul of regulators.

title: Why U.S. Growth Slowed to a Halt at the Start of the Year
description: Well, that could have gone better.

title: Energizer to Split in Two
description: After years of buying up brands, Energizer Holdings has decided not to keep on going as a single consumer-products conglomerate.

title: Editorial Contest Winner | National Parks: Ecology and Economy
description: We are honoring the Top 10 winners of our Student Editorial Contest by publishing an essay each day.

title: More on Drones and James Risen  and a new AnonyWatch entry
description: Im heading off to the International Journalism Festival in Perugia, Italy where Im one of the (many) speakers this week. My speech has an admittedly unwieldy title: What Ive Learned at the New York Times (And What That Says About Journalism). I have copious notes  and a long flight to get them in order.

title: A Korean City With 250 Holes in Its Heart
description: ANSAN, South Korea  The cluttered store next to the gate of Danwon High School in the drab industrial city of Ansan is jammed with school necessities. White gym uniforms hang in the window, behind dusty glass. Pens and pencils are sorted neatly into cubbyholes, and a freezer full of ice cream sits outside as a lure for passing students.

title: Test Prep Endures in New York Schools, Despite Calls to Ease It
description: For several weeks, Reanna Bhola and her sixth-grade classmates at Intermediate School 126 in Astoria, Queens, spent part of nearly every day focused on test preparation. First it was reading, with sample passages, questions and review sheets mirroring the actual tests.

title: Teach the Teachers Well
description: When Yvonne Ford started teaching at P.S. 133, a public elementary school in Brooklyn, her classroom wasnt an easy place to learn. Students with behavior problems struggled to remain on task. Teasing and name-calling were common. Many students came to school angry and anxious. Ford wasnt satisfied with how students treated each other or her. I knew I needed to build a positive community in my classroom, she recounts, but she didnt know how. The things they have to deal with on a daily basis are not things I had to deal with as a child, Ford says of the students at P.S. 133, about 80 percent of whom are eligible for free or reduced price lunch and some of whom live in shelters or foster homes. She worried that she would say or do something that made students problems worse.

title: A Seeger Fest to Honor Pete and Toshi, and Its Free
description: My grandfather didnt leave a blueprint about the kind of memorial he wanted, Kitama Cahill-Jackson, whose grandfather was Pete Seeger, said in a telephone interview. But when my grandmother died, just a few months earlier, I planned her memorial with him, and nothing says more about what someone would like than to see what they planned for a loved one.

title: Stern Talk From Chief of F.C.C. on Open Net
description: LOS ANGELES  The Federal Communications Commissions chairman delivered a tough message to cable and broadband executives Wednesday, saying a lack of competition in their industry has hurt consumers.

title: In California, Governor Pushes a Rainy-Day Fund
description: SACRAMENTO  After overcoming years of fiscal dysfunction that stemmed in part from an antitax ballot referendum, Gov. Jerry Brown is trying to call California voters to the ballot again  this time to approve a constitutional amendment requiring that surpluses be used to pay down municipal debt and create an emergency fund.

title: Alone at Sea
description: In two new picture books, stories of giant turtles and tortoises take different tacks, one casting facts aside to revel in the imaginative possibilities of such a creatures life, the other taking a long view of its evolution over the course of a million years. One starts in isolation and ends companionably; the other begins in a community, and ends alone. Theyre books for different age groups to be sure, but neither entirely succeeds as a picture book.

title: Breaking From Her Norm to Connect With Her Tradition
description: At a sleepy ocean-side restaurant in Brighton Beach, a Russian enclave in Brooklyn, the singer-songwriter Olga Bell peered across the table stacked with traditional dishes  sliced herring with onions, hearty borscht, blini with red caviar. Her smile broadened at the sight of the pelmeni (meat dumplings). The way my mom makes these, we put them in a broth with a little bit of soy sauce, she said, spooning another helping onto her plate. But were into fusion like that.

title: A Wide-Ranging Lineup for Lincoln Center Out of Doors
description: The world premiere of a work by the Pulitzer Prize winner John Luther Adams; a celebration of the 50th anniversary of John Coltranes Love Supreme; a memorial concert for Pete and Toshi Seeger; and performances by Emmylou Harris and Rodney Crowell; Rosanne Cash; and the Paul Taylor Dance Company are among the offerings at the years Lincoln Center Out of Doors Festival. All told, the 44th season of the festival will offer nearly 100 free events on Lincoln Centers plazas between July 20 and Aug. 10.

title: Assailants Attack Train Station in Restive Western China
description: HONG KONG  Assailants with explosives and knives killed three people and wounded at least 79 Wednesday evening outside a railroad station in Urumqi, the capital of western Chinas restive Xinjiang region, where President Xi Jinping had just concluded a visit, state news media reported, calling it a brazen terrorist assault.

title: Church Band With a Legacy
description: In 1970, the Fairview Baptist Church Brass Band  first called the Fairview Baptist Church Christian Marching Band  was created in New Orleans by the banjoist and guitarist Danny Barker, and the story of its evolution and influence is pretty much the story of how a cultural tradition rallied and flourished at a critical moment of declining interest. Those who passed through the Fairview band in the early years include Wynton Marsalis, Lucien Barbarin, Leroy Jones and Herlin Riley.

title: Campaign to Save a Carny Mainstay
description: Zipper: Coney Islands Last Wild Ride, Monday night at 10 on WNET/13, documents a way of life that increasingly seems as if its from another era, and now that film itself has a bit of that aura. It was shot in a distant time when some guy named Bloomberg was mayor of New York and developers ruled the land. It documents the emergence of an ambitious redevelopment plan for Coney Island, one that critics contend would destroy the character of the place, and it does so through the eyes of the operators of the Zipper, an old-school ride that becomes a symbol of the carny world endangered by the plan.

title: Alice Lives, Right Here
description: At the Academy Awards in Los Angeles in April 1975, Martin Scorsese had to accept Ellen Burstyns best-actress Oscar for her because she was busy starring in a play, Same Time, Next Year, in New York. Less than two weeks later, she won the best actress Tony for that play. Pretty good April.

title: Whirling Forward Beyond a Founder
description: Since time dances ever on, modern-dance groups must eventually decide how to continue when their charismatic founding choreographers retire or die. One troupe that keeps thriving is the Limn Dance Company. Since the death of its founder, Jos Limn, in 1972, it has not stopped moving forward, and its director, Carla Maxwell, adroitly balances Limn revivals with premieres by other choreographers.

title: Violin and Chorus In Unusual Hybrid
description: The composer Jennifer Higdon is best known for works that reflect old-school values of sturdy American craftsmanship and optimism, with ruminative currents running just beneath their polished surfaces. Those qualities apply to The Singing Rooms, which receives its New York premiere at Carnegie Hall on Tuesday. Ms. Higdon wrote this unusual hybrid oratorio-concerto for the brilliant violinist Jennifer Koh, who recorded it in 2011 with the Atlanta Symphony Orchestra. At Carnegie, Ms. Koh will perform with the New York Choral Society and Orchestra, conducted by David Hayes. (8 p.m., 212-247-7800, carnegiehall.org.)

title: A Lamentation for Assyria
description: Prepare to be rattled one way or another by Roberto Cuoghi: Suillakku Corral,if not by the onslaught of sound  described by one writer as an assault without respite of music, chants, animal verses, animal sounds, noises and the sound of spitting  then by the empty galleries in which it is presented or by its disturbing analogies. Opening at the New Museumon Wednesday, this show presents the latest from Mr. Cuoghi, a driven, often perverse Italian polymath who works in painting, sculpture, performance and animation. After several years of mind-boggling immersion into ancient Assyria, he has created an imagined lamentation for the fall of that militaristic civilization.

title: Funds for Troubled Mortgages Are on the Rise
description: Updated, 5:03 p.m. | In the world of hedge funds, distressed mortgage funds are suddenly hot, but it is unclear whether the strategy will live up to the marketing hype.

title: N.B.A.s Move Is Not Little, but Its Late
description: After the conga line of support spawned by N.B.A. Commissioner Adam Silvers banishment of Donald Sterling on Tuesday  a carnival led by validated players, relieved owners and a Los Angeles Clippers staff that acted as if it had just been released from Guantnamo  there ensued a natural pause. Because in celebrating the first move to excise Sterling from the N.B.A. and pry the Clippers from his grubby hands, the next thought had to be why it had not been done sooner.

title: Rescuers Turn to Boat as Storm Rocks Florida
description: PENSACOLA, Fla.  His city stunned and saturated by floodwaters, Craig Hindsman, a pastor at the Marcus Pointe Baptist Church here, suddenly became an amateur rescuer on Wednesday.

title: Remembering President Giuliani and President Brown
description: Hillary Clinton has a commanding lead over Jeb Bush, 53 percent to 41 percent, in a hypothetical 2016 matchup between the two, according to a Washington Post/ABC News poll Wednesday.

title: Ishigaki, a Japanese Natural Wonderland
description: Unruly stalks brushed against the windows of the white Suzuki minivan as it bumped down an unmarked dirt road through a field of sugar cane. When the road abruptly ended, we continued on foot down a barely perceptible path through thick tropical foliage, fighting through branches and brush.

title: A Remote Colombia City That Really Does Exist
description: The first time I heard of Momps, officially called Santa Cruz de Mompox, was about a decade ago, while reading Gabriel Garca Mrquezs novel The General in His Labyrinth. Mompox doesnt exist, Mr. Garca Mrquez wrote, we sometimes dream about her, but she doesnt exist. For years, I assumed that to be true.

title: Seen on the Street | Outside the Almaty, Kazakhstan Fall/Winter 2014 Shows
description: A glimpse at what gals are wearing this season.

title: Cabaret: Im Not a Cheese
description: Part 15: Alan Cumming, Michelle Williams and the director Rob Marshall describe how they make decisions about future projects.

title: Yes, Silicon Valley, Sometimes You Need More Bureaucracy
description: The dirtiest word in Silicon Valley is bureaucracy. Tech executives want to move quickly  a Facebook company motto is move fast and break things  and layers of bureaucracy, such as human resources departments, are seen as the enemy of speed and efficiency.

title: Cabaret: Taking on an Iconic Role
description: Part 14: Alan Cumming, Michelle Williams and the director Rob Marshall explain their rehearsal process.

title: Cabaret: The Importance of Naps
description: Part 13: Alan Cumming and Michelle Williams talk about what draws them to the roles they choose.

title: Cabaret: Alans Fragrance
description: Part 12: The director Rob Marshall reflects on returning to theater after working exclusively in film for 15 years.

title: Cabaret: Kander & Ebb
description: Part 11: The director Rob Marshall talks about the important role John Kander and Fred Ebb played in his career; Alan Cumming describes meeting Joel Grey, who originated the Emcee role.

title: Cabaret: Marilyn Monroe
description: Part 10: Alan Cumming and Michelle Williams reveal what their Cabaret roles share in common with other parts theyve played.

title: Cabaret: Not Just a Period Piece
description: Part 9: Alan Cumming, Michelle Williams and the director Rob Marshall discuss the historical context and relevance of the shows story and setting.

title: Childrens Art at Syria School, and Then a Bomb
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Organizers had worked until dawn hanging childrens artwork on the wall of an elementary school in Syrias largest city: a bright green tank under a round yellow sun, a girl in pigtails defying a soldiers bullets, a missile plunging from a warplane toward the school building.

title: Cabaret: Broadway Has Changed
description: Part 8: Michelle Williams talks about how her daughter influences her career choices; the director Rob Marshall reflects on what Broadway has lost.

title: Cabaret: A Lie Down
description: Part 7: Alan Cumming describes what its like to work simultaneously on Cabaret and The Good Wife.

title: Cabaret: Rob Marshalls Special Skill
description: Part 6: Alan Cumming, Michelle Williams and the director Rob Marshall explore their collaborative process.

title: Cabaret: Sally and the Emcee
description: Part 5: Alan Cumming and Michelle Williams discuss their Cabaret characters and the difference between musical and non-musical theater.

title: Cabaret: De-Liza-fication
description: Part 4: Alan Cumming, Michelle Williams and the director Rob Marshall talk about how the 1972 film of Cabaret transformed the production.

title: Cabaret: Concept Musical
description: Part 3: Alan Cumming, Michelle Williams and the director Rob Marshall discuss why the show was groundbreaking when it first premiered and why it continues to be important.

title: Cabaret: Evolution
description: Part 2: Alan Cumming, Michelle Williams and the director Rob Marshall each recall how they first encountered Cabaret in their lives and careers.

title: Cabaret: Intro
description: Part 1: Carol Olsen Day, director of TimesTalks, introduces the actors Alan Cumming and Michelle Williams and the director Rob Marshall.

title: TimesTalks | Cabaret: Preview
description: Alan Cumming, Michelle Williams and Cabaret co-director Rob Marshall talk about bringing the Tony-winning musical back to Broadway.

title: Dont be surprised that people still say racist things.
description: The condemnation of remarks by the Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling is almost unanimous. But racism is still more common than you may realize. In surveys, more than one-fifth of whites volunteer views consistent with negative racial stereotypes. While many fewer Americans express animosity toward blacks than they did 40 years ago, a CBS News poll from March showed that 46 percent of Americans thought racial discrimination would always exist.

title: Cruise Line Will Return to Persian Gulf
description: Royal Caribbean International cruise line will return to the Persian Gulf next year, with 16 cruises planned between December 2015 and March 2016.

title: N.Y.U. Appoints a Dean for the  Tisch School of the Arts
description: Allyson Green, a dancer, choreographer, designer and curator, has been named the new dean of the Tisch School of the Arts at New York University, the university announced on Wednesday.

title: Today in Small Business: My Idea Is Just Too Far Ahead of Its Time
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: What You Get for ... $1,800,000
description: BEND, ORE.

title: The Once-Groovy Future of Flight
description: It looks as if Austin Powers should be the next lucky passenger to descend into this scene  a prototype for a first-class Tiger Lounge, residing inside the belly of the first jumbo passenger jet, the Boeing 747, which was introduced in 1970.

title: In 1918 Flu Pandemic, Timing Was a Killer
description: Sometimes a virus can cause more devastation than all the worlds armies. In 1918, at the end of World War I, influenza spread around the planet, reaching even Pacific islands and Arctic villages. The virus infected a third of all people on earth, and caused an estimated 50 million deaths  more than three times the number of people killed  in World War I.

title: The Rent Is Too High
description: New York City stands at the epicenter of a national housing crisis that has placed low-income people at a steadily greater risk of homelessness. As Mireya Navarro and Vivian Yee of the Times reminded us on Tuesday, that risk is increasingly apparent to elderly New Yorkers who hoped to retire in the city, but who now find that their modest incomes will not cover the cost of decent housing in even marginal areas.

title: Communion, Catholicism and Conscience
description: As a companion tomy last post, I want to say something about an argument made by my friend Pascal-Emmanuel Gobry, like me (if I may so label him) a conservative Catholic with some heterodox tendencies,in defense of divorce-and-remarried Catholics taking communion, because I think it gets at a distinction thats important to my own understanding of Catholic doctrine and practice. Here (Ill be quoting at length) hes discussing how advocates of communion might deal with the fact that the remarried, if their marriages arent annulled, are living in what the church considers a persistent state of public adultery, which they dont intend to leave:

title: New Award Recognizes Two Young Choreographers
description: A group of independent performers and choreographers that includes Dean Moss, Kimberly Bartosik and Joshua Lubin-Levy have established the Award, a mentorship prize for young choreographers, based on what the prizes web page describes as the goodwill of New York Citys experimental dance community. The group describes its nomination and selection process as confidential  nominators are anonymous  with aesthetic rigor and innovation as the principal criteria.

title: From Making Bagel Baskets to Thinking Much Bigger
description: In the mid-1990s, Drew Greenblatt started dialing his way down a list of 800 brokers, lawyers and accountants, looking for a business to buy. He had sold a security alarm installation company, and he was looking for four qualities in his next venture: an honest seller, a viable market, a rational purchase price, and a business that sold to other businesses. He was through with coddling consumers.

title: Its a small world, after all.
description: At least on Facebook.

title: Times Minute | A Botched Execution
description: The renewed debate about death penalty procedures. Also on the Minute, black womens hairstyles in the Army and scientific evidence that walking increases creativity.

title: Whats Your Comfort Food?
description: I shouldve known comfort food would strike a chord, because as I wrote in todays column, everyone has a favorite. Friends have been emailing, saying things like this: For me, comfort food is caldo de fideo with a few stewed tomatoes and a good dose of lime juice. If the angel hair has first been toasted with onions to near burning, so much better for the nostalgia. (Another told me that toasting bagels was heresy.)

title: Times Minute | A Botched Execution
description: In the Video

title: The 21st Century Is Calling, With Wi-Fi Hot Spots
description: In the era of smartphones, pay phones look increasingly dumb.

title: The Other Christie Scandal
description: What is it that makes self-proclaimed centrists such easy marks for right-wing con men? Actually, its not that much of a mystery: the centrist creed is that the two parties are symmetrically extremist, and this means that there must, as a matter of principle, be Serious, Honest Republicans out there  so such people must be invented if they dont actually exist. Hence the elevation of Paul Ryan despite clear evidence of his con-artist nature.

title: Bob Hoskins, Actor Who Combined Charm and Menace, Dies at 71
description: Bob Hoskins, the bullet-shaped British film star who brought a singular mix of charm, menace and cockney accent to a variety of roles, including the bemused live-action hero of the largely animated Who Framed Roger Rabbit, has died. He was 71.

title: Do You Think Small American Manufacturers Can Compete?
description: Weve just published a Conversation with Drew Greenblatt, chief executive of Marlin Steel Wire Products, which a decade ago manufactured only $12 wire baskets for bagels. Marlin now makes 80 to 100 varieties baskets a month, including customized designs for the aerospace and medical industries that cost as much as $5,000 apiece.

title: Stop Worrying About Your Child Getting Into College. Worry About What Happens Next.
description: As a college professor, former admissions officer and researcher on what happens to youths after high school, I believe the current panic over the increasing selectivity of elite schools misses the point. So much energy goes into getting into college. Many families cant see that getting through college is far more important, and that graduating prepared for adult life will be more valuable than the name arched over the top of the degree.

title: Democrats Assail G.O.P. After Filibuster of Proposal to Raise Minimum Wage
description: WASHINGTON  With the Republican-led filibuster of a Senate proposal to raise the federal minimum wage to $10.10 on Wednesday, Democrats moved swiftly to frame the vote as an example of the gulf that exists between the two parties on matters of economic fairness and upward mobility.

title: Mom, This Looks Like the End of Me: Doomed Vessels Last Minutes
description: SEOUL, South Korea  As a ferry carrying 476 people was badly listing off the southwestern coast of South Korea two weeks ago, one of the students on board asked, Are we becoming a Titanic?

title: A Chelsea Apartment: The Reward of Staying the Course
description: Having owned property in London, where they had lived and worked, Craig Manson and Daniel Brass were interested in investing in the New York market. When the couple moved to New York for work a year and a half ago, they sublet a two-bedroom in Chelsea. It was well located, though small and dark, and rented for around $3,400 a month.

title: A Store Where Everything is Made in the U.S.
description: Boosting the domestic economy is as easy as the click of a mouse with The MiA Project, a new online marketplace that exclusively stocks goods made in America (hence the name). The site, which launches today, was founded by Micha Thomas, a former creative marketing director for an independent music-booking agency, and Jaime Lawson, whose fashion background includes a stint at Rodarte and her own bridal accessory line, Bleu Garters. The L.A.-based duo have curated a roster of designers and makers both traditional (Pendleton Woolen Mills) and new (Earth tu Face, Baggu) and will be telling some of their stories through studio visits and other editorial content on the site. The vast retailcomponent, with price points ranging from $10 to about $3,000, includes mens, womens and childrens casual wear and accessories, decorative items for the home, an organic beauty apothecary and such only-in-America gifts as an aromatherapeutic throne spray (if you have to ask). Its an assortment as diverse and democratic as the U.S. itself.

title: Stars Newest Must-Have Item: The Clippers
description: LOS ANGELES  For most of the Clippers 30-year tenure in Los Angeles, they have been viewed as a punch line in hightops.

title: Take My Buyout, Please
description: Four decades ago, Thomas H. Lee was one of the pioneers of leveraged buyouts.

title: Man Charged With Killing a Developer in January
description: The New York Police Department has arrested a 26-year-old man in connection with the kidnapping and killing of a Brooklyn developer, whose body was found smoldering in a trash container at a gas station in Nassau County on Jan. 3.

title: U.S. Attorney Subpoenas Records of Ethics Panel
description: The top federal prosecutor in Manhattan, who sharply criticized Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos shutdown of a commission he had formed to investigate political corruption in New York State, is now seeking records from the states ethics panel.

title: Oklahoma Vows Review of Botched Execution
description: McALESTER, Okla.  As Clayton D. Lockett writhed and groaned on the gurney on Tuesday night after a large dose of sedatives had apparently not been fully delivered, the Oklahoma chief of corrections rushed to call the governor and the attorney general. Something had gone disastrously wrong with the lethal injection, he told them, and the execution of a second man must be delayed. Gov. Mary Fallin instantly agreed.

title: Whither Dan Brown? Poll Lists Americans Favorite Books
description: Good-bye Da Vinci Code, hello Moby-Dick!

title: Scenes from Severe Flooding in the Florida Panhandle
description: A section of the Scenic Highway near Pensacola, Fla., collapsed after more than 20 inches of rain caused severe flooding early Wednesday in the Florida Panhandle and in southern Alabama, as my colleague Alan Binder reports.

title: Image of the Day: April 30
Facebook to Let Users Limit Data Revealed by Log-Ins
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Trying to become even bigger  and make more money  Facebook will allow users to reveal a little less.

title: Hottest Hostess in Washington
description: If politicians brought the same clarity to their public positions that Jan Maxwell brings to her acting, the lives of voters would be so much easier. Whether portraying a scurrilous British witch in the days of the Crusades (in Howard Barkers The Castle), a stroke survivor (Arthur Kopits Wings) or a self-dramatizing stage star (in The Royal Family), Ms. Maxwell has an unfailing gift for making you understand where her characters are coming from, even when they dont seem to know themselves. So the idea of her going to Washington, to lend a little transparency to the capital of opacity, is irresistible.

title: Everythings Up-to-Date (or at Least From the Late 80s)
description: As New York City Ballet opened its spring season at the David H. Koch Theater on Tuesday, one man in the audience stood out in a conspicuous disguise of fedora and sunglasses. Those in the know could recognize this as the costume of J R, the artist responsible for the giant photograph of City Ballet dancers that covered the floor of the theaters promenade earlier this year.

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 43
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The New York Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: Forecasting a Speedup in Growth, the Fed Again Cuts Bond Purchases
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve continued to retreat from its stimulus campaign on Wednesday, saying it was looking past the economic slowdown during an unusually cold winter because growth already was rebounding.

title: Big Banks Erred Widely on Troubled Mortgages, U.S. Regulator Confirms
description: Updated, 8:14 p.m. | A federal regulator confirmed on Wednesday that the countrys biggest banks committed widespread errors in dealing with homeowners who faced foreclosures at the height of the mortgage crisis, but the findings are unlikely to put to rest questions from lawmakers and others about the extent of the problems.

title: Decoding the Feds Statement
description: The statement Wednesday from the Federal Open Market Committee, the policy-making group of the Federal Reserve, offers its assessment of current economic conditions. At the last meeting, in mid-March, Fed officials saw economic weakness as being driven by winter weather. This time, they affirmed that view, and now view the economy to be growing faster.

title: Is Your Pension Plan Stupid? Nebraskas Isnt
description: Imagine you were 25 years old and considering a job with a company, and your employer told you these were the terms of the retirement plan:

title: Building Firm Pleads Guilty to Defrauding Its Customers
description: Structure Tone, one of the nations largest construction firms, pleaded guilty on Wednesday to corruption charges and agreed to forfeit $55 million for a scheme in which the company defrauded a roster of prominent financial institutions, law firms and ad agencies out of tens of millions of dollars.

title: The Voice of the Clippers
description: LOS ANGELES  When Doc Rivers walked into a conference room Tuesday night that was so packed that dozens of reporters were turned away, he took a deep breath and exhaled as he sat behind the microphone. He then proceeded to do what he had spent much of the previous three days doing: answering question after question about his employer, the Los Angeles Clippers owner, Donald Sterling.

title: Barenboim Goes Digital
description: BERLIN  As digital music consumption becomes the norm the classical recording industry is looking to new models, from video apps to digital singles. Now the conductor and pianist Daniel Barenboim, in partnership with Universal Music, has created his own exclusively digital label.

title: John Paul Stevens Gets That Money Is Not Speech
description: Former Justice John Paul Stevens appearance before the Senate Rules Committee this morning was remarkable, and not just because retired Supreme Court justices rarely show up at Congressional hearings. It was remarkable for the clarity with which made the point that unlimited and undisclosed money are eliminating fairness from the American political system.

title: Moving On, Even if Its Back in Time
description: ASHFIELD, Mass.  Visiting Ray LaMontagne is like going back to another century. The question is, which one?

title: Alibaba I.P.O. May Unleash Global Fight Over Users
description: The largest technology stock offering in history is looming, but few in Silicon Valley seem to care.

title: Energizer Split Leaves Biggest Problem Intact
description: Energizers split into household and personal care companies should improve the $7 billion companys focus. It could also make one of the newly independent businesses an acquisition target. But the proposed transaction doesnt address the batteries-to-tampons conglomerates bigger challenge: mustering more resources to take on industry gorilla Procter & Gamble.

title: Where Did You Get Those Genes? Researching Advances In Genetics
description: From junk DNA that, as it turns out, is not so junky after all, to the unique signatures in different cancer genes, our understanding of genetics is changing so rapidly that textbooks cant always keep up. In this lesson, we offer a collection of teaching ideas using recent Times coverage about how genes work, how we can work with them and where they come from.Rethinking Junk

title: Thailand Says It Will Try to Hold an Election in July
description: BANGKOK  Thailands election commission on Wednesday said it would try to hold a vote in July but opposition leaders refused to say whether they would participate, underlining the countrys political paralysis.

title: House Hunting in ... Cuernavaca, Mexico
description: A MEXICAN COLONIAL-STYLE HOME WITH POOL IN CUERNAVACA

title: Classical Playlist: Stravinsky, Mendelssohn, Harrison Birtwistle and More
description: STRAVINSKY: Oedipus Rex and Apollon MusagteLondon Symphony Orchestra, Monteverdi Choir; John Eliot Gardiner, conductor(LSO Live)As a dramatic work, Stravinskys Oedipus Rex is a riveting hybrid: both one-act opera with a Latin libretto and homage to the Baroque oratorio. It makes sense that the conductor John Eliot Gardiner, a pioneer of the early music movement, and the impressive Monteverdi Choir, founded by Mr. Gardner in 1964, would have a special feeling for the old-world musical elements of Oedipus Rex, all of which come through on this gripping recording taken from live performances with the London Symphony Orchestra last year. The actress Fanny Ardant delivers the narration in the original French version by Cocteau. Among the excellent soloists are the tenor Stuart Skelton as Oedipus and the mezzo-soprano Jennifer Johnston as Jocasta. (Anthony Tommasini)

title: New York City Police Officer Is Arrested in Westchester Shooting
description: PELHAM, N.Y.  An off-duty New York City police officer shot a motorist six times at a stoplight in Westchester County this week, in what an official called a completely random attack.

title: South Sudans Warring Leaders Draw Rebuke From U.N. Rights Chief
description: GENEVA  Navi Pillay, the United Nations human rights chief, sharply rebuked South Sudans warring leaders on Wednesday, saying they had to stop blindly dragging their people down the path of self-destruction and warning that they would face investigation for possible war crimes and crimes against humanity.

title: Futures New Album Hits the Frozen Ceiling
description: Another week on the music charts, another couple of victories for Frozen and Happy.

title: Stalking the Role of an Operatic Stalker
description: Say a wish out loud enough times, and it might come true. It worked for the Broadway baritone Norm Lewis, anyway. For years, when Mr. Lewis, the star of 2012s The Gershwins Porgy and Bess, was asked what his dream roles would be, he often mentioned Harold Hill in The Music Man or Billy Bigelow in Carousel. Yet the role he invariably named was the title character in the long-running musical The Phantom of the Opera, and at last it has come his way. Mr. Lewis will don the cape and mask for a six-month run starting May 12.

title: Higher Minimum Wage Is Popular, but Voting on It Is Another Matter
description: Pollsters have known for decades that the public supports raising the minimum wage, and this past year has been no exception. What remains unknown is whether the Senate vote Wednesday killing the proposed minimum wage increase will affect the election in November.

title: Time Warners Profit Rises On Strength in Film Unit
description: Time Warner reported on Wednesday that its first-quarter profit increased 7 percent, thanks largely to the successes of the Warner Bros. studio and Home Box Office.

title: The Transformation of St. Agnes
description: A video documents how a decommissioned church in Germany has become a nexus of contemporary art and culture.

title: A Fight for Marriage Equality, and Over History
description: Who makes history? Thats the essential question raised not so much by Forcing the Spring, Jo Beckers account of the same-sex marriage struggle, but by the controversy that has surrounded the book since its publication last week.

title: A Verdict on Comments, but the Conversation Isnt Over
description: Adam Silver did what he had to do Tuesday.

title: Finding Too Much of Nothing on an Irish Farm
description: Jane isnt built for country life. Stuck on her parents farm in Ireland, she longs for Dublin. Swap the tractors for tour buses, she commands, the quiet for noise, the slowness for speed, the loneliness for no space to think. Yet as Lisa Tierney-Keoghs Four Last Things progresses, Janes rural exile seems less and less the problem. Jane may not be built for life at all.

title: Bits and Pieces That End Up a Life
description: The role of music in telling stories will of course change depending on the type of narrative being told. In planning collected stories, the fascinating series of six concerts at Zankel Hall that concluded on Tuesday night, the composer David Lang explored the various approaches composers have taken to relate tales of adventure, love, longing and spiritual questing.

title: A Sneak Peek at a New Exhibition Co-Curated by Pharrell
description: Pharrell Williams is swiftly moving toward total cultural domination. Is it any surprise, then, that the multi-hyphenated man of the moment has been chosen to inaugurate a new art space in Paris next month? The 41-year-old first met the gallerist Emmanuel Perrotin seven years ago in Miami, and together, Perrotin says, they have been on an art adventure ever since: meeting artists and visiting studios, brainstorming all along those great moments of artistic synergies and true happiness and friendship. So its no surprise that Williams was present at the opening of Perrotins New York gallery late last year, where he treated Perrotin and friends to an early listen of his album G I R L. As one would expect, the tracks made Perrotin happy  a feeling he knew could transcend the record and fill his new art space, Salle de Bal, which opens on May 27 in a former ballroom in the 17th-century Htel du Grand Veneur in the Marais. So he invited Pharrell to collaborate on the inaugural show, also called G I R L.

title: What Bank of Americas Accounting Mistake Can Teach the Market
description: Mayra Rodrguez Valladares is managing principal at MRV Associates, a capital markets and financial regulatory consulting and training firm based in New York. She is also a faculty member at Financial Markets World and the New York Institute of Finance.

title: An Uneasy Inheritance of Indias Political Dynasty
description: NEW DELHI  On a visit to the rural constituency that has sent him or his relatives to Parliament for decades, Rahul Gandhi, the scion of Indias most powerful political dynasty, was asked a simple question: Can you name five party workers from the area?

title: The Gun Report: April 30, 2014
description: Just before 6 a.m. yesterday, Geddy Kramer, a 19-year-old package handler, opened fire with a shotgun at a FedEx shipping facility in Kennesaw, Ga.He wounded a security guard outside the building and five people in the warehouse, and was found dead of a self-inflicted gunshot wound in a trailer behind the FedEx site.

title: Scene City: 100 Boldfaces in the Crowd
description: Celebrities toast Time magazines annual list of 100 influencers (and themselves.)

title: Pictures of the Day: Palestine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Palestine, India, Florida and Spain.

title: High Culture in Colorado
description: Far from being bummed out by Colorados burgeoning legal marijuana market, the Colorado Symphony Orchestra is planning a series of BYOC (bring your own cannabis) concerts this year. Entitled Classically Cannabis: The High Note Series, the performances represent the orchestras attempt to reach a new, younger audience, so as to bolster its shaky finances and future. You have to program your orchestra for the community youre in, Justin Bartels, a trumpet player in the orchestra, told the Denver Post, noting the classical ensemble has long caught the aroma of pot threading through its concerts. Why not go with the flow?

title: Posing and Rubbing and Rolling and You Name It
description: At the start of Levi Gonzalezs The Craft of the Father, you cant see anything. But in near-total darkness, you can hear breathing. Then you hear groaning, croaking, slurping. It sounds like indigestion, and then, as the noise grows louder and wilder, more like someone pretending to be possessed.

title: Polished Yet Casual in the Flatiron District
description: Whether its tourists taking selfies under the Flatiron building, foodies wolfing down Eataly gelato or fashion enthusiasts flocking to buy the latest arrivals at boutiques, the Flatiron district offers some of New Yorks biggest draws. The area is also packed with young entrepreneurs hustling to meetings at the towering office spaces nearby. Aristotle Torres was among them. The born-and-bred New Yorker from the Bronx was on his way to a company meeting wearing a waxed trench, a cashmere crew neck, a striped button-up and Jordan 8s.

title: A Playoffs Worth of Overtimes Already
description: Serge Ibaka of the Oklahoma City Thunder caught the rebound of Kevin Durants missed 3-pointer and tipped the ball back toward the rim with the buzzer sounding at the end of overtime Tuesday night. As the ball fell through the hoop, Ibaka hit the ground with his arms raised. The Chesapeake Energy Arena crowd erupted in celebration. Ibakas teammate Reggie Jackson dived in for a hug. The Thunder had seemingly outlasted the Memphis Grizzlies to take a 3-2 series lead in their first-round playoff series.

title: Florida States Jameis Winston Is Cited for Shoplifting Shellfish
description: Jameis Winston, Florida States Heisman Trophy-winning quarterback, found himself in off-the-field trouble once again on Tuesday night when he was cited for shoplifting seafood from a grocery store in Tallahassee, Fla.

title: Voices on Iraqs Election Day
description: Iraqi officials and voters discussed Iraqs election as they cast their votes for the countrys new Parliament.

title: Murderers Are Shown With Warts Aplenty
description: Television loves the myth of smart, stylish murderers and the enigmatic detectives who pursue them, and if you enjoy those types of shows, dont watch The Killer Speaks. The reality in it just might put you off those gritty, pretty fantasies.

title: Senators Express Concern on Reverse Mortgage Rules
description: Updated, 10:20 a.m. |

title: Nail Salon Lamps May Increase Skin Cancer Risk
description: Nail salon dryers, which use ultraviolet light to speed the drying and hardening of nail polishes and gels, emit varying levels of radiation that can lead to risky skin damage in as few as eight visits to the manicurist, a new study shows.

title: Life in Canada, Home of the Worlds Most Affluent Middle Class
description: The Canadian middle class may now be the worlds richest, but it has its anxieties, too.

title: Garden Ice Does the Trick
description: There must be ghosts in the rafters at Madison Square Garden, like those who once roamed the old Montreal Forum, even if they only come out for Game 7s.

title: Political Preferences on Social Media Sites
description: Social medias promise was that people with different views and political ties could mingle in digital bliss. But some social sites are more popular with one political party than another.

title: When College Isnt in the Cards
description: If college isnt in a high school students plan for any reason, the sense of pressure and judgment that some families feel at this time of year can be overwhelming. Many seniors are deciding where they want to begin college in the fall, decisions that will be final on May 1. I feel judgment like I havent felt since my kids were babies, Adrienne Jones posted on Facebook (where many parents are proudly posting acceptances and decisions). Her son does not plan to enter college.

title: 10 Spice Blends to Enliven Any Dish
description: Sure, you can spend a lot of money on the perfect spice. Or you can make your own.

title: Calling With Clarity
description: Molly Wood describes what you can do to improve the sound quality of your cellphone calls until new technologies like HD voice become more widely available.

title: With HD Voice, Better Call Quality Is Coming. Text Your Friends.
description: CELLPHONE calls sound terrible.

title: Headphones That Make Smartphone Calls Easier
description: SMARTPHONES offer a lot of conveniences, especially for people on the go, but using one for its most basic function  making a phone call  can tie up your hands and actually limit your mobility.

title: The Action of Adverbs, the Pathos of Prepositions
description: As a fun thing to do on a Friday night, attending a show about grammar is not an obvious choice. But grammar is the theme of Sentence, a collection of sketches in word, movement and music by the longtime dance comedian Claire Porter. And as presented by DanceNow at Joes Pub on Friday, the parts of speech cleverly parsed in Sentence made for a charming entertainment, at least in parts.

title: No Extradition for Franco-Era Police Inspector
description: MADRID  Spains National Court on Wednesday dealt a setback to victims seeking justice for the abuses of the Franco dictatorship by refusing to extradite to Argentina a former police inspector accused of torture during the 1970s, the final years of the Franco regime.

title: Redrawing Map, From Different Angles
description: If youre a regular at Judson Memorial Church you might not recognize the space this week. Filling the usually bare-bones sanctuary are multiple levels of seating, towers of theatrical lights and, sprouting up from the expansive floor, seven gargantuan balloons (cubes, globes) painted with arrows and other symbols, indecipherable maps.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: Unions Giant Video Near White House Urges Halt to Deportations
description: WASHINGTON  Labor leaders who normally side with President Obama planned to vividly demonstrate their anger and frustration with his immigration policies on Wednesday by projecting a 90-by-60-foot video onto the side of the A.F.L.-C.I.O. headquarters two blocks from the White House.

title: Wheelies: The Dont Clone Me Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Happy Times
description: Retro-feeling swimwear under an early summer haze harkens back to stolen weekends and simpler days.

title: Atltico Bolts Past Chelsea and Mourinho
description: LONDON  Ten years ago, Jos Mourinho set off running on the big stage for the first time, his celebratory sprint in a designer suit and bulky overcoat serving as the indelible moment of Portos Champions League upset of Manchester United. It was bold. It was brash. It was perfect.

title: More on the Life and Times of Anna Mae Aquash
description: In last weekends magazine Eric Konigsberg wrote about the investigation into the 1975 killing of the Native American activist Anna Mae Aquash, which has gone on for decades. Despite the fact that two lower-level members of the American Indian Movement were convicted of her murder, many people, including the prosecuting district attorney, still consider the crime to be unresolved. For those who would like to learn more about Aquash and the turbulent years of mid-70s America, there are a couple of biographies and a history book that have been inspired by her case.

title: Racism and Punishment in the N.B.A.
April 30, 1939: The New York Worlds Fair Opens to the Public
description: On April 30, 1939, President Franklin D. Roosevelt officially opened the New York Worlds Fair in Flushing Meadows, Queens. Hundreds of thousands of New Yorkers and visitors gathered in the Court of Peace, near the parks Trylon and Perisphere structures, to see the parade of uniformed soldiers and national flags waved by representatives from 33 countries.

title: High Price in Utility Deal
description: Just about any way investors crunch the numbers, Exelon looks to be overpaying for Pepco.

title: Values and Data Meet at a Vatican Workshop on Sustaining Humanity on a Flourishing Planet
description: Im headed to the Vatican to participate in a novel workshop at which economists, theologians and seasoned researchers from many branches of science convene under the auspices of the Pontifical Academies of Sciences and Social Sciences to consider a subject that transcends the realms of data and values:Sustainable Humanity, Sustainable Planet, Our Responsibility.

title: White Beans and Greens with Garlic and Olive Oil, or Emmas Beans
description: Weve gotten some requests for this recipe, adapted fromThe VB6 Cookbook,so I thought Id post this as well.

title: Gelb Joins French Legion of Honor
description: There have been plenty of chevaliers portrayed on the stage of the Metropolitan Opera in recent years: the Chevalier des Grieux in Massenets Manon, the Chevalier de la Force in Poulencs Dialogues of the Carmelites, and, earlier this year, a Viennese prison warden pretending to be a French chevalier in Strausss Die Fledermaus.

title: A Suicide Stalks Young Spalding Gray
description: Ghosts are captured on camera in Rumstick Road, the genuinely haunting new work that runs through Wednesday at Anthology Film Archives. Described as a video reconstruction of a performance from the mid-1970s by the Wooster Group, the New York experimental theater troupe, Elizabeth LeCompte and Ken Koblands film is by its very nature phantasmal.

title: Starry, Starry, Starry Night
description: The Time 100 gala is one of those events where industries collide. Theres media (Rupert Murdoch), theres tech (Eric Schmidt), theres Hollywood (Alfonso Cuarn), theres the Washington Beltway (Kirsten Gillibrand).

title: Headwaters for a River of Stand-Up
description: When Steven Wright started appearing on The Tonight Show in the early 1980s, he was such a change of pace that Johnny Carson once introduced him with the tone of a teacher taking a class of jittery kids to their first play. Just let your mind go at ease here to follow Steven Wright, he said, gingerly preparing the audience. Hes unique and you have to listen to what he says.

title: Infidelity Under Wraps? Theyd Rather Share
description: Scene from one kind of celebrity uncoupling, a few weeks ago on Mary Mary: Tina Campbell, who with her sister Erica makes up the revered gospel duo Mary Mary, is in full meltdown mode. Shes just learned that her husband has been unfaithful on several occasions, and shes venting to her sister and mother: Ive got to go out here and sing Go get your blessing. Ive got to stand in front of these people and be inspirational, and its so hard, because they dont have a clue.

title: Nicaragua: In Shadows of Pain and Glory
description: In the poetic documentary Palabras Mgicas (Para Romper un Encantamiento)  Magic Words (Breaking a Spell)  the director Mercedes Moncada Rodrguez meditates on the fraught history of Nicaragua, starting with the years preceding the Sandinista overthrow of the Somoza dictatorship in 1979. Ms. Rodrguez, a sociologist turned filmmaker, has examined the countrys history before: Her 2005 documentary, El Inmortal (The Immortal), examined the scars left on a family whose members fought on opposing sides in the Contra war in the 1980s. Her new film, presented as part of the Museum of Modern Arts series Iberoamrican Images: The State of the Art, covers decades, juxtaposing period footage with the directors reflective narration and gorgeous images.

title: Nigerians Hold Second Day of Protests Over Mass Abductions
